title: Front desk - the BEST.
text:
While this Sonder room was not as well equipped or as comfortable as our last Sonder experience, the whole experience was overall quite enjoyable. 

The front desk staff were so warm, helpful and friendly. 

The  location was great for us too. We found great restaurants, shops, and even a grocery store. Cabs were easy to get…subway was nearby.

title: YES!
text:
Perfect location and size for our nyc fun!
We would highly recommend. Quiet and sheets were nice. Etc. ill come here next time because value was absolutely worth it. Sonder did a great job determining what we needed for our stay - everything was well thought out.

title: First SONDER experience of many to come!
text: First SONDER experience of many to come! Our stay was amazing, the front desk team was great. Nyib & Cassia were professional and friendly. From our early check-in to departure, they ensured our stay was smooth. Thank you Flatiron team for an incredible experience.

title: Awesome
text:
Great place. Very conveniently located with access to subways and great eateries. Friendly staff. Safe place. The room had everything that we wanted. Refrigerator, microwave.Couple plates, cups, spoons etc. 
Will definitely come back here to stay.

title: Simple and low stress place to stay
text: Room was small but beautiful. Great views out over Broadway. I like the simplicity of the Sonder check in and check out process via the app. All the access codes were electronically delivered. The people were still friendly and helped with restaurant recommendations but there wasn’t a wait in a line while someone types a novel on a terminal to check you in.  The bed was super comfortable, the pillows were fluffy. I would happily star again.

title: ideal location
text: The Sonder flat iron is the ideal location - a convenient jumping-off point to everywhere in NYC. Always feel safe and for me, self-check-in is preferable.  If the rates hold steady, I will absolutely return.

title: Great location with easy in and out.
text: Great location. It is close to Washington Park, the Flatiron, restaurants, shopping, and the subway. Easy checkin and checkout. We really appreciated the free storage lockers for our luggage. The airy feel and views out the large windows in our room were so nice. Yes, it was a bit noisy but nothing that would make us not stay here again.  Some things that would have enhanced our stay-a multi-charging/plug on both sides of the bed, a couple bottles of water or access to ice, and a comfy chair but again nothing that would prevent us from a return visit.

title: What a great experience!
text: This was a great hotel! Great location, comfortable rooms! Loved this company as well it was so easy and user friendly to get things we needed and extend our stay! 10/10 Would recommend and I am looking forward to checking out their other locations for more trips!

title: Flatiron NYC Sonder
text: I love staying here, it’s alway clean and quiet. The location is fantastic. Love the people who greet you. It’s a great stay always. It’s so close to everything and has so many good restaurants, shopping, and a great gelato place right below. Everything you need is within a block.

title: Amazing room
text:
The room is very spacious. It is rare thing in Manhattan. I loved it so much! 
Also every staff is so kind that I felt well-treated. Though I asked a lot of questions, they answered kindly. Appreciate it.

title: Could be better!
text:
This was my 2nd Sonder in NYC... The first one in Tribeca was wonderful..
Sonder Flatrion was disappointing ..
The room and bathroom was not very clean.
There is no-one from the company on site and no nice lobe with coffee option  as I had in Tribeca.... I heard the noise from the street up to the 9th floor with windows that are not opening.  Not too bad but need some improvement and some people on site..

title: Contactless
text:
Stayed from 8/30-9/4 and was placed on the lowest floor and in the smallest room, #307. Other rooms on floor are used for storage and something for the garbage, I’m used to hearing other guests come in and out of their rooms/elevators but on this floor there’s noise of the employees entering in and out. The photos online shows a chair in the room but we had a large trash can instead. I asked for 1 sheet and 2 large towels but was given 1 floor towel and a whole new bed set. I asked for a room change prior and during my stay was told the hotel was full, if you stay longer than a simple weekend you should expect the lowest quality room. I asked if we could be accommodated with a credit for their rentals but was told about the disclaimer from booking that the room type is not guaranteed. The doormen/security didn’t greet us and barely looked up from their phones, except for the gentleman on the day we checked out, he was helpful. It’s a “contactless” hotel so there is no front desk. The employees who answer in the app chat should learn proper verbiage to use, “forget it” is not an appropriate response. I’ve stayed at hostels better than here comparing service and some prices. I’ve worked in Las Vegas as a concierge for a 4 star Forbes rated hotel and this place makes me to never want to stay somewhere without a face to face human contact. 
If you want an overpriced hotel in a central location then this place is for you. Good luck and have fun.

title: Excellent place for such great price
text: We stayed here for a week during our trip to NYC. Amazing location and excellent service. Beautiful, clean units. Incredible views!!! I’d never thought we’d be able to afford such an amazing place. The best experience. 10/10 recommended!!!

title: Awfull
text: This is not an easy place to stay. You have to put the code all the time. The room was ready, but it was incomplete. The shower gel bottle didn’t work. NOISE!! Very VERY NOISE! YOU CANNOT SLEEP AT NIGHT! Definitely not working for that money. No house keeping… UNCOMFORTABLE PLACE and EXPERIENCE. Definitely, not staying anymore at Sonder.

title: I wouldn’t stay here again.
text:
New York is fabulous but Sonder Flatiron is missing any gloss.
If you want to control your own aircon temp, give this place a wide berth. We stayed here for two weeks and got downgraded to a small room because the aircon failed. It never worked properly and we were always hot. The QUEEN room is very average and close to street, avoid. The sheets are a polyester mix and add to the sweating. I think the staff did a great job trying to sort out the dramas of the building and it isn’t their fault. They were very polite and patient. I did not enjoy the stay here. The TV didn’t work properly and there was no local channels to view which I was looking forward to seeing.

Location to restaurants etc. is good.

title: Buyer BEWARE!
text: Do NOT make the mistake I did and stay at a Sonder Hotel. Their deceptive reservation system ensured that they took over $850 of my money to change a reservation less than 48 hours after I made it. They refused to provide me with a refund citing "fairness to other visitors," and refused to restore my reservation to the original length of time. I would encourage others to avoid booking at a Sonder property.

title: Great Experience
text: Great experience and location. I would definitely use Sonder again for future trips. The location was great and the app and key pads work despite some of the online reviews. The location is second to none.

title: From a picky hotel chooser
text: Location is very convenient, super fun area and close to transportation. For the price, this is the best place to stay in NYC! Check-in is easy, there is security at every hour of the day so very safe and amenities are clean! Will be choosing Sonder for traveling now…

title: Spacious studio in convenient NoMad/Flatiron
text: We loved this location. Super convenient to subway, parks, eateries, museums. Felt safe, not super loud during the week or on the weekend. The room was spacious and staff was friendly/quick whenever we had questions/requests.

title: Perfect price, perfect location
text: Very comfortable, and not actually that noisy (though I did not visit on a weekend). Shower was fabulous. Easy check in and check out, love the luggage storage lockers. Will make this my hotel in NYC.

title: Sonder Flatiron Rules!
text: Best location ever! Super clean, practical, and the staff downstairs was very helpful! But bring some earplugs and use the super cool sound machine available: it can get loud late at night… regardless, will surely come back!

title: Perfect for a getaway
text: Great place, great location. Loved everything about our trip and stay. Walking distance to all the places we wanted to visit. Accommodations were fantastic. Will definitely book again on our next trip.

title: Good, inexpensive lodging
text: Simple, room had a good size, it was reasonably comfortable and clean. Good internet service and very conveniently located. Much better than other hotel alternatives I have tried in the past in terms of price per lodging quality.

title: Great time!
text: Simple room exactly as pictured! Great location. No issues at all. There is a doorman in the lobby at most times that can answer any questions. Room was clean and surprisingly quiet at night! Only wish there was access to free water/ice in the hotel.

title: Wonderful stay in New York!
text:
We stayed at Sonder flatiron in May 2023
It was a really wonderful stay
Authentic view, easy to access the metro, 
nice cuisines near down that area
To me, everything was good but one thing 
that I was slightly disappointed about that is a little noisy late at night 
But overall it’s highly recommended

title: Stay somewhere else unless you like lots of noise 24/7 and no Service
text:
The street noise is unbearable and it's 24/7. During daylight hours - its a construction zone.  At night - its a party zone. 

The Garbage trucks start at 3AM and dont finish until 5AM. 
The restaurants across the street pressure wash the sidewalk from 5AM.
The noise within the old building travels - you can hear your neighbour easily

If you think you are going to get a restful nights sleep and do some work during the day in your room - forget it. 

Sonder are very good at apologising and making it your problem. You will receive some ear plugs and a white noise machine. Both of which are useless.

Yes, It's NYC but the windows are not double glazed. You can hear everything. Even from the apartment above.

Bed sheets are Polyester/Cotton so you are going to sweat.

Front of house staff are rude, disengaged and disinterested.

This is perhaps the worst Hotel stay I have ever had anywhere in the world.

Dont believe the 5* reviews. Thats simply not possible or realistic.

title: Great location and room
text: The bed is Comfortable. Room has a mini fridge and tv that you can cast your phone to. The location is really good. It is located in a safe neighborhood with a park and lots of things to do. There is a staff member located in the lobby. Check-in and checkout was extremely simple and fine through the phone. I’m going back in few months and will be staying there again.

title: Access to tourist attractions was good.
text: Access to tourist attractions was good. It was a great experience. I would like to come back next time I visit New York. The gelato shop nearby is also very good. I want to go every day. Thank you Sonder.

title: Met expectations
text: Sonder delivers as it met my expectations for the price point I was prepared to pay. A cross between AirBNB and a hotel, in NYC and especially in Manhattan where hotel rooms are like stamp-sized, Sonder delivered on space and location. The NoMad location was great as Eataly is one block away and the main attractions are easily accessible by subway and train. Next door is a very popular gelato joint called Anita and many eateries are in its proximity. Fairway supermarket is just 5 minutes down the road. Macy’s is an easy 15 minute walk away. Their edge over an AirBnB is luggage storage and quick response to queries and requests. Download their app and it’s easy to manage your stay. My requests sent via their app’s message function were responded in minutes. However, don’t expect hotel standards. My gripe is their bed was not as comfortable as a hotel’s and the pillows were too soft. My request for an additional pillow was not acceded to. Overall, it met my key expectations.

title: Great location, bad room; won't be returning
text:
Good
-- Location is great: one block off Madison Square Park 
-- No annoying hotel features: no check-in, no calls from the desk, and no clutter of overpriced items inside the mini-fridge (it was clean and large) 
-- The cleaning staff was helpful when I had an issue opening my room via keypad (but ultimately the problem resolved itself)
-- The Accessible room has a decent amount of floor space 
-- Security guard in lobby and keypads in elevators prevent anyone from walking in off the street 
-- Wifi is reliable and Chromecast streaming to TV is easy 

Bad
-- Room keypad simply doesn't work sometimes.  On several occasions, it took 4-6 tries to get a green light.  (Note: this was never an issue in the elevator.)  On the last trip outside my room, it took 5 minutes of entering the code and getting red lights before it finally decided to open.
-- The shower takes 7-8 minutes to heat up -- this means taking cold showers if you're in a hurry!

Neutral
-- Noise is not great (but probably not the worst in NYC): located over a subway line that can be heard from the 7th floor on the Broadway side, with street noise, and thin floors (could hear an iPhone buzzing its notifications in the room above me at night)
-- Nitpicking: the mobile booking experience bounced between the app and the mobile web site a few times

title: Vrbo - when you save on your IT.
text:
I've booked a Sonder studio apartment in the Flatiron district in New York via Vrbo. The credit card was provided, charged and I received a confirmation email. 
Just before the trip, I wanted more details about check-in. I contacted their support and was informed that the reservation was missing. How can this be possible by such a provider? I was boarding a plane and needed a place to stay in NYC. They offered a lower-quality property in NYC than I picked, as the room I booked was unavailable. It was a stressful traveling experience as I always had to be on my phone between flights. 
The entire tech team of Vrbo should be ashamed to manage such a bad platform where confirmation emails are sent and properties booked for users but apparently not shown later in their systems. IT is not something you can save money on.

title: Excellent hotel!
text: Beautiful hotel, gorgeous design!  Easy check in with 24/7 support. Great location that’s safe, in walking distance to all major attractions. Very clean throughout. Would recommend to anyone and would definitely stay again.

title: Excellent corner room with a view
text: While we were only on the 4th floor, the corner room was incredible. The room is enormous by NYC standards and all windows which was lovely. Actually a slim view of both the Flatiron and Empire State buildings. It is located just steps from Madison Sq Park, Eataly and many cafes and bars.  A really great bonus is free luggage lockers.

title: Ottima posizione, camera spazio a ma un pochino rumorosa
text: Posizione ottima, tutto era come descritto sul sito e su app. Nulla da dire. Ottimo. Unico appunto sul rumore.. camera (spaziosa e luminosa) era un po’ rumorosa (in f di stazione danno dei tappi per le orecchie). Pulizia stanza solo su richiesta a pagamento, mentre asciugamani puliti basta chiederli. Ottimo rapporto qualità prezzo

title: Perfect for a foodie in the city
text:
Perfect location for a foodie in the city! I was very pleased with the spacious, clean, and modern space. We were steps away from some of the best restaurants, and about 10-15 walking distance from Times Square.  I researched a lot of hotels and other airbnbs, comparing the size, location, amenities, and the price and this was just perfect. I would definitely stay here again recommend this place! 

The only cons: The bathtub drains really slowly. I just propped up the rubber stopper with a couple of Q-tips so water would drain faster. The power went out in the bathroom Saturday morning, and I requested help. Sonder responded right away, but it wasn't fixed until it was too late. Someone came the next morning right before I had to check out, because he said no one was available the day before. I was checking out that morning anyways, so I asked him to come back another time.

The owners were very prompt in responding to my questions regarding parking and request for a fresh set of towels.

Overall, my experience was a solid 9 out of 10.

title: The locals experience
text: The room was small but fit everything we’d need! TV had chrome cast so we could watch our favorite shows, nice modem bathroom, and coffee/tea offerings in room! We truly felt like locals living in an apartment building as it was seamless and safe entering the building, elevator, and room. Definitely will use Sonder is other cities to get good locations, good pricing, and more of a locals experience

title: Great location !
text:
Location location location!  Eataly around the corner. Need I say more?
Super comfy bed.  
Everything we needed.  Nice and easy!
Speakeasy on site.   Also Anita Gelato next door.  
A must!
Great for tech friendly people.

title: The Heart of Midtown Manhattan
text:
The building was close to everything including the subway which made it so easy to get around town and beyond.

The building is clean and secure. The noise level at night was loud the first couple of nights with the roadwork happening on Broadway however the ear plugs and sound machine in the room helped with that. 

The room was bright and comfortable. When we needed something they were a text message away. If you need more essentials you could replenish yourselves. Other than getting fresh towels it was all self serve.

Anita Gelato on the corner is a must if you like fresh made Gelato. We added a few pounds for sure as we were there most evenings. It can get busy but is worth the wait. Lots of other eats around as well. Highly recommend La Pechora Bianca and The Grey Dog all on the same street.

I would stay here again for both comfort and proximity. Thanks Sonder!!

title: Excellent location and amenities
text: In NYC to visit colleges with teenage daughter. Loved the location and felt very safe walking back late night from watching Broadway shows. Room was spacious for a queen standard booking. Bathroom clean and loved that there is no carpet due to asthma and allergies. Thermostat was programmable and was easy to use. Code for entry, elevator and room was convenient. The ear plugs were definitely good to have on hand but we are heavy sleepers and we’re not bothered by the city sounds. I would not recommend though for light sleepers or those that find daylight annoying in the am when sleeping. Curtains are light blocking but light does filter through the sides. Really enjoyed staying here and would come back.

title: Everything you need
text:
Our stay was excellent. It's really easy and good to find. The area is nice and central. 
The room is big enough to sleep and store your luggage. The bathroom has a lot of space. Overall we loved it!!

title: Ottimo rapporto qualità prezzo
text: La particolarità è che nn esiste hall e reception. Dopo la prenotazione arriva un codice che si utilizza x ascensore e per accedere alla camera. Se nn richiesto non vengono fatte quotidianamente le pulizie. Giudizio positivo soprattutto per la tariffa molto vantaggiosa

title: 5 night stay
text:
Had a brilliant stay... the place was spotless clean. We had access to everything we needed.
Seemless self check-in and checkout.
Such a great spot at the sonder Flatiron... SO close to everything... use the city mapper app to see what's within 5-15 mins walking distance for coffee in the morning etc. 
Lots of subway stops close by for uptown/downtown.
Would defo stay here again!

title: 10/10 Recommend!!
text: We absolutely loved this location! We will definitely be staying here the next time we come! Earplugs were provided but we did not need them at all. Perfect locations around so many things to do!!!!!!

title: Great experience!
text: Sonder was very responsive. They brought me a chair soon after I asked for it. The room was clean and nicely centrally located. Check in was very straightforward and the apartment felt very secure. Very comfortable room with wonderful views

title: Easy + convenient! definitely recommend!
text: This is our first time staying at any of the Sonder locations. After parking — if you can’t find a spot on the street there is a parking garage right down the block that we reserved using Spot Hero! — we took all of our belongings up to our room, it was easy to use the elevator and get into our room using the access codes that are provided. We stayed in a corner king suite. It was clean and comfy. My husband, 5 month old baby, and I were all very comfortable! The bed was nice, we took full advantage of the kitchenette, especially when needing to wash bottles or store breastmilk. There is a Starbucks across the street and Eataly is a stones throw away. There are so many restaurants to eat at or order pickup from! The perfect location if you’re fine with walking around a bit to get places and to avoid the chaos of other populated sections of the city, instead of staying in them. Shopping is just a couple minutes walk. Rockefeller center is about a 30 minute walk. It is a bit noisy at night but they provide ear plugs and i honestly didn’t use them or mind the noise. It was easy to chat with management via the app if you needed something, although we requested an iron and didn’t receive one.. there was an ironing board but no iron? But there was wrinkle release spray that we purchased in the lobby so all worked out! All in all our stay was great! It didn’t feel like an Airbnb or a hotel.. almost felt like an apartment we lived at! highly recommend.

title: 즐거운 투숙
text: 신혼여행으로 왔으나 본의 아니게 100일된 우리 아기와 같이 투숙하였다. 그렇지만 불편함 없이 투숙하였고, 직원들 모두 친절하였으며 원하는 요구사항들을 바로 들어주었다. 맨하탄 flatiron에서 4박 하였고, 브루클린 Industrial에서 2박 예정인데 브루클린 숙소도 많이 기대된다. 객실은 깨끗하였으며 걱정하였던 소음은 심각하지 않았다. 다음에 기회가 된다면 또 올 것이다.

title: A great find
text: Great space and location. Technology made it easy to check in and get access to room. Comfy bed and clean room... wouldn’t hesitate to stay here again. Would have liked to have bottled water in room but otherwise had everything i needed  for a comfortable stay.

title: Wonderful time
text: We had a wonderful time staying at Sonder. The location was excellent. Very safe and clean. Easy to get around to all of NYC. Lots of nice restaurants in walking distance and excellent Gelato just around the corner. 🥰

title: Do not stay at this self service hotel
text:
While other Sonder hotels might be better, this particular location was terrible on so many levels. I’d go as far to say one of the worst hotel experiences my fiancé and I have had to date. The only PRO here is the location but that’s about it. Here are were our issues:

- The customer service was extremely unhelpful, made worse because of the lack of communication between the remote team we communicated with on the app and the nearly non-existent ‘team’ at the physical location.
- The state of the hotel room itself was not good. The sink easily clogged, light switches by the bed hung off the wall and there was grit / grime around the bathroom floor. To make matters much worse, one of the 3 large shades that covered the tall windows was loose when we arrived and by the first night had completely fallen off. We asked multiple times and were told multiple times a team member would come to fix / replace but no one ever came. This left the window by the bed completely open with no privacy and woken up early to tons of sunlight pouring in.
- We also asked the customer service to come and clean our room multiple times to no avail, finally having to go up to the cleaning team member we saw in the hallway and point to our room to please help.
- We were asked multiple times throughout our stay if we wanted to extend our trip (we didn’t need to) but when we asked to push our check-out time from 11am to 12pm they said it would be $25 fee if approved… but it was never even approved.
- Lastly, small but annoying - Every time you use the elevator, you have to enter an 8 digit code into the elevator’s janky keypad, even just when going down to the lobby. Would be much more convenient with the app or keycard.

All and all, this is NOT a 4-star hotel as listed and we will never stay at a Sonder again.

title: Absolutely Beautiful spot!
text:
I recently spent 3 days in NY on a solo trip, I have stayed in some sonder locations around the US last year so decided to give it a try.
Pros- Absolutely beautiful spacious rooms, gorgeous views, I was on the 3rd floor & didn't have noise issues ( ear plugs were left just incase which was thoughtful), easy access to building, great safe area, close to so many spots, wifi was great.
Cons- The television was chromecast which I don't have so kind of missed starting my day with some tv, also bathroom was slightly run down and could do with a few updates.

Overall, this place was great and I will definitely be booking here again for my next NY trip :)

title: Traveler beware
text:
Our room was on the 3rd floor above Anita Gelato. Anita Gelato plays loud music all day - from 10 am until 3 am sometimes (a good evening ended at midnight). The music is loud enough for Shazam to pick up the song - so sleeping was impossible. When we reached out to Sonder online, they claimed ignorance and said they could not control street noise. Turns out according to an employee I talked with that they know this is an issue (as guests regularly complain) and have been unable to address it - but also don’t disclose it. This seems to be a pattern with Sonder as they also claim to have a fitness room in the building / but they don’t - all they have is an agreement with a gym four streets away. 

Great room, terrible company, Book at your risk

title: Perfect alternative to Airbnb
text: This was my first time staging with Sonder and my expectations were exceeded. I really enjoyed the privacy and quietness of the space and stay. The building, elevators, room, and bathroom were spotless and the amenities somehow seemed more convenient than a normal hotel - a Tulu in the lobby for essentials and snacks, super convenient luggage storage, sustainable name brand bathroom products that work for multiple hair types, and a partnership with two local gyms to use during your stay. Will 100% be staying with Sonder again.

title: Wonderful stay!
text: A nice room - very clean with a comfortable bed and everything you need. Great customer service. Loved the location - convenient to restaurants and shops. Highly recommended and would stay again in the future.

title: Easy onboarding and wonderful location!
text:
Everything about the room was perfect. Excellent value. Service such as more towels was easy to get via the Sonder app. Can't recommend Sonder enough I always look at their listings first when I travel.

Plenty of top restaurants and shops nearby. Breakfast at The Smith across the street was a highlight, and shopping at the Harry Potter Store 3 blocks away was amazing.

title: Nice room in a great location.
text: The hotel was perfect for a busy business trip and was in a lively, iconic part of Manhattan.  The sound machine provided help this midwestern sleep in the city that "doesn't sleep"!  The room came with free access to Blink Fitness gym just a few blocks away - a great included perk that I took advantage of.  Staff was helpful in showing me how to use the passcode and the storage lockers.

title: Highly Recommend!
text:
Great hotel! Very spacious for NY and clean. Easy to access and located in the perfect spot. Right on the corner there are restaurants, bars, gelato, etc. The amenities were helpful as well (luggage lockers, gym access, etc.)

Service was great. Definitely recommend!

title: Perfect
text:
Perfect location
Friendly staff
Spacious room with alot off technical amenities.
Felt very safe and taken care off. 
Hotel sits next to very good restaurant "Hole in the wall"
Nice toiletries and service.

title: Great stay
text: My friend and I stayed here for our Harry styles concert and we loved it! Super safe place and I loved the code for the elevator. A bit pricy but worth every penny, would love to stay again, thank you !

title: Great visit, would recommend!
text: My friend and I stayed here for a weekend trip and absolutely loved our stay. Very spacious, clean room and plenty of amenities. Felt very safe and the location was perfect for us, quiet but within walking distance to everything we wanted to do and close enough to a train stop. Definitely would recommend!

title: Misleading Website, a bit shabby and not really a hotel
text:
I was looking forward to staying at the Sonder Flatiron, as the location is great and the website makes it look new and we designed.  The reality is quite a bit different. 

First of all, the tech system they have driving everything (the Sonder Ap) is clunky and does not work well. The electronic key for the room does not really work, even after you manage to download it to your phone, which in my case took 45 minutes and a visit from the property manager.   You actually need the electronic key or a numeric  code to enter the rooms AND to go up and down in the elevator.  The alarming thing about this is that if there is an emergency and you don't have the code, you are effectively unable to get out of the building. How that works in the event of an emergency is something that this place really needs to consider... It seems extremely unsafe to get trapped in an elevator if you don't remember the code and the electronic key fails.

Second, the place has no regular TV.  They provide a chrome cast ap and a monitor, but if you don't have a phone or a laptop that can stream media to a Chromecast TV,  you are out of luck.  I don't come to NYC to watch the TV, but it is pretty weird to not even be able to watch network news or CNN.

The room itself (at least my room) is small and sort of shabby, with numerous scuff marks on the walls and what I hope is coffee stains splattered on the base boards.  The bathroom is dark and small, with  worn and faded tiles and when you open the blinds covering up the bathroom window, the window is actually boarded up with a large sheet of plywood.  Strong tenement vibe.

The lobby of the property is spartan and the only person on the scene is a security guard who was very friendly, but did not appear to be able to assist with check in or sort out the technical problems with the ap.  He send an email to a helpful woman who is apparently the property manager. She came by our room after about 40 minutes to try to help us out, and is very capable and friendly and tried to  help but she can't manage this whole place on her own.  In any event, it appears that most of the decisions need to go through head office.  

Also, unlike a normal hotel, once you pass the cancellation period (3 days before check-in), keep in mind that the bookings are completely non refundable.  I tried to shorten my stay to move to a better place and was told that I would not get any refund if I left 3 days early.  In other words, if upon arrival you are unhappy with the shabby rooms, the virtually non-existent service, the poor housekeeping, the odd media arrangements and the strange and potentially unsafe  access system, too bad for you, you aren't able to leave without losing 100% of the payment for the booking. 

Overall,  It seems like Sonder quickly and cheaply (and only partially) renovated the building, put a badly designed IT system in place to try to manage the property with little to no support staff, and have a poor maintenance and housekeeping team.  This is really more of a collection of badly run Airbnb units than a hotel.  Even though the price is quite competitive and the location is very good, I would not stay at this place, or in fact any other Sonder property again.

title: Great location and nice alternative to traditional hotel in the city
text: I stayed at the Sonder Flatiron for 2 nights for business. The location was perfect, right on Broadway and close to the subway and easily walkable food, drinks and shopping. The room was clean and the access was easy and felt safe even in the absence of a formal lobby. The room was typical city-small, but had everything I needed. It had more character than a typical hotel room with large windows in the room and the bathroom. If you need to work many hours in the room, you may want to request a room with a desk as there was minimal space for in-room working. I didn't not check out the work space on the 2nd floor but read that it does exist. Communication with management to request towels, early check-in and late check-out was quick, easy and responsive. I'd stay again.

title: Amazing !
text:
Perfect location in the flatiron district, few steps away from the flatiron building, the 5th avenue and Madison square park !
The room is beautifully designed, bed is super comfy ! We had a wonderful stay !

title: An excellent home base in NoMad!
text:
Check in was easy and convenient. After a very long train ride being able to walk in and go straight to the room was wonderful.

The room was exactly as described and pictured on the website. I was very pleased with the size and comfort of the room. I had a small issue with the Wi-Fi, which needed to be reset, and used the chat feature to report the problem. Kath was quick to respond and able to set up an appointment to fix it that worked around my schedule. 

The neighborhood is safe and convenient to plenty of places to go and things to see. There are tons of great places to eat in the area. 

We were able to leave our luggage in the lockers after checkout so we could continue to enjoy the city until time to head to the train station.

I would definitely book here again!

title: Amazing Surprise !
text:
I found Sonder through AirBnb but booked directly and was offered a first time guest discount. The rate was so far below others I was skeptical so I prepared myself for “you get what you pay for”, but I was pleasantly surprised! To kill the suspense, it was incredible! Once booked online, you are sent a code to enter on an outside keypad. No check in required. Once in the elevator you punch in the code again and proceed to your floor. And a final key pad press at your room. The lobby is modern and clean and the room, like a nice boutique hotel room. Very clean, very luxurious bedding. Lots of pillows. An enormous flatscreen, a small bathroom with all the shampoo etc. I even used the iron. And 3 very large windows with easy to open shades and even a mid century copy of a famous danish chair. 

And the best part. Listen closely. Just a few feet from the front entrance is the best Gelato place called Anita , worth the wait. And a closed off street to lounge and enjoy a dozen restaurants. 

So if you like a CLEAN room with nice decor A/C, comfort, a beautiful view, amazing safe surroundings all for under $200 per night (which exists no where else in Manhattan) then this is the place for you!

* took lots of great pics but keep getting error message, so just take my word for it. Nice place

title: Elevators are unsafe
text:
I stayed at this Sonder from july 6-16 partly for work and vacation. The hotel looks fine from the outside and lobby area but the rooms aren’t up to par with the amount they charge. The furniture is old and the floors and bathroom full of old scratches and stains.  And the padlock sometimes does not work, twice it took 10-20 minutes for it to reboot and allow me inside my own room. 

But all of that does not compare to being stuck in the elevator twice in two days and having to be rescued by the same firefighters twice. The one elevator I was told was too unsafe for use and was shut down and the only other elevator had broken down two-three times before that week, which the fireman had told me cause he had responded to those calls. And on the second time I got stuck I ran into the elevator mechanic which he had mentioned this was his second call to “repair” this elevator in one day. I had a room all the way in the 9th floor and when I brought up this concern to Sonder they were unable to accommodate my stay at a lower level floor and offered to switch my reservation to a different sonders if I paid the difference. But I refused and asked for a full refund and once I asked that they offered to switch me for free. Which might have been another mistake. 

The sonders the Nash is an apt building with tenants which they converted a floor with a few spaces for Sonder guests. It also is older than what they have in the pics, the kitchen is great but the other furnitures need to be updated. It’s a hodgepodge of furniture styles and all scratched up. The bathroom shower/tub would flood and be slow to drain so i hope your ok with showering in dirty ankle deep water. And did I forget to mention the cockroaches?!? Sure sure it’s New York City but if your paying$200-350/night you expect a little more cleanliness. I’ve stayed in roadside hotels and have never once seen a cockroach. That roach was the straw that broke the camels back and decided to cut my stay there short and moved to the Moxy.  To sonders credit they did refund me the unused days and a total of $600 for the inconvenience of being stuck in a dangerous elevator and cockroaches which I’m told will be in refunded in 7-10 business days. Funny how quick they are to charge your account but it takes almost two weeks for it to return. Did I mention they charged me a $800 cancellation fee? Which is taking them days to figure out and I’m still left with a $800 charge. What ever you do make sure you have a paper trail. And I would book somewhere else not worth the trouble.

title: Flatiron Stay
text: The room was as pictured with it’s included amenities. The location was great and had access to restaurants, bars, clubs, and the the subway.  Staff was response and kept in contact with us to resolve our minor issue. We would definitely recommend staying here!

title: Excellent location great accommodation
text:
Was there to 7 days on a work trip. My place was quiet, clean, spacious compared to my co-workers hotels! Tons of food, bars and coffee near by. There is always someone in the lobby if you need assistance. 

Highly recommend staying here

title: Great 3 night stay in a prime location
text: This is my second experience at the Sonder and I really enjoyed my stay. The room was large and clean with lots of amenities (iron, microwave, fridge, blow dryer, a/c, and Google chrome to connect to Netflix, ESPN, etc). I had everything I needed with extra towels in the bathroom which was great. It was a large room right downtown. I was in NYC for work and this was walking distance to the office. Also right across the street from a Starbucks. It was a little noisy (I was on the fifth floor) but after the first night you get used to it (it is NYC!). Also they had a white noise machine which was such a thoughtful way to combat that. And we had security at the front the entire time I was there. The sonder is nice for these trips because I'm really just in and out of NYC, so no need to for extra amenities or anything. It's like my own little apartment! Loved my stay and hope to come back again!

title: Perfect location and space in Sonder Flatiron
text: The apartment is full of light, very comfortable space and nice kitchenette for quick meals. The building has everything you need. It's very near so many great eating spots around Flatiron. Can't go wrong with this one.

title: Really good location, clean, modern-- a great place to stay for business or leisure!
text: I had a really good stay for a work meeting recently. The room and bathroom is clean, modern, the studio has lots of sunlight, and the check in and check out was smooth. The staff working there were also super helpful and friendly! Also used the luggage storage, which was convenient. Will highly recommend this place!

title: Comfy + Convenient
text: Perfect location, great accommodations! As a solo traveller, I loved knowing that the building was safe and secure - after 11, the doors are code-required, and there was always security (the friendliest security, no less). I loved my stay!

title: Amazing location - super convenient
text: A great room in the heart of the city. Felt safe the whole time with the codes and building security. The room was comfortable and not too noisy despite the city sounds. Everything you need is included and the on-site luggage storage was incredibly helpful.

title: Il futuro dell’hotel è qui!
text:
Ottima esperienza questa nuova proposta di hotel di Sonder!
Rapporto qualità/prezzo interessante per New York City, prezzo base poi pulizia, check-in in anticipo e/o checkout dopo le 4pm si pagano a parte solo se richiesti. 
Camera confortevole e spaziosa con letto king, pulizia eccellente.
Solo qualche problema di comunicazione nella chat per info e richieste, non sempre sono in grado di risolvere direttamente per cui tempi più lunghi nelle conferme delle vostre richieste.

title: Great location in Flatiron area!
text: We walked to so many sights including 2 nights of theater! Great restaurants nearby and the studio was perfect for 2. Very comfortable room with amenities and concierge service for extra things we requested. We❤️NY‼️

title: Excellent
text: Great Air BnB/Hotel hybrid. Flatiron NYC location can’t be beat. Rooms are spacious, modern, great value. Lots of light and great views on higher floors. Stayed 4 nights and would absolutely book again.

title: Great Stay!
text: I love this place so much. The location, service, amenities, and service are absolutely fantastic. Can't say enough about how excellent the customer service is; the staff are so friendly and helpful. Rooms are beautiful and cozy too. Only con is that you can hear your neighbors through the walls pretty well.

title: Amazing Experience
text: Very accommodating staff and a fresh clean environment! Comfortable to stay with family and friends  :) They recommended visiting 230-Fifth Rooftop Bar; indeed it was a very great experience with cool people and breath-taking views!

title: Great experience
text: Very cozy hotel, close to everything. Convenient location . Highly recommend. Room had  views of the city, subway right around the corner for easy travel in New York City. I would stay here again and again.

title: Excellent location, but issues with the details
text: The building's location was primo and the view from my room really made you feel like you were in the heart of the city. The architecture was gorgeous. The room was clean and had all the essentials, however, there were some issues with the details. The shower leaked and the room's furniture looked worn. Lastly, one of my bedside lights flickered. I'd stay here again but would stay in a different kind of room.

title: Home in the City
text: When you go to New York City it’s all about location. This Sonder is located in the heart of the Apple and was a large spacious, new, clean room as a bonus! It is safe, codes to get in the lobby and elevator for great security with a subway nearby. Great restaurants and Coffee bars on every corner.

title: Perfect location.
text:
Stayed here for 2 nights in February and it was perfect. Not too big of a place, which is to be expected, but the location was perfect in the Flatiron district and it was super easy to walk everywhere! Took the subway if it was more than a 20 min walk, which was great as well since everywhere we wanted to go was less than a 30 minute subway ride. 

Shower was amazing! Wasn't too loud outside surprisingly, and we had to use our code to use the elevator and get inside the building and our unit so I felt very safe. It was just me and my roommate and I wasn't worried at all. 

It was also very clean, they allowed us to check in two hours early, and they had plenty of luggage storage to use since we arrived super early.

title: Great location!!
text: We loved our stay at the Sonder Flatiron! Great location with a clean room with everything I needed. Check in and check out was easy and enjoyed having everything on the app. There is limited luggage storage on site which was very helpful. While a little loud at night, it is Manhattan and they included a white noise machine. Would recommend!

title: Not a nice or safe experience
text: Our initial room was on the 9th floor with a king size bed.  The room next to us was having a very loud party well after midnight.  The walls are paper thin in this Sonder location.  The room also has a connecting door to the other room.  While we were sitting on the bed waiting to hear back from the staff regarding the room, a couple guys from the room next door walked into our room from that door.  Apparently, no one locked that door before we checked in!   They finally gave us a different room.  This room was much smaller and only had a queen or double sized bed.  They refused to adjust the cost of our stay based on us now having a smaller room.  Additionally, our bathroom door was difficult to close in the new room and on our last day in NYC we tried to use the luggage locker but the lock was impossible to figure out.  The staff member didn't even know how it works.  I have rarely complained about hotels, but this wasn't a good experience!

title: El Hotel está cerrado, no está atendiendo
text:
pagué mi reserva 2 meses antes de viajar, llegué al hotel y estaba cerrado sin funcionamiento, y no quieren devolver el dinero, es una estafa, cuidado con este hotel, porque no responde, y no devuelve el dinero cuando no da el servicio.
mi número de confirmación pagada es 160745548297, para demostrar que mi denuncia es real.

title: Turned up to a building site
text: We arrived in New York at the Flatiron hotel to find it was a building site, it has been for months, we booked this trip on 26th June 2019, a treat to watch the jets vs Cowboys, we are big cowboys fans, we came over from England to this mess. We spent the first day trying to find somewhere to stay, got up at 4 in the morning, to contact our travel agent back home, who then struggled to find a hotel for the rest of our stay, with all the sport going on in the city, hotels couldn’t provide all the nights we needed, in the end at 3pm the day after we got into another hotel, we were tired, stressed, worried and dejected at the whole trip, the whole experience for our family totally ruined by this hotel being closed.we are now home trying to get answers to who has not informed people on the closure of this hotel. A total waste of money, time an utter disappointment, to let people travel from around the world to this, A joke and not a funny one at that.

title: Showed up and it was BOARDED & PAPERED UP!!
text: We had booked a special trip for my mother's birthday, prepaid, and when we arrived from EWR, the hotel was boarded up, covered in brown butcher paper, and was defunct. It was a nightmare.  It was shocking that TripAdvisor nor the property itself notified us of its closure (or forced closure due to financial or criminal activity).  We were completely blind-sighted.  To make matters worse, all phone numbers were disconnected or rang into empty air.  It was humiliating, and of course, we had booked everything else, two broadway shows, tour at the Guggenheim,  lunch at Tavern on the Green, Fig + Olive, dinner at Gallagher's, etc. It was offensive and terrible that TripAdvisor had to go through all of the processes of calling the property and then telling us that they needed to give the business 24 hours to answer.  My key question, why is this listing EVEN STILL POSTED for people to try to book into?  HELLO?  The company is defunct.  It is an insult to TripAdvisor's users and data to be so uninformed and non-reactive.  They did not make it right as it took seven days for our over $2,000 refund to be returned to our credit card.  Did they even offer to comp another hotel or assist us?  No.  I am disgusted by the fraud of the Flatiron Hotel, which is now being PERPETUATED by TripAvidsor's failure to act.  Disgraceful negligence.

title: Ditto American Horror Story
text:
Seriously this place should not even get a 1 Star. Carpet not vacuumed and scared to walk or touch anything in this room. The hotel should not be open!
I am just shocked at the condition of this place!

title: Beware: American Horror Story Hotel- One Star Hotel Experience for a Five Star Price tag.
text:
We were very excited to stay at the flatiron because if its proximity to major attractions.
The photos on the website literally look like a different hotel than what we stayed in. 

The bedroom windows were so dirty and crusted that we could barley see out them.
A good 70% of the electric fixtures in the room were broken- the very oddly placed television screen in the bathroom did not work,  the touchpad in the bathroom said', 'please wait" the entire duration of our stay. The lights above the second bed were broken and would not turn on and there were several random remotes velcro-ed to the wall that did nothing.
The beds were very uncomfortable, and there was a huge patch of melted carpet in the shape of an iron mark on the floor. 
The 'free breakfast' should be rephrased to 'breakfast snacks' because there was no actual cooked food, just some yogurt placed in a bowl of ice, dry cereal packs, and some bananas.
The cafe photographed in the website is actually an empty cafe counter with rusted espresso machines and dirty tools laying all over. 

The staff that checked us seemed to be annoyed that we were even there, and when we brought it to their attention when we checked out about all the broken things, the maintenance man laughed at us, and said 'Yeah that stuff is broken in every room'.  They also put an erroneous hold of $150 on our card during our stay even though the room was already paid in full ahead of our stay- and they could provide no reason why. 

For paying almost $400 for one night of that experience, I say, beware of this place. You can do better.

title: Great
text:
Okay, I was expecting the worse from this hotel based on the reviews, and maybe that helped me be relativley suprised by my visit. No, its not up to par, but this is a very good place to stay if youre on a budget or just looking for a nice location to lay your head. They are updating the whole lobby right now, so I feel like they hear everyones conserns in the reviews. They redid their bathrooms that are wonderful, and the room all around is fine. Were in our early 20s and was great for us. Might not be the greatest for more middle aged people looking for something nicer. 
The ice machines are not avalible, but you just call down to the lobby, and they bring your ice to your room. I loved that!
The staff was great, gave me all the info I needed at check in and was super nice.
The only thing I did not like about the hotel was the lack of housekeeping. The first night we got it, they did not make the bed or change the sheets, and the second night, the didnt even come. So we didnt get clean towels or more water (which is included in the resort fee).

I feel like they are really updating it, but that takes some time especially with smaller buisnesses. People expect too much, this place is fine!

title: Surprenant
text:
Surprenant petit déjeuner dans le hall avec corn flakes, pommes, yaourt, thé café, idéal pour monter en chambre.... Un peu soft pour un quatre étoiles.
. Accueil sympa sauf un homme brun frise jeune très antipathique, on a l'impression de le déranger et, quand aux dames super sympathiques et serviables... Bien situé et central pour profiter de la ville....chalbre correctes

title: Agradable sorpresa
text: A pesar de los comentarios negativos que lei los últimos meses, nos decidimos a reservar y hospedarnos en este hotel y nuestra estadía fue mucho mejor de lo previsto. La ubicación es inmejorable, cerca de todo y lejos del ruido, nuestra habitación para 5 resultó muy bien, 2 camas grandes y cómodas, TV (no la usamos) Heladera pequeña pero nos vino muy bien, cafetera con café, baño lindo, perchero y cajones para gusrdar la ropa. El desayuno tmabién nos gustó, distintos tipos de creales en cajas individuales, yogures de varis sabores, leche, cafe, bananas y manzanas. El hotel cuenta con un bar que no está funcionando, con mesas y sillas para que puedan utilizar los huespedes. El wifi funcionó correctamente durante toda nuestra estadía. La atención del personal estuvo bien y siempre cuentan con alguien que habla español

title: Excelente unicacion
text:
Hotel situado en la esquina de Broadway con la 5ª Avenida cerca del primer rascacielos de NY. Habitaciones limpias y aunque las camas no son muy grandes son muy cómodas. Por las mañanas ofrecen de cortesía cereales, leche, café, plátanos y yoghures, pero no vayas buscando un desayuno amplio. El personal es muy amable. Ya no funciona el bar de abajo y la terraza en el tejado estaba a la venta, así que deja un aspecto un poco desangelado. Hay un supermercado en la misma calle esquina con la 6ª avenida. Hay varias bocas de metro para subir up o downtown rápidamente, estando el
Distrito financiero o Central Park a unos 5km. Hay un Starbucks en frente.

title: Killer Ironing Board
text:
This hotel is operationally broken, but it is located at an almost perfect location on Broadway, just two blocks from Eataly and Madison Square Park.

The trouble started when checking in after midnight. The man at the desk could not be trouble to get off the phone to check my into the hotel, and then could not figure out how to take my credit card. The fun continued when finding a foot broken off the ironing board resulting in a pointed weapon that almost made a hole in my shirt! The thermostat panel was missing exposing bare electronics. It turns out the the AC was not working so they put a large portable unit in the room.

The staff here was one of the most unengaged that I have ever seen in a hotel. The maid did not even replace soaps, and the front desk staff act like they are bored with the guests. Even an email to the general manager did not generate a response even after 48 hours!

title: Niet boeken
text:
Ondermaats 
Te veel negatieve punten 
oa;
Kamer en hotel faciliteiten niet volledig
Ongeïnteresseerd personeel ( enkeling daargelaten)
Ongezellig, onpersoonlijk, er wordt geen aandacht meer besteed door de eigenaar aan dit hotel.

title: Hotel decadente e péssimo serviço
text:
O hotel possui ótima localização, longe do burburinho da Times Square e próximo da Madison e do Flatiron Building.
Entretanto é um hotel decadente, sem restaurahte, carpete muito velho e housekeeping lastimável. No primeiro dia a housekeeping não repos papel higiênico. No segundo dia não arrumou a cama.
O ar condicionado só tem 2 opções: ou desligado ou com a ventilação em cima da cama, sem possibilidade de desvio do vento.
Outro aspecto que não gostei foi que o hotel oferece café da manhã incluso na diaria, que não passa de um balcão de leite com sucrilhos, e o segurança fica observando quanto você pega...me senti enganado.
Veja as fotos.

title: Old and Tired
text:
We arrived late and was greeted my a friendly guy in reception who checked us in.
We booked our room based on the description that it would fit our family...it didn’t, 3 in one bed and 2 in the other.
As we were exhausted we slept!
Breakfast was not Breakfast as you would expect in a hotel but packs of dry cereal that you help yourself too.
Thankfully we only had booked one night otherwise we would have had to change hotel.
Certainly not 4 star, it would struggle to get a 2 star rating.
Avoid at all cost.

title: Horrible Disaster
text:
This was by far the worst hotel I've ever stayed in.

1. My heating broke in the middle of the night and I therefore woke up in the morning and my room was a FREEZING 9°C (48°F) (this was during the month of January). I had to change rooms, however the very unpleasant/unprofessional manager did not even offer to give me a partial refund (not even the resort fee for that particular night).

2. The rooms are in terrible condition compared to basically all other hotels I've ever stayed at in NYC. My bed sheets were even stained with blood, so I had to ask them to come change them. If I hadn't been so busy working, I would definitely have left.

3. Also, if you enjoy taking a warm shower, this is definitely not the place to stay.

I could go on and on but I don't feel like wasting more time on this terrible establishment which in no way meets the standards of a 4-star hotel (have a look at the other reviews, they speak for themselves). STAY AWAY!!!

title: well-intentioned upgrade failed
text: I remember when this hotel first opened, and it seemed like a fun place, especially the dramatic aquarium in the lobby. The location was near to an event, so I chose it. However, I was surprised upon checking in at the low tech things they did (like take a copy of my license which did make me feel like a valued guest but someone on probation). I am not a fan of additional fees and did not like being told of the "mandatory" facilities charge. Why not include it in the price instead of pulling a bait and switch? The room itself was fine, but the TV in the bathroom mirror was bizarre, and I couldn't figure out how to operate it. Not sure I would stay here again.

title: Reservations are worthless at this  hotel!!
text: The front desk clerk clearly knew when I walked in that they had given away my room but pretended to look up my name, then my confirmation and was adamant I had no reservation or maybe it has been canceled when I showed my confirm. When I showed her the credit card charge they had already run that evening then she claimed the reservation was for the next night despite the printed confirmation with the correct dates! She never apologized and only offered to reverse the charge, continuing to lie about my reservation so she would  not have to find me another room!  I ended up looking for another room and walking to another hotel at 1am!  I will never book this hotel again!

title: Stay away
text: Not a 4 star, pathetic breakfast consisting of cold coffee from a perculator that has seen better days, yogurt, black bananas and cereal. Room was good, charged us twice and then corrected the bill. Never again.

title: Hotel pas trés acceuillant
text: hôtel pas satisfaisant pour un 4 étoiles !! on entend tout se qui se passe dans la rue ,du courant d’air passe par tous les coins , petit déjeuner des korn flacks et un fruit!! et un yaourt  ,médiocre ,,et si on arrivait en bas à 9h30 et qu'il n’y en avait plus ,pas la peine d'en demander on nous a répondus qu'il y en avait plus !!

title: BEWARE! Read this entire review before thinking about booking this hotel.
text:
This is NOT a 4 star hotel, I repeat, NOT A FOUR STAR HOTEL! It is closer to what I would imagine a 1-2 star hotel would be like. It was by far the absolute worst hotel experience I have ever had( if I thought my previous worst was bad, this hotel made that one look like the Plaza). The Flatiron set the bar at an entirely new low. 

My boyfriend and I  booked our room the morning of our stay based entirely on the pictures shown online and the fact that this was listed as a 4 star hotel, this was a huge mistake. We booked the king room which according to the website was roomy, bright and clean, with fresh flowers and a stately bathroom featuring a jetted bathtub, in a hotel listed as having been built in 2011. That was all a charade because the building is dark and old and the pictures online are not at all an actuate representation of what the hotel actually looks like.

Let’s start with check in, we arrived at the hotel between 12:30-1PM, the “lobby” should have been a dead giveaway to what we were walking into. First, there is a large dirty fish tank in the middle of the room, the water is cloudy and the fish look like they are dying. To the right there is an area with dated window treatments and old restaurant booths sporadically placed around the room. This is confusing because there is no restaurant and “breakfast” (we will talk about this in a second) is “grab and go”. To the left is the check in area, consisting of ratty old mis-matched furniture and a counter in the corner that serves as their “front desk”. This area was filthy, and standing behind those piles of papers, boxes and wires stood our first encounter with the Flatiron’s awful customer service. As we entered and approached the desk, this woman did not greet us, welcome us, or even smile. We said hello and gave her our name, but without even checking, she told us that our room was not ready yet and would not be for awhile. This seemed odd because the lobby was empty, and the hotel was eerily quiet, (this was the case for the majority of our 3 night stay, as we never saw or heard anyone on our floor and only saw 2-3 others in the lobby) so I am not sure how they did not have a room ready, but OK. The woman said they would hold our bags in their baggage area (this is listed as an amenity on their website) and we could come back to check in later. After a morning of traveling, this was a little annoying, but we tagged our bags and left. We went to lunch and a quick museum and by 3PM, we assumed the room would be ready, so we called to ask. WRONG! The same rude woman answered the phone and in an annoyed tone, told me that our room would not be ready until at least 4. At this point, we are tired, frustrated, and just want to relax before our evening plans, but we are able to kill another hour walking around. When we returned to the hotel, the rude woman reluctantly  checks us in, and to my horror I noticed that our bags are still sitting exactly where we left them in front of the desk! I assume this means that they don’t have a bag room because our bags just sat out in the sketchy lobby for hours. There was no porter/bell hop to help us with our bags(as listed online), so we grabbed our luggage, took our keys and headed to our room via the dilapidated elevator. This elevator was as scary as it was disgusting. The kind of elevator that you hold your breath on, not only because it is so dirty, but because you think that if you breathe it may stop working and you will be stuck in it forever. The elevator also does not have key access, so anyone can wander off of the streets and onto the guest floors. Upon exiting the elevator, we stepped into a dirty, dark hallway that was straight out of a horror movie. Dim lighting, cobwebs, dirty old carpet, paint chipping off of the walls, the whole works. We get to our room and open the door, and it gets, if possible, worse. With a loud bang, the door slams behind us(because there was no slower arm) and we enter this weird corner room with so many angles. You’d think that because it was a corner room, it would be bigger, right? Wrong! This room was MUCH smaller than all of the rooms shown online, the carpet looked older than the lobby furniture, the walls were peeling and dirty(you could see layers of handprints and gunk when the light hit at different angles), the window treatments were dated and stained, the furniture was chipped and beat up, the windows were dirty and old, and the room was stuffy and hot(even though it was only April). We looked around and tried to find something that would make the room better, but we never found it. Remembering the reason we booked this hotel (the beautiful bathroom with the jetted tub!), I excitedly opened the bathroom door, only to be met with more disappointment.

The bathroom was black, totally black, with black floors and walls, not at all like the beautiful bright colors shown online. It was so dark, like God forbid if you dropped something on the floor, it would probably disappear into the black abyss and you would never see it again. It was terrifying to even use the bathroom because all I could think about while sitting on the toilet (making sure to not let my feet touch the floor) was “what am I not seeing in this dark bathroom?”. It was also tiny, not at all like the large bathrooms pictured online. How small you ask? Well, to enter the bathroom, you had to step in, go all the way back wall so that the door(which barely cleared the toilet) could close. You could not even get to the shower if you left the door open(unless you wanted to climb over the toilet). If you’re a couple, forget having two people in there at once. To brush your teeth together, one of you will have to stand in the bedroom. If two people are trying to shower together, one of you will have have to step in, close the door, cross to the shower, open the shower door, get in, close the shower door, yell to the other person to open the bathroom door, step in, close the door, cross over and enter the shower. I often wondered, “ if this is a deluxe bathroom, what does a standard bathroom look like?” If you’re expecting the mirror TV to work, you will be disappointed. I am not sure why this is an option in such a tiny bathroom as it is just an inconvenience (there is a just a black square where your face reflects). The mirror did have a light, but don’t expect to be able to do your makeup in this bathroom because somehow the mirror light’s odd blue hue makes the bathroom seem even darker. In place of the missing tub, our room had a shower that was supposed to have different modes and settings, none of which we could use because you could not change between the overhead and body jets, so it may as well have just been a basic shower head. The shower also leaked despite the door being closed, so when exiting you stepped into a puddle of water and sopping wet towels(which could not be hung to dry afterwards because there was no towel rack). Speaking of leaks, the sink faucet also leaked, leaving a puddle of water on the counter which soaked everything I left out on the first day. There is no soap dish, so expect the counter to be not only wet, but also soapy. The website boasts about their “designer toiletries and hair dryers”, and while the toiletries did smell nice, they were not replaced by housekeeping and the hair dryer was old and smelled of burnt hair.
 
Back to the room, the tiny, tiny room. Be prepared to smash your shins on the bed platform literally every time you walk around the bed. The mattress is absolutely awful, never in my life have I slept in a bed this old and uncomfortable(this includes those awful ones in college). You will literally feel every single spring inside of the mattress and I promise you will wake up in pain. The room has no dresser, there are drawers under the bed, but not all of them open. There is a small table under the tv across from the bed, but no end tables. A garbage can sits where a nightstand should be on one side, so you can imagine how that will smell when you wake up after disposing of food cartons. There is no safe in the room despite it being listed as an amenity, and the mini fridge kept falling apart and overheating. It was also empty despite the website listing it as containing a fully stocked mini bar(something that you might find yourself in need of if you book this hotel).

It quickly became apparent to us why the hotel was so dirty. During our 3 night stay, we only had housekeeping once. That means that our bed was only made once, our trash was only taken out once, and we were only given fresh towels once over the course of our entire stay, despite pressing the housekeeping button. We checked in on Saturday and housekeeping did not come until Monday. Not  Monday morning, not Monday afternoon, but Monday evening! After returning from a long day in the city (around 5PM) we just wanted to relax. Walking down the hall we noticed that our door was propped open and the housekeeper was inside. She eagerly invited us in(without having us verify that we were even staying there) and asked if we wanted her to skip our room, but that was a big heck no as it had not been serviced since our arrival, so we opted to wait in the lobby for her to finish. Unfortunately, the room was still quite dirty when we returned 30 minutes later as she had only made the bed, taken out the trash and given us new bath towels (no hand towels, washcloths, or bath mat).

Possibly one of the worst issues with the room was the lack of AC or airflow. As soon as we arrived, we put the AC on because the thermostat read 70 degrees and we prefer a cooler room. We did not feel an immediate change, but assumed that like everything else it the hotel, the AC was probably old and might take awhile. Fast forward to the middle of the first night, Waking up covered in sweat, I check the thermostat which had risen, so I turn it all the way down(~50F) and go back to sleep. By the time the sun came up, the room was so hot and stuffy and we were covered in sweat. After showering in the leaky dark shower, we headed out for the day, stopping at the front desk to complain about the AC on the way. We were informed that the AC in the building had not yet been turned on and that several other guests that had made the same complaint about the temperature of their room. We were told that we should turn the thermostat off and open a window. I explained to the gentleman that our windows had been painted shut(I found this out  in the middle of the night when I tried to open them after smashing my sweat covered shins on the bed for the umteenth time). He took our room number and told us that he would send maintenance up to fix the AC issue, or at the very least, open the windows. This made us feel better and we left for the day. When we returned that night, the problem had not been fixed and the room was a sweltering 79 degrees. That night was worse than the first and again we woke up wet sheets. Once again, on our way out for the day we stopped at the front desk to complain, but nobody was there. We waited a few minutes for someone to come back, but nobody returned, so we stopped and explained our problem to a man who we assumed to be the missing bellhop/doorman(this was the first time in 3 days that we had seen him). Thinking back now, he very well may have been some random person who wandered into the hotel because despite giving him our room information and him telling us he would have the front desk take care of it for us, it was still not taken care of when we returned several hours later. The AC never came on during our stay, our windows were never opened, and we were never even offered a fan. I could not imagine staying in this hotel in the summer or on one of the higher floors, because of how hot the fifth floor was in April. Upon reading reviews of this hotel, my educated guess is that this hotel does not have a working HVAC system because many other guests have complained about not having heat and AC throughout the year. 

Additionally, this hotel comes with its share of additional charges. You will be charged a $10.00 refrigerator fee for that broken refrigerator and a $28.69/night resort fee. Although this is common for most NYC hotels, it felt like a rip off here as we only saw a few of the items listed as included in the fee. According to the website, the resort fee includes the following:  

-Breakfast (Sugary kids cereals, open containers of milk, and coffee in paper cups.)
-Business center (not sure where this was because I never saw a sign for it, but if it's anything like the rest of the hotel, it’s probably a Windows 98 desktop on a folding table somewhere)
-Internet (the WiFi was slow and failed often)
-Daily newspaper (we were not given one for the length of our stay, nor did I see any in the lobby)
-In-room safe (how are you charging a fee for this? We did not even have one)
-In-room bottled water (2 bottles of warm Poland Springs)
-Daily Housekeeping (we only had this one time)

To sum up our stay in a pros and cons list:

Pros:
-The toiletries smelled nice
-The location 

Cons:
-No real lobby
-Poor customer service
-No bag room, leave bags in lobby at your own risk
-Room not ready upon arrival
-Breakfast was a joke
-Lobby, elevators, halls and rooms are old, smelly and dirty
-Room was tiny and not as pictured online
-Bruised shins from bed platform
-No dresser or nightstands, under bed storage drawers didn’t all work
-Uncomfortable old bed
-No housekeeping
-AC did not work, no airflow in room.
-Empty mini fridge kept falling apart and overheating
-Dark cave-like bathroom
-Bathroom was smaller than pictured and did not have a tub
-Shower did not change modes and leaked onto floor
-No soap dish and sink leaked
-Mirror TV did not work
-Hairdryer was ancient and smelled like burning hair

title: Ladies, Don’t Bother
text:
This independent hotel is why so many people stay at chains. At least you know what you’re getting at a Hyatt.

The cons: I chose this hotel because it was the least expensive near the place I was doing business. Huge mistake.

The lighting is terrible; even if you don’t wear makeup you can’t even read the temperature setting. I don’t think any bulb is over 10 watts.

No shelving, even though the huge bathroom has one bare wall that could hold a ton of shelving for cosmetics, etc.

There are no instructions on how to change the shower head flow, so you don’t know that you can’t change dribbling water to a strong flow while the water is running. It’s only when the water’s off that it can be changed, which means you have to turn the head, then turn on the water to see what you’ve done ... repeat, repeat, repeat. 

Also there will be a huge puddle of water on the floor when you get out. The shower mat is folded on the back of the toilet, which makes it hard to tell what it is until after you’ve used your body towels to keep the water from flowing across the room.

And all of the above describes the better, larger room I was moved to after being assigned a closet with a shower. The coffee maker didn’t work, the phone didn’t work.

And when you book a room for more than one day, you must stay the entire time or pay for it anyway.

The pros: the people who work here. All very nice and will change what they can to make you more comfortable once you’re stuck here.

title: Très bon rapport qualité-prix, situation idéale
text: Nous avons été ravis par cet hôtel parfaitement situé à Manhattan, à côté de l’iconique bâtiment Flatiron. Métro à deux pas, Empire State building, shopping et attractions touristiques tout proches. Nous avons pris une chambre pour 4 située sur le coin de l’hôtel. Grande chambre triangulaire avec plein de fenêtres et vue sur Broadway. 2 lits très confortables, belle salle de bain. Hôtel bien tenu et propre. Accueil agréable. Le point faible : le petit-déjeuner se résume à des céréales, yaourts, café, lait et pommes. Dommage mais plein de starbucks et autres échoppes de rue qui proposent des viennoiseries ou des donuts.

title: Disappointing
text:
It was a two-night stay :
- good location but hotel very noisy: windows have not been renovated for a good while and it sounds like you are sleeping on the street
- bad service: my room was simply not cleaned my first night (and I was away from 8 am till 9pm)
- bad care: coffee machine was broken so there was no breakfast served (!) for my whole stay. Reception was not aware of that (receptionist boasted about a good breakfast when checking in !) and hotel management simply did not care enough just to put out some coffee and at least arrange some services  (why care when your customers can go to Starbucks across the street ...)
- check-in and check out is an adventure. Deposit was taken at check-in for 2 nights even if I had a voucher (we were 4 checking-in with vouchers, 2 were incorrectly retained money on our credit card but fortunately never debited). At check-out the person (I was the only one checking out so she was not overly overbooked with work) could not care less. She did not ask me about my stay (I had already complained about my room being not cleaned the previous night with little avail), did not make me review my bill and when I asked what was debited from me just explained raising her eyes that there were taxes (without of course looking at me when speaking). During my 2 night stay I saw 4 different persons at reception with the same behaviour. I stay 3 or 4 times a year in NYC for business in the 3 past years , booking the same type of hotels and changing location in Manhattan depending of my meetings. I never had such a bad service.

title: Terrible hotel with even worse customer service
text:
BEWARE- this is the biggest scam of Newyork City. 
The hotel has no lobby. It is filthy and feels unsafe. The front desk has staff that is not trained to deal with customers and over all just not recommended. 
I canceled my reservation after getting there due to unsafe environment and they were unapologetic for the dirtiness of their hotel, no room available on request because of no staff and unpleasant. 
Pictures of wires hanging are of the front lobby!

title: Medio-alto
text: El hotel esta muy bien situado e incluye desayuno ( cafe de termo, platano y cereales) el horario del desayuno un poco tardío, empieza a las 8. El resto bien. Un dia no hicieron la habitqción pero el personal es muy amable. Recomendado!

title: Bel emplacement et fort potentiel
text:
Emplacement idéal sur Broadway à 200m du Flatiron Building. La ligne R-W du métro vous amène directement sur Time Square, Central Park, World Trade Center.  Chambre et communs propres, mais mérite une rénovation de l'ensemble.  Présence de chambres à 2 grands lits (4 personnes) Problème de pommeau de douche, réglé dans la journée !

Le Petit déjeuner se limite à un réservoir de café, des fruits et des bols pré-emballés de céréales.  Pas (plus ?) de bar ou de restauration dans le lobby Il ne faut pas être trop gourmand en place pour dormir. Les lits ne sont pas larges et surtout pas très longs.

title: Perfect Boutique Hotel
text: I come to NY often and this was my 20th visit to this hotel. It never disappoints me. From the minute you walk in the front desk staff is friendly and welcoming. My room was perfect for a business trip. The larger room had a great bed and even better shower. Lots of spray nozzles which were a great start to the morning. A coffee maker in the room was all I needed and the staff gave me extra coffee which I appreciated. Good location to everything at that end if town. Looking forward to my next visit. Very happy!!

title: Cozy
text:
We recently visited NYC and stayed at the Flatiron Hotel in Manhattan. The location is ideal. Mind you this hotel is older and could use some TCL but for the price the room was doable. We had space and the bed was so comfy!
I would stay here again.

title: Bom
text:
Bom hotel com boa localização.
Quarto para 4 muito bom.
Pequeno almoço fraco..Porém Starbucks mesmo ao lado.
O hotel está situado muito próximo de PennStation,  dando para ir a pé.  Preço agradável para a oferta de NY.

title: Caro para lo que es
text: El hotel está muy bien situado en el Midtown pero poco más bueno se puede decir de el. Para empezar llegamos y yo había pedido una cuna con un mes de antelación y me la trajeron rota y sin colchón por lo que el niño no pudo dormir ahí. La cama, de 90, lo nunca visto en USA, como el niño tuvo que dormir con nosotros si nos girábamos nos caíamos.
