Todo lo tecnológico de la habitación luces que se encienden con un mando, tv en el espejo, cortinas que se abren solas, nada funcionaba. El desayuno, horrible, yogurt, leche en una jarra de la que te servías, cafe de sobre, una manzana, un plátano y cereales que se cojían directamente de la caja, pésimo. Servicio de habitaciones nulo, ni bar ni nada, todo cerrado. En la descripción te dicen que la habitación tiene caja fuerte, albornoz, tetera... nada de eso! y la imagen que aparece de la habitación en la foto, nada que ver, es más pequeña. Además nos pusieron frente al ascensor a pesar de que pedí una habitación tranquila, oíamos todo.

title: not a 4 stars maybe 2
text: not a 4 stars hotel maybe 2. the staff not friendly the breakfast it’s like a snack. so expensive for the experience. Never i paid more for booking after the reservation i paid $30.00 more for my reservation at the moment of check in. At the check out they charge me extra $133.00 for towels and sheets because they can’t wash and they threw them in the trash because its so dirty my friend and i wants to saw the sheets and the towels.. So embarrassing the situation with the manager she was very rude.. I used frequency booking for international stays and locals stays in really 4 & 5 stars hotels.likes Hotel Atlantico in Madrid, Condado Vanderbilt in Puerto Rico etc. for say some goods hotels..the customers experience was awful in my stay in Flatiron hotel.

title: Feels unsafe, cramped, NOT 4-star
text:
I should have known upon arrival.  There is no lobby, just an unkempt desk with night staff and loads of paperwork.  No restaurant or amenities, just a really old looking fish tank that goes from the entrance to the second floor.

There seemed to be no security in place.  My expectations for a downtown hotel: an elevator that requires a key card, and preferably a hotel where the lobby is actually not on the main floor.  None of that was in place here.

I agree with other travelers, room was shabby and gross.  Whatever cleaning they did was not adequate.

Bed felt like I was sleeping on a board.  Afraid to get into it because god knows what was last in it.  

Hotel is shady to say the least.  It reminded me of a rent by the hour hotel you’d see in a bad late night movie.

So many great places to stay in NYC - don’t go here.

title: Ótima localização e conforto
text: Quarto super confortável, numa localização excelente em Manhattan. O barulho da cidade incomoda um pouco, sobretudo logo pela manhã, mas... é Manhattan! A Big Apple acorda com muitos carros nas ruas e ambulâncias cruzando a cidade. Mas os atendentes são atenciosos e a cama e o banheiro são ótimos.

title: Beware, it's a dump
text:
We were looking forward to a pleasant family vacation in NYC.
Upon arrival to this so called "hotel", I was a bit shocked at the appearance of the lobby.  It was old, stinky & dingy.  It went downhill from there:
-The front desk person was very unwelcoming.
- The room was old, grimy and dusty.   
-The bathroom was so small, one person could barely fit. Housekeeping was so terrible we were lucky to have towels.
-The room was extremely noisy!!!! 
-The curtains were coming off the rods.   

I could go on, but I think you get the point.
I do not recommend this place.  
Please look into booking at proper hotel chain managed by corporate.

title: So so
text:
I came here for business trip so for me many things are important.
1. Check in is at 4pm .. I used to Waite for two hours my room because I arrived earlier.
2. Check in is long and they mix my room number and gave me room with two beds instead one king size.
Then long procedure to change it.. time waisting.
3. Breakfast... easy to say here’s no breakfast!
4. Location is good for me.
5. Noise def here is very noisy it’s Manhattan!
6. Cleanliness not bad!
7. Room size is so so I was lucky but my colleague just came in his room and fell down on bad.. no space!
8. Price is high I was in December...expectable.
9. No lobby bar

title: Old and in need of renovation
text:
My boyfriend was staying here because he was working an event nearby, so I decided to stay with him since it would be closer for me to commute to work in the morning. After reading all these two-star reviews, I was really nervous about staying here, afraid of what I might find. After staying here, I can confirm that it is two stars, but it wasn't as bad as I thought it would be. Here is some of the good/bad:

Pros:
Location - located right in between the 23rd and 28th St RW train stations
Clean enough - I think everything was just very old, which made it feel not the cleanest but overall, it was fine

Cons:
Old - everything needs updating. It seems like they renovated the bathroom a few years ago but the rooms need some work. Those musty mustard curtains have got to go
Our door was wonky - it made it hard to open/close. Made me wonder if someone could have just kicked it down

I'm from NYC but if I were a visitor, I don't think I would want to stay here. I think my biggest issue was that everything was just super old/outdated and didn't feel cozy (or as cozy as a hotel room could feel) at all.

title: Used only for sleep, got terrible sleep
text: We had a problem with our Airbnb and had to book a hotel last minute and ended up with this place from Hotel Tonight, which advertised as a 4 star luxury hotel.  I felt i was in a motel 6, room was extremely small, bathroom sink with zero counter space.  The shower was nice with fancy shower heads, but unnecessary.  Floors stained badly like a cheap motel.  “Breakfast” in the morning consist of two cereals, bananas and apples.  I could have looked pasted all this since we only spent about 8-9 hours in the room a night for sleeping, but we had the worst sleep for 4 nights straight.  The first days it was raining so it was very humid out and warm for November, all we needed was a little air conditioning and we would be fast asleep with walking 10 miles a day, but couldn’t get that even with paying $250 a night.  The thing kicked on but couldn’t get past 78 degrees! A humid 78, so sweating in bed with no blankets on.  The next few days it got very cold outside so we thought well we can just leave it off and the room will be naturally cold, nope still almost 80 inside the room with nothing on and it’s 40 outside.  Talked to a couple in the elevator and they said the same thing, she said that she bought a knife to cut the glue and paint around the window so that she could open it!  It’s only upsetting because of the price you pay and you can’t even get the simplest amenities.  Location was really good and the staff was nice.

title: Comfortable room in a great location
text: The room is a modest size, but really who hangs out in a hotel while visiting NYC? Everything you need is right there and the location was perfect. There are many upgrades to this older building. The bathroom has a great shower with modern fixtures. The staff was friendly, the place was clean, I’d stay here again in a heartbeat.

title: soy mario vazquez y quisiera agradecer la atencion del hotel ,excelente .gracias a sandra michelle y a todo el personal
text:
personal excelente mencion especial a Sandra chin y michelle , se portaron de maravilla buena ubicacion del hotel y cerca de todo  muy limpio y comodo 
muy buena atencion del personal de limpieza y recepcion . muy recomendable

title: Buena ubicación
text: El hotel está súper buen ubicado, es limpio y las personas del hotel son muy amables. El cuarto es amplio y el baño está muy limpio. La decoración del hotel no es muy linda pero es cómodo. El desayuno es pequeño pero rico.

title: Almost as good as a room that cost a quarter the price
text: Room was average, but priced like a luxury hotel.  Part of that was just the local market for hotel rooms, but this place was incredibly cheap about amenities: two ice machines for the entire 24 story building, one of which was broken and the other of which was basically empty; flimsy plastic cups in plastic wrap, like you'd find in a cheap motel in a bad neighborhood, which was OK except that housekeeping failed to replace them when they made up the room, requiring a multiple calls to the front desk before somebody got around to sending replacements; psychotic air conditioning that left the room either freezing cold or stuffy hot; the worst wifi setup I've encountered in years, which required me to log in again each time my computer woke up or I took my phone out of my pocket (and why to do hotel wifi systems require you to log in at all?  It's 2018.)  For $450/night I would at least expect the amenities of a typical motel along an interstate.

title: Maybe 2 star not 4
text: I was there this weekend, and really had many unfavorable things to not be a 4 star hotel: we booked for four people and they gave us a room with small beds, the decoration is obsolete, the windows of the room were very dirty, the bathroom is very small, the carpet was tanned. On the other hand it says that they give continental breakfast but really what they serve is pot coffee, tea, some cups of cornflakes, and some apples. really the only favorable thing is the hotel location, and the service of the lobby staff. but I really do not recommend this hotel is too expensive for what you get.

title: Not worth it
text: I booked this hotel through Hotwire as it was a 4 star hotel in an excellent location. Here in tripadvisor it also has a good score (4/5). However, if you look at recent reviews, it is going downhill. This hotel should be 2 stars, not 4, and the price should be half or even a third of what they are charging per night. The decor is absolutely awful and it seems they have invested in some weird stuff (like tv in the bathroom mirror), but haven’t really focused in important stuff like overall maintenance. The windows don’t open and the curtains don’t roll to the sides, so you can’t enjoy any view. And also, they look like they have never been cleaned from the outside, full of pigeon sh.... They shouldn’t advertise that they offer breakfast as it is just apples, bananas, coffee, tea packets, milk and yogurt, in a very small table. The carpeting looked very old, the lights in the hallways were very ugly (but they seemed new), the remote control of the tv didn’t work, we never saw any other guests so we got a feeling of ghost hotel, etc. Overall, the only good thing is the location and the receptionists seemed nice. I am giving it 1 star because it doesn’t fulfill any of the expectations of a 4 star hotel that charged me 300usd per night.

title: not 4 star barely 1 star
text:
I booked this hotel through Hot Wire because it said 4 star and had the location I wanted
near gramercy. Everything after that was a complete joke, including rooms that were 80 degrees, rooms never maid up, towels that were promised and never came, mold in the bathrooms, fire dept showing up and shutting down the elevators because of water running in rooms below us. There promise of free continental breakfast was a complete joke, a 2x2 table with a coffee pot, some apples and a couple instant cereal. 
All of this being said we were given the managers name, sally tadros, who would talk to us. to this day she will not take my phone calls. Not sure if this person knows the meaning of hospitality, but she should
Looks like from other reviews the the AC has been broke for a while
Do yourself a favor and don't stay here.
btw- contacted Hot Wire and they said there is nothing they can do???

title: Solid
text: This is a lovely well managed property in a great location.  It won’t knock you’re socks off but is very reliable. I will stay here again as rooms are reasonably spacious for the price.  If you’re downtown there are few competitors at this price point.

title: good rooms
text: The hotel is conviently lodated, near harold square and near Eataly, We slept 3 adults, The room is very nice, and was not too crouded. Good shower.If you are vegan or health oriented, you should eat your breakfast at a nice place next door on Broadway st. On you can eat at the Smith, next corner.

title: Girls trip
text:
Shabby “chic” hotel literally, reasonable priced and best of all one of the best locations to stay in NYC!

5 stars for location 
-1 for shabby rooms 
-1 for inadequate cleanness!

Restaurants, shopping and subway round the corner.

title: Please, don´t spend your money on this place
text: This was one of the worst (but expensive) hotels I've ever been. The members of the staff (during the day) are not friendly at all, they barely smile at you. The bed was a bit broken, as well as the air conditioner. The air conditioner was replaced with a portable one and we had to leave the window open everyday and night because of the exhaust.(New York is very noisy so isn't nice leaving windows opened all the time). In general the hotel looks poor and abandoned, mainly because the restaurant close to the lobby/reception isn't working. Will never go back again.

title: Decent location and service but choose wisely
text: Got in on the 20th, with room keys waiting. Room was decent for last minute reservation. However, Madison Park Double is too small for 4 adult family members. Spring a little more for Broadway Corner deluxe for Queen beds. Also the noise. Know you are near nightlife so it’s going to be noisy. My grams was quite agitated with noise, we had to leave early. But for me, loved being in Midtown and several subway lines. Need quiet while in Manhattan...go to lower Manhattan. If you are spending time in hotel, this isn’t for you. But base camp for exploration of the city that never sleeps, go for it.

title: Horrible Experience
text: We called for a room with two double beds but when we got there they didn't have any so our family had to seperate into two different rooms. The staff was rude. TV and remote and curtains were broken. The room was dirty then we called for someone to fix the TV then almost 35 minutes later nobody came. I DO NOT RECCOMMEND

title: Could not possibly be worse.
text: Arrived at 10pm to join a queue of people with confirmed bookings, all of us were turned away. “No booking on the system”. No offer of help to find an alternative hotel from the unfriendly and uninterested receptionist. DO NOT RISK BOOKING THIS HOTEL, unless you enjoy scouring nyc for a hotel late at night!

title: Small but wonderful location in NYC
text: Got a room with two double beds and wonderful window view of the historic Serbian Orthodox Cathedral of Saint Sava which caught fire and burned 2 years ago. ( I could look down into the gutted sanctuary...It broke my heart!).  This area is so centrally located...easy to get to Time Square, easy to get to One World Trade  - and everything in between those two locations.  There is a Starbucks literally steps away from the hotel and grocery stores and drug stores within a block.

title: Shockingly bad
text: Worst hotel stay I’ve ever had, no joke. Smoke alarm was beeping every minute when I first checked in, then they said they fixed it, and then at 2:45am it started again. Not a battery problem, they said - but someone smoking in the building. Night sleep completely ruined. The phones did not work - could not call the front desk and no one fixed it. Internet was down all evening when I had to do work, said they were fixing but was never resolved. Stains on the carpet. Do not recommend this hotel at all- please avoid!

title: Terrible.
text: Had to change rooms multiple times. First room, toilet didn’t flush, second room the heat was stuck at 80 and windows painted shut. Third room adequate. Location was great but that was about it for plus’s. Hotel run down and musty.  Don’t stay here.

title: Rude staff and not well maintained
text: Staff is incredibly rude. They don’t even say Hello when you arrive nor did they say Goodbye! Air conditioning broke in the middle of the night and I had to move rooms. Place smelled like gas and the breakfast was cereal boxes and bagels. For the price we paid (even at a corporate discount) I expected more. This is my second stay there and the place is definitely going down. I will never come back.

title: Terrible experience that kept on getting worse
text:
Had a terrible experience here. During the first night of stay, a squealing sound sets off when the heat kicked in at 6am in the morning. 

The beds are super hard - ending up giving me some back pain. maybe good for back sleepers but really uncomfortable for side sleepers. 

I asked to see if there is a room available with a softer bed for the third night. The receptionist promised me 1) she could move me to a room with king size bed with foam mattress - it will be a lot softer 2) she will move my luggage in the morning. 

When I came back in the afternoon, the luggage is not moved and the new room still had the crappy hard bed. I called the front desk and they weren’t even responsive to solve the problem - I gave up and went elsewhere. 

The place is old and full of problems. With super limited service. 

LIMIT YOUR DOWNSIDE AND GO ELSEWHERE!

title: A really nice New York Hotel
text:
We stayed here last weekend and it was thoroughly enjoyable.  The room was small but adequate.  Nice accouterments and a very comfortable bed with drapes that keep the light out. The breakfast provided is nothing to write home about, but with a Starbucks across the street, no worries. The place is clean and very efficient.  Front desk persons were very pleasant and we think we received a fair value for NY pricing and the location is perfect. 
What's not to like.

title: Tired hotel and lack of customer service
text: I recently stayed for business and whilst the location is great there was very little else to be positive about. Staff appeared abrupt and there was very few of them. The room had no mini bar etc, the carpets looked grubby, the entire hotel looked tired and run down. We ran out of hot water and ended up having to shift hotels. Wouldn’t recommend.

title: Shabby but well located
text:
My 2 kids (6 and 9) stayed at this hotel last weekend (26-28 of April 2018). 

On the PLUS side, the hotel is very well located. It's generally clean, and our room was big with a nice corner view on Madison park. There was a very nice bar nearby (The Smith) where my kids enjoyed themselves... and so did I. Cool perks also included automated curtains in our room that would open and close upon just pulling on them (cool!)... Frankly, those are what keeps me from giving this place a much worse review.

On the NOT-SO-PLUS side, the hotel looks GREAT in photos... but reality is different. The hotel is shabby, with repair patches everywhere in the corridors. Ours was a very dysfunctional heating and A/C system -- on our 2nd day there, we came back to our room where the control panel displayed a temperature of some 89 degrees despite it being set for 72 degrees on automatic mode (not just plain "heat til you bust" mode)... I just shut the whole thing off and didn't touch it again before leaving on the next day. In addition, there is always ONE single person at the reception desk, so just hope you don't have to get your keycard remagnetized at the same time 2-3 people are checking in, as happened to us. Breakfast pretty much sucks (and I'm a very tolerant French Canadian on these issues), and Internet simply didn't work, despite their charging a $20 daily resort fee for these services on top of the quoted price. No restaurant or bar on premises (although I don't care much for those, except when traveling with kids - which I was!), and empty mini bar in the room. Room was also noisy from the street (I can live with that in a city, though) but also from the adjacent rooms (that, I have a harder time with).

Also, if you drive, consider PARKING : We parked at the nearby ICON parking lot... they have a deal with the Hilton and Marriott Hotels that's $25 a night -- we paid $55 per 24 hour period, so $165 for 2 nights and a few extra hours...

So all in all, NYC hotels generally aren't the best value for money, in my experience. But I've stayed at several other locations in the city, and all I can say in comparison is that I will definitely not consider this place when I go back to the city. I'd much rather go back to W in Times Square or Hilton Fashion District (in that neighborhood), although I don't typically like staying at chain hotels when travelling for fun.

title: Terrible Hotel
text: Front desk says it all.  Bedroom dirty, mold all over the bathroom and coming out of the jacousy system. Curtains half way hang on the track, the old duvet was barely covered by old sheets. We had to complain few time about someone smoking pot on our floor, we couldn't breath. The breakfast tasted and looked like it was out for days. no descent coffee cut with lot of water. Everything in the room wasn't working properly, from the heat to high or too low, the TV and internet shutt down for two night in a row ( out of four night ) , the jacousy wasn't working and had mold coming out of the tube anyway, the toilette wasn't flushing and the iron was broken. The mattress and pillows are hard like wood, and the overall bedroom was just dusty and dirty. The mini bar was empty and refrigerator broken. They should close down. I have tried lot of Hotel in the city for years, this is the worst of all my travel, I have been to.

title: Just Rude
text:
Do not book this hotel. Once they have taken your money they do not care at all about you! The front of house staff/reservations are so rude. If this hotel wants to increase its ratings it really needs to think about the staff that it is hiring.
I would never book this hotel again.

title: Bon emplacement, petit déjeuner à éviter !
text:
Les + : L'hôtel est bien situé. Propre. Chambre assez grande. Ménage très bien fait tous les jours. Free wifi.

Les - : Le petit déjeuner une vraie arnaque...lors de la réservation on nous indique qu'il est compris...à l'arrivée seulement la moitié des petits déjeuners sont inclus.
La qualité et la générosité sont loin d'être au rende-vous...pâtisseries surgelées, pas de choix, le thé est en supplément, les jus de fruits également, pour des "raisons climatiques" pas de bacon pendant plusieurs jours et nous avons même eu le droit à "Petit déjeuner non assuré ce matin pour problème de plomberie"! 
Petite salle de bain.
Pas de double vitrage.
Chauffage/clim qui est un peu d'époque...vous passez des tropiques au froid polaire...

Même si le service est agréable, un conseil si vous séjournez dans cet hôtel : sortez petit déjeuner/bruncher à l'extérieur il y a beaucoup de choix aux alentours...ça sera meilleur, plus varié et moins cher !

title: Boutique Hotel with average appeal
text: I was a bit hesitant staying at this hotel due to the previous mixed reviews.  Overall my stay was OK.  My group and I booked one of the corner rooms for more space.  The hotel hallway does have a unique scent to it due to the age of the building.  However the rooms we kept very clean as well as the bathroom.  Service from the front desk was also good.  I am a Gold Member with Marriott, so traditional service expectation was a bit lack luster in comparison, however i guess that's common with some private hotel experiences.  Overall the price was right.  The new Breakfast options are OK as well.

title: Disapointing
text:
Let's start with the best.... the quality of the bedding...
The rest was of pretty average at best...
No bar no restaurant as it was being refurbished....but no mention of this....
Breakfast...well nothing to say....probably the worst quality. 
So....if you can stay elsewhere please do.

title: ATTENTION à vos affaires
text:
PAS content du tout après la direction de l'hotel. Sur place à Noel, nous avons ouvert nos cadeaux dans la chambre. Il ne nous a pas paru nécessaire de les sécuriser dans le coffre. A notre retour, nous avons eu la désagréable surprise de constater qu'un des cadeaux (crème de maquillage Abeille Royale de Guerlain) avait disparu. Depuis, la direction fait la sourde oreille ...
L'hotel en lui-même : personnel à la réception plutôt sympa, au petit dej, pas vraiment. Chambre assez spacieuse et belle vue MAIS isolation phonique et thermique quasi inexistante : on a l'impression d'être dans la rue avec le bruit et le froid. Le chauffage a du mal à faire son office malgré un bruit de locomotive à vapeur !! j'avais lu des avis défavorables sur le petit déjeuner : je confirme : choix (très) limité, manque rapidement de tout (salade de fruit, sachet de chocolat chaud, etc.) sans compter un froid glacial dans la salle.
Même avec une localisation excellente, je ne recommande ABSOLUMENT PAS cet hotel

title: Do NOT stay at this hotel.
text: The internet was down for 6 days. It was still not fixed when I left. To make matters worse, every staff member at the front desk was very rude.  I invited a client to a lunch meeting only to find out that the kitchen was closed. How is this possible? The staff offered no apology, no recommendations to nearby cafes' that I could go to as an alternative. Just a rude notice that the kitchen was closed that day. The HVAC in the rooms were also poor. It would be either super hot or super cold at night.

title: Avoid this hotel at all cost!!
text:
If Manhattan is your destination, do not book the Flatiron hotel, you'll be sorry. Here's our story. We booked two nights last fall and arrived at the hotel and checked in. The next morning we left for a day in the city. When we returned to our room we found the room the way we had left it: the beds were not made up, the towels were on the floor, in other words, nothing had been done in the room. We called the front desk and were told that they had no one to help. The next morning we spoke to the receptionist, a rude woman, who said: You asked for the room NOT to be cleaned, which was news to us. What guest would ask for the room not to be cleaned, certainly we didn't. Her supervisor was even worse, she would not even consider a partial refund and dismissed our complaint. Our bank, whose credit card we used, tried to help but was also brushed off. Here's the bottom line, folks, there are many fine hotels in Manhattan, the Flatiron is not one of them. You have been warned.

Frank B.

title: Will not go there again!
text: This hotel needs work. The lobby is pretty bad and the rooms are not good either. The heating system was down and we froze...they gave us a portable unit but the noise drove us crazy. The breakfast area...forget it! For what we paid it was a total disaster...much better options are available.

title: Manhattan
text: La nostra camera essendo economica era un po’ piccola anche se il letto cassettiera aiutava. Nelle vicinanze vi sono comodi punti di accesso alla metropolitana. L’hotel è leggermente a Nord rispetto al Flatiron building. Nelle vicinanze Eataly New York per spuntini nostrani.

title: They are an absolute scam!
text:
Stayed at this hotel 2 rooms for one night, placed a credit card for incidental charges and received two charges the next day. One charge is $79 the incidental charge which will be removed when the room is reviewed, second a $20 resort fee which was not noted anywhere and is a nonrefundable charge for staying at this hotel. 

The hotel service knocked on our door at 9am to clean the room also while checkout was at 11:00.

Beds were not comfortable and staff was not friendly.

Horrible and will be disputing the $20 resort fee!

title: Adequate Hotel
text:
First off the location is fantastic.  Close to great restaurants, bars, shops, anything you could want.  I found the staff to be friendly enough.  Not overly welcoming, but certainly not rude like a lot of other reviews have stated.  My biggest complaint is in regards to the room itself.  It looks like they have a lot of "fancy" gadgets in the room, but nothing seemed to work properly.  The heater did not work well.  It was between 58 and 62 degrees in my room the entire time.  I had a coworker staying there too and she said her room was 50-52 degrees her first night there.  She complained to the front desk and they quickly replaced her thermostat and it worked fine.  I did not complain because low 60's is okay with me.  The best part was the shower.   Multiple shower heads and good water pressure.

I did not think the bed was very comfortable.  It was definitely a stiffer mattress which I know some people prefer.  I usually like a softer mattress.

So like I said, the hotel was just okay.  It was definitely work the price.

title: Bad reviews are misleading
text: My wife and I just completed a five day stay and were happy with most everything.  We had read some frightening reviews on this site..about rude staff, urine smelling rooms...and found nothing like that. Tenth floor was a plus and hotel is relatively quite versus other parts of town.  The neighborhood night life was something to behold--jumping restaurants and pubs packed with young people--and many nearby restaurants are very reasonably priced.  My one complaint concerns the continental breakfast which could be upgraded with very little effort and would earn the hotel an extra star in my rating.  Namely, add a grain bread and English muffins to the bread choice, add yogurt, get some fresh bananas, not the mottled ones served every day.  That would do it.

title: Amazing party spaces!!!!!
text: I went to see this property's party spaces, and I have been WOW'ed!!!!! There are alot of potential options for entertaining, within this hotel! The rooftop terrace, with it's spectacular views of the Empire State Building, the most prevalent. And, the lobby and mezzanine ares are also perfect for a large family, or an event! The rooms are nice, and the staff is, too?!

title: HORRIFIC - 1 star ONLY
text: Front desk staff is incredibly rude, abrasive and unprofessional. Our bedroom smelled like urine, the windows have no insulation so don't expect to sleep, the "free breakfast" shouldn't be counted as breakfast since it's not edible, our TV didn't work (but the hotel didn't care), and overall the hotel is unclean, old, and not kept up. The location is amazing and there's so much potential, but think of this hotel as nothing more than a 1 star.

title: Great Location.
text: This is a great place to stay in the Flatiron district. The hotel is small, but that is one of the reasons we liked it! Rooms were well appointed, comfortable and warm. The staff we courteous and helpful.

title: Horrible! Do not stay here!
text: Based on the positive reviews, I booked this hotel. After a week there, I have a hard time believing any of these positive reviews. They must be fake or paid. Some of the staff is friendly and helpful. But mainly I found them to be incompetent and rude. My television didn’t work. My bathroom had missing vertical blind pieces that allowed office workers across from me to potentially see me naked. I could see them. I am sure they could see me. The street noise is deafening from about 2 am to 7 am. And the minibar is limited and never refreshed. They also didn’t notify visitors that they kitchen was under renovation, impacting the offerings for food and drink. The shower and sink barely functioned and the mattresses on both beds in my room felt like cinder blocks. And the place is just plain ugly and has not been updated, perhaps in decades. It’s a great neighborhood, but you can get more for the same money at a new boutique hotel (though your room will be smaller). Lastly, the staff ensured me upon checking in that they could put the room on my company account and nothing was needed from me to make it so. Upon checkout I was told I needed paperwork to charge to my company and at that time it was impossible to get. Therefore they charged this horrible experience to me. I was told the manager would call me first upon coming in. Nothing. I called for her so I could change the charge. No reply there either. Do not stay here if you value comfort, service, quiet, basic decency or amenities of any kind. Seriously. Don’t. Do. It.

title: Ha visto giorni migliori
text:
Ottima la posizione!! Camera tutto sommato acoogliente, letto comodo. Le condizioni della struttura, camera, bagno, finestre, sala colazione ecc. sono in fase decadente.
Si ha la netta sensazione di entrare in un posto che ha urgente bisogno di essere ristrutturato. Si vede che è stato un albergo carino e di buon livello, ma qualche anno fa...
Incredibile la richiesta di 19$ a notte per camera, per una colazione a dir poco modesta!!!
Visto il prezzo della struttura per una settimana circa 2000$ non lo consiglierei.
PS le finestre dalla nostra camera (507) non chiudevano molto bene, aria fresca in abbondanza e rumori della Broadway in camera.

title: Worst Hotel
text: This hotel was completely awful and far from a 4-star hotel as listed on many sites. Our hotel room was dirty with no air conditioning, the hotel staff was rude and dressed in sweatpants. We had just returned to the United States from our honeymoon in Europe and this was definitely not the experience that I wanted to have at a hotel in NYC. We had to check out early and find a new hotel, due to the terrible conditions. Do not stay here willingly!

title: Do not stay here ! Worst ! Some guy walked into my room while I was sleeping !
text:
This is not a 4-star hotel as advertised. This may be a 2-star hotel at best and very overpriced for what you get. The decor is tired. The lobby is messy. Lights are half turned off and there is a chemical smell when you walk in. 
The room itself looks more like a love hotel. The bar is not even opened. 

I checked in around 3:30 on the afternoon. I was having a nap in the afternoon. All of a sudden, a guy who is not in any uniform, dirty t-shirt and jeans, just unlocked my door and walked in. He woke me up. And he told me he had to add something to the mini bar. I was startled! And scared as I was in the room by myself. 

After I woke up a bit, I tried to call the front desk to complain. And the phone does not even work. So imagine this happening at night and how dangerous it is. I went down to the front desk to complain to the manager. Without even letting me finish my compliant, she called the guy to come down. That’s the last thing I wanted. Was to confront the guy who I am complaining about. I told her the phone does not work. There was no follow up. She just did not really care. 

Constructions were happening all the time. Here was construction at 1 am in the morning. And then it starts again at 7 am. It was impossible to sleep. 

They also charge a $19usd resort fee. I have no clue where the resort is as there is no gym, no swimming pool and not even a lobby bar. It’s to cover the water, coffee and tea in the room. That is two very overpriced of Kirkland brand water!

Don’t stay here. This place is sketchy !

title: Terrible Experience, No Service
text:
This hotel is no where near the 4-star rating it got on Hotwire.  Maybe a 2-star at best. And "boutique" is quite a stretch.  

Summary: Not worth the money or it's ratings. I've had better 30€ hostel experiences.

1) First room we were sent to was occupied

2) Second room we were given had the complimentary water bottles half drank.

3) Second rooms bathroom was not cleaned well, trash not emptied, contact lense packages on the floor.

4) Despite two people checking in, only one set of towels and wash cloths were in the room.

5) Fairly rude front desk night clerk.

6) No AC in the whole building "due to the season" we couldn't get the room below 78°F, and there was no way to open the sealed windows and no other rooms available.

7) Maintenance guy who came up to check on AC was in track suit / gym gear, very professional looking....

8) Receptionist could not refund our second night even though we didn't stay, and since we were checking out at 8am, we couldn't talk to the manager

9) Hotel manager only works 10-6, and after two hours of calling, we have not been able to get a hold of anyone at the hotel.  I do not mean call back in a bit, I mean two straight hours of back to back calls, nothing. I honestly don't know the number is connected.

title: Worst Customer Service/Room
text:
I stayed here for my 30th birthday to just have somewhere to crash after dinner. The room appeared nice but the roof was leaking from the light fixture and the shower. My friend got up in the middle of the night to get a glass of water and she slipped and almost cracked her head open.

They also charged the wrong CC.

When we told the front desk about the CC and leak they did nothing about it except wrote on a post-it. RUN! DON'T STAY HERE!

title: OK hotel
text:
Few days here and the location is great, but the hotel is a little "old fasioned" but the rooms are ok, the staff are helpful and friendly.

The breakfeast could be better, but can work if only for a few days

title: One of the worst hotel experiences I've ever had
text:
I booked a room at the Flatiron Hotel for one night in late Sept. 2017.  I checked in around 9 pm with the intention of quickly showering then meeting friends for dinner and drinks.  I returned around 1:30 am and attempted to enter my room, this is where one of the strangest, unprofessional hotel experiences I've ever had began.  Getting to my room the key card seemed to not be working, after a few more tries, i began hearing voices coming from inside, I returned to the front desk where I was rudely informed that they had changed my room and somebody should have told me about it. I was given a new key and got to the room to find all of my possessions, which had been unpacked in my original room, dumped into my new room. The next day when i was checking out i mentioned how dissatisfied i was with my experience, the woman at the front desk did not seem to care whatsoever.  

my physical experience at the hotel was only half the problem.  About a week later i noticed a handful of odd charges that had gone through on my credit card from the flatiron hotel. I called the hotel and was very rudely told they had no record of charging my card. After calling back 2-3 more times a speaking to various employees who completely disputed my claim i finally spoke with someone who recognized my card had been charge. They gave me a refund for about 1/3 of the total charges they had put through.  

I have stayed at may hotels as I've spent a considerable amount of time traveling for work and never in my life have i dealt with employees so blatantly disrespectful and rude to a customer.  This has been by far the worst experience I've had at any hotel in my life.

title: Business Trip
text:
I stayed for one night. Nice hotel and check in was friendly and easy.

The room was average sized for a modern NYC room.

The business center did not have a printer which made it more complicated than necessary.

The Wifi went out 2-3 times during my one night stay for 10 minutes to an hour so that was a drag.

title: Charming boutique hotel in ideal location
text: The decorating choices in the lobby were beyond me, but our room was charming. Even the hallway was beautiful--with curved ceilings and beautiful woodwork. Our double room was surprisingly large for NYC. I found the staff to be very helpful, and I loved the location--near Madison Square Park, Eataly, and a short walk to Greenwich Village. The High Line is also a relatively short distance away. The hotel even included a free breakfast, which made it even more economical.

title: great location but this hotel is tired
text:
Our family loved the location but this hotel needs a lot of TLC. The staff was a mixed bag of super friendly people and lazy rude people.
I did not complain while I was there but for those of you who would like to stay I advise not staying in room 701. The room was old, banged up, the bathroom mirror and lighting was terrible and the lit mirror was broken. I imagine other rooms are in a similar state.
The bed didn't have a a fitted bottom sheet, just a small mattress pad with flat sheets, an uncovered duvet and more top sheets. The tub drained slowly.  Our pillows were hard as rock but fortunately our daughters had better pillows in their room to use.
They need a window cleaner! you could barely see out the windows they were so dirty. and the rooftop bar they display in their gallery is not for your use it is only for private functions....very disappointing! The bar is more like a cafeteria. Their complimentary breakfast is ok. The free happy hour drink was nice but didn't make up for the lack of cleanliness.
 Our daughters stayed in 702 the double queen corner room. it was definitely better and more spacious. For the price of this hotel i would look elsewhere but try and stay in this area. We loved the location..near eataly, near great restaurants, shopping and a park.

title: Short stay hotel at 5 star price
text:
This place is a low star establishment. I stayed here recently and the TV didn't work and when I called for repair the guy never came. Also the one clock in the room didn't work.
Average room with very old furniture and a drab lobby. Understaffed and unprofessional as well. Stay at your own discomfort

title: Scary
text: Please beware of this hotel. It is by no means a 4 star hotel. I am a New Yorker and this hotel is not your typical New York hotel, and not in a good way. Very noisy, clientele questionable (especially at night when the night club is gearing up), and there is a sense of fear for your safety here. No latches on guest rooms. *The front desk employees were very nice and accommodating- they get the one star I'm giving this hotel!*

title: Fantastico!
text: Ho soggiornato in questo hotel nella mi vacanza negli Stati Uniti. Hotel fantastico, camere molto belle e pulite. Posizione strategica in pieno centro, caotico ma non esageratamente come fosse time square, oserei dire il giusto, nonché se avrete bisogno c'è anche un comodo supermercato all' uscita del hotel sulla destra in fondo alla via. In poche parole AMAZING!

title: Inadequate facilities and bad service. Terrible breakfast.
text: We stayed at this hotel last year. It looked good on the website. When we arrived it was shabby, customer service was  non  existent and food inedible. It did not reflect the facilities described on their website.  An email was sent to the owner complaining. He replied apologising and offered a free stay in the form of two rooms at any time and he would inform the staff. He said they were refurbishing..we thought we would give it another try. I have tried to book these rooms in July for September. I am being ignored, the front desk are unhelpful. Not one email is being replied to and the Manager does not seem to exist. I have had a response today through FB saying they will deal with this after Labor Day (4th September) That is too late..! We need to book for the 5th September..they are stalling. Bad everything!  They should be ashamed. Clearly nothing has changed...

title: Ottimo hotel
text:
Hotel bello, pulito e questo vuol dire tanto, centrale e con personale fantastico. Io e mia sorella abbiamo soggiornato qui, il personale è ben educato e gentile. La camera è sempre stata rifatta e pulita ogni giorno, spaziosa ma il letto un po' piccolo, noi essendo due ragazza non abbiamo avuto problemi ma forse per una coppia sarebbe stata o un po' stretto, il resto  impeccabile. La colazione era un po' scarsa per essere un 4 stelle ma comunque buona. 
Lo consiglio !!!

title: Male Hotel Staff Member Entered My Room at 3AM
text:
Stayed here for a business trip the week of July 18 and had an awful experience. I used to live in NYC so I know this is not indicative of other nyc hotel experiences which for what you pay are usually a bit lackluster. Upon arrival this place seemed cute and decent (minus the fact that it was 95 out and the lobby wasn't air conditioned). My room wasn't ready but my co-worker's was so we dropped our things and were told about our "free" breakfast and drink at the bar between 4-7PM nightly. 

We arrived back after dinner and had missed the window for a drink but we had to be to the office early so we retired for the night. At 12:30AM the fire alarm went off for a few minutes. As I was opening my door to see if any other guests were evacuating the hotel announced over an intercom that there was no need to evacuate and this was a false alarm, so I went back to sleep (but noted how there was no latch on this door which left me uneasy. As a female staying alone, I always put the latch across.)

A few hours later (around 3:00 AM) I heard my door unlock with a card key swipe and my door opened and the silhouette of a man entered and approached my bed. I sat straight up and said hello and he immediately backed away saying "sorry" and closing the door. Half delirious and needing sleep after two big interruptions I went back to bed.

The next day I inquired about this incident at the front desk but the "system was down" so they couldn't tell who had entered, saying they would look into it during the day. I ate my "free" breakfast (a box of cereal that opens into a bowl like the kind my mom used to bring for the kids on camping trips) and went to work exhausted.

Upon return after dinner that evening I asked if anyone had figured out who had entered my room and of course their system was still down, including hotel wide internet (I was here for work!!) so they still did not know. I told the front staff that since nobody could find out and the same maintenance man from the previous night was on again, I didn't feel comfortable staying in the room. She actually said she wouldn't stay in their either but that they were fully booked and she could offer me nothing! She actually agreed with my co-worker's suggestion for me to stay in her room as she had 2 beds! But never once offered any solutions or compensation.

She told me her manager was already aware of the situation and was looking into it when I asked for a manager. 

I slept in my co-worker's room. The next morning when we woke up the air conditioning for the entire hotel was not working. Our room was 83 degrees. The internet was still "down."

I went to work looking tired and with frizzball sweaty hair from getting ready in ny room that was nearing the 90s when Inran the blow dryer. I had to get a headshot that day. (I got it back this week, it's really cute! (NOT)).

I had to leave for the airport from my office around 1pm and had very little free time to argue with this horrendous hotel while there so when I got back home to Tampa I called to ask management to refund the $25/night "resort fee" which was for things like that drink at the bar and breakfast...There's no gym, pool or spa, this is far from a resort, and a house beer or wine and a mini cereal box cost $6 at most! I also asked to be refunded for the night I did not stay in my room at the suggestion of their desk staff. The manager questioned my story and why I hadn't spoken to her directly when I was there (btw it took me 6 calls to reach this manager who is ALWAYS "currently not in and not returning until tomorrow") and as noted earlier, when I asked for a manager in the hotel I was told they were aware and "looking into it." The phone call ended with the manager saying (very unconvincingly) that she would "investigate this" and return my call. It's August 9th now. Nobody has ever returned my call.

I gave this place a chance to rectify this laughable (now after the fact, wasn't funny at all during my stay) excuse for a hotel and these thugs aren't even trying to make things right. They should have been ashamed sticking that additional bill for $65 under my door the day I checked out for their "resort fees" that weren't included in my initial book. 

This place is dangerous and a total scam. Stay at your own risk. Someone should shut them down before a tragedy occurs in the night.

title: Friendly Staff & Great Location
text: We had no problem at check-in.  Staff was very friendly.  There is a small resort fee which provides you with breakfast each morning and a cocktail in the evening.  There was a live band/music each night we were there.  While the hotel is in need of updating, our bathroom appeared to have been renovated.  Our room was acceptable and the location was perfect.  We had no problem with noise and slept comfortably.  We enjoyed our stay.

title: Muy buena situación . Hotel normal
text: El hotel está muy bien ubicado con metro y autobuses cercanos. habitación algo pequeña y con las ventanas bloqueadas. Hotel antiguo necesitaría una actualización. el desayuno muy pobre solo tostada y café americano.

title: Zijn geld waard.
text:
Op zoek naar een betaalbaar hotel in het centrum vonden we een leuke aanbieding van Flatiron hotel voor twee volwassenen en 3 kids.
Ontvangst was vriendelijk - kamer voorzien van twee bedden. We vroegen bij aankomst naar een slaapbedje voor onze jongste van 3 jaar wat kon geregeld worden.
Misschien was de prijs zo interessant omdat we de kamer op het eerste verdiep kregen - net boven de lounge waar iedere avond een concert plaatsvond? Geen idee maar met kinderen die een hele dag rondlopen in NYC was wat nachtrust voor middernacht geen optie door het lawaai... Jammer!
Ontbijt was in prijs inbegrepen en was niet meer dan wat brood - fruit & cake. Correct als je er niet voor hoeft bij te betalen.
Bedden waren daarentegen super - badkamer proper buiten een lek van bovenverdieping uitgezonderd.
Staff was vriendelijk ondanks loze beloftes voor het bedje. Er bleek gewoon geen voorhanden.
Verder na middernacht goed geslapen - goede gordijnen hielden het licht buiten.
Mooie locatie net naast Madisons square en dicht tegen metro.

title: stupendo
text:
camera in alto uindi nessun rumore La posizione è laterale a MAdison square gardens ma a pochi metri dal flatiron e la strada è piena di ristoranti carini e tranquilla e sei comunue vicino a tutto!!
puoi arrivare a chelsea union square a piedi cosi come all empire state buildingin un attimo. Bagni puliti doccia perfetta. colazione media ma non terribile.

title: There are much better options!
text:
Just stayed at the Flatiron hotel for 3 nights. Nice location and that's about it.  

From the moment we checked in through checkout, there were nothing but problems. 

The hotel does not have consistently working AC. There were 3 of us here on business and all of our rooms would never cool down. One of us even switched rooms.  The lobby also had industrial size fans blowing the whole time we were there. 

There was a fire alarm on Early Tuesday morning (12:30 AM) and over the loud speaker they told us to stay in our rooms and hold tight. Never did they come back on the speaker and say everything was ok. 

The next morning there was a sign on the elevators saying they were not working due to unforeseen circumstances and we had to wait for someone to come and get us. The elevators must have been shut down by the fire department because they weren't up to date on inspection. Funny how the inspection certificate was updated with the current date after they were running again Tuesday afternoon. 

Oh, and let's not forget the 19 dollar fee per day for the wifi and water. They never replenished the water and the front desk was surprised when we told them.  The signal on the TV stinks and there's a limited channel lineup. 

Too many issues to call this a good place. If you're considering it, do yourself a favor and find another option!

title: Great location, with evening jazz performances, to walk around lower manhattan from
text: I stayed at this hotel in order to explore around this area by walking by foot from. It is right next to the Museum of Mathematics, which has the best set of puzzles and math puzzles books I have found, if you are interested in that. The rooms are comfortable and clean, not quite as large as some other hotels for this price. It is right next to the R downtown subway from which you can explore around the whole city...Rockefeller center, Columbus circle, Central Park, the aircraft carrier Intreprid, Greenwich Village, and so much more.

title: Found a heroin needle with heroin in our room
text:
I have never written a review on TripAdvisor before but am warning others about staying here. We ended up finding a HEROIN NEEDLE with some HEROIN still inside of it laying right behind our towels. We weren't aware that it was even there until we had already used the towels on top and then found this horrifying surprise.

We immediately went to the front desk and asked for a refund and all they would do is move us to another room on the same floor. The manager didn't even want to deal with the situation. We felt incredibly uncomfortable and terrified at the fact we could have unknowingly prick ourselves with HEROIN!

Stay away from this hotel.

title: La atención en recepción es nefasta
text:
la atención de la chica de recepción es muy poco profesional. A nosotros nos cobró 2 veces la reserva y no nos hizo el abono. Llegamos al hotel con una reserva pagada a través de booking y ella hizo otro cargo en nuestra tarjeta sin autorización. Reclamamos en ese instante pero el abono del cargo nunca lo hizo y hubo que reclamar otra vez. Siempre alguien reclamaba algo en recepción por eso la cola de espera se hace larga.

Las habitaciones no estaban mal y estaban limpias.

title: Strange and noisy
text: The hotel is situated perfect, very close to the flatiron building, nice shops and restaurants are close. When you arrive at the hotel there is a very small reception with friendly staff. You can hardly understand them whilst at the other part of the entrance is a bar with very loud live music. That gives a very chaotic first impression. The rooms are a bit outdated but nice and clean. Only problem is that the hallways are very noisy and you hear the whole night slamming doors, people talk etc etc.  housekeeping rang my door at 09:00... wtf! Overall impression, strange and noisy.

title: Funky, friendly boutique hotel
text:
This is a great little boutique hotel conveniently located to all things Flatiron (Madison Square Park, Eataly, Starbucks, Shake Shack). The decor was fun and funky (giant two level cylinder tropical fish tank and an oversized king chair in the lobby). Staff was friendly and Jeremy at the bar was also pleasant as he made me the free drink that came with my stay. I had a 5th floor room at the end of the hallway that, although small, was also funky and well appointed. The shower, with its multiple jets, was pretty cool and the products were great. The bed was very comfortable as were the big fluffy oversized pillows. Complimentary water in the room was a plus too. Only a few things that are keeping me from giving a five star rating. 1) the room was FREEZING when I walked in as the AC was on full blast. When I tried to adjust, I knew it was going to be an issue as the touch screen could never quite register what I was trying to do. I spent the entire night either freezing or too warm so did not get the best night's sleep. The register for the AC is also located in a bad spot and blew constantly right over the bed all night. 2) Despite a lighted mirror, the bathroom was too dark and the mirror had this weird piece of dark film over the bottom of the mirror and a res light towards the bottom. It actually occurred to me that I might be being spied on. 3) and this is not the fault of the hotel, but important to note anyway...The 5th floor was not high enough to drown out the garbage trucks under my window at 5am that went on for 2 hours. 
Overall, a cool, friendly and funky hotel. Get a room on a higher floor and check the AC/heat before you settle in, and you will enjoy your stay.  (Update...after reading other reviews, apparently the strange black film on the bathroom mirror was a tv)

title: Amazing location & decent rooms
text:
So many of NY hotels are either old or have tiny rooms.  Flatiron has an amazing location steps from the Flatiron building, thus close walking distance to Greenwich village, SoHo, Highline, Eataly etc.  Room are spacious for NY standards, nice bathrooms, kept very clean.

Nice staff!  The only con is a breakfast: very poor quality.  Omelet and toasts, we managed to get some nice fruit on Monday.  Overall - good experience in an amazing NY location.

title: Average but tries
text: First impression of the hotel is that it is very tired and needs updating in the lobby.but the employees working in the lobby were very friendly and try to be helpful. The room is very small but does have drawers under the bed and armoire. The bathroom has shelves for storage. The shower has a rain head with plenty of jets. We were two girls and each day we only received one wash cloth.had to keep calling and asking to please get a another washcloth and they kept giving us two hand towels. We also only received enough coffee for one person but when I went downstairs they were very accommodating.The continental breakfast is barely average.A free glass of wine is available each evening and the staff in the dining room is very friendly.The housekeeping sign is remote controlled by the door. Ours never worked.,so each day we asked to have it fixed but it was never repaired the four days we stayed. I had to either go to the front desk or call downstairs each day to have our room clean.  location of the hotel is very convenient to many attractions and there are plenty of restaurants in the area.we stayed on the ninth floor and did not have a problem with noise at all.

title: Some Good Stuff but Some (Comically) Bad Stuff
text:
Stayed at the Flatiron Hotel in June, 2017, for work. It was picked by a co-worker based on price, location and what appeared to be a relatively hip, boutique decor. 

The 'good stuff':
-The location was nice for where we needed to be - several bars and restaurants within a block or two, close to nice nearby neighborhoods
-The staff was friendly
-The breakfast was fine - as long as you have appropriately low expectations for a free, or more accurately, "included" breakfast (basic cereal, eggs, home fries, pastries - that's really it)
-The room size - which was probably one of their smaller rooms - was fine sized and larger than many other NYC "boutique" hotels
-The bed was firm, but comfortable

The 'bad stuff':
-The decor looks WAY newer and hipper in photos. This includes the room - outdated & faded, and the lobby. If/when you see the fishtank in the lobby (dark, cloudy, and... past it's prime), you'll know exactly what I mean. Kinda like.... how they advertise a fast food hamburger on TV vs how it looks in real-life
-The shower is kinda cool in that it has these crazy nozzles - and I always love rainfall shower heads - but the shower massively leaked. Like, you try to close the door and it settled with a half inch gap. When you're done with your shower, it looks like you took 2 64 ounce cups of water and poured them all over your floor. Literally. The foot towel wasn't wet, it was sopping. I asked the front desk to look into the matter, and I believe that they did - the door wasn't settling quite so open, but the same issue occurred. I was only there 3 nights so didn't bother complaining again. I just put towels on the floor like sandbags before a flood.

All in all, you could certainly do worse. And, it had it's charms. But, it's no 4-star hotel in my book.

title: No esperes gran cosa
text:
Otro hotel sin más en la gran manzana cuya relación calidad-precio no se corresponde. 
En resumen,
-El personal no se preocupa porque tengas una estancia agradable.
-La wifi no funciona, gracias a que tenía roaming porque tuvimos que trabajar y usamos la wifi del móvil para conectarnos a internet a través del portátil.
-El desayuno lo más limitado que he visto nunca,  de hecho optamos por desayunar fuera.
-No dispone de unas vistas maravillosas y menos mal, ya que las ventanas se encuentran sucísimas.
-Lo único a destacar: la localización.

title: Ok hotel, mixed service
text: We arrived to the city late and had a terrible experience with the staff at checkin. Our room type was overbooked and were told we were being upgraded if we could wait 5 minutes. We were told that multiple times and we're forced to wait 40 minutes to check in (1 am). The room was not as described and my husband and I had to stay in separate beds. Not quite the upgrade we were promised for our troubles! The room was fine but definitely not the 4 stars advertised. It was a solid 3 stars, though and the staff on duty in the morning was friendly.

title: Trivsamt område.
text:
Ligger i ett trevligt område nära Madison Park. Tunnelbana i närheten och många bra restauranger.
Hotellet har en mycket trevlig personal och rummet  var bra.
Ett minus är frukosten och sunkiga sittplatser i baren, ingen påfyllning av duschkräm och dylikt.
Tredje gången vi bor här och vi älskar området och vi kommer att boka detta hotell igen.

title: Desparately in need of Refreshing
text:
As a frequent traveler to NYC, we were looking to stay in the Flatiron district for a change.  Saw reasonable pictures and reviews on-line.  What most failed to say were:
(1) The lobby seconds as a night club at night with all the sounds and, yes, all the common areas show the wear and tear, (2) While polite, the staff is not very helpful, as they did very little when asked, (3) the room seemed 'tired', like it is 3 years past due for a serious update (carpet is worn, bathroom tub not fully operational, scuff marks on painted walls, marginal air circulation, frequent internet outage....)  Also this is the first time I have been caught by an added 'resort fee' to pay for the 'free' breakfast and 'free' internet.

title: Weekend Getaway
text: We stayed at the Flatiron Hotel last weekend. We were in the city to see a play. Comfortable hotel. Friendly staff and very accommodating. When we first arrived at the hotel our air conditioning wasn't working, we called down to the front desk and within 20 minutes it was up and running. Great location. I'd stay here again.

title: En el centro de Manhattan
text:
Los precios de los hoteles en Manhattan son exageradamente altos y además muchos de ellos no están al nivel de un cuatro o cinco estrellas al que estamos acostumbrados en España. Flatiron Hotel es una buena opción para aquellos que busquen un hotel cómodo, limpio, bien atendido y muy bien situado en el centro de Manhattan (a dos pasos de la quinta Avenida, el edificio Flatiron, el Empire State y Washington Park). 

Nuestra habitación tenía un tamaño correcto y una ducha que funcionaba perfectamente, aunque puede que el armario se quede un poco pequeño si tienes que guardar en él el contenido de una maleta para varios días. Algunas curiosidades americanas: las cortinas se corrían y descorrían automáticamente al moverlas un poco y el espejo del baño lleva incorporado una televisión.

El WiFi y el desayuno vienen incluidos en un recargo de 19 dolares que se añade al precio de la habitación: el WiFi funciona muy bien, mientras que el desayuno no es muy variado, reduciéndose a un plato de huevos revueltos, patatas fritas, tostada y bacon o salchicha, además de café, tes y zumos. Tienen otras cosas, pero no están incluidas en el precio.

Todas las noches hay música en vivo en el bar del vestíbulo. La zona, en general, tiene una animada vida nocturna y está llena de bares y restaurantes interesantes.

title: Like sleeping on the street. But you pay.
text: Went once in winter and you could fly a kite in the room, it was so poorly insulated. Crazy loud bar in Lobby you can hear for about 7 floors. Just cancelled tonight because they had a flood (can't blame them there). But they sent me to a room that smelled like a toilet and the front desk was chaos. If I want stank, noise and poor climate control... I'll sleep on the street thanks.

title: Excelente ubicación, cómodo y limpio
text: Fuimos a NYC a pasar fin de año 2016. La ubicación del hotel es muy buena. Eramos cuatro en una habitación y la estadía fue muy cómoda. La calefacción excelente, igual que el agua caliente y el desayuno. El hotel entrega tickets para desayunar y otro para un trago o cerveza para tomar tipo after con música en vivo. Muy lindo!

title: Muy buena unicación
text:
Superbien ubicado con el metro a menos de 5 minutos. Camas muy comodas y el personal muy atento y siempre sonriendo. Limpieza muy bien. Ducha genial.Lo cogimos por el desyuno incluido y es muy justo, cada día hay lo mismo, si te sales de los huevos revueltos, bacon, patatas    y tostadas lo has de pagar aparte.
Habitaciones para 4 espaciosas (le falta armario si vas muchos días) se escucha el ruido de la ducha de los de al lado desde la habitación.

title: Perfect place to visit New York, but overpriced
text: The hotel is clean, the staff were friendly. The rooms were clean, small but there was quiet - we lived on the 10th floor. Breakfast was very poor and simple and hard to sit on bar chairs. It is better to go into town for breakfast and enjoy it more. The hotel is well equipped but in compare to its level overpriced.

title: Flatiron is a Great little hotel!
text:
The Flatiron Hotel is the perfect boutique hotel. Starting with the front desk people who are friendly and welcoming. Cute lobby and a bar with live entertainment. The rooms are small but done very smartly. Very comfortable bed and I especially like their pillows. Coffee pot in room (free) and a well stocked but expensive mini bar. Great multi head shower and TV in bathroom mirror. What more could you want !!

Continental breakfast included and free wifi. Perfect location to everything on that side of town. I highly recommend this hotel

title: worst service ever
text: me and my wife had the worst experience ever at this hotel. we booked a 1 night getaway for our anniversary, and over the phone while making the reservation we were offered a high floor room, breakfast, robes and slippers, which none of this was given to us. also the lady at the front desk when we were checking in was extremely rude to us. she wasn't even looking at us, she handed a sticky note to us with the amount she was going to charge on my credit card and refused to talk to us. when she did it was to tell me that my card got declined. i explained to her that it must have been a mistake and to try the card again to which she refused by saying "i cant try this card again... you have to give me a different card".  i told her to try again and the card when trough, to which she said... oh it work (all of this with an attitude) and she never apologized for the mistake made by her. after all of this she handed us an envelope with the keys to the room and said that's it. i told her that i didn't know where the room was at and asked for directions to get to the room ( almost 50 minutes in this whole process) and she said "oh elevator are over there". me and my wife go to the room and a few minutes after i call the reception to order a bucket with ice and 2 glasses which took them almost 1 hour to deliver.... while waiting for the ice, i called the reception to ask how to close the window since the remote wasn't working, and when she answered the phone, without me taking she said "sir i will send that ice but you are going to have to give me some minutes". this treatment is plain simple unacceptable, i expected so much more from this place, they are advertising things to get customers and once they have the card information they treat you like an animal. i don't give a 0 because the minimum is 1 star.

title: Great location, priced well
text: Hotel is clean and pictures of rooms are true to reality. Lobby is smaller than seems in pictures. Had a free and nice continental breakfast. Hotel staff were polite. Would definitely stay again. Location was great, with walking distance to shops, and restaurants. Safe and clean neighborhood. Right on broadway and nice park right around the corner

title: Funky, cool and low-key
text: Stayed two  nights in this swanky little joint.  Staff really great, location incredible!  Great food all around, continental breakfast gratis in the morning.  Will definitely be back, for work or fun!  Highly recommend!!

title: Daughter's 16th BDay Trip
text: What a great location! Fun lobby with live music each night there! We were treated well and will for sure make our reservations at Flatiron Hotel on our next NYC trip. Smaller hotel feel, which was perfect for us. I can't say enough about talent each night in lobby. That was so fun!

title: Très bon emplacement
text:
L'emplacement est idéal, à deux pas du madison square garden et à quelques minutes à pied de l'empire state building et du célèbre 230th rooftop. Il y a un starbuck juste en face et quelques restaurants dans les rues voisines. J'avais un peu peur du bruit suite aux commentaires car j'ai le sommeil très léger, j'avais demandé une chambre "silencieuse" lors de ma réservation et j'ai très bien dormi ! La chambre bien que pas très moderne est propre, la femme de chambre passe tous les jours pour faire le lit, changer les serviettes et déposer des bouteilles d'eau.

Le personnel est très sympa, le bar est animé le soir et on nous a même offert des tickets pour avoir des boissons gratuites (dont champagne) un petit bonus fort appréciable.

Les points négatifs: J'aurai aimé un personnel qui parle français mais ça va nous nous sommes fait comprendre :). Très déçue par le petit déjeuner ! Je m'attendais à un vrai petit déjeuner américain avec du bacon, des œufs brouillé, des pancakes etc.. Or le petit déjeuner est sucré (sauf le cream cheese pour accompagner le bagel) il est composé de : bagel, pain de mie, céréales, muffin, fruits frais, jus,boissons chaudes, yaourts... de quoi se lasser quand on séjourne + d'une semaine. 

Globalement je recommande cet hôtel car nous avons été satisfait et nous avons bien dormi.

title: DON'T STAY HERE!
text: This could be the worst hotel I ever stayed at. I don't even know where to begin. It started when my husband and I walked into the hotel. There was all these shady people outside the hotel we could barley get through the door. It took them 25 minutes to check us in and there was no line. We got up to the room and it smelled terribly, like a musty smell. The linen looked dingy and not washed. The hotel was loud, we kept getting woken up by people in the hallway. One of the managers were suppose to talk to us but that never happened. I could go on and on, but the point is, DO NOT STAY HERE! so many other nicer properties in the city

title: Worst Hotel Stay !! I need a refund ..
text: I am extremely disappointed with this Hotel. The room was extremely small !! My boyfriend and I were laying on a bed. When we discovered blood stain marks on the comforter. Which made me very uncomfortable, I called the front desk. The only thing the offered me was new sheets !!!! I will never recommend nor stay in this Hotel ever. I enjoy staying in different hotels every month. Just to experience the stay, but I regret staying here.

title: Great location and service
text: Really enjoyed this place.  It seemed to be in the center of everything.  Very nice service from everyone.  Breakfast not very good but nice to sit in lounge area to eat.  The music at night a definite plus.

title: centrico
text: muy buen hotel centrico cerca de las lineas del subte tiene de todas las tiendas cerca por la 6ta avenida podes comprar de todo y a pasos del time square. lo unico que deben mejorar es el desayuno para el precio que tiene

title: hotel muy comodo y centrico
text: habitaciones muy amplias, baño pequeño pero justo.buenas camas. ubicacion maravillosa. Muy importante,pedir habitacion en pisos altos, en el bajo hay disco y hacen mucho ruido. volveria al mismo hotel

title: Wow!  Hotel, Staff, Location, Amenities - All Amazing!
text: We booked this hotel for a one night stay before visiting relatives.  The location is great and right around the corner from Eataly.  The Hotel is lovely with a wonderfully designed lobby and mezzanine.  There is a lovely, comfortable sitting area, a bar, a band in the evening, a two story cylinder shaped aquarium filled with crazy salt water, beautiful large fish, the front desk and windows that allow you to feel you are part of the hustle and bustle of the city outside.  The staff were warm, charming, helpful, friendly and extremely efficient.  The rooms are on the small side, but packed with every modern amenity you can think of and spotless.  Most rooms now in NYC hotels are on the small side but for the price and amenities, it was beyond GREAT!  The room had enough space, the bathroom was gorgeous with a rain shower, massage jets and a hand held shower.  The bedroom had a lovely, comfortable bed with soft pillows, TV, closet, desk, chair, and every electrical device you could want.  Even the curtains were electric.  The bathroom even had a TV in the mirror!  Outside in the hallway, notice the ceilings, they are in waves with light fixtures that resemble old fashioned candle lights with a modern twist.  Whomever designed this hotel did an awesome job.  You receive a complimentary cocktail before 7pm and a lovely breakfast in the morning.  We stayed there on February 3 in room 907.  At 7pm you can park on the street right outside the hotel which was a homerun! I cannot say enough about this hotel, it was a pleasure staying there.

title: Was not Flat nor an Iron
text:
Despite completely misnaming this hotel, it was ok. I stayed here with my girlfriend over the weekend and she became my finance but the end of it. I told the staff I was going to make her my finance, or else, and I asked for a little special touch be added to our room. No special touches by the staff were made and I was kind of sad but I'm sure one can imagine my finance added some special touches (like fluffing the pillows and bringing my favorite toothbrush.). 

The staff was very nice and friendly after I asked the question

"Can you print our concert tickets for us?"

I was overjoyed when they said "Yes! Yes!"

3/5. thanks.

title: If your all about location... Then this is the one.
text: We. Booked the Flatiron hotel in manhattan for a couples break, as first time visitors we found the staff perfectly pleasant and the location of the hotel to be excellent. Just a short walk to the Empire state building, maddison square garden...  In fact just about everything is really accessible and as my husband is of limited mobility we took taxi, s when visiting battery park (to go on a boat to statue of liberty and Ellis Island), Central Park (for the park and zoo,  & the natural history museum). New York has alot going on, and it is possible to fit alot into your day, this hotel is in midtown which allows Central position for upper and lower manhattan.  Our room was on the eighth floor, perfectly clean, small but functional bathroom and well stocked mini-bar ,, however the windows are drafty and the bed was very close to the window. Thus hubby was cold at night. The breakfast is minimal, not much to say except basic... Very. And the breakfast dining room /night function /bar leaves alot to be desired too...  The tacky multi-colour velour seating is stained, worn and tables are way higher making it uncomfortable to have breakfast.  The floor could do with a good clean, with a heavy build-up of dirt around the edges... Yak.  I guess it needs a refurb!!  Apart from the shock of roughly $200 dollars held as A deposit It wasn't too bad to stay, as a couple and for... as I said,  perfect location!  However, I would not stay with my children, or at least if it was a good price for the room,,, I would not want them to eat there.

title: Staff was amazing
text: This hotel is in a great area.The room was comfy and I loved the shower that had three options of shower heads. The staff was amazing and I love that have a live band that plays at night with a cute bar and dinning area that includes a large fish-tank. Breakfast options could be better but it is complimentary.

title: Wonderful location.
text: This is a wonderful hotel.  The staff was amazing and accommodated our party when we needed assistance.  The lounge area was my favorite place in the evening to watch the people bustle up and down the street with my complimentary cocktail in hand.  The location made it easy to go to the theater or to Chinatown.  I would definitely recommend this hotel.

title: Camera e bagno ok ma la lobby....
text: Abbiamo soggiornato al Flatiron Hotel dall'1 al 6 gennaio. Ottima posizione. La camera che ci è stata assegnata era molto pulita così come il bagno, dotato di una comodissima doccia (cosa non scontata negli hotel di NY). Alla tariffa di Booking ci è stato chiesto di aggiungere 19€ a notte per colazione e Wifi. La nota dolente è stata proprio la colazione e la lobby nella quale veniva allestita. Divani vecchi e sporchi (si vedano foto), buffet scarno e scarso e mal presentato. Davvero un peccato perché l'hotel è posizionato in una zona molto comoda e le camere sono decisamente buone, ma lo stato della lobby lascia proprio un senso di trascuratezza e sporcizia.

title: Good location, but very hard bed and tired carpeting
text:
This hotel OK. Its very close to several subway stations with different lines which makes getting around Manhattan very easy and quick. 

The hotel itself is kind-of hit and miss. The decor is a little tacky, especially in the hallways and common areas. The seating in the lobby/lounge area consists of colorful couches that have definitely seen better days, they are crusty and sticky from years of abuse. The resort fee is high considering it covers 1 free drink per night which consists of very cheap well drinks and wines. The included continental breakfast is pretty meager, the only thing worth while are the hard boiled eggs.

The hotel rooms look nice, but dont look too closely. The carpeting in the room is very dated and worn out. For the most part the room looked reasonably clean, but there definitely some areas that could use a little more cleaning. One of the biggest drawbacks for me are the beds. I am not exaggerating when I say that the beds in my room were without a doubt the hardest I have ever slept on in any hotel in my life. It was very hard to get to sleep, and woke up aching from the tremendously hard bed. Not Cool At All! 

I really wanted to like this hotel, I was looking forward to the stay for a long time, but unfortunately I was disappointed.

title: Boutique Hotel with Nightly Entertainment
text: The Flatiron Hotel is located in the historic Flatiron Building. The rooms vary in size based on the shape of the building with the larger rooms having the lowest numbers. The hotel offers local dining and a lobby bar. Live entertainment is available most evenings (except Sunday) with bands, singers and occasional karaoke. The hotel is well situated near restaurants, shopping and a neighborhood park.

title: Really Great
text: I visited New York in December and spent 3 nights at the Flatiron Hotel. Location is fantastic. I loved being near Eataly, City Bakery and Fishs Eddy to name a few of my favorites in the Flatiron area. I got a great rate for the room, unmatched really for the time of year. Lobby is small, but staff is great and attentive in a low key way. I especially like having an attendant at the elevator at night, since I was traveling alone. I had a corner room on the ninth floor, very spacious. There were some stains on carpet in the entry way, but the room smelled clean and the bed was really comfortable. The complimentary breakfast wasn't very tempting, as there are some first rate eateries very close by, but the drink vouchers were appreciated. I like this hotel and will add it to the list of hotels to check on when I come to the city.

title: Didn't meet expectation
text:
