Good: the location is fantastic. You're in the middle of everything, everything is within walkable distance, and not too crazy packed. The shower has really great pressure. For someone with a lot of hair on my head, that is appreciated. The guys walking around the lobby are extremely kind, they were always greeting us and asking if we needed help with anything, it was really nice, I appreciated it. 

Needs work: Cleanliness - our curtains were really gross, they had weird large stains on them so we had to use the blackout curtains the whole time to not look at the stains. Check in service - check in time is at 11 I think, we got there at 4pm and had to wait another 20 mins to come up to the room, which is odd because what if we got there at 11? Does that mean we'd have to wait 5 hours? The front desk lady seemed to not care one bit. I'm sure she was just having an off day, it just took me by surprise how little she cared about us waiting. The air is constantly on creating a humming and a dryness in the air at all times. The TV in the bathroom doesn't work - not a big deal, but I'm sure it's an easy fix and it's a really cool idea so I bet you if it worked, people would rave about it. 

Can't be changed, but wish it could: The mattress is SO firm and the room was SO tiny (we stayed in room 707). For the price I paid per night, I was hoping there would be just a little more room, but the room can just fit one bed and 1 desk, not a lot of moving space. The bathroom is also extremely tiny and you can hear everything! It was fine because I've lived with my boyfriend almost 8 years, but if it's a new relationship, I suggest not risking it, you can hear every single thing (if you know what I mean).

Even with the development areas, the location was so great that I would stay here again if it's cheaper than my other options.

title: Great hotel, great location!
text:
We stayed at the Flatiron Hotel in November and we had a great time. The check in team was super friendly, the staff working at the bar was great and the LIVE MUSIC was out of this world! We enjoyed it so much that we stayed at the hotel each night to enjoy it! 

Rooms were comfortable, beds were comfortable. Liked the blackout curtains as it allowed for good afternoon naps

The location is perfect, walking distance to so many great things. Eataly is a must to check out and it's only a few blocks away 

The only thing I would suggest would be to have a little more selection in your free breakfasts. It was a little disappointing 

We will definitely be back

title: Excellent location.
text: We booked this hotel for a 5 nights in December and we paid 1600 in total for 2 of us in the 8th floor corner Toshi room with 2 double beds (although it said they were queen size when we booked which they werent). Our room was large, very clean with a decent bathroom, hairdryer, coffee facilities and mini bar which werent extortionate prices. Also we ordered room service one night which was about £13  minus the tip which wasnt too bad. The hotel has a bar downstairs which hosts live music every evening but we didnt hear a thing being so high up. The chairs were a bit dirty at breakfast - I dont think they got cleaned from the night before. Breakfast wasnt overly exciting - bagels and toast and fruit and yoghurt - but it was ample. Staff are mostly friendly and polite. Hotel is in the best location, away from Times Square (about a 15 min walk) but still very central and within easy walking to all attractions. Very safe area. Would recommend.

title: Un Hotel correcto pero caro para el estado en que está.
text: Un Hotel con una localización excelente para visitar Nueva York, muy cerca de varias estaciones de metro. Personal muy amable y atento. Está claro que el hotel ya no es lo que fue, se nota que está antiguo y no lo han reformado desde hace tiempo, las paredes y puertas están un poco "tocadas" al igual que los sofás de la cafetería. Para un alojamiento de 4 estrellas y que te cobra como tal, debería hacer una reforma importante. Desayuno sencillo pero bueno

title: Nice hotel, but some caveots
text:
We had a nice stay overall, and loved the location, but we were having problems with the air conditioning / heat that was unable to be resolved (So we had to just leave the window open), and they didn't appear to be able to move us to another room.  The "resort fee" is a little odd, as the only inclusion is a couple of drinks in their bar.  The club downstairs is very active, so that can be a bit noisy if you are not looking for that sort of hotel.

They arranged for someone to take me by car to an event but he canceled last minute and I had to make my own arrangements.

Overall, the staff was all very nice, and we had a very nice time.  I do recommend the hotel, but felt it was more geared towards a younger crowd (I'm only 34!).  The location however cannot be beat.

title: short trip for the weekend
text:
Very disappointed by the breakfast.  Usually these things don't bother me, but the hotel charges a $19.00 USD per day resort fee.  If I'm paying that, I expect something much better.  When I booked the hotel, it said breakfast; it was really continental breakfast - no meat, dried up bagels.
Bedroom was quiet and bed was comfortable.

title: Great location for the price!
text: We stayed here and it was really great! in comparison to the surrounding hotels the price was super good! everything was great in the room, again its not a luxury hotel but it has everything and the the location is prime! highly recommended

title: OK, nothing to rave about.
text:
Room is comfortable but dated. 
Added "city tax" ($19 per night!) was excessive, be sure to take it into account in the price when you book. Apparently it is for breakfast, cleaning and the 'complimentary water' in the room each day. This should really be included in the price when you book as being stung with an additional fee at the end of the stay really dampens the experience. 
Great location, not far from the 28th street subway station. Can also walk to many attractions.
Breakfast was average, I skipped it most days with so much better food available around the flatiron district. 
Service is average, mot of the staff were quite unfriendly. However, some staff were nice and helpful. 
Wifi was fast and worked well at all times.

title: Not a bad location for a first time visit to NYC.
text: We stayed there for a few nights in September and the stay was pretty enjoyable. If you are comfortable taking the subway it is a short walk to a station, but otherwise if the weather is fine and you need a bit of exercise after the long flight, you can walk to most places easily. The room was quite small but nicely decorated and the bathroom had a high end fit out to compensate for its minuscule space! Our room was on level three, but as level 1 is the ground floor and level 2 is a mezzanine, level 3 is the first floor above street level. The street noise was quite pronounced but the main issue was that the hotel bar has live music every night and it is really loud in the rooms immediately above. Most nights it stopped at 11pm but on Fri and Sat it went much later. So ask for a higher room, pack earplugs or go to the bar, enjoy the music and have a few drinks. Self serve breakfast is charged on top of the room rate so take advantage of it because you are paying for it anyway. Breakfast food was limited to bagels and spreads plus boiled eggs and some fruit and yoghurt but load up for energy for sightseeing and save a few bucks buying food elsewhere. Staff were friendly and helpful. Not a great neighborhood (in my opinion) but walking distance to shopping and Empire State Building if you are a first time visitor.

title: 1 night stay
text: I stayed one night on business and it was very nice, had everything I needed including great wifi and it was super clean! The band on Thursday night was fabulous and the breakfast was also nice - simple but did the trick.  The staff makes this place, super friendly and knowledgeable. I will definitely be back.

title: location locatio location
text: Nice room, cleen, new towels every day, more then continental breakfast if you are at the right time. The windows are not duoble galzied so it is noisy during the night because of works in neighbouring building.

title: Boutique Hotel with Amazing Music
text: This hotel is in the flatiron district of Manhattan. Its pretty close to most, either a walk or subway ride away. The rooms are on teh small side compared to some other Manhattan hotels. The real gem of the hotel is the night life. Toshi's on the lower lover has amazing eclectic music that goes late into the night. WE stay there a lot because the music is always so good.

title: Pleasant stay
text: Came into the city for business,  flatiron hotel was in a great location,easy walking, park around the corner, shops eateries all convenient. Hotel room was on the small size but clean and very comfortable. Check in staff very helpful, breakfast that was provided was good. Staff ordered a car for us. Very helpful. Would stay again. Priced right

title: Someone was SLEEPING when I walked into the room!
text:
I travel a lot for work and pleasure. I've stayed in a lot of hotels. I'm not terribly picking as long as I feel safe, the staff is nice, and the room is clean. The staff at this hotel were super nice and friendly. 

I called the day before my arrival and asked for an early check in, and they said they will do their best. I arrived at 10:30am, and they said a room was available. I was thrilled because I had taken the red eye and wanted to drop of my suitcase before heading out to a meeting. 

They gave me a card, I went to the room, swiped the card, and SOMEONE WAS IN THE BED SLEEPING!!! I was mortified and closed the door right away! I went back down stairs, told the front desk what happened, and they apologized. And now a room wouldn't be available until 3pm. The normal check in time.

Fine. Disappointed, but I returned at 3pm. They wanted to give me that same room now that it was empty, but I asked for another room. They agreed to another room, sent up an employee to confirm that it was empty, and they came back down and said it was free and clear. 

I went up to the room, walked in, and there was A MAN REFILLING THE MINI FRIDGE WHEN I WALKED IN! He said he had to come back and finish...all I wanted was an empty room! He came back 20 minutes later to finish. Ugh. He was nice, but still! When you're traveling, and spending money on a hotel room, you would think that the room would be all yours!

On another note...there was a TV production crew that took up the entire bar/restaurant area for the first 3 of 4 days that I was staying there, so I couldn't even get into the bar area and it was so crowded with staff and crew. The free drink tickets couldn't be used because the production was there and we never got notice prior to our stay. 

AND they ran out of breakfast coupons for our daily free breakfast that came with the room. 

The location was great, the front desk staff was nice, but it was a mess of an experience. The night manager agreed to take of the $20/night HIDDEN "resort" fee per night. Only a savings of $90.00! 

I should have asked for ALL of my money back.

Good luck!

title: Great find!
text: My college girlfriends and I get together every few years in NY for a good time.  We are all different personalities and backgrounds so finding a place that makes us all happy is a challenge.  Flatiron filled the bill!  Clean, large room, great location, and incredibly affordable, we ALL had a wonderful experience!  The hotel staff was friendly and wonderful, although very young and a little inexperienced.  Complimentary guest drink every evening during happy hour were offered.  Simple continental breakfast was perfect to just grab and go.  I would definitely stay again!

title: Posizione pefetta!
text:
Ho avuto modo di soggiornare per cinque giorni ad inizio mese di Ottobre 2016.
La posizione e' perfetta per godere del fermento di Manahattan e raggiungere in breve tempo, anche a piedi, tutte le attazioni piu interessanti.
E poi.....a due passi c'e' Eataly...godere della prima colazione con croissant ed espressino torinese...non ha prezzo...un carico di buon gusto ed energia per affrontare le meraviglie della grande mela

title: Chelsea
text:
Ubicación extraordinaria, desayuno incluido con muchas opciones. La ducha del baño de la habitación es también excelente, mucha fuerza. Tiene aire acondicionado individual.
La tarifa es alrededor de u$s 120. Tal vez se pueda encontrar algo con más onda que este no tiene pero yo no supe. Ante la posibilidad de que el clima este " muy antipático" este hotel está cerca de muchas cosas y llegas rápido estés donde estés. Chelsea es muy lindo y me gustaría conocer otro por el mismo barrio.

title: Fabulous location, unique ambiance, a little worn.
text: The location of this property can't be beat no matter what you're in the city to do and the price is reasonable given this. There are definitely some shortcomings. While the rooms are tasteful, there are quite a few "gadgets" in them that would be cool if only they worked (TV in the mirror, mechanized curtains, multi-headed shower...)  However, when they don't work they are just an eyesore or annoyance.  While I stayed there a colleague of mine found her shower was broken. The staff said this was common. That was of little help to someone who was headed to a full day of meetings without a shower. The breakfast was fairly poor with stale bagels, brown bananas and a few selections of children's cereals and the seating for breakfast was in the lounge where the upholstered furniture looked like it had seen better days and fewer washings.

title: Has seen better days
text: We stayed for two nights and were very surprised that this is a four star hotel.  The rooms and hotel are tired and in desperate need of renovation/cleaning.  The carpet in the rooms is really worn and dirty as an example.  Also, the duvets aren't even in duvet covers just sat between two sheets adding to the sense of shabbiness.  Neither the phone nor TV in our room worked and whilst the latter was apparently due to issues  with the cable in the whole area, no one addressed the issue with the broken phone despite advising the front desk.  We would not stay here again especially given how much we paid in light of the quality of the hotel.

title: Lovely hotel, great staff and brilliant location
text: Stayed here for 4 days with some friends... It is in a great location, really handy and just around the corner from the Subway. The rooms are great, spacious and the shower is brilliant. The staff are super friendly and were great with advice. Breakfast is free and is great, get in early for the best selection. The bar downstairs is lovely, the music is fab but the drinks on the pricey... Best Anne the most of the happy hour.

title: lacks in customer service
text: Staying here now; the hotel itself is gorgeous and the rooms are lovely. Not sure why anyone needs a television inside the bathroom mirror or why it's so dark in the bathroom. Location is good. But here's the rub: it's late October in NYC and it's unseasonably warm. It's 81 degrees inside my room because the school system is off for the winter. The windows don't open. I paid almost 900$ for 2 nights and haven't slept a wink. And the hotel hasn't done anything special to account for this. They haven't refunded a night, or offered to give us 2 free nights on a future stay either. What they did was take off the $20 resort fee per day. $40 how big of them. I travel a lot to NYC and I will never be back because this hotel doesn't want my repeat business. they turn and burn. Bummer...cause of the as worked I would be having a completely different experience. The hotels seeming lack of response doesn't cut it for me.

title: Wonderful Hotel
text: Stayed at hotel for three nights and will definitely be back, corner double queen extremely large for NYC, staff extremely personable and accommodating for an early check in. Jay, Candace, and  Freddy welcomed  us and seemed to be there all the time wanting to make sure our stay was the best it could be. The hotel location was perfect next to Madison Square Park and easy Metro access.

title: NYC Holiday
text:
On behalf of my mother and myself, mrs. R. Moerlie, we would like to thank Hotel Flatiron for a great experience, an outstanding accommodation, services and facilities.

It was great hotel, safe and centrally located, next to some great restaurants and bars.

Kind regards,
Mr. K.H.S. LL. M
Rotterdam
The Netherlands

title: Wonderful weekend in NYC at the Flatiron Hotel
text: Chose to stay at the Flatiron Hotel for a girls' weekend because it was reasonable and it looked like a beautiful spot in a good location. We received fabulous service at check in and throughout our stay. Rooms were wonderful! Small bathrooms but multiple shower heads in the shower and mirror with a TV!! Service was impeccable! Free continental breakfast was very nice. And we got a surprise on Friday and Saturday nights with the live bands in the lobby!! The groups were REALLY good!! The whole experience made me want to return to New York just so I can stay there again!

title: Friendly - expensive
text: The hotel staff were very helpful and well mannered. There is evening live music, and a complimentary free drink each night. The rooms were average for the price, saying that prices are competitive in NewYork. Prices range from £150-£200 a night. We had a complimentary breakfast each morning which consisted of Fruit bread, Muffins, Fruit, Yogurt, Bagels and eggs. All in all not a bad experience.

title: Great find!
text: The Flatiron Hotel turned out to be a jewel of a find; all staff members are professional, courteous, and helpful. The hotel is well located, rooms are clean and comfortable.  Will certainly return to the Flatiron when I return to NYC.

title: Perfectly good place to stay
text:
I am a native NYer and moved out of the area several years ago. I needed a place to stay for a business trip, and my usual go to hotels were all booked.  I was nervous about staying here because none of my friends who live in the city had heard of it and there were mixed reviews on Trip Advisor.  I was also very concerned about my sleep being interrupted by noise based on some of the reviews.  Prior to my arrival, I called the hotel many times (to request a high floor) and no one answered the phone.  So, I went in prepared for a bad stay.  

I spent 3 nights at the Flatiron Hotel and I am pleased to report that my stay was very good. I had no issues at all.  The hotel was clean, the bathroom was nice, the room was spacious by NYC standards, the housekeeping service was great, the front desk staff was friendly/helpful/did their best.  I was on the 6th floor and did not hear any noise from live music or the lively bar area (although I did hear a little noise from the street, my room faced 26th St.).  The internet was also strong.   
I would consider staying here again.  

Obviously, this is not the Four Seasons or Ritz Carlton.  So if you are looking for that level of services/those types of amenities, you will not be happy here.  Yes, the lobby and bar are “cheesy” and the live music seems superfluous.  Also, there is no gym in this hotel.  But if you are looking for a clean, convenient, perfectly nice place to sleep for a work or leisure trip to NYC, the Flatiron Hotel is worth considering.

title: Good Vacation
text: We came here to sightsee in 2011 and enjoyed our stay at the flatiron. Rooms were very very small but very nice. TV in the mirror in the bathroom. Comfortable beds. Staff was nice. Front entrance had a nice fish aquarium that was interesting. Very pricey.

title: Terrible
text: I called to book 11 rooms. They told me for over 10 rooms I had to speak to the sales department. 5 days later and several unanswered voicemails I called back and they said 11 rooms weren't available and they couldn't help me. Thanks for nothing.

title: So so
text:
We stayed here for a week which was full of mixed experiences..

The positives; great location, clean, well decorated, generally friendly staff. 

The negatives; the ridiculous $19/day resort fee which is for breakfast, bottled water in your room etc - just include it in the price. On 3 days we got no water anyway so bit of a cheek charging!  TV didn't work for 4 days despite repeatedly reporting it, fixed it myself in the end. And the hotel can be quite noisy with street noise as only single glazed windows

title: Great hotel
text: I don't know where to begin. This hotel is amazing starting with early check in, great staff, bottles of complimentary water daily and complimentary glasses of wine daily. Rooms are clean and a great shower in the bathroom . The location is awesome, lots of restaurants, cafes and pubs. They do have a bar in the lobby that is open nightly but you can't hear the music in your room.

title: Bella stanza, hall da rivedere
text: Albergo a due passi da Madison Square, vicino a Eataly e al Flatiron. Metro a 200 mt. Stanza con due letti king (come prenotata tramite Expedia). Sicuramente tra le più grandi viste a NYC, tutta finestrata con vista verso Madison Square. Colazione compresa nel prezzo ma un po' dimessa, disponibile nella Hall. Servizio nella Hall da tre stelle, ma comunque personale gentile sia al ricevimento che nei servizi in camera. Se vi piace l'intrattenimento la Hall si trasforma in sala per esibizioni dal vivo la sera. Giudizio positivo (molto per la stanza e il personale, meno per il contesto).

title: nice place
text:
Pros - the place is nice and they have small concert. no cover fee. good drinks. 
if you have 2 drinks with your partner, you are about break the most of $100

cons - Drink is !8.. that is ridiculous .. I do not want to have 50 ml alc for 18.. That is a rip off. Place is small.

title: cool hotel in great location
text:
I like priceline because I get a chance to check out a variety of interesting hotels that I might not have chosen had I been looking by name and star quality alone.  This hotel was pretty hip and had their own nightly entertainment going on in the lobby bar which was cool and brought people in to make it seem lively but not overly busy and didn't distract from the fact that it was a hotel you were staying at.  The room was very nice and the bathroom was well done, not a ton of space in the sleeping area, but enough, and it wasn't too cramped.
The location was perfect for anywhere you wanted to go out at - very walkable to Times Square or to the Village or any good places in between and being in Chelsea means you don't have to walk far to find good options to go out for dinning or drinking.
The staff was helpful and friendly.
Since they do have music in the lobby nightly, if you are looking for a quiet room in the evening times, make sure to ask for a room on a higher floor...I was on 3 and was just above where the band played so I could hear some of the music coming through.

title: Film  & Photography
text:
The hotel staff were awesome! Arty is the operations manager who is a seasoned veteran of the business . Lewis is the building engineer who is also a valuable asset. The hotel is in the perfect location for fast tracking around the District. Art.Parks.Food.its all a step away. Real people who make your visit relaxed and welcoming.
We will see you again on the next filming session in NYC!

title: Excelente
text: Excelente servicio. Pequeno, sin grandes lujos, pero con un servicio de excelencia. Los trabajadores de la carpeta son impresionantes, con una amabilidad asombrosa , dispuestos a ayudarte siempre. Los felicito.

title: Your floor matters!
text: We were excited about staying so close to things in Chelsea and the Flatiron building. A few weeks before our stay, a church, located directly across the street, burned to the ground. Sure enough, that was the view outside our window. I'm not saying that was a problem, it is what it is, but be aware that might be your view. After dropping off our luggage, we went out for dinner. When we returned, the hotel's lobby had become a nightspot and a band was playing VERY LOUDLY!! The waitress ripped us off by keeping our $35 change as her tip from a 2 beer purchase and not honoring the 2/1 coupon. The music could be heard from our room until exactly 1:00 am as the 2nd floor is just a balcony. The strobe light and the velour seats in the lobby were really tacky. So happy it was only one night. The front desk really should have asked us at check in if the loud music was going to be a problem.

title: Favorite Spot
text: This hotel has just moved to the top of my NYC list of places to stay.  We were in NYC for my grandson's 3rd Birthday.  The Flatiron Hotel is in a Great location.  We walked to Eataly for dinner and after dinner there was a park close by that we could take the kids to. The staff was very nice especially because we had two rambunctious little boys with us who couldn't get enough of looking at all the Beautiful fish in the fish tank in the lobby.  Our room was a nice size considering we were in NYC.  It was nice and clean and the Bathroom was a nice marble.  Beds were comfortable no lice or bed bugs but I always spray our pillows with bed bug spray so I don't know if that made a difference or not.  We did have trouble connecting to WiFi and we didn't bother to inquire about it we were just to exhausted.  The lighting was hard to figure out so it was pretty dark in our room.  The continental breakfast was nice but they kept running out of coffee.  The young men who were running the buffet were very nice though and they were doing their best to keep everything filled.  They had a variety of bagels muffins & cold cereal.  They had hard boiled eggs and a variety of juice and yogurts. For fruit they had bananas and apples.  I was satisfied.  Of course the picky little children couldn't find anything to their liking.  They had the breakfast in the bar area.  That area could be cleaner.  The seats need to be scrubbed and it would look so much nicer if the tablecloths were ironed.  I would definitely come back to this hotel.  It is in an interesting area and I really like that they have entertainment in the bar  at night.  It would like to bring my husband back for a nice weekend stay.

title: watch out for the extra $19 they sneak in
text:
There's a $19/day "resort fee," that they add to your bill. When I asked, they said it covers breakfast, Wi-Fi, and housekeeping! The front desk guy said that if I could prove that it wasn't written on my reservation, he would waive it. Of course, it's hidden in the fine print that nobody looks at. He said everyone complains about it, and nobody reads the fine print. A small amount, relative to the cost of hotels in New York, but it's just a sleazy way to grab more cash.

The hotel itself is ok, albeit with an eccentric decor. The main picture that they market with is made to look like the flatiron building, if you're just glancing at it. Deliberately sneaky, again?

title: Wish I could've stayed longer!!
text: I can't say enough about this top notch hotel! The rooms were so charming and luxe! This is a beautiful historical building and it is beautifully kept up. We had a Toshi Corner Deluxe room with 2 queen beds and it was ample and the windows were grand and were given access to free wifi. Our bathroom was beautifully tiled with marble and had lovely fixtures and a jet tub. Also a very lovely continental breakfast was included in the price, bagels, muffins, fruit yogurt and of course, coffee. Couldn't ask for more. I've stayed at "newer" 4 and 5 star hotels in the city and the rooms were not much larger than a walk in closet and more money too. This was a great value and Flatiron is a great location with quick access to other neighborhoods like Chelsea, Union Square and a nice walk to the Highline. The best part is the friendly staff who were very accommodating in securing our luggage before check-in and after check-out so we could make the most of our time in the city. Freddy & Christian were extremely helpful and courteous and epitomize the best in customer service. You really can't beat this hotel. I visited with friends this time but I'll be back with my family soon. They'll love it too. Thank you Flatiron Hotel.

title: Insects and Lice! Do not book this dump!
text: Run like hell! This is a dump motel infested with lice and bedbugs! I reported them to the NYC Health Department. The manager was "not available" nor did the front desk try to do anything. It should be closed down!

title: Ehhhhhhhhhh
text: Not impressed. Walls are very thin. You can hear doorbells in rooms down the hall. Rooms are spacious, which was nice. Front desk staff was very nice. My favorite part of the stay was the $19 resort charge per day. What resort? There was no pool, no fitness center and no restaurant. Housekeeping was very nice but they are stretched very thin.

title: Decent value, but a few concerns
text: This should be a nice little boutique hotel but it has a few oddities.  The lobby is quite disorganized.  The hotel bar runs right intothe lobby and is used for private parties and weddings and so on. So when you walk into the lobby you can feel like you are walking into someone else's party, which is not the usual boutique hotel experience.  There is free breakfast, but watch out for the extra compulsory service charge.  The rooms are fine...a little small but "normal" for New York.  They did not update the windows when they renovated so it is a little noisy.

title: Cool, Clean and Accomodating
text:
Stayed one night for wife's birthday shopping in the city. The staff is friendly and eager to help with any requests. The location is great (especially for visiting the nearby Peloton studio!).

The room was clean and comfortable and the air conditioning was cool and responsive.

Included continental breakfast in the morning with good coffee, juices, muffins, yogurts and fruit.

The decor is funky but like someone else said earlier, it's funky in a good way. We would definitely stay at the Flatiron again.

title: Son grandes lujos, pero es muy buen hotel
text:
Nos alojamos 3 noches en este hotel, y sin tener grandes lujos, estuvimos muy bien! La ubicación es bastante buena, hace esquina con Broadway, a 2 pasos de la Quinta avda. 
La habitación que nos tocó no era muy grande pero si que tenía una cama grande y muy cómoda. El baño estaba muy bien, con hidromasaje en la ducha e hilo musical, que mientras te duchas está bien ponerlo jeje.
Incluye desayuno, que aunque no sea muy variado, es lo suficiente para tomarte un cafe, zumo y bollería para empezar la mañana.
El personal de recepción es muy atento y agradable. Nos ayudaron en lo que les pedimos y nos ayudaron a hacer una reserva para un traslado a Cape Liberty.

Es un hotel muy recomendable para alojarse en Nueva York y de precio es bastante razonable en comparación con otros hoteles.

title: Good one night stay; odd fee
text:
My husband and I stayed here on July 02/16 for one night prior to moving to another previously booked hotel for a longer stay in NYC. Location was good for us, easy to walk to a variety of places; check-in was pleasant and efficient. The room was very nice, modern and clean, a bit on the smaller side but enough room to move around easily. The bathroom was also on the smaller side but that's very common for NYC. The glassed-in shower had a rain shower head and additional body sprays; shampoo, etc. amenities were supplied. The bed was very comfortable with a memory foam type mattress; the bedding was soft and comfortable. Air conditioning worked very well, a bit too well for me. The blackout curtains were controlled remotely with a wall unit by the head of the bed - nice feature. Room security was very modern and a light for housekeeping could be initiated from the inside. There was the availability of t.v. in the bathroom; however it was a square panel within the mirror, which obscured mirror clarity for my husband when he was shaving. Also couldn't seem to get it to work but overall not a big deal. Two for one drinks was offered for that night however it is for only basic drinks. A basic continental breakfast was available the next morning, yogurt, some fruit, muffins, bagels, some jams, coffee/tea. Free wi-fi was offered in the room as well. 

Now to the odd fee. Although the drinks, wi-fi, and continental breakfast were considered 'free', on the bill was a Resort Fee of $19.00, which upon check-out my husband discovered was to cover the 'free' amenities.  The hotel rate was very good for the day that we stayed; however, I would prefer that the Resort fee be rolled in so there would be no surprises upon check-out.  I would recommend this hotel and I would also stay there again but just be aware to add the additional fee on to whatever the rate is for the day that you're staying.

title: Super emplacement, très bon staff.
text:
A deux pas du Flatiron building, à 3 du Madison Square Park et à 4 d'Union Square, avec vue de la chambre sur l'Empire State ... Vous l'aurez compris, hôtel très bien placé. Il est également bien desservi par le métro.
La chambre était spacieuse et propre malgré quelques petits bricolages de fortune. Par contre, vous êtes à NY où le double vitrage n'est pas courant donc n'oubliez pas vos quiès car le bruit de la rue (broadway pour nous) peut vous gêner. Sinon, l'hôtel est bien insonorisé mais le manque de savoir-vivre de certains clients peut vous surprendre (porte claquée).
Le matelas est assez dur. Si vous êtes habitués à un matelas mémoire de forme, vous aurez un peu mal au dos. Quant au linge de lit, très "cocooning" !! Le linge de toilette est basique mais sent très bon.
Ah oui, dernier détail, pour vous faire gagner du temps : le coffre-fort est dans un des tiroirs du lit (niveau des têtes). Nous avons passé bien 5 min à le chercher ! 
Le staff est très sympa, que ce soit du réceptionniste à la femme de chambre.
Je recommande cet hôtel.

title: Details in all the things that matter
text: I stayed here for a weekend in June while attending a conference. I was greeted by the General Manager who went out  of his way to make me feel welcome immediately. There was a line at the front desk due to a lady trying to pay in cash. He smiled graciously and said "hello, would you like some water, maybe a glass of wine," it was a hot afternoon when I checked in. After a long drive to the city from a friend in Long Island I asked if he had a matchbook so my friend could smoke a cigar on his way home through traffic. They didn't have one by he found a candle lighter from someone in the dining room lighting candles and asked "will this work?" Absolutely, that is fire. During my stay, the hotel was very clean, well kept, extra detail in that there was a lighted mirror in the bathroom and a tv in the mirror, the shower had different heads which was nice. I could've been in the middle of a tropical island, not New York with the pleasantness of the staff. The food in the restaurant was great, the ambiance was chill and relaxing including the Saturday night entertainment. I felt very safe, as a woman traveling alone in NYC and felt very well taken care of. This was a great hotel, location, would stay here again, hands down.

title: Quick overnight!!
text: Other than the location which was the reason we stayed there, I would not stay there again. The hotel was clean but the sleazy decor of the tired rooms, halls and lobby were a turn-off. Our room was several floors above a night club which blasted music until 2 am. It was so noisy and you could actually feel the vibrations while trying to sleep. The bathroom was large but only had a shower in a tub which was very slippery with no rails or guards.

title: Funky in a Good Way
text: The Flatiron Hotel is clean, comfortable and with the friendliest staff in NYC. From the front desk  people to housekeeping, the service was exceptional. My sister and I appreciated the extra effort everybody at the Flatiron made to ensure our stay was enjoyable.They charged a $19 daily resort fee that included breakfast for everybody in your room, wifi, bottles of water and extremely welcome glasses of wine. Well worth the fee.

title: Pleasant stay for 5 nights
text:
Stayed with Flatiron Hotel for 5 nights. The room is spacious and comfortable. The price paid is reasonable as the location is good. Most importantly, the service staff are very friendly and ready to provide assistance whenever needed.

Another thing that really makes the stay nice is the decoration (circular aquarium) which has a calming effect :)

This is one of the hotel worth staying!!

title: Perfect for us
text: The hotel has a clean lobby with a cool fish tank . The staff is very friendly and helpful. They helped tell us where to go for late night food and quickly took care of our lock when it was malfunctioning. Our room on the 5 th floor had a huge window that even opened a tiny bit for outside air. It made the room seem more spacious. I loved the light it gave and I loved the style of the room and bathroom. The bed even is a trundle to put your things away which I love. The bathroom had cool tiles and the shower was awesome, jets everywhere. There is a hairdryer also. I didn't hear anything to disrupt my sleep but my sister said she could hear people sneezing next door. Nice bed and curtains to keep it dark if needed.

title: Excellent localization
text:
Localized at 26th street near Broadway avenue have an excellent localization near the Empire State, Time Square and other attractions.
Rooms are clean and guys at front desk are always wondering to help you. If it's possible give the preference for the Flatiron King room, it's almost the size them the Flatirom Queen room for just some dollars on top.
Note: Free Internet

title: Hotel nice some service not so...
text:
Hotel is typical NYC size. Rooms were clean and well kept. Mini bar not stocked and had leftovers from previous guest. Multi sprayer on shower head made it difficult to keep water in the enclosed area. ( leaked a lot )
We based our selection on the fact that they had a rooftop bar that looked very cool. When we arrived we were told it was closed until July. We were never told this upon booking. 
Service at the desk and housekeeping was great but I can't say the same for the bar staff. The bartender last night who left me standing there for 10 minutes while he texted and drank a beer really was pretty bad. He actually said to me ( after he poured the wrong drink ) "oh man you should have gotten here before I got drunk"

title: Great location, fun and funky hotel
text: Spent two nights at the Flatiron Hotel in the Flatiron district of New York City as a single business travelor.  Great location, near lots of restaurants.  Nice amenities including a lovely and clean bathroom with a nice shower, comfy bed and helpful, gracious staff. I will definitely be back!

title: Très bien !
text:
La situation géographique est bonne et pratique pour rejoindre différents points d'intérêts de la ville.
L'hôtel dispose d'un fantastique roof top avec une vue sur l'empire state building.
Les chambres sont très bien équipés et propres.

title: Charming Hotel--Outstanding Location
text: I spent five nights at the Flatiron, and it was a terrific visit. It was my first time at the Flatiron, but it will definitely not be the last. Wonderful concierge service, excellent amenities, accommodating housekeeping staff--from start to finish, my experience was wonderful. One of the young men at the front desk even searched for a vase for me, as my son surprised me in the lobby with a huge bouquet of flowers. I appreciated everyone's attention to my comfort.

title: Delighted throughout our stay!
text: I've stayed in a LOT of hotels, and often the term "boutique" means a cheaper, small hotel with few amenities. I was really pleased that was not the case here. The funky lobby decor and aquarium were great, staff was incredibly friendly and called us by name every time they saw us. Our room, while a little small, was still clean, modern and great fun with little surprises like a TV behind the bathroom mirror, remote controlled curtains, and an amazing 8 head shower in the bath. Have stayed in Manhattan many times, but never in the Flat Iron district and it proved to be a great location with lots of great bars and restaurants nearby. Free continental breakfast was also a nice touch. Highly recommend it and would stay again.

title: SISTER trip
text: Very pleased with our visit. Beautiful corner room with 2 queen beds for 2 couples. Comfortable and clean. Large bathroom with jetted tub & a TV in the bathroom mirror.  Good size for NYC. Very reasonable price. Greeted & treated well. Nice lounge/bar area with a beautiful aquarium.  Convenient location.

title: Enjoyable Stay
text: We stayed here for an extended weekend.  Very satisfied overall.  Nice room at god $$ and the location of the hotel was perfect.  Walking distance to many bars, eateries, park and shopping.  Subway only 2 blocks away.  Only glitch was that one day the maid did not come to the room, clean it or make the bed but this was no biggie.  Would definitely consider a return visit.  They also have what looks like a very happening roof top garden-bar/lounge but it was closed during our visit due to the rain.

title: Great location, charming hotel, reasonable price
text: First off, let's start with the location, which is central to EVERYTHING... on 26th near Broadway. The hotel itself is charmingly updated, with modern amenities yet a classic NYC feel. Staff was super friendly and helpful, a handy free continental breakfast in the morning & lively (but not TOO lively) bar downstairs in the evening. It's cute, clean, quaint and safe at a price comparable to things much less centrally located. Would definitely stay again.

title: Great
text: Nice hotel, nice people, nice place, I warmly recommand. Breakfast simple but correct. Comfortable bed. Street side rooms noisy anyway, prefer back yard rooms. Good restaurants around, italian take away at Eataly.

title: Moving daughter out of dorm, and trying to squeeze in some fun with family
text: The front desk staff is genuinely helpful and very welcoming. The lobby bar just off the lobby has colorful, low profile couches and cocktail tables set up at night with some pretty terrific local artists who pop in the sit in on a Jazz jam session.  You will see a lot of reference to "Toshi" and how much "Toshi loves you".  The place has a great vibe to just hang out and listen to some easy does it jazz standards. The  bartenders make excellent libations you will love! The new chef also prepares some great tapas style foodstuffs that you don't want to miss!  The rooms are authentic. The electric curtains are nice, and the newly styled rooms are well appointed and fun.  Get the double room with the corner view ...it was terrific!  It's a short walk to the subway and a 10 minute walk to Union Square.  It's in a great part of town!

title: Fun to find a good one!!
text:
Ok.....so....as always....I will talk about the  good, the bad & the ugly.....

Whenever I go to NYC I like to find different hotels in different areas to stay in....it lets me get the real flavor of the city....this trip was a little more than 48 hours....so I needed to be a bit central...the Flatiron is on 26th and Broadway so it was easy to maneuver around. 

I got checked on Sunday night...I had heard that the lobby was not like a lobby so I was curious to see what was what...  I thought it was great.  It is very clear that there is a desk to check you in....folks at the door to greet you, offer you a beverage...it was very comfortable and the two guys there made me laugh....so....

Off to the room I go.... It was a small room...but let's be honest...I am not in NYC to sit in my room...so this does not bother me.... The bathroom was also very small....and although it didn't bother me....I did have a moment of ....man I wish I had a little more room...this is not the bathroom you want to share with anyone... I don't care how close you are....BUT the shower....holy smoke....the shower was great (ok...sharing that might be kinda fun...) 

There is breakfast in the morning...but it's more of a euro traveler breakfast...so if you are thinking you are going to order eggs get over that....go out to eat....but a bagel and a cup of coffee and you are golden.   

There are a lot of places to eat right around there....so that was very cool...

There is no room service - which is a bummer if you don't want to go out...but not the  end of the world....

I was on the 8th floor and was able to hear the sounds of the street pretty clearly.....and for some folks that may be a bummer....that is probably the worst thing I can say...and it was not horrible....only loud in the morning... All and all its a nice place

This is a good traveler hotel.....I would recommend it....  And I would stay here again....

title: Terrible terrible place
text:
This is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in .
The staff were rude and unhelpful .
Poor facilities . Issues with bills 
Would not stay here again . 
It is well located but that's the only good thing about it

title: Great experience
text:
We stayed at the Flatiron Hotel over Presidents Day weekend, and were very pleasantly surprised. The location was convenient to a few different subway stops, and out of the very touristy midtown area. We stayed in room 1002 -- high up and away from any noise from the lobby, and also very spacious for a two-queen room. 

The concierge was very friendly. Breakfast was very acceptable -- fruit, juices, bagels, toast, pastries, coffee. Beware of the seats by the window -- I almost toppled backwards when I sat down!

There were a few good neighborhood bars just down the block, so my wife and I went out for a nightcap while leaving our two teen daughters in the room. We stayed here for three nights, very reasonably priced. We were offered evening beverages (wine and beer) by the concierge each night.

We will definitely stay here again, and probably request the same room if the kids are with us!

title: Convenient
text: Picked this place on my last night in NYC, just to experience staying in Flatiron district.. Lobby is simple, check-in is not a problem, staff are warm and helpful. My room is located at 3rd floor and at the end of the hall. Bed is gorgeous, lots of pillow but the bathroom is small. Breakfast is okay (coffee, bread, yogurt, cereals, fresh fruits) but if you don't like it, there's a starbucks accross and you can just walk in Madison Garden and grab food from shake shack. :)

title: A pleasant surprise, very comfortable and clean, great location
text: I was a bit concerned after reading reviews on tripadvisor about this hotel, but my concerns were not warranted.   Great reception upon arrival, loaded me up with bottled water.   Room (queen) was small but just fine for a single person.  NYC hotels are always small and I did not find this to be out of the ordinary.   Room was clean, bed was comfortable, and shower was great (multi-head).   WI-Fi very good, and noise level low, other than the sirens one always hears in NY.    The staff were very pleasant and helpful.   Second night came in around 10:30pm, and the bar/music was kicking up, but nothing too loud or overwhelming. Great location, plenty of restaurants close by.  I took the train into Penn Station and it was a short walk. I would definitely come again.

title: Eclectic Space, Great Location
text:
Stayed here with my husband and two teen daughters between Christmas and New Years this past season. The hotel is perfectly located for all we love to do and the interior design is eclectic, hip and fun.

Our room was very comfortable and the bed linens were very high quality along with the pillows, etc. 

Enjoyed a nice simple breakfast downstairs before adventuring out to explore the city that weekend before flying home.

title: Perfect!!
text: My Wife & I traveled here early March.We found the hotel to be perfect for what we needed.It is compact,clean & very central.The bar area can be quiet lively when they put on some entertainment.Overall we enjoyed our stay & would have no hesitation returning.We found the continental breakfast provided was adequate & a pretty good selection of cereals,yogurts fruit etc.You are within walking distance of the Empire State building & if you don't mind stretching your legs Times Square is a mere 15min walk.

title: Tacky
text: The lack of a proper front desk caused some concern immediately. I could have gotten past that, but there were continued significant concerns during my stay. "Resort fees" including gratuities (but staff accepted anyway), free coffee (only decaf in room and when I ordered coffee delivered to the room it never came), and wifi-- which is advertised as free on the website caused me to feel like I was being ripped-off. The shower was full of mildew. The room was otherwise clean. Many items did not work properly such as the remote controlled drapery. The proper time wasn't set on the clock in the room. Do not be fooled by the website. This was not luxurious. The lobby area especially is tacky with crushed velvet furniture and a throne! Given the price, the customer should expect a better atmosphere and experience.

title: Great place to stay
text:
Booked for a 3 night stay with wife and daughter for a surprise 18th birthday trip.
Double room on 7th floor no trouble with noise from hotel street noise a slight problem but hey it's New York.
Room clean and cleaned every day.
2 Double beds with water and coffee in room.
Nice power shower.
Sink damaged in the room and not a great repair let the room down. 
Breakfast included selection of Teas and coffee, Bagels, Bread, cakes, Fruit, yogurt, cereals and juices giving good start to the day.
Located approx 5 mins walk from closest Metro and approx 15 mins walk to Time Sq
Live music in the bar every night we stayed which we could not hear on the 7th floor.

title: Go in knowing what to expect
text:
Not sure where to start. The hotel wants to be a boutique cool hotel, and it could be. Great location. Interesting Vibe. But needs some work.

It has an identity problem. Is it a hotel with a club in the lobby or a club with rooms upstairs?? There is no reception desk. Just a collapsible table. You are basically walking into a night club that hasn't opened yet to check in. there are some tired sofas that probably look great in the dark during the club hours.
Weird. 

The staff was very friendly and helpful. They recognized the "look" on my wife's face and offered to move our rooms to the top floor away from the late night music scene. Very smart move on their part. Thanks.

The rooms are small but nice. Euro small. If you are not prepared, be prepared. Quiet and comfy though. Every review says the bath mirror/tv does not work. Neither did ours. Small bathroom / small shower. Again Euro small and fine if you are prepared for that.

I think if they update the lobby, make it welcoming to travelers, and make it a hotel first then it could go a long way. The rooms are fine, just make everything in them work. Keep the Club but find a way to make it a hotel first.

Not sure I would recommend it again as we could have gotten a better stay for the amount of money it cost us. I didn't walk away disappointed, but will probably just walk away.

title: Not a Luxurious Hotel
text:
there are some positives regarding this hotel.  1.) great area to shop and check out the Broadway/Fifth Ave. area.  2.) room was neat and clean  3.) bed was comfortable with clean sheets  4.) our room was quiet
the cons are as follows.  1.) at 2:30-3:00p.m. there were no rooms cleaned in order for us to change and clean up (it appeared that there were very few people staying there - saw less than 6 at breakfast and none on elevator)  Breakfast consists of a few bagels, regular coffee (no tea) apples/few bananas and boxed cereal plus some juice.  that's it!  one couple looked at it and went elsewhere.  there is no lobby - none.  there was a fellow standing at a podium when we walked in  no one asks if they can help you though they did offer us wine.  this lobby/hotel is described as a "luxurious European boutique hotel."  it is not luxurious!  there is a hotel on 45th street which is part of a French chain which is indeed luxurious.  I asked while there if they could change a $50. and they told me to go to Starbucks or the deli around the corner.  the décor is not very attractive.  I guess some find the TV in the bathroom mirror a plus.  I thought it was strange.  it didn't work and was in the way if you wanted to apply makeup.  I passed up hotels that were less money due to the advertising of this hotel.  would not go back.  it is not a 4 star.  i'd give it a 2 1/2.

title: Tried to book a board meeting
text:
I left 4 or more messages on Benjamin’s voice mail and emailed him directly and have not gotten a single response. I have gone as far as telling this to the front desk who sent me to another voicemail- I called back, told him that I got another voicemail and would just like to talk to someone about hosting a board meeting with food and beverage and discussing a room block for our board members… the front desk person put me on hold where I waited 8 minutes until I hung up. 
Totally unprofessional. What are they doing over there????

title: Couple trip to the city
text: This was a charming boutique hotel.  Our room was very comfortable and the decor was really nice.  I thought there could have been more light in the bathroom.  The location was perfect for a show we attended right across the street and not far from great shopping and the Empire State Building to name a few spots.  There are many restaurants and bars in the area.   We walked down 26th Ave and walked The Highline and walked down the other end and walked through Madison Park.  Chelsea market was a 30 min. walk and a must see.  We had a great stay.  It was a little noisy at night.  A band was playing in the bar and we could hear it in our room.. The only complaint I have is that I know I left my phone charger on the desk where I was charging it.  I know it was negligent but I totally forgot to put it in my bag.  I meant to go back and do that.  I returned home without it.  I called the hotel to see if they had found it.  They explained that the room had been cleaned and it was not turned in by the maid.  I felt as if they did not want to bother with either returning it or approaching the maid to see if she had found it.  I was a little disappointed.  Also, see below for our one improvement for the hotel staff.

title: Not what U expect
text: Upon check-in had to physically show the details of my reservation to confirm late check-out, booked for Valentines day - a jacuzzi suite, room was outdated, dull & the jacuzzi was a jetted tub for one, Not as the site described or showed. Room was clean but worn- had a tn in mirror in the bath that did not work. Addressed this upon check-in, was not serviced until the following morning around 10 am. Front desk did not pick up when call was placed & heater was extremely loud. Hotel was not worth the price & is outdated.

title: Not a Bad Hotel at All!
text: We have stayed here a few times and it is pretty good. Not the fanciest or most modern, or does not have a great lobby, but the rooms are cozy and a bit funky with small touches like a TV in the bathroom mirror and multi-head showers.  There is space in Toshi's which can be a really fun club at night, to sit with colleagues and do some work during the day.  The location is good and it is really close to Eataly which deserves to be visited as often as possible.  Decent price for a decent stay.

title: Cannot praise this hotel enough
text: I have always stayed in midtown when visiting my favourite city but thought this hotel looked too good to pass up. I went with my 15 year old niece and she loved it too. The hotel itself is a modern boutique hotel that looks beautiful from the funky ground floor restaurant with its amazing fish tank to its rooftop bar with amazing views. It's a stones throw from the Flatiron Building, Madison Square Park, Eataly and walking distance to most of the tourist spots empire State etc. The staff are the best, so helpful and friendly. I don't tend to stay in the same place twice with there being so many hotels to choose from in New York but I would seriously consider staying here again.

title: Decent(ish) Value....Not a 4*
text:
Pros:
- location is excellent, central and within walking distance of many major attractions.
- Friendly staff
- The shower is pretty cool with multiple heads!

Cons:
- Quite a noisy part of town and the rooms are nowhere near soundsproof
- The hotel is quite run down, with not much sign of investment in upkeep.
- The breakfast is really poor (a few bagels, some cereal and fruit)
- The mythical "rooftop bar" doesnt exist

Overall, I would rate this hotel 2 or 3 star at most. If I had seen that then my expectations would have been managed. The fact this is rated 4 stars is quite deceptive.

title: Was my favorite hotel, but the last trip blew that
text: This hotel is great for the value, and they are very friendly and personable. The value is one of the best in NYC. The rooms are clean, modern, and comfy. My stay there on New Year's Eve was my third stay with the hotel in 2015. However, on this trip they blew it. I left my keys in the room, and when the guy called me at the airport to tell me, he acted as if he couldn't be bothered with trying to get me my keys overnight. *(That was my only set of keys to my house and car.)In other words, it was too much trouble. Well to his credit, he called the next morning, and said that he was able to send  them overnight, but he charged my Amex $60. I thought that this was cheap considering guests already pay a "resort" fee at the hotel. And most hotels have a budget for this. Not to mention, I was a loyal guest of the hotel, and that $60 would have been repaid by future visits to the hotel. They definitely lost my loyalty. Next.

title: Localisation idéale et équipe investie et réactive
text:
Hôtel à taille humaine, très bien situé dans un quartier calme, proche du métro au centre de Manhattan.

Vous apprécierez l'accueil, le café et les bouteilles offerts tous les jours. Propreté et service en chambre irréprochable.

Un petit bémol sur le petit déjeuner qui aurait mérité d'être un peu plus étoffé (on est loin des petits déjeuners à l'américaine, pas d'oeufs, ni bacon, ni haricot).

Par contre de nombreux restaurants se trouvent à moins de 5 minutes à pied de l'hôtel.

En bref, un très bon souvenir dans Big Apple.

title: Flatiron didn't fall flat
text:
We stayed at the Flatiron hotel Dec 8 - 10 , 2015
The staff were amazing/friendly and helpful ! Special thanks to Leo and Juan!
Although ALL the staff were the greatest (wish we knew all their names)
The rooms were clean and well kept..and it was a nice little contenental breakfast in the morning.
We especially liked the fact that they gave us a much needed glass of wine upon our arrival to help us get settled in.
The hotel itself was located in a great spot with a great country food restaurant across the street. We were able to walk in about 10-15 min to empire state building and times square.
This was my first trip to New York city and my girlfriend was there once when she was a child. 
The New York people really are an amazing and rich group of individuals!
We would definitely return...and the Flatiron would be the first hotel we'd think of to stay.
Thank you again for a great stay and wonderful impression of your city!

title: Good
text: Technologically advanced, had a good experience! Oz, Leo and Jonathan there with good service! Good location! Bbbbbbnnndjdjjdjddjnnnnnnnnnnnnmmmndbndjdkdiejdhbebddjidpdobbdjfkzkxjxjdjfjdjkdppdkdbdbxjfjdjzjjxjdjdjjfbfdddopdodjw

title: Boutique Hotel with Nightly Entertainment
text: Although the rooms are not large, the nightly entertainment and access to local flatiron district parks and eateries makes this a preferred destination. The owner Toshi welcomes everyone and is often seen with his dogs and unique car. Don't be surprised to see well known entertainers on open mic nights after the shows let out.

title: Loved this small hotel.
text: This hotel is great!  It is in a good location - neighborhood that has definitely come a long way in the past 10 years.  The property is stylish but not uber trendy like other places nearby.  My room (406) was a decent size for a NYC hotel room and well appointed with everything you could need/want - great amenities, modern conveniences, continental breakfast and friendly staff.  The mastermind behind it is someone named Toshi and I was told this is his only property.  I would stay here again in a heartbeat and recommend to anyone.

title: Excellent Location and Customer Service
text:
I stayed in a corner suite with 2 of my friends for a week's holiday. The excellent customer service I received really made this hotel and my holiday stand out. We received free bottles of the hotel's custom made water in our room every day and there was a free bar in the lobby providing champagne, wine, beer and soft drinks all day and evening for guests. The free bar was a great perk and provided an opportunity for us to mingle with other guests and the owners themselves in the evening before we headed out in to the city. The owners were clearly very invested in the hotel and went out of their way to meet their guests and provide a personal touch to our holiday, for example they took us up to the penthouse (which was restricted access at the time due to renovation work) so that we could have a look at the amazing views of the Empire State building from the roof terrace and take photos!

A couple of nights a week the downstairs bar becomes a hub of local nightlife, which provides a great atmosphere and an opportunity to meet some Yanks!

The staff were also extremely helpful and accommodating and happy to talk to me while i was waiting in the lobby for my friends to come down! They were always ready with recommendations and advice to help us get the most out of our stay. Angel and Christopher merit special mention, as they were so pleasant and helpful.

The room  itself was well furnished, clean, spacious (we had a corner suite) with a touch of luxury. 

Obviously the location in mid town is excellent, it's also very close to the subway and numerous shops.

Additional features: off site gym access (across the road), free breakfast, taxi to airport service.

Negatives: the lifts (although still functioning) and upstairs roof terrace bar were still under refurbishment at the time of my trip.

title: Below average
text: Rooms are very very old and small. Elevator is super small. Besides the lobby, nothing has been renovated. Rooms are poorly insulated and noisy. I would not recommend it to anybody. The only outstanding thing is the location. That part I enjoyed.

title: Worst place to host an event
text: A few weeks ago I hosted an event at Toshi's Penthouse Rooftop.  I booked it month earlier and then out of nowhere was not hearing back from the folks i met with.  Turns out they were fired and no one reached out to let me know they were my new rep. He then asked me to come in for a tour, which I already did and had signed a contract. The events department was very unorganized. The day of the event, breakfast was 20 minutes late, and some of my attendees left to go to Starbucks because coffee wasn't even available. They brought 1 pitcher of coffee and water for 38 people, which went in about 5 seconds, and then we had to wait for more. They brought the food up in increments, only 5 plain bagels. What? The internet was not available in the entire hotel, we had to go out and buy a hotspot. Obviously that affected our presentations. Lunch was 30 minutes late. The bathroom toilet (1 of 2) was clogged and there was no garbage can in there. They had a hanging rod with no hangers. The chairs were wobbly and very cheap. It was so bad that we cancelled our event for the next day and had it at our own offices. There were only 2 people working the event because someone called out. They were understaffed and under-prepared. I was pretty much their third party, helping carry up bagels and cups. There was no place to put dirty dishes, they ran out of plates. It was awful and I was completely mortified. The rooms were nice and modern but some were small, and others had small issues like a wobbly toilet seat or a shower that did not work. I will never go there again. There is also no reception area. During my event I was looking for my contact and the reception was of no help, telling me doesn't do events and the event director had no office line. Needless to say, I will never work with them again. It's also very noisy!

title: Perfect holiday base at the heart of the city!
text:
Family of 4 booked 2 rooms here Dec 11-15 (double with 2 and king).  From the moment we arrived to the moment we left was extremely memorable.  Special mention to Jason and Leo in the lobby, always acknowledging us and making us feel welcome.
Rooms were modern, spacious and luxurious with some great modern conveniences.  Maid service was excellent also.
Location could not have been better - Flatiron/Nomad is so central and you can walk to so many places within minutes.
We asked for a high floor, put on 7 and didnt hear any noise from the lobby below or the rooftop above.
We will be back!!  Didnt want to leave!! Thank you!!

title: unlike any other
text:
this was the first time that i had stayed at a hotel without an actual front desk - it was a podium and a guy with a ipad. which is fine, and worked out. it was just different. it was also the first time where i stayed in a room where when you open your door, bam you're in the room. there's your bed. and then there's a door. that's the bathroom. there was no hallway. the size of the room was fine and it looked nice, i guess the layout just kind of threw me off. 
i read about the surprise charges after / at the end of your stay, so i was semi-prepared. i had already booked the hotel when i learned of this (i swear i checked tripadvisor beforehand and didnt see it!), otherwise i would not have done so.
the tv in the bathroom mirror did not work. bummer. sounded cool.
the good things though? the guy at the podium was super nice and helpful. the area was awesome - right in the middle of everything; walking distance to all things. loved that and appreciated it so much.

title: Confused at the Front Desk
text:
The Flatiron Hotel is in a great location.
When we went to check in the front desk had a supposed computer mishap.  They offered glasses of wine while we waited to be checked in and given our room key.  This was maybe 15 minutes or so.  I was given a very nice corner room on the 9th floor.  Very spacious for NYC.  But, I was hearing from my other coworkers that this was not the case for their rooms.  My room was clean and well appointed.  No complaints.  But, then my bill came...
I had mini bar charges...I know better then to pick up anything on the weighted mini bar...but I had two charges.
They removed both charges when I told them.  This was also the case for most of my coworkers...mini bar charges showed up on the bill.  So please beware.  Then there was confusion about the payment of our rooms...our company prepaid all of the rooms a month prior.  Yet, we had to pay.  So needless to say...we are checking and will probably have to go to battle down the road when the CC bills arrive.  Other than that...another good trip to NYC.

title: Nice staff and sweet service
text: Was staying there from 30th Nov to 4th of Dec for business. The room though is small, location is quite convenient in the central of the city. The staff are helpful and caring. Always willing to give suggestions of where to visit which makes me feel like home instead of a hotel. I didn't get bothered by the bar in the lobby as I was staying on 7th floor even though there was a party going on. There was some noise from the street but I still managed to sleep well maybe due to the jet lag. Overall it's a highly recommended one to stay and I would choose it next time when I am going.

title: Flatiron Hotel
text:
What a wonderful hotel, with all the amenities that can boast location, location, location!  Two underground parking garages are located on the same block as well as several great restaurants. (We recommend the Texas barbecue joint that had the best wet brisket we've had in the northeast!)

The double queen, corner room we stayed in was more than adequate for our family of four. 

The self opening and closing blinds made the transition from day to night an effortless reality. 

Our two boys especially appreciated the built into the bathroom mirror television screen.  

Room service was the only drawback. Like many hotels, you must order from a separate restaurant that is located just off the lobby and food can be delivered only when the restaurant is open.  

We missed the complimentary continental breakfast as we slept in, but there's a Starbucks located directly across the street which was very convenient. 

 The staff was friendly as well as helpful and the facility was clean and suitable. 

There's no hotel lobby desk but that's okay because the staff is readily available to welcome you as you enter.  Check-in and check-out was efficient and speedy. 

We ran into the owner of the hotel as he was exiting and we were entering the elevator. He was friendly and cordial and immediately asked if everything was to our satisfaction. 

We visit the city often, to visit family and we would certainly stay again at the Flatiron hotel.

title: Great location but charges slapped on at the end
text:
Great hotel but - seriously - charging a $95 'Hotel Service Fee' when I check out ($19 per night) is a sure-fire way to leave a bad taste in the mouth of your guest.

It's also a scam allowing the hotel to advertise cheap online rates, secure the booking, and charge you more as you leave.

title: Ms. Lavie
text: This was an awesome hotel.  The room was one of the largest I've ever stayed in NYC!! The lobby has a great bar lounge with live entertainment.  Downside was the line of young obnoxious party goers standing in line outside and down the street.  Staff super sweet and accommodating.  Will def stay again!! Can't wait!!

title: Thanksgiving
text: Wonderful, wonderful wonderful is all I can say about The FlatIron Hotel. The beds are very comfortable and the rooms are exceptionally clean. The staff at the hotel are most accommodating and friendly. The FlatIron Hotel is centrally located in the Flat Iron district in Manhattan. We have finally found our go to hotel when we visit our family in the city!

title: Con Artists Rude Staff
text:
Myself and my cousin took our first trip to NYC and booked what we thought was a beautiful looking 4 star hotel with access to the rooftop. On arrival the staff were welcoming but asked us for credit card details before we could go to our room. We were apprehensive about this and staff reassured us that no funds would be removed from the account unless there were any breakages during our stay and this would be $100. 

Luckily we had access to our online banking and could see that we were minus £140, we contacted the bank for the merchants details and they confirmed it was the Flatiron hotel. We spoke to the young boys at the reception downstairs who printed out an itemised bill showing a list of charges to our account for a number of different things and different amounts ranging from 0.48 - 19$ they were rude to us when we asked why the card had been charged and fobbed us off saying it would be sorted before we left. Shocking customer service. 

We had to complain multiple times before they would refund the amounts which would then inconvenience us by putting said account into a negative amount of money. They tried to tell us that we had been charged for a complimentary breakfast this in itself does not make sense!! We never ate breakfast at the hotel and didn't even know it was available as the lights to the restaurant area were off the whole stay. 

After being told a day before we were due to check out that our bill had been refunded and the bill currently sat at 0$ we woke up to an envelope slid under our door which was another bill for 19$ again we had to complain while checking out and have it changed to 0$. We feel that the hotel is being fraudulent and taking money from people's accounts in the hope that they won't notice.

No excuse for the way staff spoke to us, rude and very condescending. This hotel does not care about their customers.

Aside from the money issues we asked about access to the rooftop and staff stated it was currently under construction and won't be ready until 2016!! This is false advertising we paid good money to use this feature another money grabbing ploy. Another guest told us that the owner keeps his rooftop for the highest paid guests and private functions if this is the case then don't advertise as something else.

Hotel room ok had everything we needed and nice features spa shower and tv in mirror. Housekeeping terrible didn't clean at all just changed bedsheets, towels and emptied bin. Shower mouldy and lime scale. Minibar all weighted if u lift a product up for more than 20 secs they charge your card despite telling us that the card details they wanted were specifically only for any damages. We never even touched the minibar and were accused of drinking a soda we said they could go and check and they declined, the only other person who was in our room was the housekeeper, how can they prove it was us?! 

Lobby needs updating, restaurant lights off all the time you wouldn't even know it was open. Very small bar downstairs and expensive. No live entertainment or music. 

Check in is nearly non existent done on an iPad infront of lifts no desk to stand at. Staff hiding around the corner out of view of guests. Staff seemed to be inconvenienced by answering our questions. Their warm welcome on day one had turned sour by day two. 

Hotel in good location to everything but horrid atmosphere and rude unhelpful staff not worth the money. 

Honest review of our trip notice we have noted the good and bad.

title: Great Location and overall Great Hotel!
text:
Stayed in this hotel for a weekend break with my family. 
Some very good points to consider and some room for improvement.
Great location, 15 minute walk from Times Square which was appreciated after long days of being a tourist! There were coffee shops, restaurants, bars and super markets within close vicinity which was very convenient.
Hotel staff were very friendly ad helpful.
Hotel lobby was attractive and the bar had a good atmosphere.
Rooms were very basic with dated furniture and the layout was not very attractive, for example the wardrobe was an old stand alone in the middle of the room. It had unnecessary features such as a TV in the bathroom mirror which would have been a great extra touch, however the bathroom was tiny and there was only a shower, so these things should have greater importance than watching tv whilst brushing your teeth. 
We didn't experience any noise from the roads or traffic, however the hotel is on the corner and we were facing the side street so I don't know if this would have been a problem had we been facing the main road. Maybe this is something to consider and request when making a booking.
At the end of our stay we received a bill, $19 per day for 'Service Charge'. I enquired about this and was told it was for the wifi, breakfast and hotel booking charges. On the website we booked through it said 'free wifi', we had booked the room only (no breakfast) and did not have breakfast in the hotel and I did not feel it was appropriate to pay a booking fee to the hotel as we had already paid! When I relayed this to the concierge he promptly removed the charge without question. So I advise that you question this at the end of your stay to not pay anything that you shouldn't!!! I thought this was a bit cheeky as I imagine many people pay this without looking in to it.

In spite of these few negative points, I would definitely recommend this hotel and I would stay here again based primarily on it's location and connections around the city and also for the other shops/restaurants etc in the area.

title: Flatiron Hotel
text:
Good hotel. Brilliantly helpful and friendly staff, nothing was too much trouble. When we stayed (Sept/Oct 2015) all the staff were great and 3 names I remember were Leo, Roberto and Juan, thanks guys.

The position is great for travelling in any direction in Manhattan.

We purchased bus tickets (green bus) from the guys in Times Square, don't be afraid to haggle for a good deal. These were great value for money and included bus tours that gave you your bearings for the whole of Manhattan, do these trips 1st.. The price included 1hr bike hire for Central Park, a boat trip around the Statue of Liberty and an entrance to one of the museums. We also used the bus to get up and down Manhattan when we had had enough walking.

Get off the main roads to find restaurants and bars selling their wares at reasonable prices; they are there.

The 6 days we were there (end of September 2015) the weather was great, 20 to 25 degrees c.

title: Fun quirky hotel
text: Really loved the atmosphere and location. The staff were very nice and helpful. I really enjoyed the music in the lobby. I am not a light sleeper so the noise didn't bother me, but I could definitely see people having issues with the street noise and hearing the lobby music in your room.

title: хорошо
text: Отель в центре города. На первом этаже отеля находиться ресторан. Каждый вечер в ресторане живая музыка, очень хорошее исполнение. Между рестораном и лобби гостиницы установлен огромный аквариум с живыми рыбками, мимо которого по витееватой лестнице можно подняться на балкончик. очень красиво и интересно!

title: Excellent Experience @ The Flatiron Hotel -
text:
Have been a guest at the hotel for 2 weeks. 
Value consistently exceeds price...
This hotel was highly recommended by locals in Manhattan. 
Offer a great complimentary breakfast is the morning and complimentary beverage during check-in. 

.................................................................
I'd like to recognize the outstanding service from Hasan & Angel. 

Ross H Morgan

title: Great location, Outstanding Staff!
text: Stayed a total of 8 nights. The hotel is in a great location for everyone who wants to be centrally located to explore the city. Amazed by the friendliness and professionalism of staff. Special thanks to Hasan, Jonathan and Angel who were extremely helpful.

title: Too noisy, left early
text: There are a lot of positive things to say about this hotel. For one, the staff are very professional, kind and helpful. The location is great. My room was decorated nicely and kept very clean. I didn't mind at all that my room, 707, was tiny and there was little room in the bathroom. It was a nice, cozy room. However, the street noise on 26th at night was the worst I've experienced anywhere. It was so bad that after the third night I left early and took a penalty because I was so tired from lack of sleep I just couldn't think. I've stayed in NYC many times and every hotel I've stayed has had double pane windows and although that doesn't entirely cut all noise (like sirens) it helps tremendously.
