This property would benefit greatly from an investment in double pane windows. Until then, I'll stay elsewhere.

title: Great location - very small rooms!
text: Stayed here for 4 days on a recent work trip to NYC. The hotel is in a great location and reasonably priced. The rooms are ridiculously small! The first room they put me in was 180 sq ft and I felt so claustrophobic that I asked to be moved to a larger room. The corner rooms are slightly bigger. There is absolutely no lobby to speak of, not even a front desk. When you walk in, you are checked in on an iPad and then taken to your room. There is no room service either which is a bummer in my opinion. The beds are on the firm side but pretty comfy and they do offer free wifi and bottled water in the room.  The bathrooms are pretty cool with all marble and Swiss showerheads. There are also tv's in the bathrooms which is a neat feature but not something I really used. I do like the fact that they have regular cable in the rooms with free On Demand. Overall, a decent hotel. Not my first choice but would stay here again due to the proximity to my office.

title: Great location, reasonable value
text:
Stayed for two nights in August 2015. Nice hotel right near the Flatiron building, so great location for exploring the city. Large rooms (at least ours was). Bit noisy from traffic outside but not too bad, could easily sleep with earplugs. Didn't have breakfast in our rate so cannot comment on the food. 

Would have given it four stars except despite being told that there was free wifi, when checking out we were asked to pay $20 for services such as wifi, newspapers (which we were not informed about) and for entrance to the bar!!! We were not informed about this in any of our booking documentation or upon check in. We refused to pay this and it was waived but beware!

title: Great hotel for the price
text: My wife and I were in NY for the weekend (3 nights). If the hotel cost more I would probably rate it a little lower. The hotel seems to be newly renovated. The rooms are tiny, but that's normal for NY boutique hotels. Beds are comfortable, room was very clean. Motorized shades were a nice benefit. Tip: check under your bed for drawer space, there's no dresser in the room. The bathroom, while small, was excellent. New tiles, very clean, amazing shower system. Hotel staff was all quite young compared to regular hotel staff but extremely polite and accommodating. Check-in was done on an iPad while in the elevator so no time lost there. Location is great as you're literally in the center of the city (Central Park down to lower Manhattan, not the whole island).

title: Location is amazing
text: Small rooms as expected in NY. Well kept rooms,with a unique TV feature in the mirror. Friendly owners who engage guests to ensure you feel welcome. Live entertainment on Friday & Saturday which one the 6th floor we didn't even notice.

title: Hotel econômico
text: Hotel pequeno e próximo ao metrô. O entorno não é muito legal mas uma pequena caminhada vc chega ao Eataly ou mesmo à Union Square. Os quartos são corretos, de conforto básico, porém sem frescura. Tive um problema com o recebimento de um pacote e os funcionários foram excepcionalmente prestativos! O bar do hotel é movimentado e tem programação variada. Eles tbém fazem festas fechadas no rooftop eventualmente. É uma boa escolha para budget apertado!!

title: Good location Mediocre staff
text: The location is the best part of this hotel. This Hotel seems like it should be elegant and well kept, there are a lot of details that make it seem shabby. Hotel rooms in NYC are notoriously small, so that is not an issue, it was small. But, the bathroom shower knob fell off, we had to ask to have the room cleaned after returning at 5PM, when we got back later that night our sheets were in a jumble under the main blanket. When we checked out we were told there was an up charge for the news papers in the lobby and for room cleaning. I guess this is their way of compensating for not getting full price for an online purchase, but it was not stated in my receipt. After arguing the point the charge was removed (I think, we will see when my credit card bill comes) but just the way you want to check out and remember a hotel - as argumentative and trying to rip you off for a few extra dollars. Not good customer service.

title: Okay
text:
Four of us stayed a week at the Flatiron Hotel. We chose a Toshi Corner room as we figured with four of us sharing a room, we'd need that little bit of extra room and we'd heard New York hotel rooms are already smaller than average. The room was pretty immaculate - nicely decorated, comfy beds, tv etc, The bathroom was lovely, good pressure in the shower. The tv in the bathroom mirror was a bit random - we didn't use it but fair enough. The view was fantastic. Overall, the accommodation was pretty good value for money.

The free wifi didn't work in our room, only in the corridor and downstairs. 

The staff are mostly friendly but there was definitely a sort of 'disconnect' in terms of answering questions - maybe because we were completely new to New York and didn't know much of what was referred to. How can we give a mobile number to the staff so they can message us when our taxi was booked if it has to be an American number? Obviously we have British numbers, can't you just whack the country code on it, no apparently not (we ended up using Whatsapp, seriously, just to confirm a taxi). 

We didn't try the bar downstairs, but we definitely heard it. Very loud music. We stayed out pretty late ourselves so this wasn't really an issue but it's definitely not a quiet hotel.

The location is pretty good...once we worked out where we were. Two of the staff were incredibly helpful with directions, even explaining to us the subway system. The other staff were not so good and we ended up just figuring out ourselves how to get places. I'm not sure if this is standard in New York but in the UK, you'd pretty much expect a hotel to assist you with directions. Anyway, you can walk to Broadway, Greenwich etc all very easily. Once you get the hang of navigating the streets, the city opens up.

Overall, it was an okay stay. I didn't feel particularly 'comfortable' there but the room was very nice.

title: Small yet Friendly
text: It's the staff that makes this place very good.  They are eager to help. The rooms are small but most are in NYC.  Some of the furnishing were bumped and bruised.  But the beds were comfy. The bathroom is a bit over the top with a TV in the mirror.  This was not a feature that I liked.  The shower had multiple heads both on the wall and in the ceiling.  The location was good.  There is a restaurant in the lobby but we dined elsewhere.  I was very bothered that there was an additional $19 "resort fee."

title: perfect location...but
text: i loved my room. it was simply gorgeous. so much so that i paid extra to keep it until 4pm on the day i was due to check out...but there were a few unexplained things on my credit card after i left and though i emailed the hotel to ask for clarification [nearly a month ago] nobody has ever bothered to reply

title: Amazing customer service
text: First time in NYC can be overwhelming but the staff at the Flatiron calmed any fear we had of the big city. From the throne to the feeling of the laying on a pillow rob king size bed we settled in our room with a great view of the city. The first thing my son did was take a bubble bath in the whirlpool then donning a comfy robe he went right to sleep. The adults slipped down to the club on the first floor for a night cap, where we enjoyed great drinks and a live performance. It was right in the heart of NYC. The staff helped us find the attractions and much more. But we will not forget Benz he went above and beyond to ensure our stay was as wonderful as possible.

title: Escapade
text: Hotel très sympas tous les soirs 1 groupe différent met l ambiance sauf le dimanche le café est gratuit dans les chambres l équipement est pas mal  ainsi que le personnel le plus le manager parle français seul petit reproche les chambres ne sont pas très bien isolées le bruit à l extérieur on entend aussi la musique mais dans l ensemble  l hôtel reste pas mal et bien situé

title: It was fine
text:
The hotel staff gave us a fantastic welcome. Hotel is a bit of a faded gem I think with a lot of electronic gimmicks in the room that tended to frustrate rather than help with a few things not working. We had to change the door key 3 times on consecutive days because we couldn't get in. The rooms don't match the trendy bar area, much more traditional. Bit confused by the resort tax that we were presented with at the end of the stay, you might want to check this, it was an expense I was not expecting, it was for the free WiFi and housekeeping apparently.
In a good spot for the subway, some nice restaurants on 28th Street. Would probably try somewhere different next time.

title: " Quaint and Convenient"
text:
My husband surprised me with a trip to New York and this boutique hotel was perfect. The location in the historic Flatiron district is so convenient to everything! It is not too busy as other areas in NYC and close to great eateries and transportation. The rooms are nicely decorated and very clean. The staff is so friendly and willing to answer any questions. Please note that a bar/restaurant is in the lobby that is NOT affiliated with the hotel. They have entertainment every night and it can get very loud. So request a 3rd floor or higher. Also this hotel is NOT in the historic Flatiron building but minutes away.
You will love this place!

title: Great service. Central location
text: I enjoyed my stay here. The room was very clean and comfortable. The staff were very friendly. In particular Juan really pulled out the stops when I found that I needed to stay and extra night. The bar downstairs is fun and an interesting place to be if you are travelling on your own. I don't like rap so  didn't like all the bands that played but the more bluesy combos were very good indeed. Not many people stay for breakfast which means that they end up cooking for one. This means that the service is a bit slow but the food is piping hot. The hotel has a pseudo Japanese feel so the bar snacks include some good sushi. The two storey marine fishtank in the bar was stunning.

title: Great value for money
text: Great hotel and I say this as a person travelling with small children. Great location in mid town Manhattan and absolutely excellent customer service. My only quibble is agree with others, because of the traffic that the reception area experiences on weekends, they probably need to update their furnishings now. Rooms were clean, pleasant and definitely above average. Would return and recommend to friends and family.

title: Good location, friendly staff
text: Had to find a hotel for one night in NYC due to rebooked flight. Hence I chose this hotel almost by accident. However will definitely come back again. Very good location near Madison Square Park and Flatiron, not far away from Penn Station also. Rooms are clean, very comfortable and offer a many nice features (curtains can be closed via remote control, various shower options, there is even a tv in the bathroom). Staff at front desk (and the hotel in general) was very friendly and helpful (check-in person at night on Sep 7th and also Juan).

title: Ottimo hotel, posizione strategica
text:
Sono stato al Flatiron durante i miei 10 giorni di vacanza in quel di NY. 
Stanze belle e curate (ma chiedete quelle dal terzo piano in su!), personale molto preciso e cordiale ed un ottimo Starbucks ad appena 50 metri. 
La posizione - vicinanza di metro e molti locali e ristoranti - è veramente strategica per chi vuole girarsi in lungo e in largo New York. 
Consigliatissimo!

title: Great Location, great vibes.
text: My experience in the Flatiron has been great, this was my second time here and I'm very happy I chose this hotel, the staff is great, especially Christian and Jonathan who were very helpful in all the check in process. I read the reviews regarding the music of the bar but I stayed on the 5th floor and it didn't bother us at all. The location is also great, beautiful people over there.

title: Location Location Location!
text:
I made the reservation thru hotwire hot deal. I was worried about music at night after read the reviews. The front desk put us on the 8th floor and the sound didn't bother us at all. The front desk are so helpful and always carry a smile on their face. 
The room is very small but I think you just can't complain in downtown. My younger one had fun in the shower (playground he called) because of the massage panel. They also found interesting with the tv on the mirror in the bathroom and electronic curtain. 
This hotel located in minutes from subway or bus stop. We liked to walk two blocks to 28th on Broadway and took trains to places. There are late M bus we found from central park to stop at a block from hotel. It is very convenience and very safe to walk around at night.
The hotels also very close to many restaurants. There is variety of food to choose from. From a $1 pizza restaurant, food trucks to fancy restaurants, you will find those around there. 
We definitely will stay again!!

title: Great place!!
text: I found and paid the room hours before arrive in NY, the experience and the place was good, the personal of the hotel were good as well and the hotel is in a central area near time square, grand central terminal, everything!! Recommend it %100!

title: Oltre le aspettative
text:
camera abbastanza ampia, bagno piccolo ma bello con una rarità negli USA: la doccia!
ottima posizione, personale sempre cortese. L'unico neo è la rumorosità della zona che si fa sentire perchè le finestre non sono insonorizzate, ma se sei ad un piano alto si sente poco. Lo consiglio assolutamente!

title: Excellent Service!!!!!
text: My husband and I recently decided to spend a wknd In the city and decided to stay at the Flatiron. The rooms were nice and the location was great and we even had fun with the band in the lobby, which we didn't expect. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful, especially Juan at the front desk. We'll definitely stay again the next time we decide get away.

title: Flatiron NYC
text: This is my 2nd stay at the Flatiron and it's always a pleasure. It's perfect for my needs.Quick check in  (Thank you to a friendly Juan), comfy bed and the best location (near Madison Square Park and Eataly among other places. I didn't spend much time in the hotel (it's NYC) but the lobby bar seemed fun…Will come again...

title: Excellent help at the front desk!
text: We got in early and tired and were hoping we could check in earlier. Juan at the front desk was able to help us out checking us into a great room on a high floor with a view. We were able to rest up before we took on the city. Thanks Juan!

title: Great service
text: Just had to say that Christian and Angel were so hospitable to my friend and I and our 2 11 year old kids who wanted to see the Empire State building from their penthouse level while we were staying there visiting from Los Angeles. They took us right up and the girls were thrilled to take such an amazing pic. The view is spectacular. Truly, those two were kind and provided such great service and happy faces right when we arrived after a long road trip from Cooperstown. I have stayed at many hotels in NYC, including the Ritz, and I would stay again at Flatiron. Lounge and Bar area very cool next time I come with my husband.

title: Hôtel agréable
text:
Hôtel très bien situé, dans quartier agréable et métro à proximité.
Toute l'équipe est à l'écoute, et se rend disponible.
Chambre et salle de bains confortables (Tv sur miroir sdb), pas énormément de place pour circuler mais suffisant pour le temps qu'on y passe...

title: Komme wieder !
text:
Das Hotel hat eine gute Lage! Die Mitarbeiter sind sehr freundlich und hilfsbereit! Gutes Preisleistungsverhältniss ! Für Kurzaufenthalte ideal, nach Red Eye Flug durfte ich sehr früh das Zimmer beziehen. Keine normalität in New York City.

Thanks!

title: Amazing stay
text:
Very nice Hotel and super friendly staff. Came in from an red-eye flight out of LAX at 6:30 and was able to get a room at 8:30! Love it. This is even more special because we booked via Hoteltonight. The Hotel has a perfect location in Midtown.

I'll definitly will try to book here again.

title: Great Service and location
text:
The staff were extremely helpful  ! Thanks to Oz, Benz,Juan , John and Leo, you made our stay extra special . We booked 4 rooms for  4 families and we got upgraded to two rooms per family ! Wow!  Been at many hotels in the US but this was by far the best experience. First time here , but sure not the  last time .

Great place to stay, my family feels safe !

title: Great boutique hotel
text: This boutique Hotel is lovely and great location!  Comfy bed, clean and great staff. Was new to area but Juan at the desk was so friendly and helpful with restaurant and theatre recommendations.   I will definitely return!

title: Brilliant location
text: We stayed here for 4 nights and loved the location next to Madison Square Park. We were warmly welcomed and upgraded to a corner suite which had great views and was a really big room by New York standards. The room was always cleaned to a great standard and there was a good size bathroom with a TV In the mirror! However, We were disappointed that the roof top bar was only available for private parties and that there was no evening room service. overall, would recommend this hotel for anyone visiting New York.

title: Avoid this one
text: The Flatiron Hotel is NOT in the historic Flatiron Building though their ads are not clear on that. The location in Chelsea is good, a block from Madison Square Park and the staff were great but the hotel was very disappointing. The lobby is given over to a 7 night a week music venue that is tacky beyond belief. Seeing this I requested a quiet room and was given one on the 8th floor. The room was NY small but well equipped. However, I was woken up by noisy guests likely coming from the music downstairs four times from 1:30 to 4:30 AM. Will not go back.

title: Excelente ubicación y servicio
text:
Un hotel muy bien ubicado, cercano a cafeterías, parques, supermercado, estaciones del subway y del icónico Flatiron building. Una zona muy amena para caminar, recomiendo el flea market en sábado y domingo que se pone en la iglesia frente al hotel. 
El bar presenta música variada pero el volumen en el primer nivel es alto. Agradezco a Oz y María el detalle de la botella de cortesía por mi cumpleaños, definitivamente volveré con ustedes.

title: Summer in the city
text: I visit NY often on business and stay at the Flatiron regularly. It's reasonable priced and the location can't be beat. It's central to everything. The staff is friendly and helpful. Juan at the front desk always recommends great restaurant for client dinners.

title: Home Away From Home!
text: From the moment you walk into the Flatiron Hotel, you are greeted and welcomed as if you are family not a guest. While my daughter attended a ballet intensive at ABT, we spent several nights at this fantastic hotel. The Flatiron Hotel rooms are modern but don't lose the older elegance of the building. The ceilings are high and the bathrooms couldn't be better. More important than the room, the staff members at this hotel are AMAZING. I must begin with Kenndra because she is the reason I stayed at this hotel and I will return next time I'm in New York thanks to her and Juan, Leo, Kim and Jonathan. You will not receive better service or kindness anywhere in New York City. I hope to stay with all of you again in the future.

title: Modern rooms and friendly staff
text: I've been to New York a few time and so far this has been the most reasonably priced hotel because is its location and the size of the room(most are small). The staff Christian, Angel, Juan and Oz were amazing!

title: Viaje a NYC
text:
Viaje con mi hermana y mi mama y durante 2 semanas nos alojamos en el Flatiron hotel. Esta muy bien ubicado, a 2 cuadras del subte mas cercano, a 1 cuadra del flatiron hotel y del madison square park (un parque muy lindo para ir a pasear, ver ardillas y comer unas muy buenas hamburguesas en shake shack). La gente del hotel, Oz y Angel son los que mas nos ayudaron pero todos estan siempre disponibles para cualquier duda y recomendacion que uno necesite. Lo unico malo, todas las noches hay shows que empiezan como a las 6 y terminan a las 11 o 12 pm, es muy ruidoso, no se puede ni hablar con la gente del hotel porque no se puede escuchar nada aunque uno este hablando al oido. Pedir una habitacion lo mas arriba posible. Las habitaciones son muy pequeñas y el baño tambien. El check out es a las 11am y si pedis late check out solo te dejan una hora mas, hasta las 12 del mediodia, lo cual no es mucha diferencia. El hotel esta bien, nada fuera de lo comun, no recomiendo ir con hijos pequeños.

En general fue una estadia agradable pero hay que tener en cuenta algunas cosas, como lo de la habitacion y los shows.

title: Amazing Experience!
text: The decor, the staff and the overall atmosphere of this establishment is just astonishing. As soon as I entered my room, I was welcomed with a nice room with two beds and an awesome television. The bathroom was surprising as well. It was very clean and there was another television on the mirror. It is also in a very nice location, which is near various restaurants and Time Square. Overall, it was a pleasure to stay at Flatiron Hotel and I hope to do so once again. Honarable mention to Oz, Jonathan and Benz for being very friendly and helpful. They are the best.

title: Servicio, ubicacion e instalaciones
text: Esta muy bien ubicado cerca al metro, cafeterías y almacenes. El personal es servicial y atento, las habitaciones tranquilas y cómodas. Cuenta con un bar en el primer piso genial con música en vivo (para nada ruidoso). Lo recomiendo sin duda y me volveré alojar allí.

title: Convenient to MTA, nice staff, nice room, nice shower
text: Modern bathroom with 8-head shower, tv in the mirror, 10 or 12-foot room ceiling. Smallish room but not cramped...not unusual for big-city hotel. Very convenient to 28th St. yellow line station, plenty of eating places of all varieties in the vicinity. Very nice decor, super-comfortable bed and pillows. Band in the lobby bar every night. Street noise seemed kind of loud at night leaking in through windows but hey, it's NYC. Very quiet inside...I never saw another guest on my floor even though receptionist said it was sold out.

title: Fun Hotel in a Great Location
text: The Flatiron Hotel is a small boutique hotel located near Eataly, a small park, and many shops and restaurants. The hotel has nightly entertainment (except Sunday) and a lively crowd of all ages. The rooms are small but comfortable and quiet despite the band and singers. If they're around, be sure to say hi to the owner Toshi and his two small dogs.

title: Good week in NYC!
text: Got this hotel for a cheap price and cannot complain for what I paid, location wise it is a 20 minute walk from Times Square but plenty to see and do on the way.  Staff were helpful and friendly.  Rooms a little tired but did the job, bigger than average size for New York!  If you email ahead before the trip and request a free upgrade this might work, we got moved from a room with 1 double bed to a room with 2 double beds after 2 nights, which was good as it saved me and my aunty sharing.

title: Great location, great price, nice cornerroom
text:
Stayed two nights, 16-18 july, on our way home. Flatiron is located in the middle with easy access to subway. and walking distance to great shopping. The staff was the most friendly I´ve met in NYC. Oz, Juan and a girl I didn't get the name of, was truly helpful and gave great information. 

Hook up with better limousine service...there must be nicer driver than the one taking us to JFK. And also change direction in the map you're sending out prior to arrival. It's pointing to Flatiron building in OMAHA

title: View of Empire State
text: Angel and Christian were very helpful in helping guests take advantage of the amazing views of the empire state building during the video show Sat Aug 1. They were both very friendly and helpful. I need 5 more ...

title: Enjoyed our stay!
text:
Stayed at the Flatiron for the first time and we loved it!
Location Location Location!
Due to an early morning flight we(myself and two kids 13 & 12) had to checked in  at 10.30 am , Juan and Leo at the front desk were very accommodating  
Our corner suit  on the 10th floor,was large for New York standards and two double beds,quiet and sunny.
We could even see the Empire State Building from our room!
Bathroom was clean and the kids got a kick  out of the mirrow tv :)

title: Pool art fair
text:
Excellent hôtel 
J'y étais pour une exposition 
Le personnel de l'hôtel très serviable, son emplacement dans Manhattan en font un lieu idéal pour découvrir Manhattan 
Un peu dispendieux chambre un peu petite mais on était plus souvent hors de l'hôtel donc c'était correct. Séjour très agréable.

title: Friendly staff, great location
text: The Flatiron was recommended for a business trip.  I prefer boutique hotels and its location provided easy walking access to everything I needed.  Juan at the front desk was very friendly and helpful, as well as Leo who braved New York traffic on the hottest day of the year to find a cab to take me back to the airport.  Would definitely stay here again.

title: Girls trip to  the Flatiron in New York
text:
The hotel was very accommodating and friendly, the front desk staff were great! 
A young man by the name of Angel made sure that are needs were always his first priority if it was for directions, advice on restaurants to eat at or just needing clean towels. He was friendly and made us welcomed in his City as well as the hotel  
Hotel was in a good location for walking........

title: such a great accomodation
text: This boutique Hotel could not have been better.  Price was very competitive, the bed was the most comfortable hotel bed I have ever slept on, the subway stop is on the corner, the desk help were impeccable.  It just made for a fabulous New York adventure!

title: Ottimo hotel
text:
Ho soggiornato in questo hotel per una settimana e non ho mai avuto problemi! La posizione è ottima, la zona è bella e ci sono un sacco di posti dove mangiare sia a colazione che a cena.
L'hotel è molto carino, nella hall c'è un acquario di due piani che fa molta scena. Il personale alla reception è simpaticissimo e sono sempre disponibili. Ogni sera nel locale dell'hotel c'è musica dal vivo con gruppi diversi, molto bravi!
La camera sempre impeccabile, tutto molto pulito e ordinato. Letti comodi, doccia grandissima, ottimi i prodotti del bagno. Il minibar è caro ma ha molta offerta.
C'è il wi-fi gratuito in tutto l'hotel.
L'unica cosa non ottima è che si sente il rumore della strada di notte, ma siamo a New York!
Consigliatissimo perchè è un ottimo hotel in centro!

title: Perfect Location.
text: We enjoyed our stay at the Flatiron. They have live bands in the lobby nightly. The location is perfect. 5 min walk to Empire and about 10-15 min walk to Times Square. We received great customer service. Christian, Angel and Maria were very helpful through our stay. They were doing renovations but that did not inconvenience us at all.

title: Fantastic NYC Experience
text: Stayed at the Flatiron Hotel for a girls weekend and had a great time. The staff was wonderful and so polite and helpful. It was very clean and the rooms were perfect. Great location for seeing all the sites. Would definitely go back!!

title: A+ Customer service
text: I stayed at the Flatiron Hotel for a fun girls weekend in the city. Of course the location is awesome! In addition the hotel is very nice, I loved the room and had an overall great experience. The room was clean, trendy and cozy. What stood out the most to me about my stay was the hotel staff. They were very hospitable, friendly and helpful. My favorite staff members are Oz, John and Chris. Oz is the supervisor and he is awesome! Chris is very helpful at the front desk and John is an awesome bar tender. All people you certainly want to make friends with during your stay.  I would recommend the Flatiron to all my friends and family !

title: Wonderful visit to NYC!
text: My family and I stayed at the Flatiron from July 17th to July 20th and had a wonderful time. The rooms were clean, well appointed,  and cozy.  Service was excellent.   I especially want to single out Kim and Juan at the front desk and Leo the doorman.  They provided extremely efficient and courteous service and saw to our every need throughout our visit.  I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone visiting NYC!

title: Best Service Yet in NYC
text: We normally stay at Starwood hotels bc of points but since our friends were staying here for a bachlorette weekend we decided to come too, awesome decision. Upon checkin Oz and Chris welcomed us with a smile and great personalities ...and side note Oz was dressed very dapper. Anyways they were so awesome and professional and kind. When we got to our room it was very neat and clean and I loved the updated shower and TV mirrors. Oz called us from the front desk a few minutes after we got to the room to check on us and we told him we very happy...we also had a great view from the 8th floor. Oz had us check out the bar where John made us some awesome Martinis. We made friends at the bar and the bands they had performing were great. Overall though as I mention in my heading, the customer service made the Flatiron amazing, I loved how they payed attention to our needs. The night of the bachlorette party i was not yet staying at the hotel but I observed the hotel was very patient with the girls, even when it got a little loud. Oh and when the performers come there is also a chef making sushi in front of you. Thanks Oz, Chris, and John for making our girls weekend special and fun.

title: Friendly Fabulous Flatiron
text:
Stayed here from 6 - 10 and then 12 - 15 July 2015. The staff is friendly and accommodating - thank you Oz, Kimberly, Leo, Johnathan and Leo for helping to make our stay so comfortable!

The rooms are not large but spacious enough. Lovely large window that lets in a lot of light and the beds are comfortable.

Every night almost there is a live band downstairs which makes the hotel lively and a pleasure to come home to after a day in the city. You can sit, enjoy the tunes and a cocktail!

The hotel's neighbourhood is great with lots of good restaurants and bars. Subway is nearby too.

Overall a very good stay at this hotel.

title: Bon emplacement et bon rapport qualité prix
text: Hotel moderne, idéalement placé pour visiter Manhattan. Chambres lumineuses avec vue sur l'Empire State. Le personnel est super aimable et toujours à votre disposition. Merci notamment à Oz et à Juan pour leur super accueil.

title: Fantastic Hotel in a fantastic City
text: Stayed in this hotel for two nights and had a wonderful time. The room was fab. Large windows to the front looking out onto the street. Remote controlled curtains which were a nice touch. Room had a boutique hotel feel to it. Everything worked perfect and the bed was comfortable. Juan at the desk was extremely helpful with directions for Food and travel to the airport. Highly recommend. One bad point was the band they have playing in the restaurant which is next to the lobby. Very difficult to talk to reception and be heard but couldn't hear them on the 9th floor.

title: Hotel all'altezza delle aspettative!!!
text:
Siamo stati in questo hotel per una settimana..accoglienza ottima,il ragazzo alla reception è stato sempre gentilissimo e pronto a rispondere a ogni richiesta.
Camere molto confortevoli!!e veramente pulite!!!la doccia è degna di nota!!!!
La posizione è ottima per esplorare Manhattan!!!
Ci torneremo sicuramente!!!!

title: Great hotel in ideal NYC location
text:
We chose the Flatiron Hotel based on excellent rates and a wonderful location. We were very happy with our choice! We met 2 other families with children there, and were in the middle of NYC activities. Great restaurants, shopping and near many great sights! We walked a lot! 
The staff was friendly, helpful and responsive. I accidentally left my phone charger in the room and they sent it back to me at their expense. The beds were very comfy, and I'm picky. The bathrooms were wonderful too - super clean with a great shower!
We had originally reserved a larger corner room which had an issue and they gave us two rooms for the price of one. 
The bar downstairs was really fun with live music and great atmosphere. 
I'd definitely stay here again and would highly recommend to couples, families and groups!!

title: grandson's visit
text: Daughter and 8 yr. old grandson visiting from Australia requested a visit to Manhattan.  Flatiron is great location.  Convenient to important sites -Empire State Bldg, Highline, math museum... .Only downer was check-in time -4 pm!!.  And the room wasn't ready.  Finally Christian intervened to switch us to 2 rooms with Queens.  One was extra large for daughter & grandson.  Comp'd us with chardonnay and breakfast vouchers.  All was right again!  Leo was extra attentive taking care of our bags before chec-kin and after check-out.  .

title: Complaint
text: My experience at your hotel was so good. The tv  only stay on one station, when i got in from the show. The next morning , i brought up to the  front desk attendant. He said , he was very sorry and offer me free orange juice. It was big inconvenience for me and my girlfriend

title: Sometimes you need to escape
text:
I live in NYC, but sometimes I need to have an escape.  This hotel has a great location and the staff if very helpful and friendly.  Juan was able to help with what we needed!
Great rooms and great space!

title: Really Great !!
text:
Everything in the hotel was really great !! 
The rooms are nice and Juan was really great in the front desk ! 
That boy is really elegant and polite with clients ! Thanks to him for his kindness !!
I'll return soon ! Thanks !

title: Amazing Costumer Service and services in general.
text: I stayed at the Flatiron hotel for my vacations and it actually was a great experience. They have amazing costumer service, I totally remember it was Juan the name of the guy in the front desk who attended me and my friends during our stay, I will totally recomend this place to all of my friends and in My social media account. He was amazingly friendly and kind. and the hotel is beautiful as well. GREAT JOB !!

title: Loved the Hotel
text:
My husband and I stayed at the Flatiron Hotel in Manhattan over July 4th weekend.  It was a great location with many restaurants to choose from, including Eataly which is only a few blocks away. Starbucks is across the street, Times Square is about a 20 minute walk, and there is a subway station 2 short blocks away.  Wifi is free.  There is a small business center on the 2nd floor with 2 computers and a printer.  I checked in for my flight and printed out my boarding pass (at no charge by the hotel).

We were very impressed with the staff while we were there.  Everyone was so nice, from the doormen, to the people at the front desk, to the people cleaning the rooms.  A special thanks to Leo, Jose, Oz, Juan, and Pedro.  They were so helpful with organizing transportation to and from the airport, suggestions for places to eat, and activities while we were visiting NYC.  It was obvious that the customer comes first.  

Our room was on the 7th floor, so we did not hear music from the band downstairs.  I also didn’t hear complaints about the noise from friends on the 5th floor.  The bands are loud, but really good.  

We would definitely stay at the hotel again.

title: Silber Fuchs NYC
text: Had a great stay at the Flatiron. Was centrally located so could get to all my meetings easily. The staff was super friendly and helpful. Especially Juan at the front desk. He gave me great recommendations for restaurants and clubs during my down time.

title: Great Location and Staff!!
text: Had each of these great people Pedro, Leo, Kim, Maria, Christian and Jonathan. First time here for our family trip and stayed for 2 nights and one day. They all helped us during check in. They were very friendly and helpful. They definitely contributed to a great start to our trip. Overall it's a beautiful hotel, very clean, comfortable bed and wonderful front desk staff. I am really happy we stayed at this place during our trip. If and when, I return I will mostly likely come back to stay here. Thank you!!!!!!!!

title: Excellent séjour !!
text:
Avis trip advisor
Hôtel très bien situé, permettant de parcourir facilement Manhattan à pied, chambre petite mais cosy et confortable pour un couple, excellente literie. Bémol: simple vitrage donc prévoir boules Quiès (mais on ne vient pas New York pour dormir de toute façon !) et faire tourner la clim en journée quand vous n'êtes pas dans la chambre car elle est plutôt bruyante. Salle de sport à un bloc, hyper pratique pour commencer la journée, accueil excellent par le personnel (Thanks Christian, Juan -nice hair-cut !- Jose, et énorme Big Up à Oz: Oz, your french is bettter than average french one ! U Rock ! bref avec une chambre en étage élevé, (et malgré les clients effectivement parfois bruyants dans les couloirs) un séjour tout simplement génial ! Cette ville est formidable et le personnel a été vraiment présent et plus qu'agréable, de nombreux établissements français devraient en prendre de la graine. D'ailleurs les New Yorkais en général sont tous très accueillants! On revient dès que possible !!

title: FUN
text:
Another GREAT stay at the Fab Flatiron.
You couldn't ask for a more central location...
Great neighborhood. Fantastic dining, shopping, people watching-you name it!
This is our 3rd stay here. Best thing are the people who work there! Christian, Jae, Mike, Angel
Thanks so much!

title: Great visit, Great Customer Service
text: I was in town this past weekend for the Del Close Marathon.  I got into town early because of how long you have to wait in lines to go to shows.  Even though check in time was not until 4, Christian worked with the staff to get me into my room early so I could go enjoy the festival.  He was very helpful and courteous.  The rooms there were also in great condition and very clean.  I was also a big fan of the showers.  The location was very convenient and the price was more than reasonable.  Would definitely stay here again.

title: Quirky  Flamboyant  Bijou Hotel in Handy area for exploring Manhatten.
text:
A disappointing start because we arrived jetlagged at 1.30 but were informed that we couldn't access our room until 4.00 pm.  We had to wait in the bar area as we were too tired to go out.  We were helped by the fact that a hiphop party was beginning an hour later in the bar so they then gave us access.  The room was very comfortable and very clean although the net curtains looked ready for a wash and the main curtains to the room would not close.  Fortunately, we were having such a great time in New York, the eatly morning light did not wake us.
The hotel's biggest assett is their friendly staff.  All were really friendly and helpful, specially Chris, Leo and poor Rudy who had to search for our luggage with the wrong ticket(I had given him our arrival ticket rather than our departure)
This hotel is in a great location ( we walked to many tourist attractions from it) the staff are really helpful and we enjoyed our stay there but felt that the bar area wasn't really for us, more for the local residents  We didn't eat there because of the many opportunities to eat in and around the area.

title: Ottima posizione
text: L'hotel ideale per visitare New York. Posizione centralissima, personale cortese, camere pulite. L'albergo non è dotato di ristorante quindi dalla colazione alla cena bisogna organizzarsi fuori, ma non è un problema perché in zona ci sono doversi posti in cui poter mangiare.

title: "Centre of New York"
text:
Completely agree with the most recent reviews.

Hotel rooms good sized with comfortable beds and luxury features including automatic curtains, robes, hydro massage showers and baths.

All staff (I mean all from reception, to concierge to maid/bar/server staff) were friendly, helpful, rooms were expertly cleaned daily.

Some previous reviews had complained about the music being too loud in the "city that doesn't sleep"? We were on the 6th floor and heard occasional taxi horns and sirens, a hazard of NYC below 30 floors. If peace and quiet is important you might wish to visit the countryside or purchase ear defenders.

The nightly music is in fact an added bonus to a NYC stay as with quality bar, music and food, your room is only an elevator ride away.

The location of the hotel is perfect for walks to most attractions others are a short subway or taxi ride.

title: Отель
text: прикольный тусовочный бутик отель в очень милом районе. Рядышком Дом-утюг и Мэдисон Сквер. Персонал приветливый, а вот номера не доставили. Вид из окна, конечно, очень милый (на церковь), но сами окна грязнущие. Комнатка тоже маленькая.

title: You have to stay here, if only to meet Kim at the front desk
text:
My wife and I stayed here for our anniversary.  When we first arrived to drop off our stuff, Kim at the front desk really brightened our day.  She made us feel so welcome. She was excited to see us, and eager to please.  She even sent a complimentary bottle of wine to our room.  I have been to all sorts of hotels, and I have never seen any staff member of any place so warm, friendly, and caring as she treated us.  Juan and the other staff members were also very accommodating.

The rooms are spacious, new, clean, and have every gadget you can imagine.  A great jazz band was playing in the lobby/restaurant as we checked in for the night.  The location is right in the heart of the hustle and bustle of the city.  You really get a feel for being in New York City.

I would heartily recommend this hotel to anyone considering a trip to Manhattan.

title: Fantastic hotel, great sushi, warm staff
text: I travel to NYC about once a month, my NYC-based office is located on 5th Avenue, and it's a short commute to and from. My co-workers and I have had nothing but positive experiences when staying here-- the staff is warm and exceptionally accommodating, especially Benz and Juan, the rooms are spacious given the prime location, and the restaurant has the best sushi I've had in NYC, fantastic music and a wonderful staff. We have been coming here for about two years now, and wouldn't stay anywhere else. We love Antasha, if you stay here visit her in the bar, she's very knowledgeable about local happenings, and wonderful to talk to.

title: Excellent hotel!
text: My partner and I were very impressed with every aspect of this hotel and will definitely be staying here again in the future.  The staff could not have been warmer or more accommodating, with a special shoutout to Christian and Jose.  We were extremely pleased with the size of the room, both the bedroom and the bathroom.  The AC was easy to run.  The Wi-Fi was reliable.  The entire hotel was clean and well maintained.  The neighborhood was perfect.  We hope to be back soon!

title: Great location and good size room
text:
This hotel is aptly names being just a block away from the fabulous flat iron building. Whilst using the same name and having a similar building design, the hotel is much less impressive a structure but if you have a corner room on the top floors the view is pretty good. It also helps to keep the noise of the live music six nights a week from causing a disturbance. 

The room on the top floor was very spacious, comfortable, clean and well kitted out. Two good size double beds and a airy, light feel. The bathroom was fine but the shower disappointing.
The house keeping was excellent and everything well maintained. Staff were friendly and helpful.
We didn't eat or drink in the hotel so can't comment on that but well located for lots of places for food, drinks and shops.

title: Great hotel, great staff
text: Where do I begin. What a great vibrant hotel. Stayed there for two weeks. Staff very friendly and helpful. Nothing was too much trouble. Will definitely be staying here again. Special thanks to Jose and Christian for looking after us during our stay.

title: Another great stay!
text: We found this hotel through TripAdvisor a few years ago and loved it. When we were coming back to NYC we didn't hesitate to reserve a room here and were equally pleased. Eataly is just a few blocks south of here and Madison Square Park (Shake Shack) is just across the street from that. The staff here are very helpful especially Pedro who helped us get a cab when it seemed impossible. We'll be back!

title: Presque parfait
text: L'hôtel est très bien situé, moderne et agréable. Le personnel est très accueillant et serviable. Pedro et Jose en particulier étaient toujours prêts à rendre service (par exemple, Pedro a réparé tout de suite la sonnette de ma chambre qui n'arrêtait pas de sonner sans raison). L'eau fraîche à la réception est bienvenue, et si la musique en soirée est très forte dans le hall, je n'entendais rien de ma chambre au 4e étage. La chambre était calme, bien qu'en face de l'ascenseur, grande, propre et pratique. Le lit était extrêmement confortable, un des meilleurs que j'ai eus à NY (la literie des Affinia étant la meilleure d'après mon expérience). Le wifi gratuit dans la chambre marchait très bien. Le rideau occultant automatique couvre bien la baie vitrée. On entend un peu la rue, mais à part au moment du ramassage des ordures, ce n'est pas gênant. La télé dans la sdb est un gadget dont je ne me suis pas servie (mais il y a HBO, sinon). Autre chose que j'ai apprécié, par rapport à d'autres hôtels : le service de ménage ne vient pas frapper tôt le matin pour vous mettre dehors. Je pouvais traîner autant que je voulais. Un bémol tout de même : si vous avez l'habitude de vous faire livrer des colis à l'hôtel, sachez que les frais de garde sont de dix dollars par jour et par colis jusqu'à votre arrivée ! C'est exorbitant, mais je n'avais pas pensé à demander avant. C'est mon seul reproche, le reste était impeccable. Et ça ne concerne pas la valise, que la réception a gardée gratuitement le dernier jour. Je n'ai pas testé le restaurant ou les autres services. Beaucoup de bars dans la rue, et pas mal de restaus dans Chelsea et les environs.

title: 13 night visit !
text:
What a find this hotel was ! Awesome ! I cannot say how highly I rate this hotel. I've travelled to New York on numerous occasions, usually staying at the likes of the New Yorker - this hotel is WAY better! From the moment you walk in, the staff are amazing! Kim and Christian at the front desk are a credit to the hotel. Friendly, professional, helpful ... the list goes on! As for Jose, this guy works the hardest I've seen, will help you with ANYTHING ! We were there for my wife's birthday and our Wedding Anniversary - everyone at this hotel made sure we had everything we needed and made our stay just the best !

Rooms vety clean, the maids do a great job! We love the music downstairs also, it made coming back to the hotel even better.

Amazing stay ! Will definiately be back!

title: Great customer service
text:
I've stayed at the Flatiron a number of times. The service is exemplary, especially the front desk where they're always accommodating and friendly.

The only thing keeping this from a five-star review is the beds (too hard for my liking) and the noise from the street.

title: Flatiron Hotel not just Flat
text: Great boutique hotel  Great service from the hotel reception  tremendous entertainment in the hotel lobby  cool neighborhood great place to stay.  I found this place on hotwire and Kimberly at the front desk provided  tremendous service, eating me during my stay.

title: Going the extra mile
text: Christian at the front desk upgraded us from a small room with 1 queen bed to 2 queens in a large spacious room AND a beautiful view of the Empire State Building! Overall amazing room-amazing customer service. Perfect end to our trip to NYC.

title: Lobby was not just dirty, but filthy
text: I booked 3 room for 4 nights each . My family was coming to new york for my nieces graduation from law school. We DID NOT stay after taking one look at the lobby. all the couches were filthy, stained beyond belief, one had chewing gum stuck to it, others were full of crumbs. there were electrical cords running across lobby floor unmarked. I tripped over one of the cords.They are lucky i did not break anything.  I am shocked at the good reviews here. We left and had to fight with them to get our money back. In addition to this hotel being advertised as a 4 star , it is not even a 1 star, and you have to hassle like crazy to get your refund. Do yourself a favor .Don't stay here if you are expecting anything more than a 1 star, and even that , would disappoint you. the staff was courteous and the location good.!

title: Excellent customer service
text: i stayed 6 nights, every morning when I leave for work staff smiled and greet., and when I returned, it is the same.  The room was cleaned, plus my messy clothes were folded neatly.  I did not speak with Pedro besides greeting, but he knew my name.  I was very impressed his professional attitude.  Pedro, Kim and everybody works this hotel, I really enjoyed because of you..

title: Great stay in flatiron
text: Excellent stay in Flatiron! Everything was perfect and as planned. The hotel was extremely well located and close to everything! The rooms were extremely clean with perfect bedding and kind staff. A special thanks to Juan who pointed us in the right direction every time during our first trip to NYC. We hope to come back very soon!

title: Great customer service
text: I was only there for one night, for a quick work trip. The doorman Pedro was so helpful and kind to me. The day I checked out it was raining all day, and he went above and beyond to help me get a car and make it to the airport on time! And he made sure I stayed dry! The rooms were great as well, clean, and very comfortable! I didn't want to get out of the amazing bed! I would recommend this hotel, and I hope to be able to stay there again soon!

title: Central hotel, clean with extremely friendly and helpful staff
text: After arriving fairly late in the evening we were greeted by a very helpful member of staff, who took care of our luggage and we quickly and easily checked in.  The rooms were of a good size, very clean with some gadgets like a TV in the bathroom mirror, remote control curtains, and electronic doorbell.  The rooms were cleaned to a high standard everyday and every member of staff was exceptionally helpful.  There was live music on six out seven evenings, but this did not effect us in anyway as we were situated on the six floor and the music on the ground floor.  This is however the city that never sleeps so there is noise from the road...ie. beeping of car horns, dustbin collections etc.. but I think you would find that everywhere in Manhattan.  The only thing that let it down, but in no way spoiled our stay at the Flatiron Hotel was that it really needs some decorating and replacement furniture in the public rooms.  I ate breakfast at the hotel on only one occasion and it was superb, best Eggs Benedict I tasted on our trip.  I would recommend this hotel for good service, friendly staff and it's excellent location.  A three star hotel, but with four star service.

title: Very nice, clean and friendly
text:
We stayed at this hotel for 6 nights, we had a friendly warm welcome and we were very happy with our two doubled bedded room for us and our daughter.
Having read previous reviews we contacted the hotel in advance to ask for a room on a higher level as there seemed to be a problem with the noise from the bands that regularly play in the bar down stairs. We were allocated a room on the 8th floor which was great. As you come down the elevator you can here the music getting louder....it is very loud!! There is no way anyone should be expected to stay in the floors above the bands! Not unless you are happy to party every night with them.

That leads me onto the biggest problem that we had during our stay. On our first night we decided to pop in to see the band. They really are very good (although loud!) so with the people we were with we bought 9 drinks including 1 coke. When the bill came we couldn't believe the price... $186!!!!! We asked to speak to the manager who just said there was nothing that he could do, to be fair he gave my husband and I a free drink ( when I mentioned trip advisor) he told us that is the price throughout Manhattan. We felt totally ripped off! We met a lot of local people during our stay and we were told this was not an acceptable price. So my advice would be to go somewhere else for a drink and then go to reception and listen to the bands! We got a cab, then a ferry to statten Island had lunch, a couple of drinks each and it still didn't cost as much as those drinks!!!!
But the hotel is lovely....such a shame.

 The flatiron is in a good position for local bars and restaurants. But remember you are in a city and there is noise from outside at night sometimes, sirens etc but I think you would get that anywhere in newyork.
We had a lovely time and wish to thank the very helpful staff for making us feel so welcome.

title: Great boutique hotel in the heart of Manhattan
text:
We stayed 6 nights and from the beginning of our stay till the end, service was excellent. Juan and Jose from the front desk provided recommendations and assistance whenever we required. 

The location is excellent located between Broadway and 26th, just 10 blocks north of Union Square and 10 blocks south of Macy's and the shopping district. Also, with the NQR subway two blocks away, it was convenient to get to the other parts of Manhattan.

Overall, the stay was pleasant and good value for money. Would recommend it for the young, trendy explorer!

title: Great Find
text: I had to stay in NY for business and the hotel my office booked me at didn't have air conditioning.  I called the Flatiron Hotel and Maria and Oz were absolutely amazing in helping me a room that was affordable and just amazing!

title: Great staff, great vibe, great location, & clean
text:
I can't say enough about how great the Flatiron Hotel staff was to us during our week stay here. Kim, Leo, and Juan were great as well as gave us great suggestions for places to eat and drink close by. The hotel was very clean and super accomodating when we needed more towels, etc. 

The hotel shares the Lobby with Toshi's Living Room which features live music six nights a week. Every single band was fantastic! A couple reviews have talked about the cocktails being overpriced, we didn't find this to be the case, especially in the City. All drinks were on par with pricing, but beware because they do pack a punch! 

The Flatiron Hotel is in a GREAT location. It is walking distance up to Midtown and over to the Chelsea District. There are two subway stations two-three blocks away which makes getting somewhere extremely easy. The hotel is surrounded by so many great bars and restaurants, if you did not want to venture out. Next time we come to NYC, we will be staying here again! Overall great place.

title: National Sales Manager
text: Had each of these great people....Pedro,Juan,Jose,Maria,and Andres help me with one thing or another during my stay so far. First time here for business and staying for a week. Going to book here before I leave for my next 4 visits coming up in the next 4 months! Very enjoyable place to stay. Great music and top notch real, genuine service.

title: Great staff and atmosphere
text: Super clean Hotel with awesome staff that go out of their way to make sure you are comfortable and enjoying your time in the City. Jose, Kim and Juan are always first to greet you and provide Intel on what is going on around town. The owner is a huge music fan so there is live local artists showcased 6 nights a week in the lobby. Already planning on booking my stay here for next year due to annual business that brings me to New York.

title: Una posibilidad maravillosamente inesperada!
text:
Cada tanto vamos a New York. En general nos quedamos por Mid Town, o en el Upper Side. Este año decidimos quedarnos en esta parte de NY, donde está la movida de la noche. Lleno de lugarcitos para tomar algo, para cenar íntimo, para caminar por lindas calles.
Es una locación especial,  que repetiríamos seguramente la próxima vez que vayamos.
Pero lo que te hace cálida una estadía es la calidad de atención que recibís, y en eso realmente fue especial. Juan, en la recepción, con una buena onda increíble, Osvaldo con buen criterio para tomar las decisiones que hacen felices a los huéspedes. El resto del personal, también excelente. El trato es amable, cordial y personalizado.
Fue mi cumpleaños en el medio, tuvieron el detalle de convidarnos con champagne, de acordarse desde la mañana.
Como digo siempre, los detalles hacen a la cosa, y en este hotel estuvieron llenos de detalles con nosotros.
Como por ejemplo, extendernos la hora de salida del check out, y varios mas que sumando hacen la gran experiencia.
Lo mejor, es que es un lugar joven, con onda, con música alucinante (6 horas por día, 6 días a a semana).
Terminar el día tomando una copa en este lugar con la mejor onda y buen ambiente, sin duda es un tip para tomar en cuenta.

title: Great Location
text: My stay was great!  The hotel is centrally located and is very nice.  We pretty much walked everywhere or took a quick cab ride.  The hotel was also very clean and pretty roomy.  It was me and three of my girlfriends and we had more than enough room.  I wish they had more mirrors though :).  Overall, the staff was great. Other than a lady working at midnight on May 9th/10th.  She was extremely rude and not helpful.  We asked for towels, they were out.  We asked for shower caps, she said they did not provide such things.  We asked her to call us a cab, she said they didn't provide those services.  The next day the rest of the staff, especially Pedro, went and grabbed us everything we asked for within minutes.   Super friendly and polite!  I would totally stay here again.

title: Excelente ubicación y buenas instalaciones
text: Estuve en septiembre de 2014 x segunda vez en el hotel. La ubicación es excelente, cerca de todo, a pasos del metro y lleno de lugares para recorrer. Está a una cuadra del edificio Flatiron emblema. Las habitaciones son super pequeñas pero de muy buen gusto, al igual que el baño, tiene todo lo necesario. Los únicos dos puntos de crítica son que la cama es de tamaño bien pequeño para dos personas, debe ser la cama doble pequeña (creo que menos de 1,40 m) y que no hay frigobar.  El bar de la terraza ofrece unas vistas increíbles con el Empire State de fondo, vale la pena tomarse un trago allí.  La gente de recepción y bell boys super amables.

title: Tres agréable et parfaitement situé !
text:
Cela fait la deuxième fois que nous séjournons au Flatiron hôtel, et nous sommes toujours aussi satisfait de la prestation. Acceuil très sympathique et le personnel toujours à l'écoute et réactif ! J'en profite pour remercier tout particulièrement Leo, Oz, Vicq et le reste de l'équipe.
Les chambres sont propre, lumineuse. Demandez de préfèrence une chambre dans les derniers étages. L'hotel est bien animée car des soirées sont organisées tous les soires. C'est vraiment sympa !
Pour ce qui est de son emplacement, il est idéal pour se balader à pied. Vous êtes en plein coeur de Manhattan.

title: Great Place to Stay and Wonderful Staff!
text: I had the opportunity to travel to NYC on business for a few days. I previously lived in the Manhattan for seven years, but didn't know the hotel. It was a great choice; the room was a great size, which is unusual for NYC. The staff was outstanding! Juan, at the front desk, helped me out by printing a presentation I needed later in the day. Leo, the doorman, made a great recommendation for lunch and securely watched by luggage while I was away. Patrons should be advised the hotel hosts live music in the evenings and the music can be heard slightly from the fourth floor, but they stop at 11:00 pm and the music was not annoying. I would stay here again, and highly recommend the Flatiron Hotel if you're going to stay in Manhattan.

title: Ancient ruins where a hotel used to exist
text: I used to come here while traveling through the city and the location is really quite good... However, each time is worse than the last. Broken curtains in rooms, maids entering without knocking (multiple times) while I was trying to make love, assumingly so they could get their fill of mental images of me behaving like a over-sized jack rabbit. Nothing turns me on like getting walked in on by random maids. When I complained (see screenshot of the email), I was offered 20% off their daily rates on my "next stay." So I should spend more money with you before you rectify the problems? Totally unreal. I won't stay here again on principal, but also because you can clearly tell that the building owners are cheapskates that refuse to renovate the property. Lobby is reminiscent of 1970s if you are into that sort of thing. Wood paneling inside elevators and around bed frames is disgusting and chipped. No preventive maintenance takes place at the Flatiron Hotel.

title: Great hotel in the heart of NYC
text: My friend and I stayed in the double room during our stay in April 2015. The room was clean & extremely spacious.  The beds were large & very comfortable too. The shower, while small, came with some surprises, which we weren't expecting such as being able to watch TV whilst in the loo & mini- water jets. There is a happening live band scene in the bar in the lobby which can be rather loud but as we were in the 8th floor, we didn't hear a thing. The staff were also extremely helpful & friendly. Special shout-out to Kim & Steven from the front desk. And also to Christian who was quick to respond to my email when I had thought I left something behind in the hotel after I checked- out. All in all, great hotel in a great location at a great price.

title: good and helpful front desk attention
text: Weeks before our arrival, Juan De La Torre, the front desk personnel, was extremely helpful with our requirements. We had trouble booking the hotel through a travel agency website and Juan made possible a solution. Also, he spoke with his manager in order to give us a free upgrade so we could minimize the inconvenience with the booking, even though the problem wasn't theirs. We didn't even asked for it but he just offered to do it. Additionally, he helped us with our luggage storage during our days away from the City and he made possible an special price for us (03 day storage). Sincerely, we recommend you to stay at the Flatiron because it has a great location, good bedrooms, and try to look for Juan to guarantee a great attention.

title: excellent rapport qualité prix
text:
Très bel hôtel , très bien situé dans New York. 
Pratique pour toutes les visites à effectuer dans le centre . 
Un staff de jeunes employés très sympathiques et dynamiques .
Merci à Oz, Kim, Steven , Leo.

title: In the Heart of it All
text:
Weeks before my arrival the gentlemen at the Flatiron have been beyond helpful in my preparation of my stay. Christian was patient and understanding in all of the phone calls he received from me when I was having boxes shipped to the hotel prior to my arrival. My colleague and I arrived early to the hotel and without hesitation they took our luggage to store it until our rooms were available; so we could go explore the city without having to lug or luggage with us. When we returned back to the hotel Andre checked us in with Christian and they both gave us great recommendations on where to spend our evenings here in the city. Being two business women from South Florida these gentlemen definitely have southern hospitality, which in return has made us feel welcome with a sense of security staying here. I'm very happy that we decided to stay at The Flatiron. 

Our bellman, Steven was very sweet and gave us more recommendations on where to go for breakfast. When I had gotten to my room I realized I had forgotten one of the pamphlets Andre and Christian gave to me on the counter and Steven went back down to retrieve it for me. Everyone here is so kind and respectful; it's a great first impression of New York for me.   

As for the suite, it's all very posh and has a television in the bathroom mirror. The entire ambiance of the room is relaxing, the bed is perfect for a great night of slumber after a long day of hard work. I have a lovely view of a church and exquisite architecture of a building across the street. You really can't go wrong in staying here at The Flatiron. This is going to be my home away from home whenever I am in the city of New York.

title: Location,Service,Fun - Simply Perfect
text: the location is ideal near everything, the rooms clean, everything including the wifi works perfectly. the service is really one of the best I've experienced ever and I've gone to a lot of places because of my work but STEVE, LEO and JUAN at the concierge/front desk were just exceptional going above and beyond every single need one could have. Toshi Lobby bar is so awesome! the service of all the bartenders, and the FOOD! (need to try the sushi, trust me). so many venues to eat outside also walking distance, but if you're looking for a really fun, cool, awesome place to stay while you visit the Big Apple, don't think twice, they'll take care of you like you're family. TOSHI the owner makes sure of that, you see him there all the time and that's not something you see often at hotels.

title: Noise and unresponsive manager
text: DO NOT STAY HERE!!  Very loud music every night that reverberates through all rooms.  First person I ran into when entering hotel to check in said "good luck sleeping".  And that was the way it was.  If you want to party, ok place.  If you want a nice hotel that is relaxing then DO NOT book this hotel.  Completely unresponsive management also.

title: Great hotel find in NYC
text:
Flatiron offered nice standard rooms at a great price in NYC.  I needed a hotel to stay in while i painted my apartment.  The rooms are nice and clean. 

What really makes this hotel a standout is it's friendly and accommodating staff, including Maria, Steven and Juan.  Very charming and funny crew.  They really put the hospitality in hospitality which is so nice when you are away from home. I feel like I made some new friends and I will definitely recommend this hotel.

title: Would love to stay at this place again
text: Thanks Juan for your great hospitality. My boyfriend and I truly  enjoyed our stay over  this weekend and thanks for a great room selection. The beds at this hotel are the best I have ever slept in at any hotel.  We can't stop talking about how the bed was so comfy. Did I mention we had a hot tub in our room?!?! we are looking forward to returning  soon.

title: Weekend Away in NYC
text:
Stayed here for a weekend away for my bday in NYC. This room was to serve 2 purposes. 1) weekend away with the fiancé 2) party night out with a group of friends. Fri - Sat was for purpose 1 and that gets 3 stars. Sat - Sun for purpose 2, and that gets 5 stars - average it out and I rated it 4 stars. 

Check in
Easy and painless. I booked with Expedia with no issues. They asked for my name, DL and CC. My card was charged 100.01 dollars for incidentals - that was okay. 

Parking 
49 dollars a night. Find street parking on 25th street. Get there on Friday by 6pm to get a spot and you're good for the whole weekend!

The Room 508
King size room. Typical NYC style boutique hotel room. Small. Drawers and safe were both under the bed. A bit dated, with some cracks in the wood of the doors and crown molding. The bathroom had a window, didn't open it tho lol. The windows in the bathroom and in the bedroom are openable. Not much space to walk around in which is typical. Bathroom had a TV in the mirror, which was kind of annoying to me. Shower was a bit complicated with it's fancy knobs and settings - or maybe I'm a tad impatient. NOTE , ladies there is a full length mirror, but it's kind of like those cheap target full length mirrors - so you know. 

Friday Night 
My fiancé and I walked around the area. It was a beautiful spring evening in the flat iron district. We got back to the hotel to try and get some rest but could NOT sleep! It was so loud with lots of drunks yelling, horns on the street .. I only partially cared bc I knew id be one of those drinks the next day. The AC is also really loud and strong, so if you sleep light it'll def wake you up. 

Saturday Morning / Evening
This is when the location made all the difference! Starbucks is on the corner, as well as Num Pang. What was most important was that Pranna was walking distance away.. And went there for my bday brunch. After Pranna we walked back to the hotel, then over to 230 Fifth, also walking distance. I'm not sure if we walked to Slate after that, bc by then I was a drunk mess, but I'm 90 percent sure we walked there. 

Saturday Night
I was drunk and happy and slept like a baby!

Check out
Quick and painless. Also, be sure to stay away from the "glove box" in your room or you will be charged! Lol

title: Great hotel in a great location!
text:
I had a wonderful experience at the Flatiron Hotel.  I was arriving on an early flight and emailed ahead to see if I could check in early.  I also requested a higher floor.  When I arrived at 12 noon - my room was ready and it was on the 10th floor.  Oz and Leo at the front desk were very nice!
The room was very nice.  It was clean and a decent size for NY.  The shower was awesome!  I loved the body jets.
The location of this hotel is wonderful!

title: NYC for the weekend
text: Great hotel, great service, there is a special mention to Kimberly at the front desk, who was very helpful. i would recommend this hotel. very vibrant every evening with music and great people and not far from touristy NYC

title: Great stay!!
text: Awsome stay at the Flatiron Hotel steven helped us a bunch of times from getting us ice to saving us money on parking and he went out of his way, juan also checked us in very quickly, definitely will stay here again!!

title: Comfort in a great location
text: People are quickly discovering that the Flatiorn/NoMad area of New York is one of the most pleasant and ideally central ares in Manhattan and the the Flatiron hotel sits right in the heart of it all. Only steps away from Madison Square Park and at least 50 good restaurants within five minutes walk. The hotel itself is comfortable and reasonably priced by NY standards, clean, well run and an always delightful staff. Noise from the bar at night can be a bit of an issue as the lobby bar is a quite a scene most nights. Trash trucks are the worst menace at 04:30 am but that's a NY issue.

title: Great experience, staff, hotel and location
text:
Two friends and I met up in NYC.  We had a tough time looking for a place to stay and luckily came across this hotel. We got it for a pretty good deal for our one room with two beds.  It was a cute little eclectic feel to the hotel.  The rooms were a reasonable size, clean and comfy overall.  You don't really come visit NYC to stay in your room so it was perfect for what we needed.  They do have stuff going on in the lobby (live band/music) at night when we stayed which was pretty cool but you can't hear it from your room, (at least from ours on the fifth floor) so no worries.  

The staff was incredibly awesome and accommodating.   We arrived into the city around 6AM and were able to drop off our bags.  Our room was put as a priority to be cleaned as soon as the previous guest checked out.  They took our number and would call us as soon as the room was available to us.  Oz and Leo both helped us during check in.  Both were very friendly and helpful.  They definitely contributed to a great start to our trip.   

I haven’t been to NYC often but considering the many, many, many places we went to, the hotel seemed to be in a good location.  Its somewhat situated in the middle of everything and the subway isn’t too far away.  

Overall I am really happy we stayed at this place during our trip.  If and when, I return I will mostly likely come back to stay here.

title: nyc baby! pretty nice hotel
text: we stay at the flatiron hotel one night, its nice hotel pretty big for nyc, Juan check me in and he was so helpfull and fun. Amazing home base for our NYC travels and great location . the rooms were incredibility high tech and confortable. Definite Recommendation. the fishtank its amazing

title: great experience-super friendly @ check in with Maria!
text: I stayed at the flatiron for a night I booked for a full size bed and was upgraded at no cost for a queen size room.  The girl Maria was super friendly upon checking in mentioning a couple of really cool amneties such as a TV in the bathroom mirror and mini bar in the room! I was happy with the room size and with how comfy the beds were. To top it off I wanted to extend my stay and Maria was able to match it at the rate I saw the room online for. Would definitely be coming back!

title: Fun, affordable, friendly little hotel in the big city!
text:
I was  little nervous about this hotel because it was so affordable, but I was pleasantly surprised once I arrived. The hotel is housed in a great old building with high ceilings and crown molding, but the decor is modern and playful. The  staff was very friendly and I was able to check in at 11:00 am. Our room was great,very clean and well appointed.  We loved the tv in the bathroom mirror, the remote control drapes, and the electronic do not disturb sign.  The beds and pillows were very comfortable. 

The hotel has a terrific location. It's quite close to Eataly, shopping,great restaurants.  We walked to Times Square to see a play.  When we got back "toshi's" was hopping, and the band was great.

Only issue was, that we could still hear the music when we got back to our room at midnight. Next time I'm bringing ear plugs, but otherwise we had a fantastic time.

title: Fantastic hotel and great value
text: I recently stayed at the Flatiron through booking it on lastminute.com after staying at another hotel but not enjoying my stay. I ended up with a spacious room with everything I could hope for in a fantastic location for a really good price. The bed was comfortable, the shower amazing and the room clean and warm. I was surprised by the high level of entertainment in the downstairs bar as the local acts were varied and fun. I went to Eately twice whilst there as it was down the road.  The staff were helpful and friendly, particularly Benz and Leo and Oz. Highly recommended

title: Great Hotel
text:
Stayed at the Flatiron Hotel on a recent visit. Boy, was I surprised!!!
Not what I expected at all.
Great decor and very spacious considering your in New York City. Staff was wonderful and location was great.  Easy access to the subway or take to the streets as we New Yorkers do and walk. Enjoyed the nightly entertainment. 
Would definitely return.

title: Flatiron Hotel is my place to stay when in NYC!
text: My daughter and I loved, loved, loved the Flatiron Hotel!  Beautiful, clean, modern, hip but not pretentious, comfortable, fun and the best employees ever!  I have never felt so taken care of than at the Flatiron, which by the way, is such an amazingly convenient location!  We were able to easily walk from there to see Beautiful on Broadway, to Eataly, to the Chelsea Market and more!  Thanks to the hotel staff's great directions and recommendation from Adrian, we saw the Basquiat exhibition at the Brooklyn Museum, which we loved.  The staff is super! - Adrian was a super sweetie and so helpful, Andreas was a dear and made us the best coffee, Christian and Crystal made check in (and out) a breeze and were helpful with perfect directions to places we wanted to go.  After big days and nights on the town, it was so nice to come back to our clean, comfortable room - that is after enjoying awesome live music - another great amenity of the Flatiron Hotel!  We were close enough to everything, but enough away where we weren't disturbed by street sounds.  I highly recommend this place and will definitely stay there again!  My only fear is that it won't be a best kept secret for long!

title: Very nice hotel great value
text:
Staff was so friendly and helpful thanks Oz,Kendra and Randy
Wonderful room so much brighter than other hotels. Great shower
Great bed
Close to Eately and plenty. Of other restaurants and museums
Will definitely go back
Ellen and Barry

title: Bien situé à bon prix.
text:
J'ai logé au Flatiron en mars 2015.  Ma chambre était petite mais propre.  Excellent service client.
Très bien situé !!
Point faible, l'isolation de la chambre n'est pas super bonne.   En temps froid, la chambre passe du frais au surchauffé rapidement.

title: Chic Rooms, Great Location
text: The Flatiron Hotel adjacent to Madison Square Park offers easy access to Chelsea, Gramercy, Greenwich Village, and the N and R subway lines. Rooms are tasteful, and spacious for the price; with free internet, desks, ample storage, and nice amenities such as bathrobes and body jet showers. The staff was very friendly, professional, and helpful. I stayed on a Sunday, but on other nights there's live entertainment in the lobby bar. Frilly plastic lamps in the lobby and hallways are a curious choice, but they don't detract from the overall pleasantness. I will certainly return.

title: A Good NYC Hotel
text: We spent one night here last weekend (March 14, 2015) with my daughter and three of her friends for her 16th birthday celebration in NYC.  The staff is very helpful and friendly - thank you to OZ and Christen for their help.  The rooms are nicely appointed and the bed was very comfortable.  My only critique is the bathroom is very small and can not really fit two people trying to get ready for the evening.  The shower however, with its multiple shower heads was amazing - the best shower ever as I remarked to my wife...  The bands playing in the lobby bar were good and it was a fun atmosphere, but they can be heard from the lower (4th floor) rooms that are directly overhead.  So if this will bother you, ask for a room on a higher floor.  Overall a good experience for a hip, friendly and moderately priced NYC hotel...

title: Great location
text: This was our first time in NYC, therefore we wanted a central hotel. This hotel was in a great location, if we were to go again I think we would stay nearer Greenwich village. The hotel was a bit tired, the size of the room was expected for a city. Staff were very friendly. The only noise we heard was the builders from the redevelopment opposite the hotel. All in all a good hotel if you are sightseeing and out  and about all day. Wasn't really a place you would want to relax in...

title: Loved it...small, modern-classical, great staff
text:
