This is a classy but small hotel...there are about 9 rooms on each floor. My room was small - as are most NY hotels I've stayed at, but very charming and has tall ceilings (perhaps 11').

The king bed was very comfortable...slept through the night with no issue.

The bathroom modern and the shower excellent, but the room itself is very tight. Towels smelt bleached.

There are a number of automated conveniences for the curtains, lights, TV and other. There is actually a TV in the bathroom mirror- although I never used it.

The hotel looks a bit worn but has an old Italian feel about it. There is a night club on ground level- so, very busy and loud on the ground floor, but it is done very well (classy). More of an upscale nightclub.

Loved the staff...very pleasant and helpful.

The location is not immediately convenient to the metro, but everything is within a few block walking radius including markets and coffee (recommend The Birch). enjoy!

title: Best location in Flatiron District
text: The hotel is very good when thinking to stay on business. It's well localized just in front of Madison Pq so you can go anywhere very easy by taxi or metro. It also has nice rooms with the basic that a hotel must have. As a plus, their bathrooms have LCD Tvs inside the Mirror, so it is fun. Toshi's Bar is also a nice place where you can find good food with good fun.

title: Lovely
text:
I stayed in the Flatiron Hotel in the first week of January...What can I say, the Hotel looks really nice and buzzing all around, the girl at the reception was really friendly and comfortable and she was always with a nice smile. The room was big me and my friend we had 2 massive bed and plenty of space all around. Comfortable mattress, electric curtain and dim lights just to name few things. Oh and a TV in the mirror of the toilet, just too cool! The shower was simply amazing with different water source, I was late every morning due to really long showers, I just couldn't get out! Music downstairs at night time and the hypnotic aquarium makes the perfect atmosphere for the guests. Amazing location, you step out and you feel blended in the rhythm of the city! Also an amazing italian cafeteria 2 min walking distance for excellent espresso and croissant.
I will definitely come back.

title: servicios
text: El hotel, es muy lindo pero el servicio de limpieza deja mucho que desear, estuvimos alojadas 8 noches de las cuales 3 de ellas no nos hicieron la habitación, la tercera vez tuvimos que llamar a conserjería para que la hicieran, no nos cambiaban la ropa de cama la verdad pésimo, ahora los chicos de la recepción en particular Osvaldo Leo, impecable, atento y muy cordial, nos informo sobre los lugares para salir a comer y toda la información del metro y como debíamos hacer ya que era la primera ves que visitábamos esa ciudad, Lo único que tenemos para resaltar del hotel es Osvaldo Leo.

title: Great Hotel with very professional and helpful employees...
text:
I had friends coming into town and booked them at a Hotel in the Flatiron area. Unfortunately the place was not able to accommodate my guests, which meant that I had to find a comparable Hotel in the area on a Saturday night. Not an easy task, as you can imagine. I called the Flatiron Hotel and a gentleman by the name of Oz at the Front Desk helped me accommodate my friends.

He was very friendly, understanding and was even able to get me a good rate for my last minute endeavor. Thanks to Oz, my guests were taken care of and had a wonderful time in New York.

I can highly recommend the Flatiron Hotel!!!!

title: ottima posizione
text: Posizione ottima, a 10 min a piedi dall'Empire State Building e a 20 min a piedi da Time Square. Staff disponibile. Tuttavia la struttura non è il massimo soprattutto in rapporto alla categoria (4*) e presenta qualche carenza. Inoltre hanno provato ad addebitarmi 40 $ di Minibar assolutamente ingiustificati. Sono stati stornati dalla fattura all'atto del checkout, ma leggendo anche altre recensioni mi spiace notare che non sono il primo a cui capita una cosa del genere.

title: Bad
text: We stayed in Flatiron hotel over Christmas . Very disappointed with the room, the carpet was so filthy looked like payment outside. Also very noisy, did not sleep for 4 nights. Bathroom did not have a bath and was super small. Staff was friendly, good location, but overall very disappointing. Never been to a hotel with such dirty carpet, would not go back... Did not deserve 4 stars

title: The staff was extremely helpful and hospitable!!
text: My mother and I stayed at the flat iron on Christmas , we came to visit my sister who lives in New York. The entire experience was great!!! The doorman Angelo was extremely helpful, friendly, and welcoming!! He invited us down for a glass of wine and was very engaging . He introduced us to other hotel guests and we had an enjoyable evening with him and the other guests. He even gave great recommendations for dinner and other nearby attractions. He went above and beyond his job duties. Christian at the front desk was also friendly and quite helpful! Great hotel and staff will be back!!

title: scammed... beware
text:
I reserved a room for a not-completely-bargain rate on an online website.  I checked in and the desk clerk said to one of the bellhops, apropos of nothing, 'He's on the third floor'.  The bellhop didn't offer to take my bags and I knew I was a marked man. 

Sure enough, the floor of the third floor is the ceiling of the hotel bar, where a live band was performing until 1:00 AM.  Clerk couldn't move me.  Clerk couldn't adjust the bill.  Told me to talk to the online reservation service.  Called the service, and the service said the clerk wouldn't take the call.  Took my phone directly to the clerk (w/ the service on the line) and the clerk now says he must talk to his manager.  By email.  Right.  

Checked out w/o spending the night.  Obviously this routine, or some variation, is practiced every night at the Flatiron Hotel.  How do I know?  I asked.   

It is a pleasant hotel, and I'm sure if you aren't a Mark, and put in one of the 3rd floor rooms you will probably have a fine stay.  

Unfortunately this situation is what gives NYC tourism and hotels a bad name.

title: Perfect stay
text: We were in town on business for 3 days and we stayed at the Flatiron for the last night in NYC.  It was convenient and accessible. The rooms were spotless and hi tech, but were a tad on the small side , but considering it is NYC, quite understandable.  The hotel has it's own special personality, with bands playing nightly downstairs, and an avant garde aquarium greeting you as you walk in the door.  What I was most impressed with was the service. A Hotel Staffer by the name of Angelo Bonilla distinguished himself above and beyond. The final touch was a complimentary box of cigars left in this travelers room, based on a random conversation with Mr. Bonilla , that showed me they know how to treat their customers. I'm in NYC...I'm paying regardless of where I'm staying...For this traveler, it was the exemplary service displayed by Mr. Bonilla that has me recommending The Flatiron to anyone staying in the area.

title: Overpriced, minimal amenities and a stopped up drain!
text: Just back from an annual Girls Trip and spent two nights here. We were NOT impressed. We were billed over $500 per night-a total of$1400 with valet parking and taxes-for a shoddy hotel lacking any real amenities. CRAZY!! My friend swore this was not the rate she booked but did not have paperwork evidence. The people at the front desk provided no help whatsoever when we inquired (after we picked ourselves up off the floor from reading the express checkout bill!)Highway robbery for a glorified hostel...There was no place to sit in the cramped lobby. There was no doorman or assistance with cabs. The old elevators were slow and small resulting in lots of time standing and waiting for one. The "lounge" on the ground floor adjacent to lobby was closed for a private party on Saturday (when we wanted to have a drink) and at other times never open and big signs warned us not to step in (despite the fact that the only seats were in there). Worst of all, the tub drain didn't work, so when you showered the water was backed up above your ankles-ick! This place felt like a 2 star motel at best. For the kind of money we paid we could've been at a real 5 star hotel. We left feeling like we were robbed.

title: Fun stay, Thoughtful and Helpful Staff
text: Rooms are larger than most NYC hotel rooms!  They are clean and designed with a modern flair.  Enjoyed the electric curtains and the three options for the shower (although I did have to contact the front desk to figure out how to turn it on).  We stayed one night to celebrate my nieces birthday, it is close to great night clubs and bars, like Bounce Sports Bar.  Eataly is not too far, which is an awesome Italian market with an awesome restaurant set inside.  Front desk checked me in quickly and knowing we were there to celebrate a birthday was asked to have a late check out for the next day.  AND they sent up a bottle of wine as a gift.  My ONLY gripe is the extremely thin walls.  You can hear every conversation from the hallway or the adjoining room.  We were far enough away from the clubs in the hotel and came back late enough where any loud music wouldn't affect our sleep, aside from a woman in the next room who began singing at 5 AM, completely off key.  I would definitely come back should I need to be in this part of town for another event.

title: Modest, friendly and great location
text: Although rooms are not large (but fine by NYC standards), mine was spotlessly clean, the high floor (6) meant I wasn't bothered by street noise or by the loud music on the ground floor.  The location is great, close to Union Square, Eataly, City Bakery and a Starbucks across the street.  My kudos to the young, friendly staff, eager to help.  Benz, the manager, made sure I had a quiet room, and the night manager, Chris, went out on the street at 6 a.m. to find me a cab to JFK.  The staff make all the difference.

title: Well Located Boutique Hotel with Great Entertainment
text: We recently stayed at the Flatiron Hotel near Eataly and Madison Square Park. This was our second visit this year and we enjoyed both the hotel and the nightly entertainment (two bands except on Sunday). Toshi, the hotel owner and host, ensured that we had good seats and access to the lively dance floor. Although the rooms can be small, we found our room to be very comfortable and quiet. The proximity to Eataly and other dining and shopping venues makes this a perfect location. This will be a regular stop for us when we travel to NYC.

title: Great Hotel
text: Great hotel at a great price.  Awesome shower and excellent location.  Oz was very helpful and enthicastic when checking us out of the hotel. It made me sad to leave this amazing space. Would recommend this hotel for a weekend get away.  Also live music nightly

title: Good location but too noisey
text: This was our first visit to New York and the Flatiron Hotel. The room was nice and clean, staff was friendly and helpful. We stayed a total of 3 nights, the first two nights were not too bad, We were on the sixth floor and could hear the music from the club until 2:00 AM each night. The third night (Saturday) was terrible. The club was over flowing with about a 100 people on the street in front of the hotel after 11:00. They evidently could not get in the club so they stayed outside on the street talking loudly, yelling, fighting and blocking traffic so cabs and cars could not get through the street so the cars honked until 3:00 Am when police showed up to dispense the crowd. Earlier a fire truck came to get people off a over crowded stuck elevator. An ambulance came about 2:00 AM to pick up someone with a broken shoulder. We will never stay at the Flatiron again. All guests should be advised that a live band plays until 2:00 AM each night and to not expect to get to sleep until after 2:00 as the rooms are not sound proof.

title: Great Hotel In NYC
text:
I have stayed at the flatiron hotel twice for work and I think it is a great hotel, but there are a few Pros and Cons. Overall it is a great place for a quick work trip!  

1) PRO/CON Live band plays every night- although this is a fun thing to enjoy, if your room is not on floor 4 or higher this could keep you up.
2) CON-The windows are thin- I was woken up every morning at 5am by street cleaning and construction. I was on the 8th floor. My co-workers experienced the same thing.
3) PRO/CON- the rooms are nice and clean, but small
4) PRO- Location is awesome!! Lots of shops and my office was only a few blocks so that was a plus for me
5) PRO-Friendly staff- I can't say enough about how awesome everyone at this hotel is.

title: Great location and friendly staff
text: My team of 4 stayed for 7 nights this October and had a great experience at the Flatiron Hotel. The location is unbeatable and the rooms are comfortable. We enjoyed the live music at Toshi's Living Room.

title: Club Flatiron
text:
This was our second stay at the hotel. Our first, three years ago, was extremely enjoyable.  Overall the rooms are nicely appointed and the staff is friendly. Plus, we love the location.  Our recent stay will more than likely be our last. The hotel turns into a club at night from 5PM until 2AM.  It may have always done this but our first stay wasn't over a Sat night.   At the surface this isn't necessarily a problem except their lobby/lounge is too small for this. So you have to wade through a sea of hoochies having wardrobe malfunctions to get to the front door, then through the lobby and then wait for the elevator in the middle of all the action at 9PM. Our room was on the third floor so you can hear the music until the very end.  If you don't mind this, great hotel.  We're just looking for a different kind of luxury on our trips to NYC. 

They advertise "live music every night" but that description is misleading. I've been to plenty of live music and plenty of clubs. I know the difference. So I'm docking the rating because we felt mislead by the hotel description.

title: Excellent service!
text:
I spend 1 week at Flatiron hotel. The best thing is the service, when I first arrived Osvaldo in the the reception was very helpful and professional.  Ben also was very supportive. They are all friendly, professional and make you feel like home.
Just a tip: they organize big parties every night, I asked to had a room where I could not be disturbe becouse of the noise and the straight away arranged a room in the 8th floor!
Whenever I come back to NYC, Flatiron will indeed be my hotel, and of course I recommend it anyone.

title: Un hotel magnífico
text:
El hotel tiene una ubicación perfecta, justo en la esquina con Brodway y entre la Quinta Y la Sexta Avenidas. El personal que nos ha atendido ha sido excelente de principio a fin, en especial el joven Osvaldo y el Sr. Leo en la recepción (frontdesk), quienes nos han ayudado a resolver todas las incidencias y dudas. Las habitaciones son muy acogedoras y amplias, con camas muy cómodas y baños impecables. 

Volvería sin dudarlo.

title: Excellent all around
text: My room had huge windows. I loved coming into the music filled lobby and the gym a block away was great 24 hr fitness...eatally around the corner. What a cool neighborhood....i will be back. Terrell room 701

title: Nice and modern
text:
The price wasn't bad. A couple of blocks to a subway, Flatiron building two minutes walk away. The decor is nice, the staff were all good. The room was small but very nicely decorated with some nice touches. The curtains were electric, the shower had multiple jets and the bathroom mirror had a built in tv screen.
There is live music in the lounge most nights. Noise could be a problem, better being high up.
I would stay again

title: Fair
text: was surprised by how small the room was whe I first entered. Made me think of some Paris hotels I have stayed in in the past. However, it was impeccably clean. The bathroom had this very fancy shower with multiple jets (hand held, overhead rainfall, and body jets). However, the experience was significantly reduced by low pressure Nd temperature variations. The toiletries were fair in quality. Lovely bathrobe.  For my entire stay, the cable tv was missing multiple basic stations (NBC, HBO) with spotty reception quality.  The bed was hard(which was ok) but the pillows were just as hard!  Nice to have the automated black out curtains. As for noise, one must remember that this is the city and you have to make do with a certain level of noise, but the lobby entertainment was a bit too loud.  Overall ok. Good location.

title: Noise a big issue
text:
We had looked at many hotels in New York and selected the Flatiron partially on price and location.  We had seen the poor comments, mainly about the noise but took the advice of other reviewers and asked for a room on a higher floor which we got. We were there for 5 nights.
The rooms were quite good and not as small as in some in New York.  There were drawers under the bed and one contained the room safe. The bathroom was very small but the shower was good and the towels fluffy. The bed was firm but very comfortable. One day our room wasn't serviced until after 5 pm which was pretty poor.

The main issue is the noise.  There were three instances.
1.	During the night we could clearly and constantly hear street noise, with sirens, constant car horns and even people.  We slept with ear plugs in but still managed to hear the noise. I can’t understand why any hotel in a city doesn’t have doesn’t have double glazing. 
2.	There is very loud live music every night in bar the foyer. To be fair in our rooms we didn’t hear any noise from the bar on the first floor, but the music was so loud it made it difficult to talk with the hotel reception staff.  While going the through the foyer one morning there was a very distressed woman complaining to the staff about the noise from the bar during the night.  It obviously helps being on a higher floor.
3.	The air-conditioning was also noisy and came on and off. This didn’t help our already sleep deprived group.
Would I stay there again? No.

title: Nice stay in NYC
text: We recently stayed at the Flatiron Hotel for 10 nights and it was a really enjoyable stay. Rooms are a nice size (for NY) and the gym facilities are great (you're provided gym passed to a gym on the next block). Staff is super friendly and helpful. Location is perfect! Would definitely stay here again.

title: Terrible Experience
text:
I was in NYC for business and this was potentially the worst hotel for business travel in the city.  They have a live band that plays in the lobby and my room, on the third floor was directly above it.  When I returned to my room at 10PM the band was going strong, it sounded like they were in my room with me.

They said the band plays until about 11:30 every night.  They asked me if they should send a manager up, but I told them no, I can't work and I can't sleep with that noise, so there is nothing that a manager could do.  They asked if I wanted a complimentary bottle of wine, and I said no. About 20 minutes later a girl came to the door (had to get dressed to talk to her.) She offered no solution but again offered a bottle of wine.  Still NO.  Then about 20 minutes later I have to get dressed again for another knock on the door.  A guy is standing there with a bottle of wine.  OK, 3 no's so far and you're REALLY annoying me.

They has so few rooms that they can't move you, nobody bothered to tell me when I checked in.  Since I checked in around late afternoon there should have been plenty of choice.  Clearly this was not the first time they have had this problem as they have live bands EVERY night.

They were able to move me on the next night, but they really should be careful about those rooms, especially with business travelers. 

While the location was fine for my meeting, I was so tired when I woke up in the morning that I would have preferred to stay out in Queens and take the subway in because I could have gotten a much better night of sleep.

title: Hotel visit ruined by noise at their restaurant
text: I booked this room for a work trip so I could have a good night's sleep the night before a very important certification test. The room comfortable and I was greeted with a free glass of wine by friendly staff when I checked in that Friday night. It was a perfect location for where I needed to be for work the next day. I was assigned a room on the 3rd floor directly above the lobby and restaurant. Unfortunately, due to extremely loud live music playing in the hotel's restaurant I was unable to sleep until 2am! Reasoning that it was a Friday night, I let it go until 12am. I called the front desk twice at 12:30 with no one answering. By 1:30 in the morning, I called again and someone finally picked up and stated the music would be ending in 15 minutes. At that point, he just offered to document my complaint to managment and a brief apology. He did not offer to move me to another room and at that point I wasn't going to insist since he said it would end in 15 mintues. The music continued for another 30 minutes. It was so loud that I could feel the vibrations of the music through my bed despite wearing ear plugs and running a white noise app from my smartphone. The next morning I asked to speak to a manager and was told the manager was not in yet. I expressed my distress that I was now extremely sleep-deprived for an important work exam. He said management would call me, that perhaps I could be compensated for my inconvenience, but he couldn't make promises of what they could do for me. I expressed I would've preferred a good night's rest, it's not about the money (especially since work was paying for the visit). A day passed and no call from the hotel. I received an automated email from them asking how my stay was and stating who to contact to express any concerns. I called and left a message for this person on Sunday. She returned my phone call the next day and provided 20% off of my bill, the room really should have been completely comped. I expressed disappointment that I was not told that this music would be heard in my room (I cannot imagine this is the first complaint they've had), I was not offered a choice to move rooms, no one answering the phone at 12:30 at the front desk, and the very slow follow-up to my complaint. She was apologetic, but provided limited explantation on how this was allowed to happen. If anyone books here, be sure to ask for a high floor room or ask the front desk if the live music they play will interfere with your night's sleep. The hotel should provide a disclaimer to anyone booking a room on a lower floor.

title: Great location!
text: Our room on the 8th floor was cozy and clean, and the decor was great. The colors, curtains, high ceilings, and bed/furnishings added up to a great looking place. There isn't a lot of storage so if you are staying several days, you may want to plan on just a few hangers in an armoire. Perhaps other rooms have more storage. You cannot use the fridge in the room for your own stuff - it is intended as mini bar. The shower was phenomenal - it was a little tricky to figure out but was really cool with a big waterfall above the head and jets all over. There is a 'bottle service/VIP lounge' type of nightclub off the lobby and in the penthouse - returning to the hotel at 1:00 AM on a Saturday was quite the scene as the suited club hosts/bouncers had temporarily lost control of the crowd of club goers. It's a loud place on weekends - bring earplugs if you're sensitive to that. The front desk people who checked us in/out were new and were being trained, and they were very polite.

title: Good location and friendly staff
text:
I enjoyed staying at this small friendly hotel near Madison Square.   The limited number of bedrooms mean that there is a more personal feel.  The rooms have some cool gadgets such as electric curtains and a tv in mirror in bathroom if you are into that!    We had a corner room with two double beds in.  One of the largest rooms I have had in Manhattan although there wasn't much of a view.   It is on a relatively quiet street so we slept well enough and found temperature control good.

The staff were very helpful.  Anglophile manager Benz was so funny and Angelo on the door was very helpful and always recognised us when we came in.  Oz on reception was also helpful.

We did have to wait for our room on check in but Benz kindly gave us a late check out in compensation which was very helpful as not having our flight till the evening.

The only downside is the relatively noisy bar on the ground floor.  Great if you enjoy live music with different acts every night but it did permeate through the building somewhat.  We were on the third floor but directly above bar and we could hear it, although it didn't stop me sleeping.  In some ways it was nice to come back to a hotel where something was going on but perhaps an earlier finish might help guests.

Great location, only few blocks to subway and easy to walk down to Union Square with some nice shopping nearby.  We found it easy to get around from here and was much quieter than some other areas of town.

All in all a good experience and a memorable one too thanks to friendly staff.

title: Not exactly what we had in mind.
text: The first thing I noticed when we arrived was that there was a wedding celebration happening in the restaurant and the penthouse bar. So, the food I had pick out from the website menu was not going to happen and either was that drink in the penthouse. Our room was very small with no dresser to unpack into. Instead there were drawers along the bottom of the bed; so to unpack, you had to crawl all over the dirty carpet. The chair that goes with the desk doesn't fit under it and the shower leaked all over the floor. Cleaning was overlooked and we only received new towels. No, we won't be back.

title: 50/50..May or may not like this hotel
text:
I don't think I have ever read so many confusing reviews about a property...I was very worried about my booking this hotel...but since I had pre-paid..I felt I had no choice but to keep the reservation...so this is my experience...luckily I got a 7th floor room...great shower..robes as nice as a Ritz-Carlton..carpet in good condition..TV was also fine..beds comfortable..rooms cleaned daily...but, if you get a lower floor, you will not get to sleep before midnight and even on higher floor you will probably hear garbage trucks. The hotel can't guarantee you a high floor. If I was on a low floor..I would have been miserable...The Penthouse is also booked constantly, so if you think you will sit up there and have a drink..probably not...this hotel is interested in booking parties/events
and guests will hear Noise..several nice things about the Flatiron..but I would not stay there again.

title: Some good, some cavaets
text:
Beautiful hotel
Good location
Nice room, in fact not as tiny as some Manhattan hotel rooms
Attentive staff

However...
My #1 issue with this hotel is, the clunky in-room WiFi is probably the worst I have ever experienced
My 2nd issue is, there are LOUD private parties in the lobby bar nearly every night
(additionally, they promote the Toshi Lounge and the Toshi Penthouse, but you can almost never go there, b/c they're always booked with private parties)

I would stay there again in a pinch, but but would likely try some others in the neighborhood for better WiFi

title: Hotel for the very young
text:
As others have said ,the hotel is in quite a good position on 26 th with a dozen decent restuarants nearby and the hotel has a band playing loudly in what , I suppose was once a dining room and bar ,and is now a bar for the twenty year olds with some snack type food . There is a bar for the public on the roof also .As others have said the reception staff are very good .. 
There is no guest lounge, no business centre , no guest bar and there is no breakfast provided .. So the hotel is basically 9 floors of self contained bedrooms and two floors of loud entertainment and nothing else.
The bedrooms in the corners are spacious, with comfortable beds but with an airconditioning system that is as noisy as a helicoptor taking off .ear plugs are essential.  Housekeeping is an erratic service .. the bathrooms are clean , There is no ice on any level..you must call for that .
It seems to me that the management has decided to be a bit of an entertainment centre and a bit of a hotel . I prefer to have more of a hotel

title: All you need in NYC and at great price!
text: Great location comfy bed and nice sheets.good sized room very nicely decorated.  Roof top gorgeous and downstairs bar/ live music made for perfect NYC setting. Staff very helpful and friendly. Request higher room for best quiet.excellent value

title: Bring some earplugs
text: This hotel is really noisy, they seem to be more interested in parties every night on the ground floor and on the 10th floor penthouse. Combine that with single glazed windows, it makes for a very noisy night. One thing I would say is that the rooms are comfortable and the staff very friendly but that just doesn't make up for the noise.

title: Bad start better finish.
text:
Due to problems with booking agency Booking.com we found ourselves in a one(i) bed unit.
This was a result of this company stuffing up. Night one consisted of some sheets and some 
pillows and one of us sleeping on the floor. The clerk who booked us in made very little attempt
to accomodate our needs. On the morning of day two a new staff member a delightful helpful
young lady corrected the situation by moving us into a different room away from the nightclub
noise where we remained for the next 8 nights/
I wish I had her name so you could compliment her on her service but are unable to supply same.
After paying 3k for the room I would not recommend to my friends.

title: Best Vacation I've Had in a Long Time
text: The Flatiron Hotel was just awesome! Right in the middle of everything and close to several subway entrances, the location was just perfect for a NYC first-timer trying to figure out where everything is! The staff were VERY obliging and VERY friendly! Leo and Alex are the best doormen I've ever encountered; always helping my mom with anything she needed and recommended great places to shop and eat! And Benz at the front desk was also as obliging, outgoing, and just a great guy overall. The place can get a bit noisy at night (there is a lounge area with live music every night, but hey, this is the city that never sleeps, right?) Anyway, great staff, great rooms (very modern and always clean!), and a great location. Next time I'm in NYC, I am DEFINITELY staying at the Flatiron!

title: Love this place. Not just a place to lay your head
text: What makes a hotel different, at the end of the day a bed is a bed so what really matters?  That's not to say there is anything wrong here.  My room is a good size, there are facilities and more including the TV in the bathroom.  But hey this hotel makes me not want to stay in my room. Downstairs there is live music and the bar is buzzing, they've welcomed me in with a glass of wine and everyone is happy. The staff are really friendly and are making an effort without being intrusive and I can step out the door and find all I want to see and do. I like to move around hotels and try different places, but I'm coming back here next time I'm in New York because I've found something that I'm not sure anyone else is doing and I wanna stay for one more song.

title: Very noisy + poor service
text:
Flatiron hotel is in a great location, out of the busy midtown area. But they have live bands Mon-Sat. We stayed on 4th  floor and you could hear and feel the noise of the band to early morning hours. Even the very noisy air con didn't cover the band noise. Also housekeeping was just plain slack with daily items not replaced. 
It does have a great roof top area, but it was always booked for private functions.

title: Great Hotel that goes above and beyond
text: I stayed at this hotel during the busy time of the US Open and Fashion week. From the moment I walked in, I was greeted by Kendra the front desk girl, who right away made me feel at home, and helped me with everything I needed. This hotel is great, the rooms are extremely comfortable, and the location is really a hip spot with their nightly bands, and amazing rooftop patio. For those who also want to exercise, there is a nice 24 hour fitness literally 2 minutes away that they have a relationship with, that you can work out there. Can't wait to come back!

title: Great location in NYC
text: I love this hotel. Small but very hip. The location is great and easy walking to anywhere. Although the rooms are small they have a lot of electronic gadgets that set it apart. Push buttons to open and close draperies and even a TV built into the bathroom mirror. Totally cool. A little on the pricey side but worth the money

title: A lovely hotel but a disappointing start
text: My friend booked to stay in this hotel via a website based in New York as she is living there. I met her in the city and we went to check in, only to find it was a double room even when the confirmation clearly stated a twin and requested a high floor. We were on floor 3, the first with bedrooms on following the bar and mezzanine. We requested a town only to be told it would be a charge. We looked at our first room, a very small double that apparently was for two people and then looked at the twin which had two beds exactly the same size of the previous room. Clearly this left us confused, the first room was apparently fit for two people but so was the twin with two of the sane sized beds? In this theory, this too could have slept four!!!! Very disappointed my friend went to complain and me very tired from two flights and long transfer stayed in the room. After several conversations we had to choice but up pay a further $137 dollars on top of what we had paid in advance. We were staying for four nights and no way could have shared the tiny double, even if I were in a couple that bed would be tiny. Our stay following this was lovely and the staff and facilities were great however the stay was affected by this event. Even more so when on the last day I was looking for a check out time and read on trip advisor that this had happened to another girl and the staff had been very accommodating and had moved their rooms twice for a twin room without charge. This left a very sour taste in our mouths. Not exactly fair treatment of guests.

title: Amazing Hotel
text: I loved staying at the Flatiron hotel. The staff there were incredibly friendly and accommodating. Our first room had a small bed, so they allowed us to move rooms twice throughout the week so we could get separate beds (I was there with a friend). Each time they moved our luggage for us and when we returned at the end of the day everything was perfect and ready for us -- no hassle! The location of this hotel could not be more perfect. It is a 10 minute walk from Penn Station/Madison Square Gardens, about 13 minute walk to Times Square, 20 minute walk to Central Park, one block from each subway line, and surrounded by restaurants. There is live music every night in the lobby restaurant and the Empire State Building is in view from the penthouse patio/bar. I will definitely stay here again!

title: Great Location
text:
We stayed at the Flat Iron for 5 nights from the 21 July 2014. After reading reviews about the bands that play, I requested a higher floor. Oswaldo was excellent in communicating via email and advised he would move the earth and sea, to ensure we had a higher floor. On checking in we got to meet Oz, and as he promised he gave us a higher floor. We received a room on the 6th floor. 

Rooms are really nice and modern with electronic blinds,  I am assuming they were recently redone. They are small, but that is what we would expect in New York.. Only issue I had with the room was the sound of the air-conditioning fan. It was hot when we were there so we had to have it on. In more mild months this may not be an issue or for those less sensitive to airconditioning noise.

Location is excellent if you want to be in the middle of a lot of places. You have an sensational view of the Empire State if you want to go out on the balcony of the Penthouse for a drink. Great photo opportunity.

I have to say, when I booked this hotel, I assumed it was in the famous Flatiron Buidling. It is not, it is two streets away. It is in the Flatiron district.

The only negative was on the last night (Friday Night) the band was playing and we were trying to arrange transport to the airport at 4.00.am.  We just couldn't hear the reception staff properly. It was too loud due to the music.  We actually went down to reception three times to discuss the arrangements this was frustrating, 

If I was one to be out all night in new york and avoid the bands I would give this hotel a very good review. I think I may joust be getting older.

A big rap also for Oz, he was excellent in arranging the booking and giving us some tips.

title: Great location - Central to Everything
text: This hotel was in a fantastic location, walking distance to almost everything. The staff were very helpful and friendly, and didn't hesitate to accommodate any of our requests. The rooms were small (which is standard in New York) but comfortable and modern, the rooms were kept very clean, however we did have mould in the shower this would be due to no circulation in the bathroom. For those who are gym goers, the gym is not located in the hotel but a  block down the street. Overall we were very pleased with the hotel and its staff. We arrived at midnight on a sunday and there was live music in the bar down stairs, so if you like live music there is some at your doorstep 6 out of 7 nights a week. All in all it is a beautiful district to be in!!

title: ABSOLUTELY FABULOUS
text: My daughter and I stayed 3 nights, in August and we hated to check out! We love love loved everything about Flatiron! The room was beautiful and comfortable with lots of nice modern touches. The whole place is attractive with a fun vibe. The staff are all friendly and accommodating and the club downstairs hosts live music 6 days a week. We just had so much fun and loved everything about it! I couldn't say a bad word if I had to. We will definitely be back!

title: Best hotel in NY
text: Toshi (the owner) provided the best service around town! Him and his staff were so helpful and accommodating. The hotel itself was located in a great spot for sightseeing and nightlife. The rooms were a great size and the bathrooms were our favorite. They were all granite and there were TVs in the mirrors. I would definitely recommend this hotel and will be staying again on our next trip!

title: Great property!
text:
I only stayed for 1 night and did not really take advantage of any of the hotel's services otherwise I could have rated it higher.  My check in experience was very pleasant.  I believe her name was Kendra.  She allowed me to park my car in front of the hotel while I unloaded my bags on a bell cart.  She watched my bags as I went to find parking.  Central parking has a deal with the Flatiron to give a reduced rate.  They also have valet parking but it is about $63 per day.  My rate for 1 night with the discount was about $43.  

I was impressed with the cleanliness of the property.  The elevator on my way up to my room and my room was suprisingly very clean and well appointed.  For the new traveler to NYC, don't expect a huge hotel room unless your last name is West and your wife's name is Kim.  It was a very cute and functional space to lay my head.  Loved the automatic drapes!

The lobby bar had a singer the evening I stayed.  She was an amazing singer!  

I wish I could write more about the hotel but I did not give them an opportunity for me to taste their food or experience their customer service because I had plans that evening.  I do highly recommend this property.  Great value for the money!

title: A Chic Boutique Hotel
text: We booked the Flatiron because of the price and location. We flew in for only a night to see a show on Broadway. The Flatiron is the perfect location to be able to walk to everything! The hotel itself has a beautiful lobby and friendly staff. The rooms are chic, and fun. We will definitely stay again on our next trip!

title: Excellent Lounge
text: I had the pleasure of staying in this very unique hotel.  Only compliant was that my tv reception was poor but otherwise a fantastic property at a very good price.  The lounge area has bands every night which are amazing!  Staff is very friendly and helpful.  I would highly recommend this property to anyone traveling to New York City.

title: It's all about the customer service
text:
I don't know about anyone else but if customer service is great then I'm happy to overlook more minor detractions! 
So the carpet in the room was a little shabby and the wifi didn't work for the first day, but to be honest they are minor drawbacks in an otherwise very positive experience. The staff here were so friendly and helpful, Ben, Kenndra and Devin to name but a few. They totally made our stay and couldn't do enough for us. The location is superb as well. Pretty much central Manhattan.
Overall we were very happy with our hotel choice and it started our big trip in a perfect way. Thanks guys.

title: Hospitality and Service Abounds!
text: My daughter and I stayed at this hotel last month.  It is a beautiful boutique and personable hotel centally located and within walking distance of everything.  The rooms are a good size and they have great live entertainment.  The main attraction definitely the staff!  They simply cannot do enough to make your stay enjoyable and comfortable.  Kendra at the front desk has the most approachable and beautiful personality.  Christine, Leo and Benz to name a few more of the staff are equally as warm and helpful.  Flatiron Hotel you definitely have the best staff I have ever encountered in the hospitality industry.  Look forward to staying with you next year!

title: Perfect Vacations!
text:
Excelent location and price quality rate, huge size if you compare with the New York medium, the bathroom very comfortable and modern (this has a TV inside the mirror!!! and lights), the same with the bed. But the most important was the excelent and helpful staff, wow this guy Benz Adriano is awesome! he did everything possible reply us needs and everybody who stayed in the front desk, like Kndra and the other girl too, of course Angel with very goods indications and Osvaldo quickly and right to reply emails and resolve any problem for this way, LEO of course very friendly and helpful and a very good translater to the people who dont speak english, he helps a lot.
 
Everything you need, was always "YES" and fast, always them did all in their scope to resolve.

All them make us vacations incredible and unforgettable we seriously hope come back the next year to New York City at the same Hotel thanks to them.

ºººººººººººººººººººººººººººººººººººººººººººººººººººººººººººººººººººººººººººººººººººººººººººººººººººººººººººººººººººººººº

-Excelente ubicacion y precio/calidad.
-Espacio abundante en comparación a la media en New York, incluyendo la habitación.
-Baño grande, cómodo y moderno.
-Cama cómoda y limpia.
-Sobre todo la excelente atención por parte del personal, todos en general, especialmente este chico Benz es increíble, y quien estuviera en el Front Desk como Kndra y la otra chica tambien, obvio Angel muy buenas indicaciones y Osvaldo rápido y preciso para contestar mails y resolver problemas por esta vía, tambien LEO muy servicial y buen interprete para los que sólo hablan en español, el los ayuda. Todos ellos hicieron que nuestras vacaciones fueran increíbles e inolvidables, esperamos con ansias volver el próximo año a Nueva York City y al mismo hotel gracias a ellos...

title: Mostly Good, But....
text: This is a decent hotel located near transportation, restaurants, etc. The marble bathroom was beautifully appointed, with cool gadgets like a TV mirror, interesting lighting and a gleaming tub and shower. The queen room was about 10 X 16 with high ceilings, nice bedding, and about 12 feet of windows. It could have used a clock, functioning wake-up call system, and perhaps a mirror in the bedroom, but the automatic drapes added to the cool factor. Although our 4th floor room was pretty quiet for a city hotel, the club music (none on Sunday night) impaired our sleep, even with earplugs. Is it really necessary to blast the club music that loud during the week? I tried to wait out the noise by watching TV, but the signal was so poor, we couldn't get through a show without the signal pixellating and dropping (also no NBC or Fox the entire stay). It's pretty basic that you stay in a hotel to sleep at your convenience and maybe watch a little TV.

title: Amazing location at a good price
text: Considering the incredible location of this hotel, close to subways, eateries, Madison a Square Park and coffee shops, the price for the rooms is really great. The room size is reasonable and is kept clean. The bathroom is incredible kitted out with a spa type shower and a tv. The noise from the bar downstairs wasn't an issue for us, the noise from the city is far more annoying. There is a great energy at the hotel and staff are super helpful.

title: Exceptional service!
text:
One night stay turned into 2.  Had lost a member of my party and had to stay another night.
Samantha who worked the late night front desk was amazing and was so concerned and helpful.  We contacted each other a few times thru the ordeal and it ended up tuning into a hug once he was located.
Benz was also helpful during the day before when we wanted to freshen up before a late night concert... Extending a lower price daytime room to us.
I will definitely stay here again not just for the good location, spotless rooms and nice size rooms and bathroom...but more importantly...the Customer Service.

title: Great location
text: You can't beat the location of the Flatiron. It is close to the subway, coffee shops, great restaurants and Madison Square Park. Make sure to visit the Shake Shack in Madison Square Park. The front desk and bellman staff were outstanding, especially Leo and Alex. They were friendly and helpful. The negatives of the Flatiron are the noise from the night club in the lobby. We were in a corner double Queen room on the 5th floor directly above the night club. The noise was unbearable on Friday and Saturday nights. We could hear the music and people screaming and yelling until 3 AM. Not much sleep was gotten those first 2 nights. On Sunday - Tuesday the noise was much more tolerable - it might have been that the crowd was much smaller and less obnoxious at the nightclub. Since we had one of the largest rooms available(corner queen double) it was a comfortable size for a family of 4. The room was well worn (furniture and carpet with multiple stains). The bathroom had a tub/ shower and was clean. Despite the hotel being in an ideal location and having a friendly staff, I would not recommend it for a family. They appear to be marketing to a young crowd who likes to party and does not care about getting much sleep on their vacation.

title: Wonderful place
text: We stayed here for a five day trip to NYC. It is very pretty and comfortable rooms, but tge staff is very friendly and helpful. Every time we asked for a restaurant suggestion or advice about how best to go somewhere they were so happy to help.

title: OK for a few days
text: Well situated hotel near the Flatiron building with easy access to exploring Manhattan. The room was tiny but functional, clothes drawers were in the base of the bed and there was limited hanging space. The bathroom was also very small, but the shower, which leaked occasionally, was good size. At night this was a buzzy hotel with music in the bar downstairs and sometimes partygoers running through the hotel corridors shouting. Not sure if the hotel tries to cater for people seeking accommodation or those who like to party. The staff were very friendly. We probably wouldn’t stay there again, but if you decide to, ask for the room on higher floors, which is what we did, so you won’t be bothered by the noise from the bar.

title: The Flatiron Hotel was full of energy, and in the center of it all.
text: We had a great time at the Flatiron Hotel. The rooms are a little small but that didn't matter because you don't spend much time in it since there is so much going on around it. The bed was very comfortable with plenty of pillows. There was not much closet space and the PH Bar was only open to Hotel guests 1 night out of the 5 we stayed there due to private parties going on. The downstairs bar/lounge with live music was always packed and energetic and a lot of fun. Parking is a little expensive, but "That's NY" the Hotel does give you a voucher if you park it at the garage down the street. The room also needed a couple of minor repairs (shower handle, digital room notification and no signal on a few channels on TV) BUT, Without a doubt, I would stay there again, but next time ask for a bigger room.

title: Nicest people
text: Went for a two night stay. The room was great. Loved the shower. The best part of the motel is the great staff. Kendra, Benz, Leo, and Angelo were so helpful and made us feel so welcome. I would stay in the Flatiron again!

title: Lovely Experience
text:
The hotel was fabulous! Such a chic boutique!!The room was pretty, clean, comfortable, loved the shower, the TV in the mirror. Absolutely adored the staff. Benz checked us in and was so cute and happy. He loved our NC accent. Everyone ...Samantha, Leo, Angelo, Kendra were all so kind, sweet and sosososo helpful to make our visit to the big city such a great memory!! 
We will tell everyone to stay at this hotel. We walked to Times Square, had cocktails at the revolving restaurant at the Marriott Marquis, saw so many sites. Maysville next door was perfect for lunch. 
The Toshi's  nightclub right as you walk in to the hotel had a wonderful band...great fun music and so many singers in the crowd that joined in. Such fun!! Josh, the host was so kind and attentive. 
We were 4 ladies from NC in New York and had a ball!

title: fun place
text: the place was awesome, the staff went out of their way to be accommodating, they are wheelchair accessible and the veiw to the city was awesome could see the Empire state building out my window and they have a Starbucks across the street....they also have coffee in the room but I like my foo foo drinks as my cousin calls them....and  they have a live band nightly in the bar....great music if you like to dance!!!

title: Simply fabulous
text:
I booked into the Flatiron for a 7 day stay in NYC at the end of May. This hotel is brilliant. The staff were amazing, on the ball at all times, very professional yet friendly - loved Oz, Kendra and the lovely Angelo. The rooms were clean and it's true about the showers... they ARE awesome. I was just gutted that I didn't get the chance to go and have a cocktail at the roof bar. I would highly recommend this hotel and I can honestly say I would love to stay here again. 
Oh and there's free WIFI which most hotels charge for, it's free at the Flatiron.

title: One of the top hotels in the world
text: The Flatiron Hotel housed our wedding guests. Benz and his team went far beyond our expectations. If you want outstanding services surrounded by elegance, friendly staff, quality of food, amenities, etc. and not to the mention a location to die for in one of the world's greatest cities - Looking No Further!

title: Flatiron hotel stay  NYC  June 2014
text: The people who work for The Flatiron are top notch.  Benz, who was behind the desk was EXCELLENT at his job!  He was there with whatever we needed, whenever we needed it!  He rolled out the red carpet for us.  We are from NC and needed much.  He was SO accommodating and ALWAYS happy.  The doormen, Angelo, Alex and Leo also helped us tremendously with luggage retrieval, directions and cabs.  The hotel itself is very contemporary and trendy.  With that said, functions are always going on at night and the bar and penthouse are very loud.  We were in a corner room on 7th floor and slept well each night.  I also take a white sound machine when I travel and it came in very handy.  The location of the hotel is good; right by Madison Square Park.

title: Felt at home
text:
Me and my fiend loved our stay here!
We arrived early at 1pm and the room wasn't ready so they took our bags and we went for a walk to find our bearings. After coming back around 4pm the room was ready and we had a fast checkin, the reception staff where great and Benz the manager even gave us a VIP pass to jump the queue for the empire state! Yes every night was a party night with loud music but on the 5th floor it was quiet enough. 
We had a great time with no problems and look forward to coming back to this great hotel.

title: Decent hotel. Terrible place for an event...
text: Decent hotel. Great location. Front desk staff is very nice. If you are planning a corporate event at the location, look elsewhere. The hotel has a wonderful penthouse venue with an incredible view. Unfortunately, the hotel upper management is not accommodating and does not allow their event staff to service corporate clients effectively. Kudos to Jonathan Davis for trying. Mark Anthony and his service staff were wonderful. Angelo the bellman is the absolute best. Note to upper management: your penthouse venue is a diamond in the rough. Too bad you don't know how to manage it.

title: Nice Hotel w/Great Location
text:
This hotel is in a great location and easily walkable to anything mid-town Manhattan has to offer.  My room was on the fifth floor across from the elevators.  Admittedly, I'm not from NYC so the loud noise from the street kept me awake most of the first night, this is pretty normal for big city living. I slept like a baby the next two nights though.  Because the halls are narrow, The housekeeping staff can be heard in the hallways talking fairly clearly in the mornings from your room.  If you don't have an early start to your day, this may be bothersome to you.

Good amenities and the room, while small, was plush and the shower was awesome.  The real selling point for me was the staff of this hotel. Everyone was so kind, friendly, and helpful.  Kendra and Leo were my favorites, and another taller black man (bellman?), I didn't get his name, was so helpful on things to do, and just making small talk with me while I waited on friends.

When I return for business I will stay here again without question.

title: 100% satisfaction
text: Good location. Very friendly, helpful front desk staff: Benz, Osvaldo & Angel  and all the porter guys made our 7 night stayed much more enjoyable. Rooms and hotel very clean. We'll recommend this hotel to family & friends.

title: First impressions are lasting impressions
text:
I'm rarely this conflicted about a hotel. I met a total of 4 people, and they were all very nice. And that matters. It's also true that the rooms are put together pretty well (although the cut out for the TV looks to have been made by a dull hand saw).

The problems that doomed this review all cropped up in my first hour there. First, I was informed that my credit card would be charged the room amount plus $100 for incidentals, and whatever I didn't use would be returned at check-out. A customer-unfriendly policy. Charge incidentals after they happen. Obviously. Second, we were 3 thirsty travelers when we arrived. A nice relaxing drink at the bar to unwind from the drive? No, the hotel bar doesn't open until 6. Really? So instead of quenching our thirsts, my daughter decided to look in the huge floor to ceiling fish tank in the lobby. She was quick to point out the 2 big dead fish. 5 feet from the front door, 10 feet from the front desk. And no one noticed?

This hotel wants to be a night club after dark, and the lobby is cluttered with cardboard boxes and DJ equipment. It doesn't welcome a traveler looking for a nice hotel.

The nice staff deserves a positive review. But I won't stay at this hotel again. No attention to detail. Not a place that aspires to hospitality; rather a place aspiring to attract aspiring hipsters.

title: Fabulous hotel!
text: This was my first trip to NYC and staying at the Flatiron made it better than I thought it could be! The hotel was clean and the room had everything we needed. The staff were extremely friendly and very helpful whenever we asked for anything. The location was perfect--we could walk to everything we needed and there were great restaurants close by. I highly recommend it!

title: Prima volta a NYC,Flatiron forever!
text: Soggiornato per una settimana a NewYork, prenotato tramite booking camera quadrupla con letti standard (sono letti ad una piazza e mezza, bisogns farci l abitudine ma sono comodissimi) hotel pulito e personale molto disponibile. Durante il soggiorno abbiamo avuto una perdita in bagno,si sono subito premurati di spostarci in una camera migliore pensando a spostare le valigie. Nulla da recriminsre, fermata della metro vicina e visti i prezzi newyorkesi é stato perfetto! Tornerò sicuramente a NewYork e tornerò al flatiron!

title: Toshi doesn't quite love you
text:
This place definitely has its pros and cons.  The location is ideal as it is a short walk away from a subway station and there are many places to grab breakfast before you head out for the day.  The room was relatively clean and the shower was great.  

On the other hand, the nightly music was usually terrible (singers always out of tune), the beds were uncomfortably firm (and I typically like firm beds), and our sink would not properly drain.  We called maintenance about it but their solution was to take out the stopper, which did not change anything.  Also, do not be surprised about mini-bar items being inappropriately charged to your room.  Annoying when the one tray of items is on the desk you would like to use.  We were told at the front desk that the sensor is incredibly sensitive and that "looking at it may charge you!".  Okay... 

Thankfully, you do not spend much time in your hotel room and at least it was clean.  As others have said, only stay on floors 5-7 in order to get a good night's sleep.  Odd business model when you place offering entertainment higher than giving your paying hotel guests a good night's sleep.  I understand that this does not apply to everyone but it seems odd when there aren't that many individuals listening to the music in the first place, particularly on weekdays.  I have read the replies from management mentioning "light sleepers".  You do not need to be a light sleeper to be able to hear that music.  Geesh.    

Was it an adequate stay? Sure, but I certainly would not recommend it or return.  We were there for over a week and that was enough.

title: Great Stay
text: Stayed the weekend of June 6 with the family (wife and 2 kids) for 2 nights.  We took the advice of the previous reviews and asked to be moved to a higher floor when we were given a third floor room at check in.  We stayed on the 7th floor and noise was never an issue.  The location of the hotel is perfect with easy access to parks and the subway.  The room size was perfect for all of us and we enjoyed the nightly entertainment.  We'll definitely be back.

title: Incredibly friendly and helpful staff
text: This is my second time staying here. The staff goes out if their way to be helpful. Angelo in particular was my hero in his tireless and successful effort to get me a taxi in the rain.  Great lounge with awesome music at night. Ask for an upper level floor if you need to go to sleep early though.  Large and well appointed rooms for NYC at a good value. Great neighborhood.  This place is my new go-to hotel for NYC business trips!

title: Great Location, Great for Business Trip
text:
I wasn't sure what to expect when booking this hotel, as it was the cheapest available through my corporate booking website.  I was pleasantly surprised by the cleanliness of the rooms, friendly staff, and noise level.

Room - I had a queen room on the street side and it was (shockingly) very quiet.  I also enjoyed playing with all the control pads around the room that controlled the curtains, lights, temp, maid service, etc.  I was also very surprised at the amenities in the room which included nice robes, brand name bath products, tv in bathroom, etc.

Bar - The bar area seemed very nice and lively in the evening, there was a big party there the night I stayed at the hotel but the noise did not carry over into my room.  They were also giving tours of the penthouse which I thought was pretty cool!  Who doesn't wonder what a penthouse looks like?!

Breakfast - I believe they served breakfast in the bar area each morning but I opted for Starbucks which was right across the street.

Fitness - There is not a fitness center onsite but they will give you access to the 24hour fitness right across the street.

Staff - From the front desk staff to the doorman (who also served as the bellman) everyone was very friendly.  I'm used to uptight folks around the NYC area so it was refreshing to have staff members that were genuinely nice people.

title: Great experience
text: My friend and I booked the Madison room, two double beds. We had a fantastic time. Staff were very helpful and friendly. Loved the full body shower after a long day of walking. Only complaint is that there was no room service for morning coffee. We were on the 4 th floor and didn't hear the music once we closed our door. We enjoyed the various bands down in the Living Room. We have already planned another visit in October.

title: What a breath of fresh air
text: Amazing ambiance and feel for a Manhattan boutique hotel.   From the moment, we arrived there was an artistic sensuousness.  From the moment we walked in, we were in like another world.  Live jazz was playing.  We were offered a complimentary flute of champagne as a welcoming.  Benz at the front desk couldn't have been nicer.  I had read all the reviews about the noise but my room was on the 5th floor and heard nothing.   The bed was comfortable as you'd expect from a 4 star hotel but the TV in the bathroom was the best.  Nothing like can while you're rushing to get ready.

title: Don't stay here
text:
One of worst hotel experiences we have ever had.  Toshi does not love you if he thinks anyone should stay on floors 3&4, and 8 -10.  We were originally put on 3rd floor.  1st floor is their lobby and bar where they have alive band every night, 2nd floor is another lounge area.  Our friends were on 10th floor, underneath the penthouse where they also host parties with live bands or djs.  Weekends they play very loud music till 2 in the morning. Returning to our room on 3rd floor, you would smell weed coming up from the lounge in the hallway. The rooms are not very sound insulated, so on the third floor room, it sounds like you are still in the lounge.  Then after music stops you can hear the partiers out on street. We were not able to go to sleep till 4 am due to the noise.  Same with our friends on the 10th floor.

Hotel did move us to the 7th floor (which was quieter) after we complained about not being able to go to sleep on the 3rd floor.   But this room the shower was really musty, because the shower did not drain properly.

Our third floor room had no pen and paper, there was a leather notebook that usually has info on the hotel it was brand new and completely empty.  Why would you even put this in the room?  There was no luggage rack, no alarm clock.  Our shower in the third floor room would run when ever someone else in a room around us was taking a shower, as a result the floor flooded.   There is no room service.  The bar/lounge downstairs was out of every single wine on their menu.  They were no help on concierge services, literally had no clue what restaurants/bars etc were around the hotel. 

I still don't understand the live music concept of toshi loves u lounge.  It is not that packed and they don't have any alcohol they list on the menu.  They can't be making that much money on the nightlife, but they jeopardize the satisfaction of their hotel guest that would bring most of the revenue of the hotel.  As a business man it does not make sense.  If you want to do this music concept.  Then totally sound insulate your rooms, so the floors above and below your loud music are quiet and people can actually do what they pay for a hotel for- sleep!

My advice is to never stay here.

title: Bon choix
text: L’hôtel est bien situé de par sa position centrale dans Manhattan, pas mal de sites sont accessibles à pied. Les chambres sont très confortables et le personnel est très sympathique (comme la plupart des New-yorkais). Le hall d'accueil sert de salle de concert pratiquement tous les soirs jusqu'à une heure raisonnable. Je ne regrette pas mon choix, pas grand chose à dire de négatif, peut-être les tarifs du minibar qui vous motivent à sortir boire un verre sur Broadway.

title: Stay Elsewhere!
text:
This hotel is a disaster for the business traveler. The noise from the band in the lobby keeps those on lower floors awake. My air conditioner was noisy and it was impossible to complain except by going to the front desk because the phone in the room did not work!!  I had to go to the desk to request a wake-up call.

The next morning I decided to eat in the hotel because it was raining. I was told that they were out of regular coffee and had only Decaf! How can you be out of coffee in NYC!!!

The service at the desk was confused and the staff had to consult the manager every two minutes because they had not mastered the computer commands.

This place was simply the worst hotel experience I have had in NYC in decades!

title: Don't. Really.
text: Don't stay here if you're in town on business and need a good night's sleep.   Ultra thin walls.  You can hear the nightclub downstairs (even with a white noise machine) and the drunks down the hall.  Tiny room. Tiny bathroom.  Phone didn't work.  The modern amenities advertised are cool but the hotel assumes you know how the gadgets work and don't provide any instructions.   I won't be staying here again.

title: Bring earplugs!
text:
After a day of flight delays, I was looking forward to checking in and getting a good night's sleep before two days of meetings. When we pulled up in front, the cab driver said, "Oh, I'm sorry you have to go into that noisy place." The band was in full roar and you could hear them in the street. Inside, the front desk person and I had to shout at each other to be heard over the music while I checked in. I asked for a room on a higher floor, and he sent me to 5, which wasn't quite high enough. It was also on the 5th Ave. side of the building, so I could hear the music from the lobby, as well as the raucous party that went on in the street from about midnight until 3, the subway, and someone's small dog yapping for hours on end. I had forgotten my earplugs, so the first night I suffered, but the next night I left the fan running all night for white noise and it was somewhat better. I visit New York a lot, so I understand city noise, but this was over the top.

The room itself was fine, although mine didn't have all of the amenities advertised on the hotel web site. I had a standard tub and shower -- no rain shower or jacuzzi -- and no electric curtains. The TV in the bathroom mirror was cute, but the lighting around the mirror was dreadful -- I had to put my makeup on in the mirror next to the door where I could actually see what I was doing. The room was fairly large and mostly clean, although the carpet was stained and ripped in one spot and the chairs had stains on them. Also, the window was so dirty I wouldn't have been able to see the view if there had been one. (I realize winter just ended, but wow, the grime was astounding.)

The best part about staying here is the location. It's in the middle of everything and an easy walk to food, shopping, and entertainment. Madison Square Park and the Shake Shack are steps away, as is Eataly. There's also a popup food square in Madison Square Park where you can find all kinds of ethnic street food for a reasonable amount of money.

In short, I doubt I would stay here again. Details are critically important, and this place drops the ball. And really, having a rowdy nightclub in the main part of the hotel is unpleasant if you're there to work or rest. (Although I guess if you're there to party, it would be just fine.) There are many better options in the same price range where you can actually enjoy peace and quiet.

title: lovely hotel
text:
everything OK, nice hotel, quiet room, close to everything, subway next to door.
Room and bathroom are wider that what you have in most hotels in manhattan.
Wifi connection not at best..most of the time slow or not working at all (but it could have been a temporary problem..)

title: Lovely place, mostly terrible service
text:
I want to start by saying that the Flatiron is a lovely hotel. It's truly a beautiful little boutique hotel. Unfortunately, the service of said hotel was fairly terrible. Check in went fine, people at the front desk were friendly. I went downstairs to grab dinner in their bar and was told after ordering that I couldn't eat there because they were having a private party. And then they asked me to move to the bar. After getting my food I headed back up to my room, to find that the automatic curtains in my room were malfunctioning and opening and closing randomly. I called down and they told me they should stop shortly. Sure enough, after 20 minutes they stopped. Ate, went to bed. Fast forward, curtains opening and closing randomly at 2AM. Sigh. Again, stopped 20 minutes later. In the morning I figured out that the issue was that the curtain was catching on itself and giving just enough resistance that the mechanism thought I was trying to reopen the curtains.

The next morning I called down at 10:25 to ask for my car from valet. Kendra told me it would be 10-15 minutes. I came downstairs at 10:40. At 11:00, Angelo, the doorman, kindly asked if I was asking for something. That's when I went back to the front desk and once again asked about my car. That's when Kendra told me how swamped she was and admitted she hadn't called for the car yet. It was another 20 minutes before my car was delivered - 55 minutes after I called. 

I feel that I was mostly blown off as a guest of the Flatiron. It did not leave the best taste in my mouth and I will have a hard time recommending this hotel to others as a result.

title: Nota dez !!!
text: Sem palavras para descrever ótimos quartos e localização pertinho de tudo no coração da cidade e bem educados os funcionários sem distinção pela pátria e você pode fazer compras e dar endereço entregam tudo certinho sem stress e quando chegam já no seu quarto também conta com um bar movimentado que dá aquele toque a mais para você se distrair se for a trabalho.

title: Ótimo lugar!
text:
Me hospedei com três amigos no Flatiron Hotel entre os dias 27 de abril e 05 de maio e só tenho coisas boas a falar da minha estadia. O quarto era bastante confortável, a localização ótima (pertíssimo do metrô, do Eataly e do Shake Shack) e os funcionários eram extremamente simpáticos. Fiz muitas encomendas na Amazon enquanto estava lá e quando chegava à noite ao hotel, todas as caixas já estavam me esperando no quarto, o que achei ótimo.
Vi muita gente reclamando do barulho das festas que ocorrem no bar no térreo do hotel, mas fiquei num quarto no nono andar e elas não me incomodaram nem um pouco. Achei até bom por que, quando chegava tarde ao hotel, a rua estava sempre movimentada por causa do bar. Caso volte a Nova York, com certeza ficarei de novo no Flatiron!

title: Great location, Fantastic staff, Everyone's a VIP here
text:
Located in walking distance or easy taxi ride to everything. We started with coffee and bagels/danish from a fantastic and inexpensive stand in the park then walked throughout the day to everything we wanted to see from financial district, to highline, to times square and shows, as well as central park and museums.

We were two couples and the staff made us (and everyone else) feel like VIPs.  From Angelo opening the door making fabulous recommendations, to over the top service from Kendra and Benz (relax on the couches in the lounge, I'll print your boarding passes and bring them to you).  I've stayed at numerous specialty and boutique hotels since I visit 2-3 times a year but I can't see staying anywhere else now. No rooms in NYC are large but these are redesigned to use the space wonderfully, fantastic lighting for reading, fun high tech touches like a TV in the bathroom mirror and keys that you simply wave at the pad.  There is a comfortable living room style bar and restaurant that has music every night, it made the decision to see a show hard but was wonderful to return to.  The energy of the hotel and staff is what hooks you - you never want to leave.

We had a bit of a glitch and confusion with the reservation system but they attended to it professionally and with grace beyond hotels that charge 3-4 times the price cannot manage.  We left realizing there was nothing we could have done to improve the experience at this fantastic establishment -a rare event.  Keep up the wonderful work we can't wait to return.

title: Super Hotel
text:
Wir waren eine Woche im Flatiron in NewYork City. Über die Lage lässt sich streiten, da es zwischen Uptown und Downtown liegt. Also eigentlich weg von allem, aber die 2 Subways Stations 23th Street und 28th Street sind zu Fuss in 5 Min. zu erreichen.
Das Personal ist sehr freundlich und zuvorkommend. Einziger Schwachpunkt des Hotels sind die zu kleinen Betten. Alles andere war für unseren Aufenthalt in New York perfekt.

title: Great place. Great location. Great service.
text:
I stayed here Easter weekend for 3 days. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The location is fabulous. You're next to Madison Square Park. Right near fashion district and union square.  11 Madison Park restaurant is a 3 minute walk away ( incredible place). You're close to Chelsea and Penn station.  The room was great.  I was in a king bed on 10th floor. An abundance of water pressure and hot water in the multi port rain shower. The bed was comfortable
 Samantha at front desk was very helpful also Leo and Angelo the concierges were
 great. This place also has a very lively bar with live bands. The only thing I didn't like was the soap and shampoo was cheap.

title: Flatiron
text: The hotel is older and charming with a casual feel but feels nice.  The staff was kind, personable, and went above and beyond to meet our needs and make our stay special. The hotel is quite convenient to all of Flatiron, Chelsea and Union Square.

title: Sumptuous
text: My business was cut short here on this trip and the worst part about it was having to leave this hotel. First of all the staff are all brilliant. Naturally chivalrous without being sickly and will bend over backwards and sideways to make you feel comfortable. Crystal, the manager and Director of Operations runs a tight ship and sets a brilliant example, she's superb. The receptionists are wonderful making you feel at home on arrival too. All the rooms are differently designed and are different shapes and sizes and all the beds are too, but are incredibly comfy. There's just such a lovely vibe about the place and it's such a super location, close to mid-town for business yet not far from downtown which is more my area. Its got music and different artists performing every night but if I didn't want that, it was unheard where I was on 10th floor. I would say it is more suited to maturer young people. It is stylish in design and you can see it's been carefully thought out. They behave like they are operating as a 5 star big chain hotel, yet in fact it's got a unique boutique feel. Loved it, dying to go back.

title: Chic, friendly and fabulous!
text: We loved this hotel!  The staff went out of their way to make us welcome.  The room was contemporary, clean and charming.  We loved the gadgets and it was quiet and comfortable.  Very reasonable price for terrific location.  We would definitely stay here again.

title: 3 Star Hotel
text: The NoMad area is up and coming and close to many subway lines.  If you book here, get a room on a higher floor - as others have suggested.  The bar area has theme nights Monday through Saturday, and the room windows won't protect you from the noise.  The common areas were not clean.  A good sweep and mop of the elevators would have gone a long way.  The pillows and bed accessories smelled and needed to be replaced.  Toothpaste on the bathroom door.  The bed was sloppily made with laundered but stained sheets.  The shower was tiny and needed a scrub down - the grouting was black.

title: Fun Hotel, Great Location
text:
I got a great deal on the room for a girls weekend in NYC. The hotel is very nice, well located and the staff were so helpful and service-oriented (HI ANTONIO!). The room decor was really pretty with many cool gadgets in the rooms, like auto open curtains and a tv screen in the bathroom mirror! The beds were amazing, the most comfortable I've ever slept on! The rug in our room was kind of dirty, but everything else was great.

I would stay here again, with one warning: the rooms with two beds are on the third floor, which is directly above the night club/disco. They go until 2 a.m. on weekends. They did bring us earplugs, but you may want to get a room on a higher floor. Also, the restaurant is not open on weekends, which is no problem with so many great places nearby.

title: Great hotel in a great location.
text: On our girls trip to New York, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Flat Iron Hotel. Staff were friendly, particularly the doormen. They were alway helpful in giving advice, had a good sense of humour and welcomed us with a smile in returning to the hotel each day.  The reception and bar area are quite unique with the large fish tank and modern design.  The only thing I would say was that the design and colour scheme of the rooms didn't seem to quite seem to fit with that of the public areas of the hotel.  This, however, is just a comment and didn't impact on any part of our stay. We had everything we needed and liked the area and facilities around the hotel as well. We would recommend this to others looking for somewhere to stay in this district.

title: Little gem in the Flatiron
text: Room was small but clean and new. Hotel is conveniently located to everything yet area feels very neighborhoody. The lobby and lounge was very nice. The staff was wonderful - went above and beyond.  We would definitely stay again.

title: A great hotel
text: The Flatiron Hotel is in a great location and excellent value for money. The staff are particularly helpful and the bed is extremely comfortable. This will now be my hotel of choice in lower Manhattan.

title: Good modern urban hotel
text:
This hotel has an amazing location, very nice nightlife and good food in the menu.
