But there is couple of things to be aware of....for example they charge you 8 DOLLARS FOR A ESPRESSO or in weekend days party in the hotel last until 3.00 a.m. So if you are visiting NYC with your children or you are not a party tolerant person better if you find another place to stay. 

For everything else this hotel is superb good rooms, electronic curtains, good dining and amazing doormen....

title: NO GERAL
text: acomodações muito boas, comida boa, serviço de quarto bom, barzinho bem legal na recepção do hotel, a unica coisa ruim foi que me cobraram por um serviço de gerencia, o qual não autorizei e so fui perceber quando recebi a fatura do cartao

title: Friendly
text: Angelo was excellent. He was very helpful and we enjoyed talking to him. We enjoyed our stay and plan on staying there again. Thanks Angelo, even though it was very hot in our rooms because of the no AC you still made our experience wonderful.

title: A real treat
text:
The Flatiron Hotel was a wonderful experience in New York. Kenndra Moore's reception was warm and friendly and she continued to be cheerful and really helpful throughout. The other members of the staff were all friendly and helpful; the high-tech gadgets in the room were fun and the marvellous multi-level shower set this accomodation apart. I will return.

Alasdair Hutton

title: Great Boutique Hotel
text: This hotel had the perfect location for us (family of 4) and was by far the best choice for us. Great, friendly and helpful staff.  Very comfortable room, but suggest you go with the corner room and would also suggest you stay on the 4th floor or higher, as the nightly music is very good, but also very loud.

title: Toshi's Flatiron Hotel Rocks!
text: Stayed overnight Saturday and it was fabulous! The Yazmatics rocked the house til 10pm and the next band kept the dance floor grooving til 2!  Toshi (& Ponzu) is a most gracious host, and his hotel accommodations are top shelf.  You won't be disappointed.  The Chelsea district is a terrific area of NYC to enjoy and staying at the Flatiron is a most convenient location.  The High Line is nearby, the Chelsea Market and restaurants galore.  Plan a stay at the Flatiron Hotel and don't miss the live entertainment in the Living Room EVERY NIGHT!  Amazing!

title: If you like music...
text:
This hotel was perfect for our needs, but I was glad we were on the ninth floor. As we arrived, a four piece band was just starting up in the lobby restaurant, and I could still hear them halfway up to my room in the elevator. It wasn't a problem for me, and well...it's New York!

The room was great. Surprisingly big, a beautiful bathroom with jacuzzi tub and lots of good technology (TV in the mirror in the bathroom!). The bed was very comfortable and the wifi was great. Highly recommend the hotel. Front desk staff were great.

Great location to enjoy the city from.

title: afantastic hotel!!!
text:
Great location, clean, an incredibly accommodating staff.Cannot say enough good things about it!

Benz, Kenndra, & Marc are the most helpful & friendly hotel staff you can imagine!

This is the only hotel our family stays in in NYC.

title: Perfect for a few days
text: First time in NYC. Stayed on 5th floor, broadway side and was very quite room. Could not hear the band and in fact walls seemed very sound proof! Great location and really helpful staff. The only flaw was the carpets in the room need shampoo or steamed as there was stains.

title: The Flatiron Hotel ticks all the boxes!
text: We arrived feeling tired after a long day travelling from the UK so it was nice to get a warm and friendly welcome from the doorman and Benz on the front desk. We were visiting NYC for our anniversary and Benz was kind enough to upgrade our room and also arranged a surprise bottle of wine and congratulations card in our room, which was a lovely gesture. The location of the hotel is great and there are subway stations close by. The doormen (sorry can't remember their names) were friendly and when we checked out and needed a taxi to the airport, the guy was almost stood in the middle of the road to find us one. Our room was clean, well equipped and the bed was comfortable. The hotel bar has live music most evenings which creates a good atmosphere. We eat there one night and the food was really nice. The staff are all friendly and the service we received throughout our stay was excellent. It is Benz though that stands out as he does everything he can to help you and he is a great ambassador for the hotel. We would highly recommend the hotel and we would definitely stay again if we find ourselves back in NYC.

title: Would definitely stay again!
text: Very clean hotel and rooms.  The staff is extremely helpful, courteous and kind.  We loved the location and would definitely stay here again.  The rooms are quite spacious, beds comfortable.  The sheets were nice and clean.  The bathrooms were spotless.  Which indicates a great housekeeping staff.  Joe who greets you at the front door and takes your luggage to your room is wonderful.

title: Great Central Location
text:
We stayed two nights at the Flatiron Hotel while in the city to catch a show.  Valet parking was worth not having to haul your luggage down the street as it was $48 to valet and only three dollars cheaper to self-park.  

The lobby has a beautiful floor to ceiling fish tank tube.  When I requested a high floor, the manager advised that there was a party going on in the penthouse that night and would prefer to put us two levels below to avoid being disturbed.

As with any New York hotel, the deluxe king room and bathroom were very small.  However, the bathroom made up for it in big ways:  television in the mirror (which I haven't seen anywhere but the Four Seasons), a rainfall shower with six additional body sprayers, and nice toiletries.  Some improvements could be made in the quality of pillows and mattress (rock hard) and towels (small and scratchy).  

The lobby bar looked nice but was inundated every night with non-guests coming to hang out and listen to the (awful) band that was playing.  Walking through it during the day showed some dirt and wear thanks to the sheer number of people that pile in every night.  We had no chance to check out the rooftop bar as a visit in February isn't conducive to a relaxing patio drink.

As we came for a Broadway show, we were quite happy with the central location that made walking possible.  The hotel has quick access to subway stops, a drugstore in every direction, and a wine shop just a few doors down.  A midnight stroll through nearby Washington Square Park felt very safe as did all areas around the hotel.  

At checkout, the front desk was doing their best to help a foreign woman who needed a town car to take her to the airport.  She didn't have any credit cards accepted in the U.S. and the staff went out of their way to make call after call, looking for any company that would take her reservation with no credit card to hold it.  I was impressed at how hard they worked to help that guest.

Upon leaving, the valet stepped into the middle of the street to have traffic stop so we could easily pull into traffic.

title: We'll be back!!!
text: What a great hotel! Romms were beautifully amended  elegant, but simple. This was the most friendly and attentive staff of any hotel I've stayed at in NYC. Benz at the front desk was as courteous as they come and Angelo and Joe treat eveyine like royalty. Right on Toshi!!!!

title: Great Spot
text: Loved the location and the staff at the Flatiron. The front desk staff was very friendly on check-in and accomodating. I had a flight cancelled and called from the airport to re-book a room for the night and they couldn't have been more accomodating, and gave me a great rate - as it was a quick overnight stay need. The downstairs lounge has great live music and the location is excellent near quite a few amazing bars and restaurants. Centrally located - I'll be staying here as much as possible on my future business trips.

title: Great location. Great people. I will only stay at Flatiron from now on
text: I had a wonderful experience at the Flatiron hotel. I stayed there for two nights recently when visiting NYC for a conference. From check-in to check-out, the staff were helpful, friendly, and extraordinarily delightful!! I had not been in the city for over ten years and had lots of questions. They answered all of them. The room was comfortable and quiet (as much as you could expect in NYC) with neat details like a rain shower and side jets and a TV in the bathroom mirror. Stay here. You won't be disappointed.

title: I like the staff
text:
Stayed here for a business trip for a month. Lived on 7th floor, didn't hear any music. When there is cold outside, then it's not very comfortable inside the room, especially on the bed that is by the window. But I've asked for additional heater and they gave me. 

The staff of the hotel is awesome. Friendly, hospitable and help you with everything.

Owner of the hotel and his dog are great. He  lives the hotel's life.

title: Great Stay. Just check your bill.
text: I had to find a hotel quickly as my meeting ran over time and I was going to miss my flight. I wanted to try using PayPal as well, so I pre-paid using Hotels.com. The hotel is nice, clean with average size rooms. I've stayed in a lot smaller. The bathroom is tiny, but what it lacks in size it certainly makes up in features. There's a rain shower head and full body shower heads so you know you're going to wake up when these hit you. There's also a TV discreetly hidden behind the vanity mirror. The staff are friendly. On check in I was told that I would be charged an additional $100 to cover incidentals and I had no problem with that. Most hotels authorize a $1.00 charge but their policy was the full $100.00. The next day I quickly checked out and got into a car. Whilst heading to the airport I viewed my bill and noticed I was charged for my room (even though it was pre paid) and charged $200 for incidentals. I called and the receptionist stated that the charging was automatic and would "drop off" within a week. So they had charged $355 to my card. I wasn't happy with that!

title: Great Location
text: This perfectly located hotel - within walking distance to everything - combines very friendly service with a 'happening' ambience.  With a club/bar on the ground floor, you feel as if you are right in the midst of a NYC experience.  The rooms are somewhat small, but well-appointed with a multiple-head shower and a very comfortable (double) bed.  If you stay on the upper floors, you will not hear the club noise, though street noises do come through....it is not, however, on a heavily trafficked street, so that's not much of an issue.  Would definitely stay again.

title: Bem localizado
text: Excelente localização!! Perto da times e perto do westvillage! Do lado do Madison Square park e do Eataly (restaurante/mercado italiano maravilhoso)! Hotel limpo e quarto espaçoso! Tem um bar no térreo onde todos os dias tem bandas muito boas tocando. Bom pra quem gosta de festa! O único problema é que pode fazer um pouco de barulho pra quem quer dormir cedo e está hospedado nos primeiros andares do hotel.

title: A Great Discovery
text: My husband and I were visiting our family in the city this weekend and stayed at the Flatiron. What a nice surprise. This staff is truly the most genuinely helpful of any that we have encountered on our many trips to New York. They acted as if they enjoyed doing things for the guests! The location was great, and we walked quite a bit in spite of the bad weather. Our room was very nicely decorated, comfortable and quiet. Loved the shower! The clientele here seem to be a bit on the younger side, but we were made to feel very welcome. I would highly recommend this hotel.

title: A wonderful hotel that has it all.
text: I found this hotel looking for something that was a little removed from the bustle of Times Square.  This hotel seemed to fit the bill.  I was travelling with my wife and we were very pleasantly surprised.  The hotel is small but it is very, nice.  We had a king room.  The bed was very comfortable.  The bathroom was very modern and updated, with rain/massage shower and a television in the mirror.  I was there in February and it was very cold but the heater in the room worked fast and great.  The entertainment in the lobby was wonderful.  If you like jazz you will be in heaven. The food and drinks in the restaurant (Toshi's Livingroom) was very good and not outrageously priced.  The staff was very polite and helpful and the hotel itself is located close to everything (metro, restaurants, shopping, etc...)  This is definitely a new favorite of mine and I look forward to returning.

title: A éviter, mauvais accueil et mauvais rapport qualité / prix
text:
On peut trouver bien mieux pour ce prix là. Un établissement "money oriented", pas l'impression d'avoir été considérée comme une personne, accueil déplorable. Seuls les portiers étaient aimables.

 Après 8 heures d'avion, j'arrive et règle l'intégralité de mon séjour. L 'hotel me demande en plus une verser une caution de 100 USD au cas je viderait le mini bar / détruirait la chambre (!). La transaction ne passe pas (jai une carte européenne). L'hotel insiste, je propose alors de leur verser cette caution imprévue en liquide.  On me demande alors de verser non plus 100 mais 200 USD. N'ayant pas encore changé mes euros en dollars, je propose de leur donner en euros  qu'ils me restitueront 3 jours après. L'hotel refuse, et exige des dollars. Je dois insister à plusieurs reprises pour pouvoir accéder à ma chmabre avant de partir en quête d'une bureau de change. Puis je dois réclamer avec insistance mon passeport (!) pour pouvoir aller changer l'argent, cela directement après le voyage. Le tout sans amabilité aucune, des airs soupconneux, avec le vigil venu à côté du comptoir en prime, bref 3 personnes (le responsable, une employée, le vigile) en face de moi non souriants et soupçonneux, alros que je venais de régler l'intégralité d emons éjour.

Quand à la chambre, le chauffage ne sétaitn pas, et se met en branle au milieu de la nuit, en plus du reste j'ai donc très mal dormi.

title: Fabulous time!!!!!!
text:
Front desk service could not be better!! Benz took care of us famously. All I can say is WOW!
Absolutely love the place! Great room! Incredible hip ao sphere in the off-lobby bar! Loved it! Generous drinks wonderful bands/ entertainment !

title: Nice place! See Benz
text: Great service from Benz! Convenient and nice bar area with music! Benz was the best! No big issues but any problem or anything you need Benz always came through. We enjoyed our stay even with the terrible weather. The hotel helped make up for the weather.

title: Don't even need to leave the hotel
text:
My husband and I stayed here for a nice NYC staycation for his 30th birthday. I picked Flatiron so that we would have the option of hanging out in the hotel, going out, or just chilling in our room. We did a little of everything.

The staff were very nice and friendly. I was in a bad mood at check in, but Kenndra's upbeat attitude made it impossible for me to stay angry. I love the lounge and will probably stop by with friends some other night. The fish tank was so pretty too, I love aquariums. Our room was nice and cozy, we didn't want to go home. If it weren't for our two babies back at home we probably would have tried to stay another night.

I read other reviews about the noise. Since we were staying with the intention of celebrating that didn't really bother me. However I really didn't think it was as bad as others have stated. Then again, I'm actually from Manhattan so I know how loud it normally is at night--especially during the weekend.  My husband's from the Hudson Valley, however, and he didn't really notice until I pointed it out. I don't know, maybe some people are just more sensitive to noise than others.

Anyway, I already told my husband I want to do the same exact thing for my birthday. So we'll definitely be coming back.

title: This is the hotel of your dreams!
text:
The Flatiron is in a class by itself.  From the moment you get there, you are in a different universe starting with the phenomenal two story  aquarium that greets you in the lobby.  

I have never been to a hotel anywhere with nicer and more helpful staff.  All were great, but two were stand-outs.  Joe, a doorman not only took my car, but agreed to keep it in front of the hotel the afternoon we were leaving so we would not be charged an extra day.  And when we got there to pick it up, he had even put our luggage in the back seat!  He got us an umbrella when we found ourselves in the rain, gave us directions, and greeted us by name.  Benz, the receptionist who registered us gave us a free upgrade, called us when the room was ready (we arrived two hours early) and then apologized because the room wasn't ready when we got there - not their fault we came early!!

The rooms themselves are a kick.  Palatially large by NY hotel standards with enough gadgets and electronic devices to keep one amused for a week.  We finally figured out that the black square on the bathroom mirror was a second television.  We didn't use the tub jaccuzzi or elaborate lighting system, but it was there.

This is definitely my NYC hotel of choice from this day forward.  It is also in a perfect location - easy walk to Times Sq, Chelsea Market, and the gallery district.

title: Friendly staff. Fun place.
text: We stayed a night but our flight got cancelled and we needed to extend the trip one more day. Oz was great help especially here. We had a miscommunication resulting booking debacle where our office manager booked an extra room and he helped sort it out. Would come again if I were in the area.

title: Trapped at the Flatiron...
text:
Booked the Flatiron based on the location and reviews. I arrived Saturday, one day prior to the person I'm working for. . .this will not end well. 
The desk staff was sweet and welcoming, but the first thing I saw after opening the door to my room was bunched up carpeting and a large stain. I spoke to the desk staff, and because they're fully committed, the first opportunity to switch rooms would be tomorrow.  
At about midnight I went to the lobby to ask about amenities (breakfast/room service, workout room, etc) as there was only an empty binder in my room. The hotel is up for grabs tonight. I squeezed into an elevator packed with partiers, cocktails in hand, and after being held up for several minutes on the mezzanine, I finally got to the jam packed lobby and literally had to go into a side room with the desk person, because neither of us could hear over the noise. After being told that the binder IS actually empty, there is no room service and there is no on site gym, I had to fight to get back on the elevator which was being blocked by a bouncer(?) and a crowd of people. The floor of the elevator was soaked with beer at this point.
I'm not exactly sure what to do. When my boss arrives after a five hour flight for her prepaid reservation tomorrow night she will freak out unless there's been some sort of dramatic change here.

title: Nice hotel for my visit to Flat Iron district.
text: They have the details down, remote control blinds, Tv in the bathroom, outstanding shower! My advice is to upgrade the mattress, (it was acceptable, not outstanding like the shower). And keep the elevators cleaner. I know it must be harder in the winter time but it's one of the first things a customer sees. I like the entertainment at night, friendly staff, location and will stay there again during my stay. Cute boutiquey hotel.

title: Good spot, lovely rooms
text: The location of this hotel was convenient, and the room was great. Fantastic bathroom and shower, & comfortable bed. I'll be staying here again. Staff was helpful. The entry looks very cool-- though be warned, there is live music Monday-Sat, which can get a little loud. However, this did not effect my ability to have a quiet's night rest!

title: Exploring the City
text: The name of the hotel describes the district and is not in the iconic Flatiron Building.  This area of New York is absolutely hopping and the club off the reception area is great.  Despite the "with it" ambiance of the area, the hotel staff is bureaucratic, inhospitable and downright Kafkaesque, e.g. I couldn't get a drink from the bar to take to my room before the 5:00 pm opening until the front desk ok'd it which they wouldn't do without the permission of the bar.  The mini bar in the room is electronic and will charge for items taken off of the sensor for 20 seconds or more.  Given the location of the mini bar on the desk, items can frequently get jostled and end up on the bill.  A standard room is so small that clothes have to be put in the closet on an angle and the bathroom door barely clears the toilet.  And the was no heat in the bathroom!

title: Superior accomodations with personal touches added
text: First impression has been the best! Staff very nice and friendly. Booked the hotel for my wife's 40th birthday and they really delivered by providing 7th floor corner room with 8 windows to see the city! All the finest that a hotel could offer. Jacuzzi tub with Tv on the bathroom mirror. Comfortable queen beds with plush linens and fine inviting decorum. One complaint although a nice LG 32 inch flat screen Tv the channel reception is very poor. Although I didn't come to the city to watch TV the NFL playoffs are on and the local HD signals are miserable. For a 4 star hotel I found this to be surprising. Beyond this minor issue this place delivers beyond words! They provided a birthday card and a compliment bottle of wine for my wife! Thanks to Angel and all Toshie's staff.

title: Weekend Staycation
text: We're from New York so we have never checked-in any hotel in the city. We stayed here for a weekend to celebrate my husband's 30th Birthday. The room is smaller than amy other hotel room I've stayed on the past but I'm guessing this is the standard in New York city. Apart from that, the room was clean, and we enjoyed our stay very much. we never called on housekeeping to make up our room so I cannot comment on that. I was a little hesitant to book this hotel based on the customer photos I saw of the bathroom with leaking ceilings and ugly or moldy fixtures but this was not our experience at all. although the room carpet could use a bit of a steam clean. the room is not equipped with slippers but they will gladly bring one up for you if you call front desk and ask. request for a room on a higher floor though. the band that plays in the bar downstairs and they can be loud. we were on the 6th floor so we were okay.

title: Great value and location
text: We arrived on Jan 1 and the bar/lobby was a little out of sorts but it was easily overlooked.  The room was nice and clean.  Very comfortable.  Enjoyed tge multihead shower.  Small room but who stays in the room.  I would stay here again.

title: Família em férias
text: Hospedamo-nos no Flatiron entre 26 de dezembro findo e 01 de janeiro, três adultos (pai, mãe e filha) em quarto com 02 camas queen. Quarto espaçoso, banheiro adequado, bom isolamento acústico. Ótima localização, perto do metrô e da Eataly, mercado com especialidades e comida italianas, que vale a pena conhecer. Apesar de nossa dificuldade com inglês, tivemos todas as nossas necessidades atendidas, por pessoal atencioso e prestativo. Pedimos um frigobar para nosso uso, 10 dólares de taxa única, instalado imediatamente. Internet grátis, com bom desempenho. Destaque especial para um funcionário Filipino, que atendeu na recepção, e para o porteiro Joe, que além de muito atencioso, fala português o suficiente para nos ajudar na recepção, e foi muito útil ao nos ajudar com malas e taxi. Não tivemos qualquer queixa ou reclamação e se voltar a New York, procurarei ficar nesse hotel novamente.

title: Fun.
text:
I booked this for a business trip for an apparel market, and was motivated by the nightly music in the bar and the price/location. It was fun. The room was very small but I booked the standard. It was filled with technology (tv in the bathroom mirror) and well appointed. 
The live music in the bar was quite a bonus. People at the desk were excellent. Would have loved some coffee in the lobby, but had a great time. Probably best for the young or like us, the young at heart.

title: Comfortable, Excellent Staff.
text: This was our 3rd stay at the Flat Iron Hotel. The staff is very helpful and courteous. The rooms are clean and a bit larger than other hotel rooms we stayed in in NYC. Location is very good. Subways are local. Eataly is a block down and we frequent this italian eatary/market every time we stay at the Flat Iron. Ask for the King room with the jacuzzi tub. That made my day!!

title: Lovely, spacious rooms
text:
Our first stay at the Flatiron Hotel... and it won't be our last.  Booked our stay online - but staff said to book directly thru hotel website for best rate.
Good location! Away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square! A short walk from Penn Station.
Room and bathroom generous size.  Our king bed was more comfortable than my mattress at home! Plenty of pillows and good quality sheets. Towels in bathroom should be upgraded to match the quality of the bedding.  
We were fairly warned at check-in about the mini bar-if you hold it for more than 20 seconds... it's yours!
Room had an ironing board and iron. Everything in working order.... no functional issues at all.
All staff was friendly and accomodating. 
Check-in isn't until 4pm.. but we were allowed to store our luggage upon arrival and departure at no charge!  Staff took my cell phone number and called me when our rooms were available!!  Nice! As it was well over an hour before the 4om check-in.
Mini coffee pot in room for that first cup! And coffee, bagels and scrambled eggs!! In the lobby once you got going.
My first time seeing a TV built right into the bathroom mirror!!!!
Other than the towels.... my only recommendation is the rug in our room needed cleaning (or replacing!)
Highly recommend staying here.

title: Location, location, location
text: This fairly new hotel has the best location for people like me who are ex-New Yorkers and want to avoid the masses of tourists in mid-town. Flatiron/Chelsea has always been a great area and this former production building was redone as a hotel 3 years ago. The staff is extremely friendly, the rooms spacious by NYC standards and since it is now Asian-owned, the latest in technology rules. The bathroom mirror has a TV in it (quite a shock when your mirror suddenly starts talking to you) and the drapes have buttons to open and close. Everything was perfect and this hotel was well priced. The bar/restaurant was a bit odd but 26th Street is loaded with great clubs and restaurants.

title: NYC at Christmas
text: This was our first trip to New York City and could not be happier with our choice of hotel.  Perfectly located within easy reach to Lower Manhattan and Central Park areas.  Rooms aren't large but are very nice.  Staff is very accommodating and helpful also.  I hightly recommend Flat Iron Hotel.

title: For price and location, this was great
text: I booked this hotel the day before as I had a company party to attend that night in the city and didn't want to travel back home to NJ.  It was only 10 blocks from my office, and the price was right.  Checking in was quick and easy.  The room was expected size for the area, very clean.  Comfortable bed, great shower.  I counted 8 shower heads coming from the side and top.  That was awesome.  I read several reviews about club noise, but since I didn't make it back for the night until 2:30am, the club was closed.    I was on the 6th floor and did hear some street noise in the morning, but this is NYC, have to expect that.  Upon checking out, there was an error with a room charge from the bar, it was accidentally doubled.  They took care of it very quick and without question. I would definitely stay here again.

title: Nice stay in NY city
text: This hotel has a very good location in Midtown, nice room but you can hear some noise from the subway. Front desk guys were exceptional, giving me advices for good bars around there, they were very helpful.

title: Mixed feelings
text:
I stayed in a King room for a week.

Good things...
Location was great
Bed was one of the most comfortable beds ever slept in

Bad/strange things...

Just seemed to lack some of the hotel amenities you'd expect like good cable TV, complimentary water bottles... 
But mostly what was really bad about the room were 3 things in order from bad to worst

1. TV was jacked and said "no signal" half the time. Was fine cuz I wasn't watching much tv but there was one night I felt ill and tried only to get stuck with one working channel.

2. I could not regulate the room temperature to save my life. It was either blazing hot or freezing. 

3. By far the worst thing was that when I turned on my jacuzzi jets inteh tub (I was SO excited BTW) BLACK CHUNKS came flying out of all the jets. Like gross omg Im gagging just wrtiting about it. I flew outta that tub soo fast hoping not to end up with some weird disease or rash...
The sheets also had a small almost not noticeable stain but still.. I do not expect to find that in a hotel.

Finally one weird/creepy/funny thing happened. I came out of my room one morning to find a toilet paper roll with a very intricate mans face drawn on it right outside my door facing at me - CLEARLY left for me. From the hotel staff or creep neighbor? Who knows. 

I did meet Toshi and his dogs and they were super cute and nice (he and his dogs!) I just think the hotel is more focused on their "party time" vibe than the details in the rooms.

title: Our second stay
text:
We previously stayed a couple of years ago during their soft opening and we liked it so much we came back even though the price was considerably more expensive, although not out of line. The room itself (toshi corner deluxe) is very large by NYC standards. My wife loves the little hallway in the room. The view is nice enough.  For us the location is hard to beat, walkable to a lot of great stuff,and close enough to the mta for other things. The staff were very friendly. The hotel could easily earn higher marks from us for all these positive things. 
The drawbacks for us included the following.
Our single biggest complaint would have to be the seemingly overburdened housekeeping staff. There simply does not seem to be enough people on staff to keep up in a timely fashion. We would typically leave around 8-9 in the morning and come back for a spell in the afternoon, before going out again at night. Housekeeping never got to our room before 3:00 and often well after. We know because of the great location of the hotel we were able to pop in now and then to pick up or drop things off.  It's not like it got a complete makeover every time either. Sometimes the sheets were not changed, just made up. Not a problem per se, we're all about reducing the use of resources etc, but that tactic should save a lot of time when making up a room. We just felt keeping the rooms tidy in a reasonable timeframe was not a priority of hotel management.
Single paned windows allow a fair bit of street noise in, which actually wasn't a problem for us, we love the hustle and bustle. However they also tend to generate large temperature swings in the room. The heat, when blowing, was a bit too effective. If you were in the blast radius the air temperature would start to become unbearable after 3 or 4 minutes. When the heat stopped blowing there was a period of about 10-15 minutes when all was well. Then the drafty windows took over and the temperature would drop fairly rapidly. All well and good when you are tucked under the covers, but quite cool (or hot) when just being in the room. The bathroom was consistently cool because there was no heat register, but there is a large window that let a lot of cold air in.
The room itself was a bit shabby for the price I felt. The furniture was well used, some kind of beat up, which happens,but making sure that not all the drawer knobs are loose is a simple thing I expect to be addressed for the price we paid. All it takes is a screwdriver and couple of washers. There was no hairdryer in the room despite what we were told by the confident bellhop, nor did the safe work. The in-room coffee was not always replaced. These are admittedly small things, but they started to add up to create a picture of hotel management that is far more concerned with the music venue than the day to day functioning of a good hotel.
All in all we enjoyed our stay, but if we did not have the corner deluxe room we would not even consider staying again. There are too many nice hotels at this price point

title: Beautiful, fun, friendly!
text: We stayed at the Flatiron for 2 nights during Thanksgiving week, and wished we would have stayed longer.  The front desk person (Saabina) was super friendly, and helpful.  I wish i would have asked for the bellman's name, because he was really our first impression, and was very nice.  We booked 2 rooms (Madison double, Toshi corner) both were beautiful, with great views!  Beds/sheets were very comfortable.   The Madison room had a rainfall shower & the Toshi had a jacuzzi tub; such nice touches!  Live entertainment in the evenings, lots of restaurants & shopping near by, and metro just a few blocks away.  We stayed at the Doubletree for the first 3 nights (Terrible experience!), and only wished we would have stayed here the entire time.  Close to Chelsea, Greenwich Village, NYU, SOHO, Empire State Building, EVERYTHING! Only thing i missed was room service, but that didn't change my opinion of the amazing hotel.  I can't wait to stay here again!

title: Great for the price and great location too
text: The fifth floor room was very nice. There was a band playing in the bar/lounge and we couldn't hear a thing. Clean and up to date. Great location for my work and social needs.Couldn't find the local channels  on the bathroom TV but didn't have a lot of time nor cared to figure it out.

title: Nice Hotel, Good Location
text: This hotel was the perfect location for us as we were visiting a relative who lives about six blocks away.  The room, which was on the sixth floor, was nicely done and had all the latest technological gadgets (remote control to close and open the drapes, TV imbedded in the bathroom mirror, electronic notification for the maid).  Some of the reviews complained about the noise from the night club downstairs but we never heard it.  Hotel staff were friendly and helpful and the hotel provided several e-mail reminders about our upcoming stay.  Overall, it was the nicest hotel we have stayed at in the city.

title: Perfect Holiday Honeymoon Hotel!
text: The room, location, staff, and lounge were all amazing.  The staff took care of us and made us feel right at home. Mr. Benz, Devon, David, and Natalie took time to make a guest connection with my wife and I. The Flatiron Hotel is in a perfect location to get anywhere in the city no matter the mode of transportation and is only a few steps from Eataly! The room was very clean and spacious and the details in the room were nice (marble walls, vaulted ceilings, automated curtains, and tv in the bathroom mirror).  Toshi's Living Room is a great spot to enjoy a drink and amazing bar food (the Siracha mac&cheese and Ponzu sliders hit the spot). Toshi himself was super friendly and was kind enough to give us complimentary champagne to celebrate the honeymoon!!! I will be looking forward to staying at The Flatiron again on our next trip to the city. Thank you Flatiron staff for an unforgettable holiday honeymoon!!!

title: My Love Letter to the Flatiron Hotel
text:
Here is what I just wrote to the Director of Operations:

This is a love letter, because we love the Flatiron Hotel. We have stayed at many different hotels in NYC, but this was our first experience with the Flatiron and it was so fantastic! Here's what we loved:
1. Contacted by e-mail asking for early check-in. Got an immediate reply on a busy day from the night manager Benz A. saying he couldn't promise but would try. It was gracious, courteous, prompt, and immediately gave me a good feeling about the hotel, even if we hadn't gotten our early check-in (we did!).
2. Arrived and felt 100% pampered by everyone; our luggage was whisked up to our room while we checked in, everyone was friendly, cheerful, even working on a holiday!
3. Though all of your staff gets an A+, special mention to Kendra at the front desk. What a gem! I would come again just to see her. There wasn't anything she didn't do. She explained everything about the room, the hotel, the neighborhood. You are lucky to have this wonderful young woman representing you.
4. Great room, perfect size, very comfy beds, lots of pillows, awesome shower. My husband loved the TV on the bathroom mirror!
So, expect to see us again! You are now our go-to hotel.
When I have complaints, I write, but it's only fair to do the same when I have only good things to say. I could go on and on...great neighborhood, grand chairs in the lobby, aquarium that delighted my 8-year-old...next time we will try the restaurant. What you are doing there is remarkable. Thanks to all your staff for making our Thanksgiving stay a perfect treat! Hope you will share these sentiments with them.

title: gorgeous hotel
text: It was not a as wonderful as i was expecting it on my first stay in this hotel. so i thought of calling the hotel prior to my arrival since i have my pregnant wife with me this time. Mr. Benz the Front Desk Manager took care of everything, he would always come out of his way to make our stay a wonderful one, we were granted an early check in without any fee, higher floor to get a good night sleep on our 5 nights stay. every time we needed assistance front desk staff are always there with a warm smile. i cant thank them enough, my wife was very pleased. Flatiron hotel is definitely my second home whenever i visit the big apple.

title: Great hotel for a great price
text: Very good hotel. Small rooms that were very comfortable perfect size for a few nights. Staff was extremely helpful. Free internet in NYC?!?! Who would have thought. I will stay there again just for that. My only issue was that I was on the third floor and could hear the band on the lobby bar. Ask for a room on the 4th floor or higher.

title: A solid C
text: I've been in a lot of small NYC hotel rooms, but this one would compete for the winner. Room was clean. If you want a very, and I mean very loud night club/lounge in the lobby,this is the place for you. Unless you're above the sixth floor, on the lounge side of the building, you'll be enjoying the music in your room along with everyone in the lobby. Front desk agent was literally yelling at me when I checked in and I could barely hear him. I was also charged for a mini-bar item I didn't consume. It was removed when I asked at check out, but it always feels shifty when random little charges appear on your bill. If you're in your 20s and want to rock it and won't spend any time in your room go for it. The location is great.

title: Pretty hotel, great staff, night club lobby
text:
We stayed here on a last minute Hotel Tonight booking (no problem using that app here) as a little city getaway, as we do from time to time.  Bottom line:  this is a beautifully renovated little hotel in a great location with wonderful staff and a loud nighttime lobby. 

The building itself  is loosely shaped like the nearby Flatiron Building that defines this area.  It is right adjacent to Madison Square Park (the first ever Shake Shack is there) and across the street and down a few doors to the popular and delicious Hill Country BBQ, fyi.  The all 20-something and 30-something staff are friendly, smart, and service-oriented -- had I had the opportunity I would have loved to sit and chat with the front desk staff as they seemed like such great people.  The decor is sort of like what you'd find at Kimpton properties (this is not one) -- a combo of modern with self-conscious ornate touches.  

Our room was predictably small but well-appointed and comfortable.  For example, our queen bed was a platform bed with storage drawers underneath (note the room safe was housed in one of them).  The bathroom was tiled in what looked like alabaster stone (pretty) and the shower had one of those "car wash" type nozzle arrangements that aligned vertically - nice.  My only issue with the bathroom was that the mirror above the sink was a bit far away and I kept looking for a magnifying mirror, which wasn't there.  There was, however, a TV embedded into the bathroom mirror, complete with a waterproof remote and directions on how to use it.  In putting my contacts in in the morning, I'd much rather have had a magnifying mirror!

The one big downside to this place is the nightclub that happens in the lobby, complete with a live band.  Coming back from dinner around 11 p.m. we had to wade through a bunch of folks with glasses in hand. It was hard to communicate verbally with the front desk staff even though we were standing right at the front desk because nobody could hear anybody speak.  I don't know how the front desk staff stands it.  Once we got past the party-goers (and thankful he was there, a security guy) and up to our room, we laughed at how from the third floor it was still pretty loud.  My hubby pointed out that you could hear/feel the subway as well.  At some point the noise was punctuated with an elevator alarm.  With the exception of the subway, this all stopped around 2 a.m. We expected this from reading other Tripadvisor reviews.  

So, if you understand what you're getting here, you'll be perfectly satisfied with this hotel.  If you are looking for quiet, don't stay here.  For us, although we liked so much about this place, we would hesitate to return because we don't really value a party soundtrack to a hotel room.

title: Good hotel;  bad bed
text:
This is a nice hotel in a fun of town where I had meetings.

Rooms are very small but newly furnished like many of the newer NYC hotels. Front desk area is a bit crowded and staff not so attentive,  but the worst problem is the beds are rock-hard. Two of us stayed last night and we both had the same complaint.

title: Large room, good location, very loud
text: We stayed in a fourth floor corner room overlooking broadway and 26th on a Saturday night.  The music in the bar on the first floor was very loud until about 1:30 AM.  Otherwise we liked the room, which had many creature features like the mirrored tv built into the bathroom vanity.  I also liked the classic architectural design of the room, but the blue lighting in the hallway was garish and tacky.  The thing that really disappointed me was that our room keys were deprogrammed at least ten minutes before checkout.  We had been out to breakfast and hurried back to our room with ten minutes to spare.  Neither key worked.  I brought mine downstairs and was told by the receptionist that the locks are programmed to automatically reset a few minutes before checkout. This makes absolutely no sense and I complained to a manager, who was nice enough.

title: Not what I thought...
text: I didn't realize I was checking into a place where the ENTIRE lobby was a pitch black nightclub with a screaming band. I wasn't prepared for so much noise. This place can't decide what it wants to be-- hotel or nightclub.

title: New York, e la 5th strada non e' vicino al Flatiron
text:
Buon Hotel, con camere spaziose ed accoglienti. Il bagno e' un po' piccolo, e per noi Italiani, non trovare il bidet e' stato un grande discofort. Il personale si dismostrato gentile e professionale. Noi abbiamo trascorso il week end di halloween e tutte le sere il bar ha organizzato serate con musica dal vivo (vari generi). L'albergo tutto sommato e' bello, ma per il prezzo che ho pagato, con la stessa somma, in futuro, cerchero' di trovare strutture un po' piu' vicine a Central Park, vero centro di gravita' delle passeggiate a New York.
Dimenticavo di dire che il sistema di aria condizionata era molto rumoroso, come del resto la stanza nonostante fossimo al 7mo piano. 
Curioso il sistema di addebito delle consumazioni al minibar della camera. Se muovi qualsiasi bevanda o snack dal suo posto, ti viene automaticamente addebitato l'importo come se avessi comsumato quello che hai toccato (tempo per ripensarci 20 secondi). Comunque niente paura, bisgna spiegare alla reception l'accaduto e la consumazione ti verra' detratta dal conto. Pero' che noia spiegare alla signorina che e' stata tua figlia a far cadere tutte le patatine e i salatini....
Buona Vacanza

title: Worst Guest Service Ever
text:
I stayed there with my family this weekend, and my friend went to pick me up for brunch this morning. I realized that I forgot my wallet in the room, so I asked her to wait for me in the lobby while I went back to the room to grab my wallet. However, the bellman kicked her out of the hotel lobby, even after she stated that she's waiting for me, a paying guest in the hotel. He was being extremely rude to her. I was only gone for less than 5 minutes, and seriously your staffs wouldn't let a well-dressed 20-year-old girl to wait in the lobby for 5 minutes when it was raining and cold outside?
RUDE STAFF (the male doorman who is working around noon this Sunday)! so I WILL NEVER GO BACK TO THE HOTEL. 
To the doorman who kicked her out: you ruined the day.

title: Desk Clerk Literally Gave Me His Tie
text: Very comfortable, clean, user friendly hotel in a central location.  Though the neighborhood is a business area that is largely quiet and dark at night, but for a few trendy restaurants and bars, it is easy to catch a cab on Broadway a few feet away.   The room was very nicely furnished with more storage than most rooms, an extremely comfortable bed, and appealing modern design.  But nothing beats the staff:  I had forgotten to pack a tie and mentioned it to the desk clerk who proceeded to loosen his tie and hand it to me.  While I didn't take it -- it was a very nice tie, by the way! -- I will never forget the gesture!

title: Made good on a challenging event
text: The staff at Flatiron Hotel were warm, hospitable and willing to go the extra mile to help us feel welcome in the City; and also to address an issue that did occur. I really appreciated this! Also, the rooms are very nice by NYC standards.

title: Soggiorno gradevole hotel ke non delude unica televisione in bagno mitica letti comodissimi personale gentilissimo unica pecca l
text:
Personale gentilissimo,camere molto comode televisione in bagno hotel che non delude...letti comodi,posizione ottima,anke se c e un po di caos tr
a strada e piano bar ma sicuramente non si va a new york xsentire il silenzio!consiglio questo hotel è molto gradevole

title: friendly staff
text: Great location and friendly staff.bellhop very helpful.explained how everything worked in our room when bringing up our luggage. Room clean and very comfortable.nice big windows.easy access to everything needed.staff very helpful in finding us places to eat.would stay here again

title: One week in NY
text:
Main positive points of the hotel:
1) position
2) rooms cleaned very well day by day
3) courtesy of the staff
4) events calendar > every night the hotel organize something

Negative points:
1) noise if you have a room in the first floor

All in all my experience in Flatiron was excellent; for sure this is not the best hotel in the city but I think it's a good value for money solution.

title: nice find
text:
Distinctive rooms. Friendly staff. Lobby performance space. 

You'll get some NYC street sounds -- the subway rumble, the occasional sirens -- but I couldn't beat this location.

I took a chance on this, and I'm glad I did. I'll be back.

title: Good value and friendly staff
text: I needed a place to stay in NYC for a couple of weeks, but just could not stomach paying $500 a night. I found this hotel on Trip Advisor and booked based on the scores and price at the time. Good choice. The room was nice with big windows - not large but enough space of me AND my bags - comfortable.  The location is decent and just a block or so from the Flatiron Building and just a few blocks South of the Empire State Building. Easy access to everything I needed.  What the hotel lacks in amenities it makes up for with an extremely helpful and friendly staff. Everyone made me feel welcomed and at home. A good price/value compared to many hotels in New York.

title: the best stay in the big apple ever
text: the hotel location is great and hotel rooms are very clean and cousy everything in the room runs electronic and even a television in the bathroom mirror and jets shower. the hotel stuf are young nice and very helpful. will come back for sure!

title: Awesome spot, killer location
text:
Just returned from having spent six nights in this hotel. Toshi, the owner is a gracious and caring individual who truly values music and the hotel reflects it.

The room was not super large, however extremely nicely appointed with very luxurious touches like motorized drapes, a Tempur-pedic mattress, and a great bathroom.

The location simply can't be beat, it is centrally located, and made getting to all areas of Manhattan a breeze.

We were not certain if we wanted to stay, as some reviewers complained of noise given the live music that takes place in the hotel nightly, however we requested a quiet room and our room was quite easy to get a great night sleep. 

Would highly recommend, especially if you're a music lover, we will definitely be back.

title: Открывая Америку
text: Отель располагается в удачном месте, недалеко от Мэдисон сквеар и Эмпайр Стэйт Билдинг. Рядом огромнейший супермаркет Мэсис. В отеле адекватное обслуживание, номера чистые, исправна сантехника, убираются каждый день. Хорошая "четверка". Единственный минус на первом этаже по вечерам проходят вечеринки, куда приходят не постояльцы отеля, а местные жители. На верхних этажах музыка не мешает, но приходилось долго ждать лифта.

title: Nicely decorated, great location
text: Shopping, restaurants, Eataly, Maysville Bourbon bar, close to Union Square, and all that goes with that - Republic, farmers market, ABC Carpet and Home, Fishy's Eddie... cant lose.  This place has a two story cylindrical fish tank between the lobby and the entertainment lounge with a curved staircase that sort of hugs it. Half tacky half cool when lit up at night.  The band plays loud and proud, and if you are a big shot, a server will deliver your bottle of champers or grey goose with a lit rocket flare over her head as she works through the crowd to your table in an unforgivingy tight and tiny red dress. Good people watching.  Snobby inbreds here, goodfellas there, silver fox dancing with his young babe too close, co-workers gone wild... all good.

title: Cool little hotel in the Flatiron district, with some minor issues
text:
Bought a room here because there was a special that made it cheap (by New York city standard), and was relatively happy with what we got.

Stayed 11 nights and it's perfect as a base to explore NYC. 2 blocks away from the 28th St station on the N/R line, and also 2 blocks away from the 23rd St station on the F/M line.

Room size was a little small than what I'm used to, but I believe it's standard across the board in NYC so can't really complain.

They sure did splash out on the room: in-mirror television in the bathroom, three different jets in the shower, auto-opening curtains. Although I would trade all these features for some hooks to hang our towels and clothes - how can they leave that out..

Some of the minor niggles: paint was falling off near the window sills, the shower cubicle is not properly sealed so you end up with an extremely wet floor no matter how you do it.

Also the stretch of Broadway between 28th and 33rd Streets can be....intimidating at night especially for NYC first timers. If you're planning to spend a lot of time closer to Midtown/Times Square then perhaps you may want to consider hotels in closer to Herald Square/Koreatown.

Some users complained about the noise from the nightly bands, but if you ask for a higher room then this becomes a non-issue.
I requested this when booking and was given a 10th floor room and didn't hear anything other than the garbage trucks rolling in the morning.

title: Hip Boutique Hotel
text: This is a great little hotel in NY - for me the location cannot be beat - but overall it has a "cool" feeling about it the moment you walk in - Front desk very friendly and efficient - they have a fish tank that is really beautiful right in the middle of the lobby and an adjacent bar with live singers and bands - the room itself is small but hip - the drapery opens with a remote control - they have a TV built into the bathroom mirror - totally loved that - the shower although very small had shower heads from every direction including a rain shower overhead - the room is small but good enough for NY and clean as a whistle - really like staying there - and will continue to go back

title: Bring your earplugs
text:
They won't block the bass and drums making the walls pound, but they will dull the loud music that plays every night. 

If you are coming to NYC on business, unless you are expecting to stay out every night until around 2:00, go elsewhere.  There is a band playing in the lobby every night - a large band with horns, etc. If you must stay here, ask for a top floor to get away from the noise.  It is so loud the people working the front desk cannot carry on a conversation with you or anyone calling on the phone -- so don't call downstairs and expect to get service.

title: Flatiron
text:
A friend and myself decided to book the Flatiron for our first visit to NYC. We originally booked the hotel because of it's central location. Us being first timers wanted to experience as much as we could and Flatiron seemed to be in the middle of everything. 
I haven't stayed in a boutique hotel before and when we arrived check in was a bit busy. The lobby is tiny and was crowded with patrons and their suitcases. I was a bit annoyed after an early morning flight, however the rest of our visit went smoothly. Our room was spacious for NYC standards but the bathroom was tight. Our beds were super comfy and we both didn't have problems sleeping (I should also mention we came in late most nights). 
Samantha at the front desk was very personable and she gave us a few dining recommendations which we appreciated. 
I liked that live music was offered in Toshi's, the lobby bar, however we always had someplace to be so we didn't enjoy it. It turns into more of a club/lounge at night. When we came back to the hotel one evening, we were whisked into the bar by the bouncers and they sat us at a table... we thought why not have a nightcap.... Well, we waited about 15 minutes and no server came by to take our drink order so we left... it was maybe at half capacity. Poor service.
There is a Starbucks across the street which was nice in the morning. I did like this location as it was a good central spot for everything we had planned- went up to the Upper East Side, to the Financial District and everywhere in between. It's not as congested as some other locations in NYC- wasn't a fan of the immediate area (think State St. in Chicago)... but there were things within walking distance that we enjoyed. Eataly market is just a few blocks away as well as a park (can't remember the name) on 23rd and Madison with a Shake Shack that was perfect for a late lunch!
I would recommend Flatiron when staying in NYC.

title: NYC 2013
text:
I had a spacious room on the 8th floor and could not have asked for a more comfortable room. The bed was super comfortable and longs days were relieved by a soak in the whirlpool tub.
The staff at Flatiron were all super friendly helpful. Thanks for playing such an integral part of my first trip to NYC.

title: Terrible
text: Honestly, the hotel has "charm" but the owner does not know how to run a hotel. There is live music every night (which -cool-) but they fail to tell you at check in that the band plays until 2am in the morning. My husband and I were on the 4th floor right in front of the elevator, and it was bad enough we could here the band through the floor, but then every time the elevator opened, it felt like we were sitting right in "the living room". We complained about the noise and they offered to change our room but would be unable to move us until the following day because they were "booked to capacity". The next night we met Toshi -the owner- and instead of acting like a professional he was galavanting around the lounge with his dog in one hand and a martini in the other. We were appalled by this behavior. We completely understood why the lounge was so loud at that point - because the man just wants to party!! Needless to say we will not be returning to the flatiron hotel. The whole idea of the place disgusts me. There is no consideration for the guest. And you can see it in the employees faces, they want to help but they CAN'T HEAR YOU!!

title: The Flatiron Hotel is a fun place to stay in NYC
text: Our night at the Flatiron Hotel in August 2013 was awesome!  We lucked into a last minute reservation there and ended up paying a fraction of the regularly advertised price.  We didn't know what to expect.  From the beautiful two story fish tank and opulent nightclub just off the lobby to the elegent room upstairs, this place was fun!  Yes, you could hear the band in the nightclub until the wee hours of the evening and yes, you could hear the rumble of the subway beneath the building.  But as someone who hates quiet, this was the place to be.  My husband and adult son loved the t.v. in the bathroom mirror and the big screen t.v. in the room.  Fun features included a doorbell in each room, a jacuzzi tub and automatic drapes. We loved having a drink in the nightclub and listening to the band.  However, beware, there is a $40 minimum in the club and it is assessed in later hours when the club is full.  I would not recommend this hotel to families with children under the age of 21 as the real attractions are things that can really only be appreciated by adults.  The hotel is pet friendly. Actually, there is a dog that serves as mascot for the hotel and it is often on site.

title: Great hotel great location
text:
Great location for hotel Flatiron in new York, 3 blocks from mack's,  6 blocks from soho

great hotel with the nicest staff,  highly recommended for stay in ny

rooms are small but very comfortable, lots of amenities especially TV in mirror in bathroom

title: Nice boutique hotel. Shame the rooftop terrace wasn't open to guests
text: The Flatiron positions itself as a boutique hotel. We stayed in a queen room on the 10th floor which was comfortable but compact. Although we stayed six nights, we didn't really see or hear from any of the staff. The front-of-house was pretty absent. The website made a big deal of the rooftop terrace and bar with views of the Empire State Building, so it was a bit of a disappointment to find that was not open to guests, only private hire.

title: Moderno e confortável
text: Me hospedei nesse hotel logo que ele abriu as portas. O staff ainda não estavam bem treinados mas apesar disso o hotel é super bem localizado e confortável. Tem um bar sensacional no térreo com bons drinks. O quarto tinha ótima vista e era bem confortável. O Banheiro era maravilhoso. Vale muito a pena!

title: Ideally situated
text: This hotel is ideally situated if you want to visit NY city. Our room was on the 10th floor and it was great, really big and comfortable. The staff is friendly. We would certainly consider going there again.

title: Ideal place to stay
text:
My fiance and I (29 and 30 years old) stayed at the flatiron hotel in August 2013. We stayed for 4 nights. Our rooms were on the 10th floor. 
The rooms were very clean and the beds very compfortable. The staff were friendly. We had no complaints. 
I give this hotel 5 points because for a 4 star hotel in New york I found that the rooms were big enough, it was very clean, and the whole "experience" was nice. Furthermore, since we booked via hotwire.com, the prices were also great. 
The area we stayed at was quite central, without being overflowed with tourists right in front of the hotel (as in comparison to hotel right at times square). 
There is also a roof top bar about 3 minutes away from the hotel which was amazing.

title: Excellent Flatiron!
text:
Viaggio per lavoro a New York da anni, almeno una volta al mese, e mi fermo in città solitamente per una settimana. Ho sempre avuto difficoltà a trovare un hotel di qualità e ovviamente a buon prezzo. Da quando sono stato al Flatiron, non ho più cercato altri hotel. Il personale è cordiale, attento e premuroso, i clienti sono sempre ben accolti. Le camere sono pulite, con ampie finestre con una vista favolosa sulla città, tutte completamente accessoriate e dotate di wifi, caratteristiche essenziali per i miei viaggi.
Strategica anche la posizione, in centro a Manhattan.
Lo consiglio vivamente per chiunque voglia un soggiorno piacevole a New York! Antonio

title: Sleepless in NYC
text: This is not a Hotel, It's a Night club disguised as a Hotel. We stayed there four nights in August and were put on the fourth floor. The music from the restaurant is so loud at night that you'll never get a good nights sleep. They brought us the last pair of earplugs left at the front desk but to no avail it was still noisy. We were finally moved to the sixth floor. The band that night must of been even louder because again we had another sleepless night.  The employees were very apologetic but there is no way to resolve this situation because the hotel lobby isn't big enough to be separated from the restaurant and the rocking music. I have no idea why tripadvisor gave this place great reviews, it was our families worst nightmare!!!

title: Great for the price
text:
We found an excellent deal for Flatiron Hotel and for being very central, the price was fantastic. Nothing standout or special as far as character and atmosphere but comfortable and was what we needed for our last night in the city. 
Room and bathroom was spacious, interesting that there was a tv in the mirror of the bathroom. Excellent location next to the NRW train, super easy access to Soho and East Village.

title: Nice hotel with room for improvement
text:
Room was comfortable, though small, with lots of gizmos and gadgets. They included a TV in the bathroom mirror, a deluxe shower with shower heads coming at you from all angles (learning curve here), electronic maid service sign, and electric curtains. 
Location in Chelsea District is great. A brand new full grocery store with reasonable prices is within a block. Subways aren't too far away. Within walking distance of Penn Station. 
The two annoying negatives: no ice machine, so ice has to be ordered from the front desk & delivered to your room. I hate tipping for something like that. Also, it can all take way too much time. I tried for a half hour to get through to the front desk & finally gave up. The next time I approached the front desk in person & ice was delivered about a half hour later - way slow. Second negative: maid did not replenish the in-room coffee. Unfortunately, I didn't notice this until the next morning at 5am when I got up to catch the train. Very sad :-(
They have a nice bar off the lobby with live music & dancing if you're interested in that sort of thing - I used to be in younger days. 
My wife & I really like this hotel. We've stayed here twice & will stay here again, but they're a little short of perfect on the small but important things.

title: Good NYC Hotel
text: Great location, reasonable rates. The rooms are on the small side, but they are clean and comfortable. Friendly staff. We spent a long weekend visiting family in the neighborhood and this hotel was perfect. Close to Flatiron Building and Madison Square Park.

title: Hospedagem excelente
text: O hotel e muito bem localizado. O atendimento e otimo. Tudo no apartamento e automatico, das luzes as cortinas, incluindo a hidromassagem no chuveiro e tv no espelho. Tudo funcionou muito bem, Tem um bar com musica ao vivo muito animado no lobby. Ficaria la outra vez. Recomendo.

title: Average at best
text:
1.	Hotel is located in a good area for restaurants and accessing the rest of the City.
2.	Do not stay on the 3rd floor unless you want to hear the band all night
3.	Hotel is in need of remodel, the rooms and public spaces are looking a bit tired. 
4.	Bed was comfortable and linens were good. 
5.	Alas hotels are now figuring out people hate paying for wifi and the Flatiron wifi is inclusive in your rate. 
6.	If the rate was below $200 I would stay here again, otherwise it is not worth the $

title: Excellent experience
text: Our family of 4 spent the weekend in NYC and had a greatbexperience staying at the Flatiron. Staff were helpful and friendly, room was perfect as we're the views. Will be back for sure. Within walking distance of Eataly food gormat shop and Madison Park close by for the children to play in. There are a couple typical diners around for breakfast as well so location is good

title: Great experience! Would definitely come back!
text: This was a wonderful hotel! What a great location and excellent staff and service. We enjoyed the downstairs bar and entertainment. We didn't find it noisy at all! Loved our room and would definitely choose the flatiron hotel again!!!

title: A great place to stay in the heart of Manhattan
text:
This is an awesome hotel located just off Broadway. The rooms are incredible and super tech savy. When you walk in you are graced by oversized windows that allow a bright and luxurious room. Some other features include Wifi, an LCD TV, and an iPod charger/dock. This hotel has by far one of the coolest bathroom's I have ever been in...it has amenities like Swiss rainfall showers or Jacuzzi bathtubs and televisions in the bathroom mirror! How awesome is that! 

I also highly recommend Toshi's Livingroom for meals. The food is really great with a great variety of cocktails and entertainment. Live music starts as early as 6 pm every night. I suggest this hotel for anyone looking for a fun time in New York City!

title: Nice Hotel - bands were just annoying
text:
I liked this hotel, it was clean, brilliantly located and had wonderfully friendly staff. The décor was very good and the beds fantastically comfy. The owner Toshi has a concept of this hotel which is that it should be a centre of creativity in the area. However, this leads to bands playing every night which to be honest just got annoying, its all well and good a couple of nights a week but c'mon six! Also the bar did not open until 5pm which is not really brilliant after you've hoofed it around in 100 degree heat all day! The bar menu is severely limited. All in all the experience was pleasant but for what we paid we should not have to ask for a high level room and should not be made to feel that the lobby was basically out of bounds if we didn't want to be deafened. Its a good job there are three nice bars within easy walking distance.

Also, Mr Flatiron Hotel, please do not advertise so heavily around the rooftop terrace that isn't open to "normal" residents like us, only the fancy in crowd who get invited to parties. Its a good job trip advisor had pre-warned us or I would have been annoyed about that after the website does not really mention that fact, but does cover itself in lovely pictures of rooftop terraces.

In essence, if Toshi wants to run a hip music bar he should, but this is a hotel!

title: Family with kids put right above the club--SO LOUD until 2:30 am
text:
I wanted to like this hotel-the location is great, the rooms are big by NY standards. But I arrived very early with 2 kids, left my bags, and was told I'd be called when a room was ready. No call. Finally we came back to the hotel around 6:30 pm and they put us in a room on the 3rd floor, directly above the band in the club  Toshi's, downstairs. When you sit on the bed you can feel the pulse of the music below. Said they didn't have any other rooms, but that the music would stop at 2:30 am. Receptionist asked if we were going out? I looked at my kids and then looked back at her. All she said was "there's nothing I can do." It's REALLY not fair to put little kids in this room.
Also, the TV didn't work (although someone came to fix it), I had to climb on the toilet to fix the drapes so that kids weren't using the toilet with all of Broadway watching, there's free wifi but it is truly impossible to get a connection, and the bathtub drain won't hold water. The windows are lovely, looking out onto Broadway, that's one positive and it's pretty clean. But the noise level is truly outrageous. They have no business renting this room as a place for a people to sleep (and they know it).

title: Nice Hotel - but is LOUD
text:
Flatiron is a great option for a nice affordable hotel in NTC, booked using www.hforhotels.com and got a great deal.
This hotel has a very nice bar in the first floor with very nice live music at nights, also next door theres a nice bar, BUT, if you stay in a floor lower than fifth, you will be hearing a LOT of noises; music from the lobby (yes its LOUD) drunken people from bar next door and cars.

Overall the hotel is great, the location is safe, close to subway (2 blocks away) and with a short nice walk you can get anywhere fast

title: Hotel and night-club: bad combination
text:
We stayed at the Flatiron for 4 nights in August. If you want a hotel where you can actually sleep, this is not the place for you. The live-music in the lounge feels more like a night-club 6 nights a week. In fact, the music is so loud that you can here it one block away when walking on Broadway! We had read in other reviews that you could not hear the noise above the 4th floor, so after making our reservation we called and asked for a room above the 4th floor. We had a room on the 6th floor, right above the lounge and with a view on Broadway. Well, the noise does go above the 4th floor. In fact, it was so loud that it felt it was right undeneath us. On the first night, we asked for another room, but there were none available and we were told we could probably have one the next day. On the next morning, the front desk called our room to offer us one on the 9th floor. Since we wanted to see the room, we waited for it to be available. While in the elevator, we met a guest that was on the 8th floor facing 26th Street, and she too could here the music. We then decided to stay in our room and buy ear plugs, which helped a little.

The Windows are old and let in all the noise from the street, especiallly the subway.

This hotel is said to be 4 stars but doesn't feel like it. The rooms are nicely decorated and the bed is comfortable but one expects more from a 4 stars hotel. There a a few out of the ordinary things like a tv in the mirror in the bathroom but maybe money should have been put on better Windows and noise diminishing walls.

The staff however was very professionnal and friendly. And the location is great to explore NYC. We could walk almost everywhere we wanted to go.

We will not return to this hotel and will not recommend it.

title: Noise Noise Noise
text: The hotel was in a perfect location and the rooms just great .The noise from the live music in the lobby was just overwhelmingly loud .So loud in fact , that it was difficult to check in on friday at 6 pm as I couldn't hear the receptionist yikes! the music lasted each night until closing time . I was thankful that our room was on the 6th floor and that I had brought my ear plugs .Other than that it was a great small hotel with nicely done rooms , very clean and a convenient location

title: Wonderful Stay
text: We stayed here in August of 2013.  The hotel was in the best location!  We were close to everything!  The staff was so accommodating and just really nice.  Each day they asked if we needed anything!  The rooms were clean and had some cool amenities (TV in the mirror, remote controlled curtains, and fun showers).  Loved the hotel.  Seriously cannot say it enough.

title: Perfect Location
text:
The location of this hotel is perfect if you are staying in Manhattan and want to be close to everything. Live music every single night of the week is really awesome and keeps you busy. The staff are extremely friendly and knowledgeable. They always try to help you to have a great stay and advise you on where to go around the city. Joe, with guest services, gave us a lot of great tips and told us where to go to have fun and enjoy our vacation. Khaili mamnoon (Thank you) Joe.
As far as the room goes, it was on the 10th floor with good views of our surroundings. Awesome 8 head shower, with a TV inside the mirror. Under the beds there was many drawers for our cloths in addition to the big closet in the room. The only problems we had with the room was first the curtains were extremely dirty and had huge stains on them. The stains were also on the pillows and the sheets. Other than that everything was fantastic and we really enjoyed our stay.

title: Great Hotel
text: Me and my boyfriend stayed in the hotel March of 2012. It was just a a fun one night stay in the city to get out of the house, we live in Queens. Upon entering the hotel I have to say I loved the fish tank more than anything. And just the all around decor of the hotel is great. Don't think we got a chance to get a drink at the bar, and I just now found out about the outdoor area called "Toshi's Penthouse" which makes me want go back now. Loved the complimentary champagne and chocolates in our room, and also the t.v in the bathroom mirror. Don't really have any complaints, only dissapointment for me was that the jacuzzi/tub was way too small. Staff was professional and friendly, whenever we had a problem or question they seemed more than happy to help. Specifically Benz the night auditor, we had an absolute BLAST talking to him throughout the night. Extremely smart guy and very professional. I would definitely say he was the highlight of our stay, he gave us great tips on where to stay if we ever visit the Philippines! So all around I would say this is definitely a great place to stay whether its for fun or on business, I would definitely stay again.

title: Nice and great location but.....
text:
I want to really like this hotel, I really, really do.  The front of the house staff are excellent and the crowd that gathers at Toshi's during the night seems fairly good spirited as far as New York people seem.  However there were a few problems.  1) No room service 2) Forgot to clean the room (despite being requested) 3) You can hear the music from the bar all the way up to the penthouse suite.

Overall the hotel feels like a good deal for the money and the people working there are super friendly, the problem is it just didn't quite make for a 5 star experience.

title: Saved but disappointing
text:
I stayed in the hotel may of 2013 for a business trip. When walking in I was a little thrown off of how "club-like" it was (it kind of reminded me of a knock-off W.) I consider this 2 reviews

Part 1 (1 star):
 My first room was rather dirty:
-door handle falling off
-wad of gum on the counter
-handprint on the head board
-dark stains on the chair
-(memory foam mattress) I am convinced due to a burn and turn/heavily accessed room
-if you are low (4th floor) it is loud

My friends tease me about being high maintenance but after I tried wiping things away, I was grossed out. I called the manager and she came up abruptly, apologized and said they would switch me to another room but they were booked for the night. They surprisingly didn't offer to re-clean the room. I went out and bought lysol wipes and wiped down everything.

The next night I was moved, up to a new floor (6) and it was a DRASTICALLY better room. It was clean, it was quiet, things were in place, the mattress was NOT memory foam. It was a really pleasant stay the additional days. The management was helpful, and the doorman was great. Definitely a 4 star experience. 

However, now I am nervous to stay there again, because I am worried about what experience I will receive.

title: Great people
text: The staff at the hotel were extremely helpful.  Devin, the doorman, was always smiling. He made us feel right at home.  Whenever we needed anything, it was delivered to our room immediately. Would definitely stay again.

title: Perfect!
text: We stayed at the Flatiron June 9, 2013 and were very, very happy that we picked this hotel.  Since it was our first trip to NYC and I was traveling with my 15 year old daughter, I really wanted a safe, comfortable and convenient hotel in Manhattan.  This hotel was PERFECT.  The location was awesome, the room was large, clean and had great views (we stayed in a corner room on the 8th floor).  They also have nightly entertainment in the lobby which was a lot of fun, and I did not feel uncomfortable stopping in there for a bit with my 15 year old to enjoy the music.  The staff...  well, I cannot say enough about them.  They were excellent, friendly, knowledgable, helpful and above all courteous.  Being complete tourists from Wisconsin, they helped us get around NY, gave advice and made this a trip to remember.  Without question we will stay at the Flatiron Hotel on our next visit!  Highly recommend!

title: Muy bien ubicado
text: Buenos espacios para Manhattan. El personal muy amable. El posible "pero" del hotel es el bar en el lobby, los pisos bajos del hotel probablemente tengan problemas con el ruido en la noche. El roofterrace desafortunadamente no está abierto a los huéspedes.

title: Flatiron Hotel was a wonderful experience
text:
Stayed at the Flatiron on July 6, 2013.  The room was clean and coooool(thankfully because there was a heatwave that weekend)  The staff was friendly and helpful. Reginald at the frontdesk
and Joe the doorman were exceptional people. Would stay there again. It was a great experience.

title: "Unique hotel, great location, friendly service"
text: The Flatiron is a jewel in Chelsea. The rooms were spacious, by Manhattan standards, uniquely designed and clean. We were on the 5th floor and not at all disrupted by the club in the lobby. Which by the way, was a cool venue, fun bands and a great entertainment at your doorstep, if you so choose. The staff was super friendly. We were able to get into our room at noon, upon check-in.  The bellhop was great at getting us taxis when needed. There is a Starbucks directly across the street. The Eataly (fantastic fresh/market food) was 2 blocks away. A must stop!! The shower was amazing with 8 jets. Also a tv in the mirror in the bathroom. Not your ordinary room...which is a good thing!!

title: LIKED IT
text: I liked the area of town a lot.  The hotel employees couldn't have been nicer.  Stayed in room 806.  The room has a lot of positives: the bed, windows (three large ones), bathroom with tv in mirror, cool "power" drapes.  I guess the employees were the thing I liked the best.  They were nice and helpful.  Negatives; no restaurant, and the lobby kind of was non existent.  Overall, a good experience and I'd go there again.

title: Great hotel for a family stay in Manhattan
