text: We stayed in a family room at the hotel.  Very comfortable and great facilities, including free wifi.  Very friendly and helpful staff too.  Only downside was the noisy a/c unit in our room.  No room service, but the 'grub hub' online delivery service recommended by the front desk was a good alternative.

title: A great stay
text:
My wife and I stayed at the Flatiron Hotel for our first visit to NYC, and it was snazzy enough to make me feel like the Country Mouse visiting the City Mouse.

"Gee wiz, Country Honey! They've got TVs in them thar mirrors. Press this button and the curtains 'll open over yonder. And have you ever seen eight showerheads in yer life?"

I do declare.

The room was small (I hear that's typical in the city) but very well-appointed and immaculately clean. It had the feel of a boutique hotel, with a spiral staircase winding around a cool two-story fish tank in the lobby.

The ground floor turns into a club on weekend nights, so be prepared for booming music on the lower floors. We couldn't hear it from our fifth-floor room on a Friday night.

It was a good location for seeing all the touristy sites in New York. It's very close to the Flatiron Building, that Mecca for photography nerds who want to make black-and-white posters of city architecture. It's convenient to several subway lines ... but honestly, where can you go in Manhattan that isn't?

We felt safe in the neighborhood after midnight, which is a testament to either Manhattan's safety or the naivety of us Country Mice.

I liked the hotel and would recommend it to anyone wanting to gawk at their city cousins.

title: Location, location, location
text: Updated rooms, not huge, but average for the city. Band was great in the lobby but one in our party could hear the music playing til very late. We were on the 8th. Tv in mirror was great. Clean rooms with a great staff. Devin helped us with everything we could ask for and more. Kids loved the fish tank.

title: Great hotel at great location
text:
My boyfriend and I stayed here between 3-8 of July. We had a great stay! The staff was friendly and serviceminded. The room was clean and spacious (broadway classic room). 

The location was great! Right on Brodway, relatively close to Times Square and shopping. Just a few blocks from the amazing High line and a few blocks away from Empire state building. With a Subway station just around the corner made it easy to go anywhere.

Real restaurants though we found it hard to find. Several starbucks ans 7-elevens close by. But if you fancy a burger I'll recommend you to go to the Shake shack in madison square park. Lovely place! 

When it comes yo noise you can hear the traffic outside pretty well (we lived on the 9th floor) but it didn't bother us that much. I got more bothered of the noisy air conditioner which turned on every 10-15 minutes :/ woke me up several times every night.

title: Great Location, friendly staff
text: Not without a few hitches but, the staff the front desk did there best to make our stay enjoyable. Every staff member we encountered was incredibly friendly and professional, but Samantha and Joe really stood out. Rooms are clean and beds comfortable. As others have mentioned there is live music in the lobby and it is loud, my family stayed on the 5th and 6th floors and no one heard a thing from their rooms (so don't let that deter you). Location is great, easy access to several subway lines and lots of great shops and restaurants within blocks, including Eataly. If you get in and want an easy no wait dinner--Hill Country Fried Chicken a block away is amazing!

title: Perfect Location, Good Price
text:
The hotel seemed to be recently refurbished and to a high standard throughout with very friendly and helpful staff who were attentive when we checked in and throughout our 2 night stay.

THe room was well appointed with comfy beds, wifi, iPod docks, flat screen TV etc with a very modern shower room albeit with slightly disappointing water pressure but then we were on floor 7.

As noted on other reviews, the bar area is extremely loud with live music (good quality music though) playing throughout the evening and nights when we were staying which was a weekend.  We'd read the reviews before booking a requested a high floor to avoid the noise in the room itself and we had absolutely no problems at all.

All in all, although New York in general is a complete ripoff for hotels, the Flatiron provided us with a good value stay (relative to the surrounding areas) in a modern, sleek hotel which had a great atmosphere, especially in the evenings and nights and we would happily stay here again.

title: Old but not so Fogey
text:
Okay...first the good. In fact, the great. The location of this hotel is excellent, right off of Broadway and Fifth Avenue and across the street from a lovely park and even better was every single person we met there. The staff went out of their way to be helpful and friendly and made us feel very comfortable and welcome. Beyond the staff, New York City opened its arms to us...or at least it felt that way. Across the street from the hotel is "My Place Deli" and the people there were absolutely amazing...so helpful, friendly and even stayed open late the night we got in (horrible weather, cancelled flights) to make us sandwiches. 

I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone in their 20's, 30's and maybe even 40's...I am 57 and my husband is 65 and we and not old fogeys...but we do like our peace when we get back to home base on trips. I had read the comments about noise and requested a room away from it all. The staff placed us in room 905 which was great...we could not hear the band at all up there. But you should be forewarned...the lobby where you walk into the hotel is actually part of the bar with a very lively, live (and loud) band right there. When we first got in (around midnight on a Thursday, having left our Tucson home at 5am that morning) we had to shout to be heard over the music there in the lobby. Again, the people were so nice and helpful, it wasn't a huge problem but it was a bit jarring and unexpected. 

The idea of a band Monday through Saturday nights appealed to us, we just didn't think it would be right in the entrance and part of the lobby. Also, from the pictures on the website, I was very excited to sit up on the rooftop and have dinner and drinks but turns out the rooftop is only for private parties. Again, the staff were so nice and willing to take the time to show it to us, but we couldn't actually relax up there. There is a rooftop bar just a block or two away on 5th Avenue though so all was not lost. The room was very small (we got the queen size) but well appointed and the t.v. embedded ghost-like in the bathroom mirror is an interesting novelty. 

This is really a fantastic property, just a little on the high energy side for us but we highly recommend it if you are not put off by the entry bar.

title: Charmoso
text:
Toda noite rola um som ao vivo no lobby. Å primeira vista parece confuso, mas empresta um clima alegre a sua estadia. Sabendo disso já pedimos na reserva um andar alto e não tivemos problema com barulho.
A localização é boa, perto das coisas e sem aquela multidão de turistas. O hotel é bonito e limpo, cama ótima, tudo funcionou bem. Ficaria lá novamente.

title: Fantastic place to stay
text:
Our stay at the Flatiron was wonderful!  The staff was very courteous and accommodating, especially Samantha and Devin!  Room was very clean and comfortable.  Loved the tempur-pedic mattress! 
Location is close to lots of restaurants and bars, including the Shake Shack and the 40/40 Club.  Shopping just a few block south on 5th Ave.
The bar connected to the lobby has live music most nights and a very lively crowd!  We stayed on the 9th floor, so noise wasn't a major issue for us.  You can hear the rumbling of the subway, but you are going to get that most anywhere in the city and it's part of the NYC experience!
Overall, great trip and will definitely stay there again!

title: Great Place to stay.
text: I came into town for a long weekend with my wife and we couldn't picked a better place. The locations is excellent for New York, plenty of places to go with in walking distance and the subway stations are only a few blocks away. The service at the hotel is excellent, Devon and Sam was very helpful and provided great assistance. I can truly say that this place is a untouched gem!

title: Bring EarPlugs!
text: Please search for this hotel and read all the negative comments  about the noise volume and room temperature - they are correct.  While the staff are helpful and kind (especially Angel), the noise level in this hotel beggars belief (and it doesn't stop until 2:00 am!)  The staff and hotel guests have no choice but to raise their voices beyond 9:00pm at weekends.  in your room you will find fancy digital controls for the curtains, the a/c, and even a TV embedded in the bathroom mirror but don't even attempt to change the temperature in your room it always returns to 68 degrees.  If you, like me, secured this hotel via priceline, hotel.com or hotwire in a "name your price deal" be proactive and email the hotel to secure a quiet room - room numbers that end 07 are going to be safe - if you end up in a room ending in 01 you are screwed unless you bring earplugs. While the hotel is in a safe central location, the management, made up of a former club promoter are clearly delusional  if they think they are going to survive from the bar takings and not deal with the complaints that keep being echoed here.

title: Very Friendly Staff
text: I was in town for a few nights on business and I really liked the place.  It has been a lifelong dream of mine to go to Yankee Stadium and the staff were really good at advising me what I should pay, best place to sit - they were on the phone to their boyfriends, their cousins - it was like a snap Yankees ticket poll!  After a while, hotels seem much the same so whenever the staff go above and beyond, that always makes things a little bit extra special.

title: Great Hotel!!!!
text:
My girlfriend and I came here to celebrate my birthday and there's not one bad thing we can say about this hotel. It's wonderful classic/modern chic decor gives it such a welcoming and comforting vibe. The staff was very friendly and accommodating.  Located in a part of New York where it wasn't too busy or crowded but just a few blocks away from the all action of the Chelsea/TriBeCa area. The Toshi room (hotels bar) was very lively with a band performing and it's a good place to grab a drink before you head out on the town. 
The hotels doorman; Devin Flores, enhanced our experience at the hotel further by being extremely helpful with our luggage, hailing cabs for us and assisting us with checking in our room. It's always good when the first the person you meet that represents the hotel is nice and welcoming. Also, his vast knowledge of excellent restaurants and bars was impeccable. He know all the trendy places that are "the scene" as well as the fantastic lesser known eateries. We went to 2 places per his recommendation. 
All I all the this a exquisite hotel and I'll definitely be coming back the next time I'm in New York.

title: Not the best!
text:
We booked a room with two double beds for three of us. We arrived at the hotel at 2:30pm  & after a 7hr flight from London we were told check was at 4pm & the room wasn't ready, bearing in mind check out is at 11am each day I'm not sure why there is such a late check in. They offered to hold our luggage for $1 per bag. We decided to head out and returned 5:30pm only to be told our room was still not fully ready because they needed to defrost the aircon in our room and fit it with a new part in one hour. We were desperate to sleep by this point. I was glad our room was on a high floor as requested. We waited in the room for the maintenance guys for over an hour after which point the aircon unit started leaking all over our bags. 

We called reception and asked to speak to the manager & were directed to his voicemail, we left a message & no reply. We called reception again & they offered to upgrade us to a bigger room which may be 'slightly effected by the club noise'. This turned out to be a massive understatement, the noise travelling up to the rooms is incredible not only from the club but the endless cans using their horn or trucks making deliveries. If you want a goodnights sleep then don't stay here. Upon check out we asked for extended check out until 2pm, the front desk said no. I find it unbelievable they don't let you in the room until 4pm but expect you out ASAP.

On the plus side the rooms are comfortable, the doorman is excellent & some of the reception staff were pleasant to deal with. Other than that I wouldn't recommend this hotel & won't be staying here again.

title: Ottima posizione
text: La posizione e' strategica, le stanze non sono da 4 stelle italiano. Non si può fare colazione ma eately a due blocchi e' comodo, non economico. Se si trova l'offerta e' un hotel da tenere in considerazione. Si beve volentieri qualcosa al bar dell'hotel dove quasi tutte le sere fanno musica dal vivo...

title: Terrible Place
text: Terrible place!!!! I had booked my wedding here in October 2012 for August 2013. In April they had gone through 4 different Managers who handeld my contract & of course none of them had known about our wedding, so I had to tell each one what was going on. I even renegotiated our contract with the second manager, and had been trying for 2 months to get it taken care of. She was either fired or quit (would not surprise me). After I went into the hotel because no one was answering my emails, I spoke with a new manager, who went to the owner and showed him our new contract. The owner, Toshi who was no where near a calendar at the time, sent the manager to tell me it was booked for that day. Im assuming because he wanted more money. It WAS booked for that day, for MY WEDDING when I signed the first contract in October. I cannot believe the unprofessionalism of Toshi! Thank you for making what should have been an amazing event more difficult, and I really appreciate that when I was in the lobby crying you did not have the decency to come down and speak with me. Terrible person, and terrible place!

title: This hotel is a must!!!
text: The staff at the Flatiron goes beyond the call of duty. I was fortunate enough to stay there my first night in the city. After that all of the rooms in NYC were either sold out or 550.00 and over. I was traveling for business and 550.00 a night is definitely not in my travel budget. The staff tried to get me a room elsewhere (since they were sold out as well), they held my luggage and they got me a reasonable car service. They could not have been more accommodating. I am in and out of NY quite often and I will only stay  at the Flatiron.  The hotel is great with small lobby and a great bar with nightly music, the rooms are very cool and immaculately clean.

title: Location, Location, Location
text: Absolutely fantastic location.  As a veteran NYC visitor, I don't think I've ever stayed in a better located hotel.  I must say however, if I hadn't read about the club in the lobby, when I arrived on Saturday night at 11:00, I would have turned around immediately and left.  The lobby which houses the front desk, also serves as part of the hangout for the live music venue and there were lots of tipsy club goers hanging out in the lobby along with the myself and another group who were trying to check in.  The separation between who was a hotel guest and who just needed a question answered (where is the bathroom?; can I get change for a $100?) was definitely not clear and just a little frustrating.  As was the shouting at the top of my voice just to be heard by the front desk staff - but, remember I had been informed of this before going and sort of knew what to expect.  However, it was still more than a little off putting.  My room was on floor 5 and surprisingly (!), I could not hear even a bass thump from the band downstairs.  Upon descending early Sunday morning into the lobby, i was greeted by sweet peace and quiet and a very happy, helpful staff who made me feel like I was in a hotel again.  The rooms are quite small and not as clean as I would prefer, but not grossly so.  Again, the major point for me is the excellent location.  Would I stay here again?  Maybe, but with a few recommendations - find a space on the second floor to use as a check in desk during the evening hours when the band is playing; better communicate what kind of place they are trying to be (the website mentions the club, but from my observation, the the site projects a much higher end of venue, when in reality the club has much more of a downtown vibe); clean the windows.

title: Feel deceived and appauling management response
text: We booked this hotel based purely on the photos of the rooftop bar/restauant on their website...however this is only available for private functions and not open to guests at all but the hotel use the photos to sell their hotel. This is not clear at all. We complained when we found out and as we were only there 2 nights I complained verbally to reception (it wasn't passed on as I was told it would be) and in writing to the manager Sean Applewhaite who I then had to chase up daily for a response, he failed to adequately reply and in general treated my complaint as a joke and with complete unprofessionalism and contempt...a thread I now see is common when I look at the less than favourable reviews on here. The management need to take responsibility for false representation of the rooftop bar and deal with complaints in a timely professional way.

title: High Tech Hotel with Great Location
text: We love this location of the city - so close to so many things we love - Eataly, Shake Shack, Dogmatic, Doughnut Plant....This hotel was such a gem and we just stumbled upon it as we didn't like the hotel we were staying at. The hotel is extremely clean and nicely decorated. The staff was super accommodating and went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable. The fish tank in the lobby is really neat. The room is super comfortable with a big bed and many interesting electronic devices in the room like touchscreen thermostats, tvs in the mirror in the bathroom and there were multiple massage heads in the shower.

title: Buono ma non un quattro stelle
text:
Forse per gli standard americani puo' considerarsi un 4 stello ma per quelli italiani no.
Partiamo dalla posizione: ottima. Si trova a Middtown all'angolo tra la Broadway e la 26th. La zona non è troppo chic ma nemmeno malfamata. Direi che siamo nella NY vera. A metà strada tra due fermate della metro (la 23th e la 28th) e comunque distante circa 5 minuti a piedi da tantissimi negozi sebbene anche sotto l'hotel sia presente uno starbucks ed altri negozietti.
In hotel non si serve la colazione che per un 4 stelle secondo me è gravissimo. In ogni caso a poca distanza, sulla 23th, si trova Eataly, un grossissimo store italiano pieno di ristoranti, bar, market. Noi facevamo allegramente la colazione con un ottimo cappuccio e brioche anche se non proprio economico. In ogni caso il posto era frequentatissimo a tutte le ore.

Le camere con letto matrimoniale sono piccole. La prima notte ci hanno sistemato in una camera con due letti che ho rimpianto in quanto i due letti erano grandi ognuno quasi come quello matrimoniale (lo chiamano king size ma è piccolo) e comunque anche la camera era piu' spaziosa. Quindi se potete vi consiglio di scegliere questa soluzione, del resto se poi volete nessuno vi vieta di dormire poi entrambi in uno dei due letti.

Il bagno è piccolissimo. Lavello, water a ridosso del lavello e doccia. Ma è bello è moderno. C'è la specchiera con incluso la televisione in bagno. La doccia è bella, moderna, polifunzionale.

In camera c'è un grande televisore lcd, e minibar. Attenzione che c'è l'avviso che se si sposta roba dal minibar per oltre 20 minuti viene addebitata la consumazione. Ma su richiesta forniscono un frigo.

In camera c'era l'asse da stiro ma non la cassaforte. Questa è stata una pecca. Nella camera con due letti era presente un armadio, in quella con letto matrimoniale un piccolo angolo dove appendere i vestiti.

Le camere sono ristrutturate, pulite e dotate di comfort elettronici quali aria condizionata, tende automatizzate, radio sveglia, porta ipod etc etc.

Personale davvero cortese. WIFI gratuita in tutta la struttura.

A piano terra c'è un grosso acquario ma la sala è adibita a locale per la sera dove fanno musica dal vivo in maniera assordante. Consiglio quindi di prendere le camere agli ultimi piani. Fatelo presente. Poi non si sente piu' nulla se non i rumori esterni della città. Ma io dormo sempre con i tappini.

In ogni caso ci tornerei.

title: May 6,2013 review
text: First the location is great. Right in the middle of Manhattan. I could get to Soho or uptown very easy. Train both ways is right on 23rd st. The staff is super friendly and willing to help you with anything you need. Devon is a great person to have as a greeter to this Hotel. The downside is that this hotel has not been kept up. You see alot of wear and tear on the walls and chairs have stains. The hallways are dirty. The rooms are pretty good. TV's do not work very well. Plus there is a TV in the bathroom but it's built in to the mirror which means you can't see what you are doing. Not sure why this hotel chooses to have live music below all the hotel rooms....seems very odd. You will not get any sleep unless you ask for the very top floors. If you can't get a top floor room I would not stay here. Not sure that I would stay there again...also say they have an outdoor lounge which is true but not open to the public. I was very disappointed.

title: im trying to like this hotel!
text: My husband and I are veteran visitors of NYC and stay at hotels that give us the best deal money-wise, because it's better to spend the extra cash on the fun stuff in this fab city! I got a deal via Priceline for The Flatiron (Madison Double room) for 7 nights. I read other reviewers regarding the noise issue from live music venues @the lobby level, so I called the hotel to confirm reservations & ensure a high floor room (which one should always do). The confirmation was honored & our room was available upon our arrival after a red-eye flight, which was amazing. My thoughts on the Flatiron:  1) while the room was spacious w/high ceilings & crown moldings, it had a peculiar odor which I couldn't readily identify (I ended up going to the local grocery store & purchasing room spray & scented candle); 2) comfortable platform beds w/drawers below for lots of storage (armoire also in the room)-no bugs; plus the main window opens a couple of inches, which is a treat!; 4) the carpeting was dirty; lots of stains (I believe the hotel accepts pets; maybe we got a "pet-friendly" room?)-bring your slippers, the hotel provides bathrobes; 4) tiny marble bathroom w/shower only, although the shower is fantastic (6 heads & rain shower fixture above)-nice bath products called "Pure" by Gloss; there is room for your own toiletries if you re-arrange the towels on the shelves; 5) there is a coffee maker, but if you like tea, bring your own teabags-none are provided; 6) no room service (in fact, no food is available within the hotel) or evening turn-down service-I find that very unusual if Flatiron is striving to attain a high-status reputation; 7) cable was spotty (HBO never came in); 8) the hotel charges to store bags if you have a late departure flight, which I find annoying. Having said all this, the staff is first-rate (thanks Joe & Samantha) with expert housekeeping service & the location is prime-subway lines- N, R, 1, 6- all nearby as well as Eataly and The Doughnut Plant.  Keep in mind there is a party spirit most nights here, so bring earplugs if you're sensitive to a throbbing rhythm, even on a high floor (it didn't bother us).

title: Great location even better staff
text: Three day stay in NYC and this location is great.  Comfortable accommodations , fabulous shower and very professional an helpful staff. Right off broadway , convenient to Chelsea , Time Square and subways.

title: Enjoyed my stay
text: Stayed at the Flatiron Hotel for one night. Fit the bill for me. Room was small but that is to be expected at most places in NYC. The staff was very pleasant and helpful. Nice lounge in the lobby and has a 2 floor fish tank.

title: Beautiful Place; Incredible Staff!
text: This was a great hotel, the staff was unbelievably helpful and friendly!  Devin, Joe and Sam(antha) really helped make our experience phenomenal, these 3 people are no doubt in the right industry and made our trip and stay a pleasant and memorable event!!!  The level of service we received far exceeded our expectations.  Thank you for that, will stay there again in a heartbeat!

title: Great location, comfortable stay, but noisy
text:
I always try to stay in the Flatiron district when i visit NY and this hotels location cannot be beat - one block from Madison Sq Park, central to everywhere, quiet neighbourhood with little street noise. We requested a high floor as warned to by all the reviews and we spent 4 nights on the 7th floor unbothered by the horrifically loud live bands that play every night in Toshi's Lounge on the ground floor. It's quite a scene. Our first night (Feb 13) coincided with some sort of event being held there for New York Fashion Week so the tiny lobby was jam packed with rails of clothing, models and hangers on. 

The rooms are clean, comfortable and hi-tech, with large flatscreen TV & blackout curtains operated by a remote control and an additional LCD TV display IN the bathroom mirror. The free wifi was good and the beds excellent, with tempurpedic style (memory foam) mattresses & nice linens. Housekeeping was patchy as we were often left only one bath towel for the two of us after the room was cleaned and I had to resort to taking extras from the housekeeping closet left open opposite our room.

Unfortunately although we were away from the sound of the lobby we were not from the sound of slamming doors and TV from adjacent rooms and I was woken and kept awake on at least two nights by noisy neighbour(s) returning late from partying and crashing around their room(s) with their TV up loud. Based on this I would not return as although this hotel ticks most of my boxes there is simply inadequate soundproofing between rooms.

title: $419 out the window!
text: Worst stay in a hotel I've ever had. How it has a good 2012 review from tripadvisor I have no idea. The rooms are filthy, my be sheets were stained and so were the curtains. So what there is a tv in the bathroom, that doesn't make the barely moveable room in the bathroom any better. It is such a loud and "party hotel" which is not what my company and I were looking for. The front desk was highly unorganized and we were quoted a price half of what we we to pay at check out. Such a waste of money. Thank goodness we only ended up staying one night! DON'T STAY HERE!

title: Brilliant.
text:
I was in town for 5 days for a conference and chose this hotel because it wasn't too far from the Javits but still close to the nightlife downtown. The staff couldn't do enough for me. They received marketing material and held it for me for two days before I arrived - everyone was lovely, polite and incredibly helpful. In particular Devin at reception who helped me throughout my stay with organising cars to pick me and my clients up to go to dinners, airport runs, catching cabs and even lending me an umbrella for the entirety of a rainy day. He recommended places to go, directed me to pharmacies and even helped me on the last day to get an extra suitcase. 
Housekeeping brought me extra coffee when I needed it (and I SO needed it) and the room although small - it is NY after all - was delightful and I wish I could've stayed in that amazing shower for the whole week. I know I'd be all pruney but wow those jets.
I was SUPER lucky that I had a room on the 10th floor so I didn't really hear all the noise from the bar & band playing downstairs, but the PH did have a party and it did get quite rowdy. It's the only reason I wouldn't give this a five star rating (if I'd had my kids with me I would've struggled).
Other than that, I absolutely recommend this place.

title: Caveat emptor
text: Start with the positive - nice location; staff are really lovely, friendly and helpful people. HOWEVER, please ask before you stay there if they are having a concert in "toshi's living room" - the lobby. Last night they had "Nema's Boom Boom Room" a "biweekly R&B artist showcase" in the lobby and the sound carried all the way up to our room. And the show went til 1 am. I really wish I'd known in advance so I could've asked for a quieter room. Ask before you book. I agree with previous posts about the hotel looking a little run down - it could use a little sprucing up, that's for sure.

title: Poor Experience
text: This hotel would have potential if they took care of it cared about the comforts a guest looks for when staying at a hotel. When we arrived the hotel staff seemed overwhelmed even though there were only 3 people at the front desk. There was a new person "training" it seemed and the woman "training" him was more so yelling at him for not doing something correctly instead of helping him. The hotel has an odd vibe to it right when you walk in. Our room was not going to be ready until RIGHT at the check in time, 4pm. Which was fine cause we were going out. But that's never happened in all of the hotels we've stayed at. Oh well. So when we got back and got into the room we were on the 3rd floor right on the street almost. The walls are not sheet rock painted walls, I am not sure of the material but it was a kind that was glossy and SOOO dirty, you can see so many fingerprints and smears of dirty hands. SO gross. The room was SO small, you literally walk in the room and the bed is RIGHT there. No room to put anything, no closet or dresser. At night you can hear music loudly and noise of people slamming their room doors. Late, like 2-3-4am. The carpet in our room was stained and pulling up from the floor where furniture was. I think we almost could have dealt with all of that, but the rock hard bed and pillows were the final straw. We did not mention any of these things to the hotel cause we were only there for one night then left to go to a different place thank god. But it was not comfortable, it was so small, dirty, staff was inexperienced and seemed rude. We have stayed in probably over 20 hotels in NYC and this was by far the worst. It has neat little touches in the room that would have been cool if the important things were not so crappy.

title: Great...all that you need
text:
We stayed at Flatiron and was very very very nice and cool..
i think that Flatiron is ALL i was looking for!!!
You have amazing location,fashion hall,great personel 
if i could say with one word is PERFECT!!!

title: flatiron hotel
text: Excellent hotel!! stayed here march 2013 for my girlfriends 40th birthday present , perfect location ,large very clean room,friendly staff! a perfect stay! in a very trendy hotel!! would def stay there again ! New york its wonderfull!!!

title: Posizione strategica
text:
Abbiamo soggiornato in questo hotel a fine febbraio; eravamo già stati a New York, e l'abbiamo scelto per la posizione (praticamente sulla 5th), e per l'offerta su booking.
A noi piace camminare, e lì è fantastico, stimoli di ogni tipo.
Dall'hotel abbiamo camminato fino al WTC, e il giorno dopo fino al Metropolitan.
Location a parte: stanza minuscola, moquette vecchia e macchiata, mio marito che si congelava 
in quanto costretto a dormire appiccicato alla vetrata, e alla tenda, dietro alla quale l'ultimo giorno abbiamo scoperto una bottiglia vuota di birra non nostra, che stava lì chissà da quanto.
Per chi ama il movimento, ogni sera nela lobby concerti, sfilate di moda e tanto rumore.

title: Fabulous Location Fabulous Stay!
text:
We found this hotel on Agoda and can say it was everything we expected & more.
Great location- easy to get pretty much anywhere in the city by foot, subway or cab!

Devon thank you for all your hints, tips & advice! 
You could not have been more of a gentleman!

title: A gem in the Flat Iron District
text:
The Flat Iron District is changing at the speed of light, its golden towers visible from Madison Square Park beckon you to this delicious neighborhood. The Flat Iron Hotel is steps away from it all. A boutique Hotel with excellent Staff (this is my 3rd stay) who remember your name and go the extra mile(like bringing hot water to my room late night for a cup of tea so I wouldn't have to drink "coffee flavored" water from the room pot.)  Samantha at the front desk, and Joe & Devon will make your stay a pleasure and Sean the manager will make it all effortless. 

One small reminder stay on the upper floors as the Toshi Room can get loud, or if you're in town to enjoy yourself, go join the fun.

title: Really a great place
text: My NYC office is a block away from the Flatiron Hotel (I regularly commute from LA).  I've stayed at all of the reasonably priced hotels in the Chelsea area and the Flatiron is by far my favorite.  The staff is GREAT!...including Idelsa, Samantha and Devon.  Ask for a room on a higher floor to escape the late night club music from below.  Super comfortable clean rooms, great location, right by the subway.  Lot's of excellent placed nearby to dine, including Eatly and Colexico (amazing Mexican food stand where B'way and 5th criss cross).  Also free wifi!  Highly recommended.

title: Fabulous on all points!
text: I love the decor of the hotel. The rooms are very nice and spotlessly clean. The beds are comfortable too. Best of all, the staff is excellent. Joe and Carmelo are the best doormen in the entire city.

title: Highly recommended
text:
My partner and I stayed here for 6 nights. The room was bigger than we were expecting and the staff were very friendly and helpful. The live bands were entertaining and it was great to be able to stay within the hotel on cold evenings. We were on the 5th floor and did not hear any noise from the live music. 

Whilst the windows can be little drafty the heater immediately warms the room. 

We got a good rate through last minute.com and would stay here again.

title: Great Place, Great Location
text: My sister in-laws took me to the Flatiron hotel for a birthday weekend. It was a great place to stay. The rooms were recently updated and the beds were very comfortable. We had 4 guests in each room and never felt crowded. The staff was wonderful especially Devin and Joe who were friendly, very helpful and went out of their way to make us feel special.  We loved the safe area around the hotel and Starbucks across the street. Our only complaint is the area is a bit noisy at night. We would definitely visit this hotel again!

title: The shower is the best.
text:
I stayed here for three nights in March 2013, with a great rate ($139) through Zootravel.  (I have paid the same for New York hotels not nearly as nice.)  The location is safe and not a bad walk to visit my son who's a student at NYU.  The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was New-York-small and recently remodeled with a lot of great details.  The bed was very comfortable.  Unlike some other reviewers, I had no problems with the room temperature, and everything worked as it should.  By far my favorite thing about it though was the shower with all those wonderful jets spraying you from every direction.  I would definitely stay there again. 

P.S. The two-story fish tank in the lobby/bar is beautiful.

title: Great Place to Stay
text: I took my daughter to NYC as a surprise for her 16th birthday. The Flatiron was a great place to stay. The staff are absolutely awesome! I cannot say enough good things about how friendly, helpful and accomodating they were. I sent "Sweet 16" decorations ahead of time and they had decorated our room so cute. They told my daughter happy birthday when we checked in and treated her special during our entire stay. I paid extra for a corner room and it was worth it to have the view. The beds are so comfy....a great place to end up after a day of walking and walking and walking! The Flatiron is in a very convenient as well as safe location....just a few blocks from the subway, and also a nice park area. We loved our stay here and would definitely stay here again.

title: A great stay
text:
My husband and I, both middle-aged professionals, got there a few hours early -- well before checkin time -- but the front desk staff acted happy to see us and got us settled right in with no delay. Tiny lobby but with great view of the bar, which is sleek and colorful and so cool. Room size is in line with other New York properties (so small). The bed was PERFECT -- great mattress and luxurious linens. The bathroom was black marble with flat-screen tv, nice amenities, plenty of high-end fluffy towels and a GREAT rain shower. Insulation isn't so great, so the bathroom was chilly with the door shut.
One bit of weirdness: the minibar/snack shelf. Like a lot of hotels these days, the shelves are sensored to note when an item is removed and within 10 seconds or so your account will be billed. So check your bill carefully. It's easy to knock a package of nuts from the desktop shelf. 
We would go back.

title: Amazing location but beware of scary draft between floor to ceiling windows
text:
The hotel was beautiful but very drafty. Our room constantly struggled between overheated and chilly. You could feel the cold air and have a loud hiss of the wind if the drapes were not completely closed as the insulation was weak. It might have been a nightmare for anyone staying during Hurricane Sandy. Whenever the wind blew too strong, our heater would go into overdrive and make the room like Tahiti. The bathroom was very cold by the toilet. I did not think the room was up to par for the price. The irony of the floor to ceiling windows is that you look straight into other buildings so you don't want the windows exposed too often. 

The location was wonderful as it was a hop and skip to everywhere. The staff was so sweet and friendly. Very helpful on directions and services. The hotel bar was a cool addition. The beds were very large and comfortable.

title: Perfect hotel
text: There is music every night in the nightclub that has a two story balcony with a two story aquarium.  TThe rooms are comfortable and modern with full body showers and TV sets in the bathroom window. The curtains are all electric and the staff is very polite.  It is close to everything and perfect for midtown, downtown and village entertainment.  This place is 5 stars and the price is very reasonable.

title: Friendly and helpful staff Great location
text:
We stayed Sat - Tues late February. The staff here is very helpful and friendly, especially Devin who runs the door/security/luggage and is the first face you see upon arrival. He was very helpful with snagging taxis and restaurant/entertainment recommendations and just making sure we were enjoying our stay. Super nice guy!  Front desk girls were super nice and helpful as well. 
 
The room was clean and comfortable. Bathroom shower was AWESOME!!! If you position the handle just right you can get all the shower heads to work at once lol! TV in the mirror was pretty cool. The toilet has some water regulator in it that sounds like a nuke exploding with every flush. Jumped everytime! First world pains I guess so can't complain too much.  The phone, however, didn't work properly so glad I had my cell phone, but hey... Who really uses landlines anyway? Right?

Didn't make it to the roof top bar due to rain and cold but the live music inside was not so bad. The drinks were small and on the weak side so didn't spend too much time here for entertainment but nice to have something going on only an elevator trip away.

title: Decent stay - Really *want* to give 4... But can't.
text:
Stayed at the flatiron hotel for a night after booking last-minute through Hoteltonight for 129+tax in march '13. Chose it because it was convenient to where I was located in manhattan and wanted convenience to LGA in the morning. A friend had stayed there 1year ago right after their grand opening and he loved it. 

Won't comment on the area, because whether "it's in a great area" is REALLY dependent on where you need to be / what you want to do in NY. Flatiron area is convenient to Chelsea/midtown/east side and fairly close to Times Square. Not a "hip" area but Betty is in the eye of the beholder. Very safe area though. 

Pros: the hotel was fairly stylish, decent location, safe, and you really can't complain for the price. The room had fairly cool amenities (but see below), and I agree with many other commenters, the staff was ABSOLUTELY FANTASTIC: the front desk girl was very nice, helpful and accommodating, and the front door bellman/security/front-house guy (same guy all the other commenters mentioned) was super helpful. Took my bags to my room when I was in a hurry (not standard service), gave a legitimately good restaurant recommendation, and they were both very friendly and kind. 

 Cons: and this is why I said I wish I could give a 4 but can't: agree with another user review - the hotel simply looks tired. It is an older building which was renovated a year ago, and while the rooms have fancy options like TVs in the bathroom mirror, flatscreens in the room, remote-controlled curtains, a waterfall shower with about 7 waterfall heads, and also had a very cool bed & finishings... Unfortunately, the phone didn't work, the waterfall shower didn't work, the tv didn't work (either of them), the room was pretty "worn" (prob due to location and price point), and the shower tiles were taped up with masking tape (seriously, shocked) and I found some tape which had fallen off the window in the middle of the floor. 

I probably could have complained and I am certain that the very helpful staff could have moved me, but I was only there for 8 hours and then flew out, so I didn't bother. In a nutshell, if you can't find a decent hotel for the 100-200 range (NEVER stay in a 3-star or less in NY unless you want bedbugs), it is good enough. But through Hotwire/Priceline you can usually get 4-stars for the same price (the same day there were multiple options in manhattan for 113+), and other places I've gotten like the Waldorf, Benjamin, Hyatt, westin grand central - are nicer.

title: Great hotel with great staff
text:
We recently stayed at the Flatiron hotel on our holiday to New York.  Without doubt the most fantastic part of this hotel is it's staff.  Throughout our stay the staff were always available to solve any issue no matter how small.  In particular Devin on the front door was a pleasure to deal with throughout stay.

When we first got to the hotel we found that the room that we had reserved was not appropriate.  I am a big guy and my poor girlfriend was at risk of crushing in the standard double.  We raised this with the front desk who upgraded us to a king room.  Whatismore, as they didnt have any reservations for that room for the duration of our stay they kindly upgraded us for free.  Thanks to Samantha on reception for helping us out.

The bar downstairs is a lot of fun with some great live music and good choice of food and drinks.  We ended a couple of evenings in the bar including celebrating our engagement.  Just to add to the already superb reception the staff had given us at their hotel, the day following our engagement, the hotel sent a bottle of champagne to our room to congratulate us.

The venue was a superb location to explore Manhattan.  Sitting on Broadway we found it convenient to set out on foot from here to many of the sites and shopping that we did whilst we were in the city.

All in all, for the price the hotel is great value, and made extra special by excellent staff.

title: Feels Tired
text: This hotel is not bad, especially for the price in NYC. Good location within walking distance to the subway, Madison Square Garden, Penn Station, etc.  However, it feels like it is ready for a re-fresh.  The bones are fine...just a little shopworn.  Nothing a little paint, some new carpeting, etc. can't fix.  Just don't change the shower...which was great (rain from the top with six jets pointing toward your torso).

title: Good stay, Great location, Good Price
text:
We booked for a 4 night stay on our first trip to NYC, it was a good price with a great location and as it was our first trip to the big apple we were only really in the hotel for sleeping. Our only contact with the staff was checking in and out (oh and a leeky toilet - which was fixed by a very helpfull maintenance guy) On check in the woman on the desk was rather surly - maybe it was my accent but it was not the treatment we were led to expect from previous reviews.
She was by no means rude but it was a point worth mentioning after a transatlantic flight. We were on the 10th floor and didnt hear a peep from the bar, and as I said, you only really choose a hotel like that for the location and price, and it served those purposes admirably.

title: small rooms, friendly staff and great location
text: My husband and I stayed in a Queen bed room at this Hotel for three nights. The staff were very friendly. They accommodated our request for a room on a higher floor (so we could avoid the noise from the bar and entertainment that goes on every night till about 1:00 in the lobby). The location is great - very central. The bed was comfortable, room was clean, albeit small, even by NYC standards. Shower in the bathroom was great. The heating in our room was very inconsistent, the room would alternate between being cold and hot like a sauna. We never managed to get the thermostat regulated. But, all in all for the price and location, we can't really complain.

title: Good rooms, decent value
text: I stayed here for two nights while in NYC on business.  Overall, a nice hotel.  I didn't much care for the "nightclub" on the first/second floor and I can imagine that if you were on the floor of sleeping rooms that are directly above the nightclub it could perhaps be loud.  But, from my room on the 7th floor I couldn't hear a thing.  The room was reasonably well appointed and I found the hotel to be a pretty good value.  Location is within a 10 minute walk to Penn Station and I found a couple of nice restaurant and bar options within less than a 10 minute walk.  The subway is reasonably close as well.

title: I will certainly stay at the Flatiron on my next NYC holiday
text:
I've just got back from 3 nights in New York, and I feel like a jammy git (British talk for smug) for finding this place!

The room was very nice with jet showers, TV in bathroom mirror, very comfortable bed, clean and well furnished. The hotel itself is also fantastic. The location was perfect, the staff were friendly and helpful. Every night in the hotel lobby and bar there is excellent live music and cocktails, set in a funky lounge environment - so nice in fact that I met several New Yorkers who chose to drink there rather than one of the many other bars in the city. I was also fortunate enough to get access to the penthouse which has amazing views of the Empire State Building. I'm really struggling to find fault in this hotel.

Don't stay here if you're old and boring - there's a slight hum of music from the bar in the rooms (certainly not enough to keep me awake though) I was on the third floor (the floor nearest the noise). My feelings are that if a hum of music from the bar keeps you awake, you've probably not done New York properly - this place ought to knock you out tired every night!

This is a must stay place for anyone looking to have fun and experience vibrant New York, in a vibrant hotel! Can't recommend enough.

title: Fun and great service but some noise problems
text:
We stayed here for one night at the end of January. The service was great! The room -  
super techy and fun! Comfy beds! There was a live band playing at the bar who were awesome! The food was so so, but the drinks were good :)

I would say the only problem here is the noise. We were on the 28th floor (I think) and still heard the band. Also, the delivery trucks make quite a ruckus during the late hours of the night and early mornings, and the windows are not the big chain hotel windows, so you hear all of it! Better not be a light sleeper.

title: Nice rooms, pleasant stay
text:
Our family rented a number of rooms of varying size over the weekend, and we were all happy the room, the amenities and the sleep quality.  Our room had two beds and was of a generous size overlooking 26th - one floor above the well-documented noisy third floor.  Although we could hear a faint background hum from the nightly entertainment, it was not disruptive.  We felt lucky to have ample space to move around in our room, while others in our family had to leave their room just to change their mind - seems to be hit and miss for room size.

The location is pretty good, a few blocks of walking - or a short cab ride on cold February mornings - will put you in reach of good shopping and restaurants.  The immediate neighbourhood seems to be in gentrification mode and is on its way up.

I could not give a full 5 star rating because our check-in was delayed well beyond the standard check-in time, due to housekeeping issues.  A straight answer from the desk staff was difficult to obtain, and what started as a 10 minute delay turned into an hour of waiting with still no difinitive answer - and no room.  The bell staff helped with storage of our luggage and with space on the mezzanine level to allow us to get sorted before our dinner reservation.

title: Just OK
text:
We stayed here for 4 days a few weeks ago.
When we arrived it was early in the morning and our room wasn't ready. The front desk offered to check our bag for $1 (should have been free!). We returned at 330, nearly 7 hrs later and no room was available. A businessman was checking in at the same time and was also upset to hear that a room was not available so late in the afternoon when the hotel did not appear to be busy (we didn't see any other guests aside from this businessman during our stay). 
The rooms are amazing, the cleaning staff do a wonderful job and are very friendly. The extras in the room (TV in bathroom mirror, amazing shower, automatic blinds, dimmer lights, etc) are all fantastic.  Our only complaint with the room is that the draft coming in through the windows was unbelievable. My boyfriend froze each night. When the heat kicked on it was so powerful we felt like we were in a sauna. It would go from one extreme to another and made getting a good night's sleep near impossible. 
Some of the reviews rant and rave about the staff at the front desk. I found them to be disinterested, distracted, and unprofessional. The front lobby is quite busy in the evenings and I found that the staff were more interested in socializing and caring for their bar clients than their hotel guests. One evening I had to phone down 4 times in a row before someone would answer in order to request a morning wake up call. Over 5 minutes of the phone ringing constantly and no one picked up. 
Overall, we enjoyed our stay but probably would not return.

title: Agréablement surpris par cet hôtel
text:
Nous avions réservé cet hôtel par hôtel.com et nous ne savions pas a quoi nous attendre.
Dès notre arrivée le personnel a été très accueillant , très serviable et attentionné .
Les chambres ne sont pas décorées selon mes goûts mais modernes et propres.
Tout le nécessaire se trouve dans la chambre et en plus quelques objets hi-tech toujours agréable comme Tv dans le miroir de la salle de bain , douche jets massants, rideaux fermeture automatique ....
Les chambres sont propres et calmes ( nous dormions au 6eme étage , je l'avais demandé quand j'ai fait la réservation ) 
Proche de macy's = shopping et métro .
Live music le soir , super choix et bonne ambiance !

title: Really Good Stay - Great Staff
text:
The first thing to point out about this hotel is that the staff - particularly front of house, were fantastic. Devon the Guest Services guy was superb and couldn't do enough to help us. Lets face it, we all know that it is the job of front of house staff to make you feel special - and that is how they make their tips. But, this is one of the first hotels that my wife and I have stayed at that the staff , seemed to want to help because they were proud of their hotel and their city, and that shone across. We couldn't be more complimentary about them all.

Rooms were clean. Our room was very small - but we got a deal on the room and that is why - you get what you pay for.

Music in the downstairs area was lively and fun. It finished by 12pm all nights bar Friday and Saturday, no music on Sundays. We read other reviews before we arrived and requested a room on the upper floors - duly granted. We also took earplugs in case we needed them and I popped them in on Saturday night (the noise was not excessive).

Location of the hotel was good - away from Times Square, but close enough to walk there in 10 mins. Subway stations within 2 or 3 blocks.

Altogether a briliant little hotel. Advice would be to look out for deals on this hotel - they do happen. If you are looking for a hotel with loads of facilities to relax and enjoy then this possibly isn't the best option. But, if you are looking for a place with superb customer care, and somewhere to use as a base and get out and see New York then this hotel is perfect.

title: Amazing customer service, free live entertainment and great location!
text: We booked this hotel through Hotwire and were pleasantly surprised! Hotel Flatiron Toshi is eclectic in its decoration, with good food & drink and an amazingly pleasant staff. Sam at the front desk helped us with numerous small requests and questions and Carmello was the best bellhop/valet we could have asked for! Free live entertainment was a joy and the entire club & hotel staff really seemed to enjoy being there. A quirky value place with loads of personality and a great midtown location! Thanks to all who made our stay do enjoyable!

title: very pleasant surprise
text: We chose the Flatiron on a whim.  It turned out to be a great choice for us.  Having said that, if you are visiting New York for the first or second time, do your homework. Each neighborhood has its own personality, and you should make sure your expectations, priorities and agenda synch with reality. Staying in the Flatiron district is going to be a very different experience than staying on Central Park South or the Upper East Side. The neighborhood itself is named for the Flatiron Building, a New York landmark and architectural gem.  There's lots of office buildings, plenty of places to eat (check out Eataly) and subway stops. The hotel itself is a friendly boutique hotel with a nightclub in the lobby.  There is free wifi but its not the most reliable...so if you want a good night's sleep and need to be on the internet all day, this isn't the best choice.  The rooms are small, but again, expectations have to coexist with reality. In a city where it costs $50.00 to park your car in a garage overnight, its ludicrous to expect a spacious room and large bathroom for $200.00 or less/night.  I found that the small space was very well thought out and gladly traded a large bathroom for my six headed rain shower, high quality toiletries, linens, bathrobes and lots of fun electronic gadgets.  The queen sized bed was captain style, which means the mattress was on a platform with six large drawers underneath.  For us, the nightclub in the lobby was great.  The band, City of Six, was fantastic, and without having to leave our hotel on a freezing night, we had a few drinks, bar food, danced and had a really nice evening. Best of all was the free pass to the 24 hour health club across the street.  Its a full service gym, better than the one we belong to at home.  We found this hotel to be wonderful, and will definitely return on our next trip home.

title: Nice sized room, nice view... not very clean
text:
I just found this stay a little gross. My husband and I stayed for 2 days... and while there were some cute perks like a tv in the bathroom, rainfall shower, jets in the shower, automatic blinds, etc. 

The room was just pretty dirty. They don't really cover the duvet, they just put it in between 2 sheets.... but when the duvet does slip out- it's dirty.. which makes appreciating the hotel difficult. 

Prior to showering, the bathroom looked clean--but had such an awful smell, i couldn't fully enjoy the shower. 

We were there for 2 nights, and the room was never cleaned. I try not to let things like be a big deal--but when you are staying in a hotel, you are only in one room and have brought whatever you need for the time that you're there--so things can get a bit cluttered. Between that and the beds not being made (and gross)... the whole experience starts to feel uncomfortable. 

The second night, i was trying to fall asleep - and noticed red stains on the ceilings. Why would those stains be there?

I don't recommend this hotel and will not be going back.

title: Perfect Accommodations for Gift Show Attendees
text: For business or pleasure I would highly recommend this charming hotel. I shared a comfortable and clean two queen beds corner room with a co-worker. It was a spacious room with a nicely appointed bath with a whirlpool tub and the "TV" in the mirror. The closet was small but adequate for our needs. Following the advise of previous guest reviews, I requested a higher floor and had no problem with noise.i would also recommend setting the thermostat to "auto" and dialing down the temperature while you sleep. The friendly staff was very accommodating and the bellman service exceptional. Although timing gave me more contact with CJ both gentlemen are a valuable asset of the hotel!

title: Fine Time at the Flatiron
text: In all the 30-odd visits I have made to NYC, I had never stayed in the Flatiron district.  The location popped up as being ideal for a  recent combination business/leisure trip with my husband and a friend.  My challenge was to find a hotel in the neighborhood that would serve us all well.  I wanted a romantic pad for the first night, desk-work space and connectivity throughout the stay, enough room to welcome a third occupant for the second night, a reasonable rate and, dare-I-ask in Manhattan, abundant natural light?  I zeroed in on a Toshi Corner Deluxe room at the Flatiron.  With 2 queen beds, a spacious bathroom and wrap-around floor-to-ceiling windows, I scored a home run with all parties. We found the staff very welcoming.  Devin, in particular, had a knack for keeping an eye out and making sure that all of our needs were being met before even being asked.  The room was overall terrific, with a few rough edges; a leaky hot water tap, a loud and hot-air-blasting heating system, and oddly, soap was “on-request,” whereas bath gel, shampoo and conditioner were supplied.  Colors, décor and bed linens were all pleasing.  We had plenty of towels and wash cloths. The (no surcharge) WiFi worked fine. Closet space was tight but the corner room had good nooks to tuck things away and there were plenty of drawers under the TV stand and beds, so storage was ample.  I had been forewarned on TripAdvisor regarding loud and late lounge music 6 nights a week, so I requested a high floor room in advance of our stay. The request was acknowledge by email.  I admit that I was a bit disappointed to end up assigned to the 4th floor, only one floor above the first level of rooms.  Perhaps this was the only corner room left, but no explanation was given.  Music was indeed loud on Saturday night, but we did not return from our evening out until after 1 am, so we were not kept up for long and Sunday night was quiet.  All in all we were very satisfied with our stay and would happily return to the Flatiron Hotel.  I heartily recommend it to other travelers for whom the many pros outweigh the few cons.

title: Reasonable location but don't expect hotel chain facilities
text:
The hotel is well situated close to subways, north of some of the nice shopping areas, but south of some pretty shady areas.
Rooms are pretty good with comfortable beds. Few facilities in the hotel, for example only a bar, no restaurant.
The bar is really lively with live band on almost every night. 
I'm not sure if we were unlucky but there were a lot of unusual smells emanating from one of the rooms on a couple of nights; you could get high just by standing in the corridor!

title: I'll Be Back!
text: I made a last minute decision to stay in NYC last night rather than drive home late at night after hosting a birthday dinner for my daughter. As we were having dinner in the Chelsea/Flatiron district I searched under "hotel/chelsea/flatiron" and The Flatiron Hotel was one of the first to pop up.  It was in a great location, 9 W 26th St., and the rooms looked modern and frankly the prices looked impossible.  A regular room was listed around $169 so I sprang for the largest room for $233!  I have never stayed in NYC for anything close to that except when using Priceline.  The Flatiron is a boutique hotel with a very cool vibe.  The lobby is an open concept, sharing space with Toshi's Livingroom, a slick restaurant/bar with live music every single night.  As soon as you walk in you note an enormous spiraled floor to ceiling fish tank worthy of an HGTV special.  Fun.  The room was large and very tech saavy with switches for everything, a remote control for the curtains, a jetted tub in the bath and a huge mirror in the bath with an imbedded tv.  We had two very comfortable queen beds with abundant pillows. I'd like to mention again...for $233.  I love this neighborhood and will definitely be returning to this hotel in the near future.  If you stay here, dine at Cafeteria on 17th and 7th Ave.  It was fantastic.  Red Velvet Cake in a jar.  Need I say more?

title: 1st class treatment
text: We loved this hotel.  As others have said, the location is perfect for just about everything and walking distance to Eataly is a true bonus for me.  Everything in the room is fun, drapes, bathroom TV, shower with rainfall and jets and LED displays for do not disturb or housekeeping.  The room was good size for NYC and was cheery, bright and immaculate.  Anything we requested appeared nearly instantly.  I did find the automated mini bar weird.  The BEST part of our stay was the staff.  Every single person was helpful, genuinely friendly and just plain nice.  We stayed to attend a wedding and the next day we were asked how it was.  I often book hotels through 3rd party sites partly to save money and because I am afraid to pay full price for a place I don't know.  This is the only hotel where everyone treated us perfectly, most hotels treat bargain hunters like scum.  Next time I won't be afraid to book here.  Can't wait!

title: Hi Tech in older setting
text: Location was terrific, right in the middle of everything.  Room a bit small but nice.  TV in the bathroom mirror was fun as was trying to figure out the drapes.  Staff was friendly and helpful.  The bellboy gave some great tips and recommendations.  We moved to another hotel because additional nights were a bit expensive for our budget.

title: Perfect place to stay for a fun weekend in the city!
text:
Loved this place!  I stayed with a friend for a four day girls weekend that we booked blind on hotwire without knowing the name of the hotel until we confirmed.  Lucky for us because we really loved this place and may not have found it otherwise.

First of all, the location can't be beat- an easy walk to everywhere from Saks to Soho, subway only a block or two away, and only a short walk to Penn station.  Ideal for us because we wanted to cover a lot of ground.  Also good when you are planning to buy every pair of shoes in the city because you are never too far from the hotel to drop off your bags and keep going.  

The rooms were very clean and modern.  The shower was pretty amazing- plan an extra 30 minutes of shower time into your day because you will undoubtedly linger in that shower.  The tv in the bathroom mirror is pretty neat, although I couldn't see above the tv because I'm so short and used the full length mirror in the bedroom instead.

The lobby is great at night- fun and energizing!  They had great music during our stay and a pretty good stand up comedy night on Sunday.  And the fish tank is fabulous, especially lit up at night.

The Flatiron staff are what distinguish this hotel from the rest.  They are all very helpful, genuinely friendly, and surprisingly polished and professional for such a young team.  The service from everyone was great, from check in to requesting extra blankets to reserving and printing tickets for events to restaurant suggestions.  We particularly loved Devin!  He sent us to a number of great restaurants and was always excited to hear all about it when we got back. I'm a real foodie, so I knew I was in good hands when we asked him where he thought we should go and his eyes lit up when he spoke of caipirinhas and Brazilian food. He took such great care of us and was so welcoming when we would return each day!  Would have loved to pack him and the fish tank up to take home to PA but was limited to two carry on bags on the train.

I also felt very safe and comfortable here as well as in the surrounding neighborhood.  As a young woman who typically travels alone and therefore has to be safety conscious, I would not hesitate to come back here to stay on my own.  

Great stay, can't wait to go back!

title: The hotel is fine, but the third floor is unacceptable
text:
I've stayed at the Flatiron Hotel several times.  My other stays were totally ok.  Nothing great, nothing terrible.  On the plus side, the staff has been pretty good.  On the downside, some mistakes are made (e.g. last time, when I was leaving for the airport at 5am, the doorman directed me to the wrong towncar ... he put me in one ordered for someone else, while presumably that person got mine.  Thing is I had double-checked the name with him and he just said, "yeah"). Anyway, before I got all the way to New Jersey we figured it out, and I managed to get to JFK in time for my flight.  

So, back to this stay:  the problem is that there's a loud two-story night club downstairs; and on the third floor, you are just above the ceiling of the club.  The music plays til 1am... so if you need to go to sleep before that, you are screwed.  You are stuck listening to music that isn't all that great, at volume.  

I read a lot of tripadvisor reviews where people complain about noises, and i think they are just whiney.  Let me assure you this is not just a little bit of noise - it's a full-on live band.

Really, they just shouldn't rent rooms on the third floor to people, unless the offered a specific "noisy room" rate.  It's every night, and it's ridiculously unacceptable.

title: Fun and funky  - but stay in a high floor if you want to sleep!
text: I've stayed at the Flatiron several times. The rooms are funky and comfortable.  They are very tech oriented and sometimes hard to figure out how to turn the lights on or close the drapes.  But they are stylish and comfortable. The first floor has a restaurant/club with live music every night. It's quite a scene. You can hear the music loudly if you are below the 5th floor so choose wisely. The bar is super-fun but not if you're in your room trying to sleep!

title: Not worth the money...
text:
I stay in NY quite often and have been to many hotels, and the Flatiron really was not that great.  It is very clean hotel, located in the heart of Manhattan, but other than that it was not at all special.

The rooms are small and poorly lit.  The air handling system was SO noisy, it drove me nuts all night. There is no room service.  THere is a bar/restaurant down in the lobby, but I didn't get the sense it was associated directly with the hotel.  As most boutique hotels, there are very few services: no gym, etc.

The hotel staff were sweet, but not very experienced.  They were not very skilled at making restaurant recommendations, nor providing directions.

This hotel was quite also quite pricey for what we received.  Will most likely not return.

title: Fun decor, hard bed, no food
text: I had high hopes for the Flatiron, based on reviews and initial impression.  The decor is fresh and slightly funky, and the room had some fun features, such as the TV screen in the bathroom mirror.  Unfortunately, the bed and pillows were very hard and there was no breakfast on site, not even a modest continental offering.  This wouldn't have been so bad if there were options close by.  Amazingly, there were no diners or restaurants serving breakfast in the vacainity, just a couple of pizza shops, etc, that sold limited breakfast sandwiches.  Also, light sleepers might want to take note that there are live musical acts nightly on the hotel's main flooor.

title: Perfect stay!
text: New York was our first stop in our U.S trip - and what a great hotel to start! Walking distance to attraction like Times Square etc without being in too busy an area - room was awesome!!  A T.V . . .in the bathroom mirror!! And the bed was soo comfy! Room was spacious - great all-round hotel - would definitly stay here again!! :)

title: Flatiron in the city !
text: I was here visiting family for Christmas Eve.  The room had a tv in the bathroom and very comfy beds. Eva at the front desk was very helpful and had a smile on her face. She told me a great bistro to get dinner with my wife.

title: Great Stay. Can't wait to Return.
text:
We've stayed at a lot of hotels in NYC and we can't wait to return to the Flatiron.

If you're looking for clean, friendly, decent sized rooms and an ideal location - this hotel is for you.

I cannot say enough good things about the staff at the Flatiron. From day one they were helpful and easy to work with. We checked in early and they were kind enough to let us take our bags right up to our room instead of "checking" them for the afternoon. They provided lots of suggestions for new neighbourhoods for us to explore and reco'd travel routes.

The rooms are average size but the beds are really comfortable and the shower is amazing. There's even a TV in the bathroom mirror.

What makes this hotel worth every penny is the location. It's far enough away from crazy Time Square - so you can at least get some sleep at night but it's a close enough walk to hundreds of sights restaurants, bars and boutiques. 

We will be staying here again for sure!

title: Great employees
text: We had very helpful attendants, devin and carmello in particular were excellent, we had a nice conversation and they directed us to vegetarian friendly places to eat. Also Benz helped us to our requested room and I am still here and loving it!

title: Quirky Central Location!
text:
Excellent hotel. Quirky designed hotel. The reception area is plain & average until you see the beautiful floor to ceiling fish tank. The ground floor bar continues the vibrant theme with a hint of Alice in wonderland look to the seating. 
The rooms were beautiful with the most amazing comfortable beds. Pure perfection after a long trek around New York!! We didn't eat at the hotel but the bar was packed and had live  music every night. There wasn't a gym on site but we had use of a gym two blocks down which was fine. 
The staff were all very friendly and we would definitely stay again however we were lucky & got a good deal on the room :) 
The hotel was located right near a subway (which you could hear!) however that just added to the New York vibe.

title: Loved those great big windows.
text: If you are a frequent visitor to NYC it is fun to stay in different neighborhoods.  Flatiron is less crowded and more livable then up town.  There is also a great selection of restaurants nearby.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.  Its small size is also a nice change from the uptown monsters.  Yes the rooms are small but as a single traveler I was very comfortable.    They compensate for the small rooms by having beautiful marble bathrooms and fancy showers.  The room had free internet and in room coffee.  Breakfast is not available.  Oddly it had no clock radio and the automated telephone wakeup call failed me.  I enjoyed the view from the 10th floor.  Loved those great big windows.  There really is no common space.  In the lobby there is a club with free entertainment.  However if someone was performing the seats were full and the rest of the time that space was closed off.  I forgot to turn off my do not disturb sign one day.  So when I returned to the room late in the day it was not clean of course.  Within 5 minutes of turning off the do not disturb sign housekeeping arrived.  Very impressive.  A few years ago I stayed at the Giraffe Hotel not that far away.  I believe that the Giraffe is much more expensive.  It’s hard to tell because hotels are such game players with rates.  If the rates were close the Giraffe offers much more.

title: Bring your flannel pjs.
text:
My friend and I got a decent deal on Hotwire and were glad to be in a fairly central location. I will second what others have said, you need to go a distance for any decent food and the subway lines we needed were a 10-15 minute walk.  There is, however, a nice whiskey bar just a few hundred feet away.

As RJL mentioned, there were some interesting technological upgrades in the room (tv in the bathroom mirror, button by the bed to close the curtains) but call me old-fashioned, I just want a room without a draft. My friend kept asking me if the window was open and we made a running joke about who has to have the bed closest to the window. While I don't mind the close quarters (this is NYC, after all), when you have to sleep one foot away from a window that feels like it's open, it can be a bit uncomfortable.

Speaking of uncomfortable, the bed was too hard for my taste. I didn't sleep much the three nights we were there but that could have also been because of the incredible noise outside (NYC, I know).

We never went to the bars but I would agree that seems to be where most of the attention is paid. I never really understood the draw...

The reason why I gave a rating as high as "average" was the staff. They were really terrific and attempted to take care of us at every turn. Just don't go to them for recommendations unless you want the true tourist traps of the city...

title: Not all it appears
text:
I was looking forward to staying at the Flatiron as the website certainly made it alluring.  The room itself wasn't bad and the bed was pretty comfortable.  I rank it "poor" for several other reasons.

The bathroom was ridiculous - so small you have to squeeze into it and close the door before you can even see the toilet.  No soap dishes of any kind.  In fact, no place to put soap or shampoo in the shower other than the floor.  They have opted for some trendy "perks" which are nice on the surface but not worth the effort.  The bathroom mirror has a TV nested within the mirror itself.  At first this seemed pretty cool but quickly became a nuisance as you can really use that part of the mirror for shaving.  They also have a wall shower in addition to the overhead but the showere stall is so ridiculously small I could barely squeeze into it.  I'd prefer a soap dish over these expense and useless additions.

The wireless internet is beyond ridiculous.  The signal strength goes in and out all the time.  I sat and watched it go from 1 bar to 3 bars back to 1 bar, over and over.  When I called the front desk, they explained that the internet may be slow when the bar is full downstairs.  Slow internet doesnt' explain why I can't attach to the local wireless network however.  Moreover, I got up a 6 AM to get some important work done and the internet was still *painfully* slow.

Perhaps the biggest problem of all is that they have no room service!  I've stayed in all kinds of hotels all over the world of every shape and size and every price category.  Even those places that don't have a restaurant or kitchen at least provide local take out menus.  The only available information in the room was urging me to check out Toshi's, the clubs on the ground floor and penthouse.  Clearly, the clubs are what the owners care about.  This hotel has a restaurant/kitchen but no room service!  I've never seen such a thing.  The local food establishments leave a lot to be desired.  This is probably the only area in NYC that has very few choices for food without venturing farther afield.

Other nitpicky problems - the desk chair is actually quite nice, but since the room was so small, I couldn't fully pull it out and had to stand on top of it and gradually slip my legs under the desk.  Also, I had turned on the "Do Not Disturb" sign as soon as checking into the room as I was very jet lagged and needed to take a nap.  As soon as I fell asleep, someone from Housekeeping knocked and entered the room to restock the minibar even with the Do Not Disturb prominently displayed.  There is no concierge service to speak of and I ended up having to find out everything myself as the staff seemed to know nothing about New York City.

They should stop spending money on useless oddities like curtains around the bed and provide some of the basic features all hotels have.  It's clear that Toshi does *NOT* love us - he loves his bars but cares very little about taking care of his guests.  If you are as disappointed as I was, you can always wipe your feet on the rug that has Toshi's picture on it....

title: Eh... at best
text:
I lived in New York and have reasonable expectations of what you get at hotels in the city.  I was disappointed by the Flatiron Hotel.

I'll start off by saying that this hotel is in a perfect, convenient location.  That is key.  It goes downhill from there.  I agree with others who say this is not a 4 star hotel.  I've stayed at many boutique hotels, frequently with Kimpton--and if you think that's the level of service/ambiance you'll get here, you're wrong.  The whole hotel seemed a bit haphazard--from the bizarre lobby with aquarium and a very loud bar/live performance area--to the room which was very gimmicky/electronic/digital, but nothing really worked right.  I had to switch rooms because things weren't working properly in my first room.  The size is ok--nothing to be excited about--but normal for a NY hotel.  I also wasn't impressed with the service.  They were willing to help when asked but definitely nothing above and beyond.  Also, they make you pay to store your bags... Seriously?  At a hotel that's theoretically a 4 star?  That's just a service you provide for people who are paying $ already to stay with you.

This hotel is aspiring to be something cool, hip, high end.  But on all accounts, it does not succeed.

Finally, I had horrible sleep staying here.  I live in a city--on a traffic circle--so I'm not sensitive about sound.  I'd read about the bands downstairs so requested a room on a high floor.  I got floor 5.  I could hear the pounding of the bar downstairs and the live music until past 2 am.  This is NOT a comfortable place to stay.  Not the worst.
