But I'd sooner stay at the Chelsea Hampton Inn next time than here!

title: Great staff, wonderful rooms
text: We had a fabulous stay at the Flatiron Hotel this past weekend.  The staff was warm, friendly and very helpful.  We have a son who is a year old and therefore have a lot of special needs when we travel (crib, refrigerator, etc.) and the staff was very willing to help us and had a great attitude.  Johnny Ortega in particular was excellent and very helpful in putting together the pack 'n play for us and making sure that we had everything we needed.  The room was clean, modern and spacious (for NYC).  Loved the shower.  The bar/lounge downstairs was very cozy and fun - we enjoyed the music and the drinks there.  Overall, great experience and would definitely recommend this hotel.

title: Stylish but noisy
text: This is a fashionable boutique-style hotel right at the corner of 26th St and Broadway, so close to Fifth Avenue shopping and an easy walk to Penn Station and Times Square. My room wasn't large but was well appointed with contemporary furniture, including electric drapes controlled from a bedside switch. The bathroom had the tech gimmick of a TV built into the mirror (which I had no interest in, and which, when switched off, meant there was a dark rectangle in the mirror when I was shaving).  The shower was a highlight: a combination of overhead rain showerhead and front-on body sprays: you could select either or both with the rotating knob. The main problem with the accommodation was that no amount of flashy technology could conceal the underlying dated infrastructure. The heating was crude: every few minutes it came on with a huge whirr and blasted the room with hot air until it began to feel oppressive, then it switched off again and the temperature dropped away until the cycle was repeated. During the night I switched it off to avoid the noise and the big temperature swings while I was under the covers. But at least the room had heat: the bathroom, on the other hand, was distinctly chilly. It seemed that there was no heating there at all, except when you opened the door to let a little drift in from the room. Hotel staff were very friendly but another annoyance was the restaurant/ bar on the ground floor, where at check-in a band was playing so loudly that I asked for a high-floor room. The receptionist chuckled, obviously knowing exactly what I was talking about, having had to work with it all evening. In summary, a great location and nice fitments in the rooms, but with issues caused partly by their own making and partly by the fact that this is a conversion of an old building.

title: Gem in the Flatiron district
text: I landed up at this hotel by chance (long story)...what a lovely hotel.  Samantha and Jason at the front desk were wonderful and settled my very ruffled feathers.  The room was small, but beautifully appointed and, most importantly, quiet, even though the lobby is busy and hopping and loud!  The location is great and very safe for a woman on her own.  Walked at all times of day and night and never felt unsafe.

title: Trustworthy, AMAZING staff
text:
The staff is wonderful. I forgot my ipad in my room--only remembered when I was at JFK. I called and they'd found it. I emailed all of my info to them right then and by the next day it was already at UPS being shipped to me. Not only was everyone amazingly honest in this situation, but what wonderful service to package and ship the very next day.

The room was what I expected and the location was perfect for me. Would definitely book again.

title: Not a 4 star in my opinion
text:
I was disappointed.
The furnishings and room are sumptiously decorated, and there is a TV in the mirror of the bathroom - and I can't complain about the sheets or attress.  The room was laughably small - but that's true of NYC in general.  Only a Queen bed, which is too small for the two of us. 

But, the towels were ratty - I've added a photo.  The thermostat has a blue screen which is right at the sleeper's eye - a no-no for good sleep.  The hotel information notebook had no pages, and when we asked for them, never receved them.

There is a nightclub on the first floor.  It certainly looks popular and has live music.  BUT, we were in room 301 which is RIGHT above the nightclub.  Nightclub = nightmare when you want to sleep.

title: Good for the most part
text: I stayed here because it is right around the corner from our office. The property is nice, the bed was so comfortable I didn't want to get up. My only complaint was the service. My shower was broken and they sent someone to fix it. Well, he needed to replace a part and said he'd be back. But he never returned. So I have a full day of meetings and feel disgusting, but that's cool. When I came back around 6pm and it was still not fixed, I went to the lobby and asked to talk to a manager. Another guest services employee was there and asked me what was wrong. They finally got everything fixed and the manager apologized but I literally had to ask them three times to fix my shower. Once it was fixed though, it was the greatest shower ever.

title: Average Hotel, Amazing Staff
text: This hotel was nice but little things bothered me.  I was on the 8th floor and it was extremely noisy.  (street noise)  Another minor irritating thing was my alarm clock was two hours fast.  I think Housekeeping should be aware and take care of things like that.  I also had a light bulb out, and they were stingy on the amount of towels that they supplied.  There was also a tv built into the bathroom mirror, which was distracting because it was at eye level of where I look into the mirror so it made getting ready difficult because I saw the tv and not my face.  On a good note, the staff was super friendly, the room was clean and the location was superb.

title: great central hotel
text:
Stayed at this Hotel for 5 nights beginning of November with my aunt. Great spot with very friendly staff. Our room on 9th floor, quiet, cleaned every day and fresh towels left, air-con stayed in average sized room, TV, with a  small bathroom which had a TV in thr mirror.
Best bit were the staff very friendly, helpful when we needed help printing off boarding passes and booking airport transfers. My aunt fell in love with Tony bar staff and Devin. Very happy to try and please loved the breakfast served in the bar. Don't miss the music in the evening got some great singers like having a broadway show in your hotel, hence very popular with non residents. Drinks a bit pricey but very central and would certainly go back. Just down the road from the Empire States and just around the corner from the underground if you're not into walking.

title: Great place to stay in nyc
text: Great hotel! I booked it because i got an offer in hotwire. I loved it, great daytime service in the lobby, great music in the night because they have a trendy bar and lounge, excellent area, near everything, the best places to eat and shop. I recommend this hotel to everyone.

title: Cool Hotel, Friendly People
text:
We stayed at the Flatiron for 4 days while my son visited colleges in NYC. It made a great home base. Central location, close to subways. Many people write about the small rooms, but I'm assuming they've not stayed in New York very often. We had a room with two double beds and it was plenty large enough for my wife, my son and me. 
Definitely try to get a higher floor, as there is music in the lobby nightclub every night. Our room was on the 9th floor and we had not trouble with noise (other than they typical New York street sounds).
Hotel staff was uniformly friendly and helpful. 
Highly recommended.

title: Nice Hotel, Outstanding Service
text:
Tripadvisor Review

Thanks to the collaborate efforts of FEMA and Flatiron Hotel, my family and I found a warm and friendly place to stay after Hurricane Sandy hit, leaving us with no power for 14 days.

Most hotel rooms in Manhattan are the size of some people's closets. But surprisingly Flatiron Hotel has big rooms. We had a corner room on the 6th floor with 2 queen beds, flat screen TV, even the bathroom had a built in TV in the mirror.  The hotel bar/lounge has live music daily. I hate when places charge you for Wi-Fi, and some hotels even have the nerve to charge you per device. But Flatiron Hotel not only provides this service free of charge but the access code and password to log on to the Wi-Fi is written on your key card holder.  Thats considerate and a nice added touch. How many times have you called the front desk asking for the password all annoyed after finding out it cost $15 per day per laptop and iPad? Hotel guests also get complimentary access to a 24hr Fitness Derek Jeter gym across the street. 

I am a New Yorker and I have to say this hotel has a GREAT LOCATION. It is walking distance to Union Square, Herald Square, Times Square etc. but is still away from the hustle and bustle of things so you can get a goodnight sleep. Also there are some good eats down the block and around the corner like Hill Country BBQ, Melt Shop and Shake Shack.

What trumps the spacious rooms and great location is their hospitality. Because of JASON from Guest Services, my 3 year old and 6 month old finally got warm showers and slept in warm beds after being nomads for a week. So thank you again for everything Jason! I even asked for Jason at the front desk on his day off (unknowingly) and he called me the same day and even gave me his cell phone number in case I needed him again. Who does that?! To say the least, Jason and the staff treated us like we owned the place during our stay. I felt like Paris Hilton at The Waldorf Astoria.

Don't go looking for flashy hotels in the middle of Times Square, you will be broke and unsatisfied.  Book your next stay here because after a long tiring day of sightseeing, you will want to come back to a place like home...and the staff at Flatiron Hotel sure know how to treat people like they live there!

title: Great Hotel in Good Location
text: Rooms are small but well put together lots of cools stuff push button draps, TV behind the mirror in the bathroom, full body shower electric "do not disturb" sign.  Storage looks very limited but they put drawers under the bed that really helped out.  Lobby was cool with the fish tank loud at night with live shows and the busy bar area spilling out into the lobby.  Would stay here again!

title: Great job post-hurricane
text:
Kudos to manager Vita and her staff for their excellent service during the blackout. Given what I was reading, I assumed that my trip to NYC would have to be cancelled, but I called the Flatiron and they assured me that they had power.  When I arrived, their's was the only block with power in an oasis of Manhattan darkness.  Operating with a skeletal staff that went above and beyond the call of duty, they provided an immaculate room and excellent service.  Although they were inundated with people from the neighborhood seeking respite, and the restaurant was getting low on food, they did everything possible to make people comfortable, were incredibly upbeat and helpful. I didn't expect to like the hotel much because it's very "trendy" but it turned out to be lovely and relaxed.

The room was small, but the high ceiling, large windows, and strategic use of space made it very pleasant.  Nice furniture/linens, marble bathroom with rain shower, but no counter space. The high tech features were cute but unnecessary.  I liked the digital "do not disturb" but the television in the bathroom mirror, after the 10-second "wow," was just silly, since the bathroom was so minuscule that it was senseless to watch it; also the reflection in the mirror required turning the lights off in order to see it.

title: Small room but great location
text: Rooms are probably ok for one adult but not two and a toddler!  I'm afraid very small and moving about proved to be a challenge.  Rooms are pricey here but they are very well kept and the furnishings are of high quality.  Would only stay here and sacrifice space available if a good deal was going.

title: Swanky Little Spot
text:
Small boutique hotel with lovely linens. Rooms were VERY tight and the shower even tighter. Like don't drop the soap because there's no way to bend over to retrieve it.

Entertainment in the lounge area was quite good. Staff was very friendly. Centrally located.

title: Small and Pricey, but great neighborhood
text:
Some of the smaller rooms I've encountered have been at the Flatiron. It's fine if you are solo on business. tiny bathroom but modern. the rooms are well appointed despite size. unfortunately, there are so many better value alternatives nearby that i rarely stay here -- the rates are great in the winter but then go up dramatically and make it not worth the $. 
the neighborhood is terrific but it can be noisy - madison square park right outside your door. Eataly and the rooftop beer garden, and a short walk to some of lower manhattan's best neighborhoods.
while i don't use it as a regular traveler to NY, the Flatiron is worth visiting, at least once.

title: Great Stay During Hurricane Sandy
text: We had to leave our apartment because of an extended power outage during Hurricane Sandy.  We drove around the neighborhood and all of the hotels were booked.  Then we happened to pass the Flatiron and they had rooms.  We spent three nights in a corner double, with two queen beds and windows on three sides.  Our office was also closed, so we needed the space to work it.  It was very spacious and comfortable.  The room and hallways were very stylish and well-appointed.  There is a lively nightclub off the lobby with great music.  The staff was very accommodating and helpful.  The neighborhood is great -- lots happening on the stretch of Broadway between 23rd and 34th -- very up and coming.  Plus you are located close to beautiful Madison Square Park.  Transit options good, too.  Highly recommended.

title: Strangest place I ever stayed
text:
I have traveled all over the world and this  is the strangest hotel I've ever stayed in. The most positive thing about the hotel is the staff. They are friendly, efficient and eager to please. After that, the place is all down hill.
The hotel considers itself a "boutique " luxury hotel. It is neither. It may have been conceived as one but in reality,it falls far short. Rooms are quite small. Items like automated drapes either don't work or close by themselves in the middle of the night. The heating system is a nightmare. There is no control for the fan. When on it cannot be adjusted providing a burst of hot air. Since it gets too hot, the only option is not to regulate it, but to turn it off. The result is the room is then too cold and drafty.
This on/off scenario goes on all night long. The bathroom have no soap dishes or more importantly, drinking glasses. You must call the desk to get cheap paper cups. There is an automated mini bar but no glasses for drinks. There is no ice machine. You must call the front desk to have ice delivered. There isno room service.
We paid an outrageous $467.00 per night without taxes. The hotel claimstohave a fitness center but we were told it was no longer available and was being dismantled by management. We were told there was free WiFi access but the signal was so low we could never access it  in our room.
For the first two days the flat screen television only worked sporadically, unable ompletely to get major channels. When we complained several times to the front desk, we were informed it was because it was satellite TV and the signal was week due to hurricane Sandy. After two days of paying $467.00 per night with no television, we called the front desk yet again and insisted that they send up a technician. The technician discovered and fixed the problem Ina matter of minutes. The problem was the  connection not  hurricane Sandy
The feeling one gets from staying here is that the hotel seemed to have been designed as a boutique hotel but that a deciision has been made to operate it as a budget hotel. That would be fine at $200 a night not $467.

We paid an average of $467.00 per night without taxes

title: The Flatiron Hotel made Hurricane Sandy Bearable
text:
My best friend and I travelled to New York City this past Friday, and got stuck in the city due to Hurricane Sandy. We stayed at the Flatiron hotel for Sunday-Wednesday of the hurricane. This hotel exceeded our expectations by far, and made what was a pretty heinous experience bearable. I have never been more pleased with my stay at any hotel, ever, in the world. This is a cool hotel - it is decorated in modern fashion with new, stylish rooms, super cool amenities (such as a tv built into the bathroom mirror and a rain shower that I literaly spent an hour and a half in) and the staff is truly fantastic. We are forever indebted to the Flatiron Hotel for entertaining us in a city that was almost completely shut down and we will definitely stay at this hotel again the next time we come to NYC.

Kristina Desimini and Visnja Tibljas
Toronto, Ontario

title: great location, friendly and helpful service
text: I have stayed at this hotel a few times during business trips to NYC.  The front desk staff, especially Jason, are ALWAYS helpful, friendly and accomdating.  The bar and restaurant has great food and some of the best entertainment in NYC.  Toshi and Ponzu, owner and his 4 legged partner, is extremely friendly and his number #1 priority is making sure his guests are comfortable.  I will always recommend the Flatiron Hotel and will definitely be returning to the hotel for my upcoming NYC trips, which will be next weekend.  I am looking forward to returning to the Flatiron Hotel and hope I will be able to bring my dog with me for my next stay.

title: Great value for the location
text: Needed a hotel in the Flatiron district that was near a work event and scored a great rate via Hotwire at the last minute. Very skeptical at first because it seemed too good to be true...but pleasantly surprised when it turned out to be a decent place. Beds very comfortable, bathroom clean and modern (but TINY), friendly staff. Only two gripes - carpet had seen better days (a little frayed and stained in places) and if you go to bed early (before 1 am) the live music from the club in the lobby will likely keep you awake. But if you're determined to make the most of your stay in NYC and just need a place to crash late at night, this is definitely a hotel you'll want to consider.

title: be advised, there is live music in the lobby every night
text:
I got this hotel on Hotwire for 3 nights at $189/night so I can't really complain, however, it should really be considered a 3.5 star hotel.

I booked on hotwire for 2 people.  They gave me a full sized bed (I'm 6'4").  I complained, they moved me to a king bed.

At check in, there was no bell hop to help me with my bags

There was a band played crappy cover songs in the lobby (guy sounded like Montell Jordan rapping Jay Z's verse on "Crazy In Love") that was so loud, I couldn't even hear the person at the front desk.

I got up to the room (408) and could still hear the band in the lobby.  They stopped playing around 1:30 in the morning.

The room is very small and bizarrely appointed.  No nightstand.  Random chair under the TV.  The chair at the desk doesn't fit.  Can barely fit one person the bathroom.

The bed was VERY comfortable and the shower was great.

All in well it was an okay stay and the location is very convenient, however, I'd hardly call it a 4 star (no room svc, no gym, no pay per view).

The free internet is also a bonus.

title: Ideal für alle Unternehmungen
text:
Das Hotel, direkt am Madison Square Parc gelegen, ist ideal für alle Besucher, die viel zu Fuß unternehmen wollen und abends in ihrem Viertel Essen gehen wollen. 
Fast hätte ich mich von den vielen negativen Bewertungen abschrecken lassen. Aber das wäre definitiv ein Fehler gewesen. Wählen Sie ein Zimmer im oberen Stockwerk, um der abendlichen Lifemusik zu entgehen. Aber gerade die verschiedenen Sänger machen den Charme dieses Hotels wirklich aus. Die beiden Doormen sind von großer Freundlichkeit und Hilfsbereitschaft. Der Preis für New sehr günstig. Die Eckzimmer geräumig und mit Kaffeemaschine reichen gut für Familien mit zwei Kindern.

title: Nice hotel in the city
text:
We stayed for two nights, four friends.  We had a very decent room, very clean and comfortable.  The bathroom was clean, with all the standard amenities plus a waterproof t.v. 

We found that this hotel is very close to some important must go spots, and the service is very good and quick.  I reserved this hotel for me, but because we were traveling from different cities, one of my friends will arrive earlier than I, so I wrote an e-mail to ask that let my friend do the check-in, and in two hours I had the reply on my inbox, of course, my friend didn´t have any issue.

I really recommend this hotel if you prefer to stay in Central Manhattan.

title: Great stay at Flatiron
text: We stayed one recent Friday night at The Flatiron and would recommend this hotel to others and would stay there again ourselves.  The location is great on 26th Street, just off of Fifth - a short walk to Eataly, Madison Park w/Shake Shack, Flatiron Building, Union Square Farmer's Market and walk down Fifth to Greenwich Village, Soho, etc.  The front desk staff were friendly and made a point of saying hello and "Welcome back" when we returned from being out. Having stayed in many hotels - this level of friendliness stood out. The lobby shares its space with a lounge that has singers/bands at night - so one returns to a very loud performance and nightclub atmosphere going on..at least on the Friday night we were there! So - not sure if that's everyone's cup of tea. That wouldn't be our first choice to have in a hotel lobby...would be nice if it were a little more separated from the lobby - or if the volume of the microphone wasn't as ear-splitting (!) But our room was great - large enough w/king size bed, great bathroom (small, yes...but well designed with dark grey marble, seamless glass shower doors and fabulous multi-jet shower)..flatscreen tv in room and tv inset into bathroom mirror, large floor to ceiling window serves as one wall  of the room overlooking 26th Street w/automatic curtains...we were happy to be on the 6th floor and at the far end (away from 5th Ave) for a quieter sleep.  Definitely ask to be in a room far above from the performance area of the lobby.  The fan in the room served somewhat as white noise, so we didn't wake up to hear trucks/ street noise in the middle of the night.  Rooms felt new/clean/tastefully decorated.  Surprisingly reasonable price for a hotel in a great location with comfortable room that felt fresh/clean/modern with very comfortable bed/bedding too.  A great find.

title: Boutique hotel w/ a chain price !!
text:
This was a great hotel.  

Location: only 2 blocks from Gramercy Square.  Hence the name, as the Flatiron building is on the square.  It was great to check out Mario Batali's italian market and cluster of mini restaurants, named Eatery.  Eatery is also located on Gramercy square.  (I will give a separate, more detailed review on this.)  If you are a walker, and just have an overnight bag, you can walk from Penn Station.  If you need a cab, it was only about $10.  Long Island Railroad to/ from Penn Station is the most direct, straight forward way to transfer from airport to city.

Room itself:  Tasteful, and well selected details.  According to my friend, who is an actress and goes to the city often, the rooms are more spacious than other downtown locations.  She invited me to join her on this trek, and we had two beds in the room.  Since I did not take care of making the reservations, etc..... cannot really speak to other comments about one bed not being available.  

Bathroom: The bathroom was uber cool.  The shower had a set up that had 4 shower heads that came out of the side, and then another giant sunflower shower head.  And the mirror in the bathroom had a TV built into it.  It was really cool.  And the towels were thick and soft.

Service:  We had some hours after check out before we left for the airport.  The hotel was gracious and stored our bags.  The cost was $1 per bag to store.  When the time came, they helped us get our bags loaded into a taxi and off we went.  

Overall, I very much enjoyed this hotel's room, the service of the staff, and the location.

title: Decent option in the city
text:
Stayed at the Flatiron on a deal from priceline. The rate was very good and the hotel is quite vibey in a lovely area. The room was tiny, but i guess most NYC rooms are. The bed is pretty small too but very very comfy. The hotel is quite new and has nice modern features like tv screen in the bathroom mirror, free wifi throughout the hotel, rain shower and electric curtains ect.
The staff are all very friendly and helpful and always offer to assist you when they see you in the lobby.
My main complaint was cleaning staff. The room was pretty clean however it was only cleaned late afternoon and the passages were vacuumed at 5pm in the afternoon. So forget about afternoon naps!

title: We really enjoyed this hotel
text: We got this hotel from Hotwire.  We were a little surprised when we learned the bed would be a full-size mattress and not something bigger, but that's what you get when you gamble on a boutique hotel.  Other reviews have complained about noise, but we were on the 5th floor and weren't really bothered by it much--you hear some car honks and the underground subway, but hey, it's the big city. The automated curtains were cool; there was a receiver tucked away in the room's desk so you could play music in surround sound; a closet unit to hang clothes in next to the fluffy bathrobes; expensive snacks, if you so choose; iron and ironing board; iHome clock; hairdryer; coffee pot; TV in the small shower room (no tub); another TV mounted above the desk, and an extra chair to sit in by the bed.  The bed size ended up being not a problem after all.  The shower had many water heads on it, so that was really cool.  They do not have rollaways because the rooms are small, so if you have more than 2 people or have adult family members or friends of the opposite sex, be sure to see if they have a two bed option before booking.   I would not hesitate to stay in this hotel again, as it's location was really convenient to a lot of touristy things to do around Broadway and Times Square.  The subway is nearby, so it's easy to hop on and off of it if you get tired of walking so much.  The staff was very friendly and accommodating.

title: Cleaned every day
text: The hotel was in a brilliant location about 30 minutes from times square. Our room was cleaned every day. The bar is loud at night but where we stayed on the 8th floor we could not hear a thing. I would stay here again.

title: Hip and Comfy
text: We had a girls weekend in NYC and stayed at The Flatiron Hotel for two nights in the corner 'suite' / room. The decor is nice, modern and happy colors. The automated curtains didn't work so well, but we got a kick out of it when they opened and closed on their own. Our room faced B'way and 26th and we were on the 8th floor, although we heard the subway pretty clearly every time it went by! Reminds you that you are in NYC. I asked for a upper room after reading about the noise level of the restaurant / lounge in the lobby. Since we were there over Labor Day weekend the lounge was dead so I can't comment on the noise. The staff was friendly and helpful as much as NYC staff usually are when not staying at the Ritz! For the price, location and comfortable rooms it gets a solid thumbs up.

title: New Hotel in New York City
text: My daughter and i were pleasantly surprised at how nice this new hotel in New York City was.  It is located on the corner of 26th and Broadway, which use to be a very sketchy area, but is now in transformation. The rooms are nicely decorated, and the bathroom has all of the updated amenities, such as a tv in the mirror, and multiple choices for your shower.  There is a restaurant which has a small menu, but everything that we had was excellent!  They have a happy hour with a good wine for $5.00, and entertainment starting at 6:00.  I have never stayed anywhere in N.Y. which offered all of this, plus a staff that is extremely nice and helpful!!!  Hope you enjoy your stray as much as we did!

title: Bueno, pero podría ser excelente
text: La instalaciones son inmejorables para el precio y para ser NYC. La atención, es especial de todo el personal en el lobby es sin duda una de las mejores que he recibido en mis viajes a Manhattan. El "pero" es que hay un bar en la entrada del hotel, donde habitualmente està el dueño del hotel, que arruina la estadia para las habitaciones de los pisos màs bajos (música y ruido hasta la madrugada). Por suerte me tocò una habitación en el piso 9!

title: Good service, but noise is a problem
text: Unfortunately, noise can be a problem in this hotel. The staff are very nice and helpful, but street noise from nighttime roadwork made it impossible to sleep.  The rooms are clean, but New York sized (small). The bed is comfortable and the shower good, as other reviews have noted. The TV in the bathroom mirror may seem cool, but it makes the mirror a little hard to use for shorter people (for example, putting on makeup). As with many NYC hotels, the in-room services are bare: no room service, no movies on the TV. One isnt really expected to stay in the room I guess. But after a long day out in the city, it would be nice if one could at least order a drink up from the bar or watch a flick. Maybe the hotel could add some such services.

title: hotel flatiron
text: excelente hotel,personal muy amable,habitación cuadruple,con dos camas de matrimonio,buenas cortinas para tapar la luz,televisión en el espejo del baño,al lado de la 5ª avenida,muy cerca del Empire State,muy buena ubicación.Lo aconsejo de todas todas.

title: Boutique, Clean, Friendly Staff
text: Me and 3 of my girlfriends stayed in the corner Toshi suite. We really loved it. It's a smaller boutique hotel and the staff was super friendly. It's at a great location and is on the corner so ask for a higher floor for added quiet from the street.  We had no problems with noise.  There is a bar downstairs that has live music at night and serves food. We really enjoyed our stay there and were pleasently surprised because in NYC you really never know what you're gonna get until you are actually there.

title: Love the living room!!!
text: I came to NYC for the first time with my boyfriend last week and we wanted to stay in a convient area. The rooms are clean (a bit small but it's ny) and the location is great! There was live music in the lounge/restaurant which was really fun and upbeat, and the theme reminded me of something from Alice and Wonderland. The food is really good (we had the sliders and truffle pizza yum!) the drinks were a tad pricey at $15 a cocktail but delicious none the less (I recommend the strawberry one- I forget what it's called but it's really tasty) the entire staff was super helpful and friendly-- the vibe was good and everyone here seems to get along like a big family such a change from other places we experienced where the servers seemed miserable and stressed!! I highly recommend going here if you're in NYC.

title: Nice Place
text: My husband and I and another couple stayed here Labor Day weekend (through a special from Travelzoo) and we were very satisfied with the hotel.  The location was great (a block from Eataly), it is located on 26th street between 5th and 6th avenues.  The lobby was beautiful, the rooms were pretty spacious for a little NY hotel.  EVERYONE at the desk was nicer than nice.  There were bands there every night and they were pretty loud but we were not affected at all and we were only on the third floor.  Do not touch anything in the fridge or on top of it because there is a 20 second sensor and if you don't put things back you will get charged but we didn't move anything and had no problems.  The air conditioner gets a little loud at night but that too was no big deal.  I would definitely go back there, it was a nice experience.

title: Flatiron Hotel...buon albergo se trovate l'offerta!
text:
Posizione ottima, a 2 passi dalla 5', ad una altezza buona, perchè è in una via di mezzo sia per andare a sud che a nord di Manhattan.
L'albergo l'ho prenotato da Booking, cogliendo l'offerta lampo ancora a marzo, abbiamo pagato € 124,50 a notte (incluse tasse e spese di gestione varie) la camera doppia standard.
L'albergo è bello, di recente ristrutturato. Sicuramente paga l'occhio.

Premetto che per quello che lo abbiamo pagato...anche troppo per tutto (quindi sono contentissima della scelta fatta!!!).
Ma per il prezzo a cui danno le camere sul sito, avrei qualche appunto da fare.
La standard ha un letto di 1 piazza e mezza. La camera non è piccolissima, ma il letto si. Comunque è arredata bene, con un bel bagno.
Altro appunto. Siamo stati in questo albergo sia all'inizio della vacanza che alla fine. La prima volta per tre notti al sesto piano alla 606, la seconda volta per 2 notti al nono alla 906. Nonostante l'altezza, le camere sono rumorose. Il kaos che c'è fuori sulla strada e sotto, si sente parecchio. E' anche vero che noi la sera eravamo talmente cotti che non abbiamo avuto grossi problemi a dormire.

L'albergo è abbastanza vicino alla metro, ma non vicinissimo, bisogna andare o alla 23'th o alla 28'th.

Nella bella Hall c'è un piano bar, dove fanno musica dal vivo...anche quei rumori arrivano in camera!
Comunque nel complesso, bell'albergo. Pulito. Personale gentile e disponibile. Ha una postazione pc disponibile per i clienti, con stampante collegata...postazione da noi utilizzata per fare il check-in dei voli per il rientro a casa.

Wi-fi free in tutto l'albergo, che funziona abbastanza bene anche per chiamarte, sia dalla camera che dalla reception.

title: Don't Stay Here
text:
I read the mixed reviews on this website and I thought I would risk it by going, but I really should have listened because everything they said was right. The hotel is very noisy, not good for light sleepers. I was very specific about getting a room on a quiet floor and be sure to ask for it on the side that doesn't face the subway line. Toshi's "lounge" is extremely loud and there can be some horrid singers, so you don't want to hear that all night. The waitresses at the lounge were all too busy chatting with themselves and fixing their dresses instead of providing service, so I wouldn't bother going there. 

The room itself was pretty decent after we finally got one. Apparently our original room had "frozen over" because someone left the AC on, so we had to get a different room. 

If you go through Bookit.com and you're entitled to two free drinks, be careful to ask in advance. The concierge had no idea what we were talking about and I got some vague answer about them comping it at the end, which I had to argue for when the bill actually came. The concierge in general were all pretty lax and unprofessional. 

I really wouldn't bother staying here, there are tons of better locations and better hotels to stay at. 

Also, the CHARGE you to hold your bags. We had to pay twice when we were checking in and checking out to pay for our bags at $1 per bag. I've never had a hotel that needed to charge for holding the bags for 2 hours. Ridiculous.

title: I wanted to move in!
text: The Flatiron is an amazing hotel. The hotel and rooms are gorgeous. The staff went above and beyond in every way. They even googled and printed out a list of restaurants for us when we wanted to eat in Little Italy. I can't wait to come back to NYC just to stay here again. HIGHLY recommended.

title: Great Stay......
text:
My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights Labor Day weekend.  The location was the best.  We walked and walked!!!  From  Chinatown to Little Italy one day and to Central Park the next.

Every night we asked the front desk for ice and it came within 10 minutes!  All the employees were friendly.  Do not touch anything in the refrig or cookie/candy boxes or you will be charged!!!!

I room was clean and a nice size for NY standards! (Queen size bed room).  They have live music every night which is loud, but really didn't bother us.

We would definately stay here again if the price is right!!!!

title: noise
text: Through the hotel is small in size, all the staff seemed to be friendly and helpful. We had a TOSHI suite in the front of hotel and you could here the street noise as well as every passing subway train.

title: Great value in a great location.
text:
We checked in on a Friday evening. Parking is about a 1/2 block away so you may want to drop your bags first and then park the car.

The staff was exceptionally pleasant and helpful with all of our questions. 

The room was cozy. There is not a lot of room for bags and bags of stuff. One of the most high tech bathrooms I have ever seen. In addition there were terrycloth robes to change into after a hot shower. My wife was in absolute heaven. Beds are comfortable and sheets a crisp and clean. Street noise was not a problem nor was noise from any other room. No hearing the flushing toilets of other rooms or listening to someone else taking a shower through the walls.

There is a variety of music most every night in the lobby. WE saw four bands the two nights we were there and we impressed with the talent. Originals to covers, jazz to rock, it was all great listening. 

Drinks in the bar area about $12-15.

Overall an AWESOME property with a PHENOMENAL value!

title: Famous Hotel in NY
text: We stayed 5 nights from 30. of June until 05. of July in Flatiron. It was our third time in New York and our best hotel there. Friendly,helpful and well educated personnel at the desk. The whole hotel is spotlessy clean.The rooms are well equiped, bathrooms with screen inside the mirror (funny) and a very nice shower. Every evening you could find a good, varied program in the bar, sometimes with a real broadway show! The location is in the heart of Manhattan, walking distance to Herald Place, Macy´s, Madison Square, etc.. The next subway is not more than 2 minutes. Perfect place to start exploring.... We will come back!

title: Best value for money in manhatten mid town!
text: I had a chance to stay in several hotel chains in New York city between them known one like Radisson, Holiday Inn, Hilton and others. It was by chance that i got to Flatiron. The stuff and specifically Jason at the front desk were very welcoming and helpfull. The bar area has great live shows every night till 1am. You could feel the signature of the owner in any detail. Later i learned that he is indeed present, Toshi is there making sure atmosphere is kept. Yes its noisy some times but hey that is NYC. The rooms ( stayed at the delux toshi room) smell amaizing and the decoration is exact. Its fresh, its comfortable and considerably big room. I have no other words than perfect. Definately going to bring my BF there next time when I vacationing the big apple.

title: Expected a Bit More from Flatiron Hotel
text: Had a one night stay at the Flatiron Hotel, a boutique style hotel in New York City.  The address on 26th St, close to 5th Avenue, was its best asset as far as I was concerned.  It was close to where I needed to be as the next day my daughter's final fitting at Kleinfeld's bridal was within easy walking distance.  Madison Square Park, Shake Shack, and Eataly nearby which I like. I thought the hotel was good but not great for these reasons:  upon walking into the hotel for check-in after 9:30 pm, the ground floor entrance was interesting, especially the exotic round cylinder fish tank running up the middle of the room.  However, the band playing in the lounge which is open to the check-in area, was absolutely blasting, so unnecessarily loud.  We felt bad for the clerk who must have hearing loss by this time.  Thankfully, check-in was so quick we got our room keys and quickly got out of there.  Security while traveling is important to me, so I was disappointed that anyone could enter the elevators and go up to our floor without restriction.   Our room was practically across the elevator and the hallway was quite narrow in favor of a rather large size room (two queen beds in this room) with very high tray ceilings and ornate crown molding.  The beds, while stylishly decorated, especially the headboards with decorative curtains on either side, were not as comfortable as I've had for the price and the mattresses were hard, but some like it that way.  Nice pillow selection and nice sheets.  The beds were platform beds with drawers for storage, so I promptly banged my leg on the corner of the platform.  The rest of the furniture in the room, in my opinion, was cheap looking, nothing special.  I'm used to minibars, but this one the clerk actually warned us about it upon check-in saying that you only have 20 seconds and if the sensor picks up that something is not in its place, you're getting charged.  That includes a sensor for dry snacks on top which look like they're in an ordinary tray - they're not.  Needless to say, didn't touch either.  One cup at a time coffee maker, lousy coffee.  There's a Starbucks a stone's throw from the hotel, much better.  There is a restaurant which I assume serves meals in the same location that becomes the lounge for entertainment in the evenings.  I didn't have any meals there.  The little extras that did not impress me was a TV in the mirror of the bathroom (you had to shut the door to get in front of the sink) so the only time you might want to watch it is while washing you face, etc. since you can't see it unless you are standing right in front of it.  The shower was very nice with a large rainshower head, optional jets for lower body, plenty of towels, etc. but no where to hang them except one hook on the back of the door.  Toilet small, very low.  Air conditioning very good.  Robes in wardrobe closet.   Lighted buttons for do not disturb or to request housekeep.  Very large windows running the width of the room with motorized curtains.  Free wifi and nice large LG flat screen TV on the wall.  Clean room, but definitely wouldn't say immaculate.  Seems like a lot of stuff that might appeal to some, but when it came down to it, I decided I'll stay somewhere different next time.

title: Excellent location and modern
text:
Location: Fantastic. In the middle of Manhattan. Nearby Empire State Building, a lot of shopping etc. Don't stay at the Times Square, stay here!!

Hotel and grounds: Modern and small hotel, with a huge fish tank and a night club(?) in the lobby. This club starts swinging in the afternoon and keeps in going. Wich brings a lot of party people there, and it makes of course at lot of noise. 

Room: Clean. We payed extra to get a corner suite, and it was worth it. Big enough for to people and four suitcases. Could be nice with more closet space. It's not super to "live in a suitcase". Plenty of cool digital features. Enjoy.

Bathroom: Big and clean. We pay'd extra to get a bathtub. Tv in mirror!!! That's super cool, and not enjoying at all. It's not a problem doing your makeup, you're probably taller then the tv anyway... 

Service: Superb!! Nothing to complaint about. The receptionists was helpful. They helped us book tickets etc etc etc.

Tip: Print out your reservation. They need to have it in paper? It's not enough to show them the reservation on your iPad etc.

title: Nice hotel  ... Small rooms
text:
I thought  the rooms were very small even tho they are done up nice .  My daughter and I are small people and we could hardly get in with our 2 suitcases.
The shower was awesome and the bathroom was quite nice but small . There  was no place to even hang up your towels.  Had to phone downFTP front. desk for ice and glasses and they brought up plastic ones!!! I thought when you are paying good money for a hotel you shouldn't have to phone for glasses and then have plastic ones
They missed my 5am wake up call so luckily my head alarm woke me up and I was not late for my flight!

title: Good location, well furnished but noisy
text:
We choose the Flatiron for its location, relatively central in NYC, next to the Madison Square Garden. When we arrived at around 1:30pm, we were told that normal check in time is 4pm, but that our rooms would be ready by around 2pm. I found 4pm a bit late. 
The room was located on the 3rd floor. It was relatively small, the bed, a desk and then a small bath room with a shower. It is well furnished, new, clean. Nothing to make yourself a cup of tea but there was a coffee machine. 
There is a huge aquarium with some nice fishes downstairs. 
When I came back at around 11pm, there was a concert on the first floor (there seems to be concerts organised quite often here, which may be nice when you like that but not when you work the following day. Obviously, my room was way too noisy, so I asked to change. So did my boss. The only rooms available were on the 4th floor. 
There is some kind of a business center on the mezzanine. I saw only one computer available. It was still enough to print my boarding pass.

title: Great choice
text: My 2 sons and I needed an inexpensive, good location hotel for 2 nights. Nothing crazy expensive but a decent hotel. This was just what we needed. Comfortable, right near the subway and a short walk to Times Square. Would stay there again.

title: OTTIMO IL PESCE PALLA
text:
Siamo molto soddisfatti sia della posizione pressochè centrale che per il servizio offerto: non facevamo in tempo a chedere un taxi che già ce l'avevano prenotato.....ottimo per tutto!!!
L'acquario era davvero fantastico!!! Scoperto il nome di quel pesce strano: arothron nigropunctatus!!! magari vinciamo un soggiorno gratis?????????!!!!!!!!!

title: Si nous retournons a NYC, ce sera certainement la bas
text: Un personnel tres agreable et serviable, une chambre quadruple tres spacieuse, propre et moderne, a 3min d'une station de metro au centre de manhattan, que de bons points pour cet hotel! Seul bemol: la musique lors des soirees de l'hotel assez forte lorsqu'on se trouve dans le hall mais le reste compense largement.

title: Fantastic gem of a hotel.
text:
The room was amazing, all mod cons, comfy bed, lovely bathroom. Service was great and the hotel was excellent value. Close to 5th avenue and the sites.
Would definitely stay again.

title: Very comfortable!
text: Very comfortable and clean hotel. Had a great stay in a nicely decorated room facing the street. Queen bed. The only thing we didn't like was the high and hard pillows, which made our necks ache. Otherwise it was perfect and we recommend this hotel!

title: Terrible experience!
text: Arrived to a loud and noisey hotel. We booked this hotel for one nite following a road trip to Canada. We received a room on the 10th floor it was an okay room until the ceiling started leaking. I called the front desk and someone came up with a trash can so the water could fall in to it. We were shocked because now we hear thump thump from the water hitting the trash can bottom. We called the front desk again and was told to put a towel in the bottom of the can (we did not). We were finally moved to room 704 which was okay. This ordeal started at 11:45pm and didn't end until 2:45am we were extremely tired. On  top of the above problem we were told parking would cost 35.00 but when we went to park the care we were told we had to pay an additional 10.00. The above complaint was addressed with the front desk personnel. We were given a card with the manager name on it I tried calling the number one was disconnected the other was housekeeping. Called front desk when I got home and no one seem to no when the manager was coming in and I was given the same wrong numbers and then transferred to Benjamin and the only thing he told me was he would get with the manager and get back with me and as of today I have not received a return call and i'm still waiting. I took pictures and videos and will try to upload them. What a disaster!

title: Very Classy Hotel
text: This was a very nice hotel. It’s relatively new, and very modern. The lobby and furniture is very nice. The staff and concierge are very nice and helpful. The rooms are small, but beautiful. The bathroom is so modern, room are very clean. We stayed for 1 night, at a good price found on Kayak.com.  I would go again, although the parking was not so great -VERY expensive! Location is good, right on Broadway. A bit of a walk to Time Square, but a pleasant one.  Great hotel pick in general, we were very happy here! I definitely recommend it !

title: notmoney
text: the flatiron is a very attractive premises in a very attractive area with very attractive high tech upgrades.  all of the common areas are beautifully crafted and decorated and definitely hold fascination to the eye. I was however slightly let down by the quality of the room particularly the bath fixtures. I had expected a great deal more for the high price tag. however the staff of this establishment more than made up for this little detail by going above and beyond anything they could think of to make my stay more pleasing. they offered new rooms and showed them all to me they offered to send champagne and ultimately helped me create a very special and relaxing anniversary celebration. I had originally booked this hotel because I had heard great things about the actual building itself, it was however the staff that made this stay fantastic for us. thank you hotel flatiron I'm sure you will enjoy continued success.

title: Ottima posizione !
text: Hotel fantastico soprattutto per la posizione centrale; infatti si possono raggiungere tranquillamente tutte la principali mete. La struttura è nuova e non grandissima ( a differenza di quanto ci si potrebbe aspettare da edifici newyorkesi) . Le camere pulite,spaziose e silenziose. Nella stanza le finestre sono molto ampie;una doccia grande,molti asciugamani e addirittura sullo specchio del bagno c'è una tv :) Inoltre il personale dell' hotel è molto cortese. La sera suonano la musica(almeno durante la mia permanenza così è stato) ma ciò non ha creato fastidio poichè dalla camera non si sentiva niente. Lo consiglio per un avacanza di circa 5 giorni adatto,a mio parere,a tutti i tipi di viaggio.

title: Cool, funky place to stay
text:
My husband and I stayed at the Flatiron hotel for two nights last week. We were there to celebrate our anniversary to to catch up with old friends because we moved away from NYC 10 years ago.

Location:  Perfect for us. We both used to work in the neighborhood, so we're especially comfortable with the area and it was easy for all our friends to come meet us in the Toshi bar downstairs.

Toshi Lounge: Loved it.  Added a good vibe to an area that we remember being really dead at night. My husband couldn't help but notice and mention (repeatedly) what a good looking crowd of women were at the bar on Thursday night. Obviously, if we still lived up there, that would be his new Thursday night hangout.  :)

The room we were put in on the 9th floor was a good size, so judging by the other reviews on here, ours may have been bigger. The bathroom was especially spacious, so we must have landed a good room. Husband also liked the TV in the mirror. Typical guy.  He likes pretty girls and cool gadgets, go figure. 

The front desk staff could not have been nicer. We mentioned we were there for anniversary when we checked in and they made a big to-do about it.  You would have thought it was our honeymoon instead of our 17th year together.  Made us feel very welcome.

Overall, the place was clean, comfortable, safe and welcoming with a funky vibe that made me give it the full five stars. Def planning on staying here again next time.  Thanks so much!

title: Hit & Miss
text:
Booked a King room and although I didnt expect it to be big, it left me wondering how small the standard rooms might be. There was barely enough room to get out of the bed, the other side of which was pushed right up against the wall making it impossible to reach the curtains to close them.

No room safe and too few working TV channels were the only significant negatives however.

Bathroom was very small, you literally could not fit more than one person in it at any one time.

Room decor was fine and nice to come back to at the end of the day. Bed was very comfortable indeed.

Hallways were decorated in dark colours and given how small the hotel is, made it all the more claustrophobic. 

Location is unbeatable, walked right up to Central Park and all the way back down to the financial district without needing to take the subway. Surrounding area also felt totally safe, despite some rundown shops nearby. Everyone is so much friendlier in NYC than London.

Lobby staff were very helpful indeed, although there was a band on when we checked in and it was impossible to hear a word the guy was saying.

We had a breakfast in Toshi's and it was very good.

I wouldnt go back simply because i found the dark decor of the corridors depressing and the lobby too informal, but if you are looking for a good base to explore from, the Flatiron ticks all the right boxes.

title: Cool spot!
text: Clean trendy  relaxing rooms. I enjoyed my stay, staff was very cool professional and friendly. No complaints here!

title: Plus ou moins bien
text:
La situation est bonne car plusieurs stations de métro sont proches et possibilité de visites à pied.
Le hall de l’hôtel est très petit car il n'y a même pas un siège pour éventuellement attendre quelqu'un et la réception est petit comptoir d'a peine 2 mètres !!
Le personnel n'a pas été particulièrement accueillant ni chaleureux; ils me semblaient tous être
des débutants!
La chambre est très très petite mais avec tout ce qu'il faut , avec même des gadgets superficiels et/ou inutiles ( comme la tv dans le miroir de la salle de douche qui m'a gênée pour me maquiller ), la literie était très propres et très  confortable mais Il y avait néanmoins beaucoup de bruit de la rue !!! Certaines nuits il y a eu beaucoup de bruit dans les couloirs à cause de clients qui rentraient en faisant énormément de chahut.
Les après-midis il y avait de la musique en live au restaurant et c'est chouette,  mais lorsque l'on rentre dans son hôtel on trouve que le hall est plutôt très bruyant car le petit hall et le restaurant ne sont séparés que par une tenture !!!!!

title: Friendly modern hotel
text: We recently spent two nights in the flatiron hotel in one of their two double bed suites and have many positive things to say. The staff were very friendly and very helpful looking after our luggage and recommending local places to go out or have breakfast. The room, although a tad small (Come on, this IS Manhattan) was fully functional and made excellent use of space. All of the amenities were excellent and included free Wi-Fi, a secure safe, two TVs (including one in the bathroom mirror), iron, hair-dryer and one of the best showers I have ever had. I would definitely stay in this hotel again and thoroughly recommend it.

title: Perfect location, perfect hotel
text:
Just returned from a fab five night stay at the Flatiron. E-mailed the hotel 3 months prior to arrival, requesting high floor and nice view and ended up on the 10th - and highest - floor with a street view! Warm welcome from the front desk, easy and quick check in and just a perfect stay. The bathroom mirror-TV was not working and this was fixed directly. Stayed in room 1008 which was a king with a large bed (180 cm), desk and a - by NYC standards - huuuge bathroom. Clean and fresh with a hand held shower in a HUGE shower cabin (could easily fit 8 people in there) with good water preassure. I think that a full length mirror in the room was missing from a wall which was a bit annoying, We used the bathroom mirror instead so not a big deal but would have made going out at night more easy. Also hooks in the bathroom would be nice - we ended up hanging towels on whatever surface we could find. 

Some people have written that the neighbourhood is shady, but this is not true at all. The hotel is right by the park with lots of restaurants and shops, 5th av and Broadway. Garbage is left outside of every building in NYC so this is not any kind of weird thing to see at night. You reach Macy's within 10 minutes by foot, and the subway is 2 blocks away (lots of different lines close by actually, but the closest one is just 2 blocks away - one minute by foot). Broadway between 26th and 28th (hotel is on 26th) has some down market shops and sure, you might think this is "shady", but trust me there is nothing unsafe about this area at all. My fifth time in NYC this is by far the best hotel and nicest location I've stayed in - no matter where we were, Times square, The Upper West Side, The Village or Brooklyn, we were always close to home which is perfect when you want to dump the shopping and take a shower before you head out again.  

Turndown service consisted of turning down bed + changing towels and emptying trash. A nice touch! Housekeeping was spotless. 

Bed was comfy and had drawers in which one could place belongings. There was also a closet with hangers and bathrobes.  

Nice lobby with cute fishtank & Toshi's where you could have a drink or dinner. Good live music! 

We were not disturbed by Toshi's or subway but keep in mind we were on the 10th floor.

AC worked fine, did not get a chance to look at the gym. Front desk had adapters and when we checked out a faulty minibar charge was corrected without discussion. 

I would very much like to recommend The Flatiron - cool, clean and a perfect NYC location with friendly staff! Very nice and by NYC standard very-very nice! Will be staying there again.

title: Nice hotel
text: The flatiron was very accommodating in many ways. I was allowed to check in early due to an early flight. After checkout they held on to our bags so we could still explore the city. Joe was wonderful with offering tips on what to do & how to get there.The rooms were clean & modern. Saturday nights were a little rowdy in front of the hotel but it is NYC. Overall I would recommend this hotel.

title: Fab hotel, amazing location - we will definitely return!
text:
Myself and my girlfriend spent ten days in new York and stayed at this brilliant hotel - would recommend it and we will re-book next time we go back. Key reasons are...

1- the location is amazing. We love the flatiron building, which is just round the corner so we could enjoy it everyday. We enjoy walking and getting down to Battery park or up to central park and everywhere in between was easy from the hotel. Very near a couple of subways on 23rd. Also near some great food places including Eataly, shake shack and while we didn't go, two of the top three trip advisor rated restaurants in NY. We also benefitted from a seasonal food festival 'Madison square eats' which we would highly recommend. 

2 the hotel - the hotel is about a year old and looks great, very clean and contemporary. The big fish tank in reception is beautiful! We were on the 10th floor an had a very good sized room. For ten days stay we accumulated quite a bit of stuff and the room was still spacious, the bed comfy, always clean and the tv in the bathroom mirror - quality! The downstairs bar was good, live bands every night and while we never ate there, the food looked and smelt good. It was nice to have a good bar on site as an option for a night out. 

3- the staff. The staff were always very polite and professional. Everyone associated with the hotel that we met we're great - special mention to the concierg team who were tremendous especially Carmelo (hope I've spelt that right) who we saw most evenings on our way in and out of the hotel and was always friendly and willing to help. 

All good? One slight grumble was that we booked through hotwire and had to reschedule due to a dislocated knee (ouch!) and extended through the hotel by an extra couple of days. This caused a number of conversations with different people before it wa finally resolved. To be fair, it is one of those rare events that would be a billing nightmare and as it got resolved fairly this by no way impacted our stay. 

We had an amazing trip to New York and a great part if this was due to our stay at the Flatiron hotel.

title: Flatiron Hotel
text:
Changed rooms 4 times in 2 days. Back end rooms are quieter but so small could not open a suitcase without removing furniture from the room, moved to front room 3rd floor which was a good size but the noise unbearable, literally shaking the room, were told it woud finish at midnight but did not happen spent the night in a middle room, it was booked next night so moved to a higher room, somewhat quieter but think they must decide it they are a hotel or nightclub or at least ask guests if they can cope with the noise.
Rooms maybe could do away with the door activated mini bar, (surely they are a waste of space in small rooms) and the tv in the bathroom mirror is a gimmick as it does not even face the bath and to put on make up or shave you need to sort of look around the screen. Please also provide a couple of glasses not those awful plastic cups.
Front desk staff were helpful but always stressed with many people waiting in line, when going to our room another party arrived at the same time with an identical key, lucky for us they were the honest type and we both saw the funny side of it, guess it could have had a different result.
All these issues could be dealt with with good direction but there did not seem to be any management around the whole of our stay. The hotel is clean and pleasant and in a great position,

title: Great hotel, centrally located, stylishly presented rooms but lacking the frenzied nature of the uptown hotels
text:
Enjoyed my 10 nights here as a solo traveller!
Friendly staff, well appointed room, location fantastic, great food all around.
They need to fine tune a few things regarding cleaning of rooms etc bit otherwise first rate.
The shower is excellent with rain shower head and various jets.
The lighting is another bonus, can actually see in the room.
Well done

title: Great rooms and service but noisy
text: I recently stayed at the Flatiron and was impressed by the rooms and the service at the hotel, but even though I was on the 6th floor it was quite noisy - music from the downstairs bar, and the subway trains kept me awake several times. It's a great location though and if you are a night owl don't let it put you off - despite the noise I would recommend the hotel to friends.

title: Nice staff,good location
text: I stayed with my husband for almost two weeks. The staff wew very friendly and helpful, really exceeded our expectation. Location was also good.just 2 minutes' walk to N/R train station,which took you to Central park,Tiffany store on 5th ave,etc. The empire state building and Macy's were within walk's distance.As Chinese, we were so happy to find a cheap Chinese restaurant "taste good".good for take away on 25th/broadway. And the korean town on 32nd street. Although  the room was quite small, we enjoyed our stay and do want to recommend it!

title: Nice people, but scary area late at night
text:
The staff was friendly, hotel very clean but sadly, the location is scary late at night. We arrived around 11pm by shuttle to find no hotel sign but Toshi's Bar... a loud rock band playing in a nightclub, rolled down graffiti-laden grates over store-fronts, homeless people sleeping among the garbage bags on the streets. 

The atmosphere is fine during the day, near the subway and Madison Park. 

Don't take anything out of the fridge (not even just to put your own water bottle in it) or you will be charged. Don't pick up the snacks on the table because there are sensors on them, and if you move them for more than 20 seconds you are charged. So if you want to move them out of the way you'll have an unpleasant surprise on your bill. 

The tv in the mirror is a fun little accessory, but if you're a woman of average height you may wish it were not there, since it makes putting on your makeup difficult. The dark area where the tv is makes it hard to see your face. 

I will not be going back on my next trip to NYC. It had good things (chiefly the cleanliness and the nicer-than-nice staff) but it is definitely not the four star hotel I reserved. The amenities are simply not there, and the character of the neighborhood at night makes walking back late in the evening too frightening for a woman alone... it's on the fringe of a much better neighborhood but some people will not be comfortable with the conditions late at night.

It should also be noted that this hotel is not in the Flatiron Building, just in the Flatiron area.

title: LOVE LOVE LOVE!
text: We stayed here because it was one of the cheaper hotels we could find, that was still nice. When we got there, everything exceeded our expectations. We stayed on the 10th floor, so it was nice an quiet. The rooms were beautiful and full of fun stuff to play with (loved the TV in the mirror!), the staff was the friendliest people I have ever met in any hotel I have every stayed in and anything that was needed was brought/done right away with no hesitation. The Toshi lounge downstairs was a cool place to hang out and the location was great. There are a couple of subway stops really close by (less than a 2 min walk) and it was super easy to get anywhere from the hotel. I don't think I would stay anywhere else when revisiting NYC.

title: Lots to like here
text:
I stayed here with my teenage daughter for two nights visiting colleges in the area. The location was excellent. We often stay in Murray Hill but this had more to offer in terms of easy access to public transportation and more subway lines, a wider variety of restaurants, Madison Square Park etc. 
We were upgraded to a corner double and had requested a higher floor. The room was spacious although a little oddly shaped. The beds were super comfortable. When my daughter was sitting at the desk, I had to climb on the edge of the bed to get into the main part of the room. The bathroom was a good size too. 
This would have been an excellent stay except for two things. One - the hotel is located right above/next to a vent from the train station and you can hear this pretty much all the time. If you are a light sleeper you might want to reconsider although usually this type of noise bothers me and I slept pretty well. The second was Toshi's Living Room - there was very loud live entertainment rocking this place in the evening. During the day, I got the feeling that they did  not really want you hanging out here unless you were ordering beverages/food. Unfortunately since there was no lobby there was no where else to go. They were having wifi issues (which is complimentary when it works!) on  our floor so I had to go to Toshi's to access this. 

The parking is self serve and a block down the street (before you reach the hotel). This worked fine except  we were not charged the advertised price because our car was oversized (it would have been nice to know this in advance). I would consider staying here again.

title: I liked this hotel but didn't love it...
text: We chose this hotel due to its excellent reviews and proximity to our daughter's apartment. It was fine. The room was small but not tiny. The bed was comfortable but nothing special. The furnishings trendy but not too over the top (chairs and upholstery don't look like they will hold up long). Shower head very trendy with rainshower and multiple horizontal shower heads but I would have just liked one shower head that had plenty of water pressure as the rainshower and multiple shower heads were a little weak.  On check out, we asked the front desk person if he could call a cab for us.. he said that we wouldn't be able to get a cab at that time of the morning but so in so who happens to be reading the paper in our lounge would be happy to take us to the airport and it would only be a few dollars more than the cab.  We agreed for the driver to take us as we didn't want to go out on the street with our luggage and hail a cab but we felt a little like he was trying to take advantage of our naivety. Overall, I would pick it again due to the location but it wasn't one of my favorite New York hotel experiences.

title: More like a nightclub than a hotel
text: I felt after staying at this hotel that it valued its nightly club clients more than its hotel customers. Loud live music could be heard from my 4th floor room late each night. When I came back to the hotel one night and attempted to ask the desk clerk a question at around 10:30 pm, we literally couldn't hear each other because the club is open to the lobby, and the music was blaring. One physical indication of the importance of the club is the fact that there is plenty of seating in the club and absolutely not one chair available to hotel guests in the lobby. One evening I had to get in line next to a red velvet rope and a bouncer just to get to my room because the Swedish embassy was having a big party in the Penthouse. One other issue - no food. The hotel has mini-bars, but there is no restaurant and no room service. I found it to be a bizarre place to stay for a business trip and would not recommend it.

title: Toshi's Living Room at the Flatiron Hotel is Rockin'!
text: An absolutely cool beyond cool scene with great food, great music and great spirits....Toshi, the friendly owner of the restaraunt, and his dog, welcome you to the hippest bar in the city with great live music. The hotel itself is modern and chic with a great location at 26th and Broadway. Reasonably priced rooms in the mid 200 dollar range are well worth it and you can walk to Greenwich village in 10 minutes or be at Times Square in 10 minutes.

title: Great deal leads to a super experience
text: My husband and I decided to celebrate our 3 year anniversary with an overnight trip to NYC. We booked our hotel through Expedia's unpublished rates, which we'd never done before, and when the Flatiron was revealed as "our" hotel we couldn't believe it! While initially suspicious that it was a too-good-to-be-true scam, especially for the price we paid, the hotel turned out to be one of the best parts of the trip! We'd never stayed overnight in NYC, and the Flatiron made it a WONDERFUL experience! Waking up above the city to luxurious surroundings was delicious (it's nice to pretend you're rich and cosmopolitan sometimes;), and we loved that the hotel itself was in a super-convenient location, as we spent most of our trip just walking around the city and sight-seeing. The hotel itself is BEAUTIFUL! The lobby reminds me of a ship (maybe the huge aquarium has something to do with it? lol) The actual rooms are very tall, as well, and designed to be elegant and modern-looking. We loved the beautiful shower/bathroom (corny, but true!) and are dreaming about remodeling our bathroom accordingly:) We were thrilled with our little trip, and plan to visit again!

title: IS THIS THE SAME HOTEL?
text:
Reading the reviews below, we're stunned!  Stayed here recently for four days and it was TERRIBLE!!! 

We were assured a corner room with two beds, and instead were assigned their tiniest room with a double bed.  Two grown women sharing a double bed!  After repeated inquires, we were finally moved to a third floor room...with a queen.  Again, very awkward sharing a bed, and being on the third floor, directly above the lounge, we got to listen to the blaring music all night. 

On the second day, our room wasn't tidied; we had no clean towels.  Had to call down twice over three hours to finally get some delivered.  Every time we tried to speak a person at the front desk, staff was indifferent and condescending.  

We're usually pretty easy going travelers...gone all day and just looking for a clean, relatively quiet place to rest our heads at night (...oh, and of course, a few clean towels would be nice).  

WE WILL NEVER STAY HERE AGAIN!!!

title: Great staff,great hotel!
text: We stayed at the Flatiron Hotel this past weekend, and were so pleasantly surprised at the politeness and thoughtfulness of the staff, who tried to help in every way they could. Everyone was so kind. When we arrived, our room was available before the regular check-in time of 4pm. The room itself had a great view, was very clean with new furniture, and the bathroom was very orderly and nice. Overall, the hotel is very modern with technologically-equipped rooms (touch panel for room service and "do not disturb", and two television sets). The neighborhood is excellent, there is a Starbucks across the street and a subway station two blocks over. The only minor downsides to this hotel would be that there is no safe in the rooms, and you must pay for a refrigerator. We would definitely stay here again.

title: This is New York
text:
I went to this hotel on Easter with my Family and everything was absolutely fantastic!
Check in very quick and we were given all the information that we needed. 
Beautiful room (Toshi Corner Suit) clean but a bit noisy in the night. In the bathroom there was tv on the mirror so while you wash your theeth you watch the news :) confy bed, a/c, but small wadrobe!Free internet connection bar with music every night!
The location is also very good just in the middle of Manhattan so if you like to walk you can really go almost everywhere by foo. Of couse there is a starbucks just in front the hotel!
A special thanks to Reginaldo the receptionist, he was really nice and professional!

title: Wonderful stay, nicest staff ever!
text: We had a wonderful stay at this beautiful hotel. It has a central location, next to the flatiron building. The staff was extremely nice. There's a computer with complimentary acess to the internet wich was great! Hope to come back some day...

title: Una bella sorpresa
text: Ho selezionato questo hotel esclusivamente in base al prezzo e alle immagini viste su tripadvisor. Le recensioni lette non erano ottime, ma ho voluto provare lo stesso e sono rimasta piacevolmente sorpresa! Ottima posizione- chelsea- a 5 minuti a piedi da macys e a meno di 20 da times square, personale disponibile ed accoglinte, hotel giovane con un bel lounge bar e musica dal vivo, insomma proprio quello che stavo cercando! La mia maggiore preoccupazione era la grandezza della stanza, temevo che come spesso accade in Usa ci avrebbero stipati in 4 in un stanzetta angusta e invece abbiamo avuto la "corner suite"' che ci ha permesso di avere due grandi letti matrimoniali, un ampio bagno e tante finetre che rendevano la stanza ariosa e confortevole. Accappatoi ed asciugamani a profusione, pulizia, cassaforte e design moderno confermano il livello 4 stelle dell'hotel. Avevo letto anche che l'hotel era 'rumoroso' per via della metropolitana che in effetti un pó si avverte anche dal settmo piano, ma vi assicuro che dopo aver camminato per 8 ore al giorno con l'emozione che una città vibrante come new york ti da, il rumore si avverte appena. Complimenti al flatiron hotel!

title: excellent location, will see me again!
text: Perfect stay! Nice area and centrally located. Close to the subway, highline, SoHo, Empire State Building and naturally..the Flatiron Building. Loved the TV on the bathroom mirror as well as the remote controlled blinds! The only thing is that we stayed on floor 3 and the bath and shower were not as promised. Very average. The view wasn't good either, but overall it was a good hotel.

title: super hotel, tres bien situé pour visiter NY
text:
Bon hotel, bien situé. Le seul problème, est que la wifi ne marchait pas au 9eme étage...
Bonne literie, chambre toshi corner assez spacieuse, salle de bain ok

title: Great location!
text: L'hotel si trova in un'ottima posizione, vicino a tutte le maggiori attrazioni della città, in un quartiere tranquillo ma con un discreto numero di ristoranti e locali aperti alla sera. Lo staff dell'hotel è molto cortese e disponibile. La camera era più ampia di quanto ci aspettassimo, con una bella vista, e molto silenziosa (era al decimo piano). Unico appunto: la pulizia della camera non è stata sempre impeccabile (per alcuni giorni non è stato svuotato il cestino dei rifiuti in camera) e sarebbe stato opportuno qualche gancio per gli ascigamani in bagno. E', comunque, un hotel assolutamente consigliabile.

title: Great hotel, perfect location
text: Perfect stay, no complains at all. The staff was nice and the room better than expected. Close to everything, highline, soho and Empire state building

title: Very nice hotel!
text:
We stayed here for 4 nights. Friendly staff, nice room and nice area. Subway station nearby.
Would go back anytime. Great experience!
Only 1 minus: it was a full house so the cleaning personnel forgot to clean our room the second day of our stay. But they send someone to our room the moment we mentioned the problem.

title: Nice Friendly Hotel
text: I stayed at this Hotel for 6 nights including Easter.  It was booked by my cousin then I started reading  some reviews and I thought *Oh dear* BUT I found the staff friendly, helpful and overall a very nice Hotel.  I was unwell on leaving and they kindly let us have the room till 1pm and headed for the Airport at 1.30pm.  Would reccomend.

title: We Love It!
text:
I wrote a review while staying at the property on September 8, 2011.  Someone was trying to sabatoge the opening of this hotel and reported my review as "inappropriate" , it was deleted within a few days.  It appears Trip Advistor does not really check a review.

The staff was very helpful, the room was beautiful and we loved the location.  It will be my hotel of choice when I visit New York again and the price was a real bargain.  We got a corner room because we wanted 2 queen sized beds, the view was fantastic, it was like I could just reach over and touch the Empire State Building, loved the remote controled drapes and the mirror/television in the bathroom.  My Place deli right across the street.  This is what people have to say about them:
http://www.menupages.com/restaurants/my-place-deli/

Jackie Aucoin
Near New Orleans, Louisiana

This is the fate of my first review.

title: A really cool hotel in a great location
text:
I spent 5 nights at The Flatiron Hotel with my teenage kids, within 20 minutes they said "If we come back to New York can we stay here again?". The room we had was really lovely, clean, stylish with a great bathroom and everything you'd need... including a TV in the bathroom mirror!

The staff were friendly and helpful and made us feel at home and this is the clincher, in the evening the lobby lounge becomes a really cool bar staffed by delightful and friendly waitresses and local semi-pro musicians play jazz and light pop music to an amazing standard. Listening to Moon River being sang in a Jazz style over a double bass felt like, well, New York.

The Flatiron is two minutes walk from Madison Square Park, home of Shake Shack, the finest burger bar in the city and is perfect for hitting the shops on 34th, Times Square or going a couple of blocks west and catching the High Line down to West Village. Perfect. You are surrounded by excellent restaurants, Hill Country is few doors down on 26th for the best Texas BBQ, so the location is pretty much ideal.

Seriously, stay here and you will not be disappointed. I'm already planning a return trip next year. Nice work guys, keep it up.
