title: Beautiful boutique hotel. Staff were superb!
text: Would definately stay again!  The gentleman who greeted us at the door when we arrived made sure we got taxi's, got our luggage to the room, greeted us every day. Felt like honored guests!  Thanks

title: Nicest Hotel I've Stayed in in NYC
text: I stayed at the Flatiron with my sister at the end of March. We thoroughly enjoyed it. The room was lovely, very clean, small but then all NYC hotel rooms are.  The beds and pillows were so comfy!  I loved the tv set into the bathroom mirror, very cool. Staff were very helpful, service a little bit on the slow side. We were woken up a couple times with noise from outside, there was a big fight out on the street beneath our window at 3am one of the mornings and the usual taxi's beeping horns etc but I dont know how you could control that! We did think their security could be improved, it seemed like there was a different person on reception everytime we arrived/departed, I'd think it would be hard to keep track of who is actually staying in the hotel. In saying that I would really recommend this hotel and would definitely stay again.

title: Great hotel - a very pleasant stay
text: We travelled as a family staying in two rooms. The hotel is in a great location - its only 2 blocks from the subway and close to heaps of good restaurants and shopping areas. The staff were always very friendly and were happy to answer our 'touristy' questions. They even allowed my sister to check in earlier then the rest of us (she was arriving earlier than us from a different destination). The rooms were a decent size and had some great features such as the tv in the mirror in the bathroom and electric curtains. We would definitely stay at the flatiron again and would definitely recommend it!! Thanks to all the staff for a pleasant stay!!

title: Great New Hotel in NYC - Chelsea
text:
I had to stay over in New York for work, and booked the hotel through a discount travel site, so I didn't even know the name of the hotel until it was booked. I was impressed. I stayed on the 10th floor in a king room (memory foam bed, great pillows). The bed was very close to the door, but there was space between the bed and the work desk/TV. The rooms are not huge, but spacious enough for two people. I've stayed in bigger rooms in New York and paid a much higher price for it in a very large and overcrowded hotel. The bathroom as well appointed with a TV in the mirrow and jacuzzi tub/shower combo. The water pressure was strong and the water was hot (I like it very hot). 

They are trying to get local musical artists of all genres to entertain on a nightly basis, which is fun. The night I stayed, the talent swung from folk/rock to Robin Thicke-like styles.

The staff is young and very very attentive so kudos on great hiring process. 

The one downside I found, which did not bother me but is important to note, was the sound of the subway train roaring by. I wasn't screechy, but a low and distinctive rumble. It's the N,R line. I was in a lower number room on the 10th floor, so keep that in mind when checking in. Again, didn't bother me, but people ought to know about it. 

I would return to this hotel.

title: a room with hi-tech features
text:
The hotel is located in mid town area of Mahanttan and about a mile from Times Square. The location is fantastic as it is close to many restaurants (located in lexington ave) and shopping areas such as Macy which is half a mile from the hotel. This is a boutique hotel which has huge round shaped marine aquarium and a beautiful corridors. 

The check in was not very smooth as we were in for shock when the reception staff told us they could not locate our booking which was done thru expedia even though we had the confirmation, and there are no rooms available at that time. After talking to expedia directly, the matter was finally resolved at the intervention of the Hotel Manager, Mr. Benjamin who informed us personally that we will will able to check in and our room will be upgraded to superior room. He also apologised for the delay which lasted for about Hour and half. 

The room was in the sixth floor, corner of the buliding with full size windows on both sides which provided excellent view on both sides outside. It had hitech features such as mirror with lights and small TV screen in it in the bathroom, bath tub with Jacuzzi, button to open curtains near the bedside, electronic display button for do not disturb & for house keepin, etc. The mattresses and the pillows were fantastic and the lights in the room were excellent and much more than sufficient. As our flight was late in th evening, the hotel cocierge staff were glad to keep our luggage in the storage area. At the the time of check out, Mr, Benjamin, Hotel manger enquired about our stay at the hotel and informed that he is looking forward to welcome us at the hotel next time. One area of improvement is certainly the reception staff who I think should be more friendly and provide service with a smile. I will certainly stay here next time I visit New York.

title: Fantastic hotel
text: Flatiron hotel was a fantastic place to stay in New York. The beautiful room on 10th floor was amazing (toshi suite). The staff was very helpful and  friendly. I would love to stay there again and so would my family (husband + children (age 18 + 20)

title: Nice, pretty and clean, just don't sleep over the lounge
text: We love visiting Manhattan, and were excited to find a reasonably priced hotel in Midtown.  The Flatiron is relatively new, so some small quirks (room card didn't work at first,etc.) but the management and staff were responsive.  Good morning coffee a block or two away at Stumptown or the Birch Cafe!  We loved our corner suite, which worked fine for two adults and a quiet teenager.  The lobby aquarium is pretty cool, too.  Our only complaint was that the lobby lounge music is very noticeable at night when you're on the third floor.  We'll be happy to go back to the Flatiron, but will reserve a room a little higher up.  Not sure what this hotel wants to be, yet.  Internet a little slow, so not business travel.  No pool, so not good for young kids. Worked for us, though.

title: Love the Flatiron!
text: I first discovered The Flatiron Hotel through a deal on Living Social.  Right away I loved it!  The rooms - although on the small side - have amazing beds with fabulous bedding and pillows. The staff is friendly and helpful.  The lobby bar just opened and they started serving Breakfast just today.  I've been back 3 times and looking forward to my next visit!

title: Flatiron was a great experience
text: The Flatiron hotel is in the heart of the Flatiron district in NYC.  The area itself is full of attractions to tourists such as Mario Batali's "Eataly," Jay-Z's "40/40 club", the Flatiron building itself, Teddy Roosevelt's birthplace and many more.  The hotel is new and still in its opening phase, so there are a few hiccups here and there, but the overall experience FAR outweighs any negatives.  The lobby is lovely with a huge unique saltwater aquarium surrounded by a transparent spiral staircase. There is live music at night with a great jazz ensemble.  The room itself is wonderfully apportioned and the bathroom has a TV in the mirror.  We had some difficulty using the Wi-Fi and had to be in certain places in the room to get it, but I'm sure that's a minor kink to be worked out. The thermostat settings were a bit touchy, so we found it better to leave it alone. There are those who complained about the subway noise - and while noticeable, I have to say my take was "Welcome to New York City."  There's nothing they can do about that now.. and if anything, if you want to visit other parts of the city, you know that the subway is close by!  You're in walking distance to Times Square (16 blocks - we did it with a 7 y/o) and a nice park around the corner. We found the staff to be very friendly and accomodating.  Overall, my family VERY MUCH enjoyed the stay and we would come again.

title: Loved the Flatiron!
text: I would not hesitate to recommend the Flatiron Hotel to anyone looking for a place to stay in NYC.  We had never been to New York and weren't sure what to expect, but found the Flatiron by luck and the nightly rate seemed very fair.  (It was about $250 per night for the Toshi suite.)  The hotel is in a great location - a block from one of the subway lines, and walking distance from A LOT of sights.  Our room was very high tech with remote controlled window coverings and a television built in to the bathroom mirror.  Cool stuff!  The Toshi suite is a corner room with windows covering two walls and it was worth the little bit of extra cost because it was a lot of fun watching all the New York sights below us.  The staff was friendly and helpful and the hotel was well run and very clean.  If we return to New York we will definately stay at the Flatiron again!

title: A real NYC gem
text:
The best thing about the Flatiron Hotel (aside from the gorgeous fishtank that catches your eye the moment you step into the lobby) is just how unique it feels.  

The room we stayed in was a tech-geek delight with remote control curtains, iPod dock, HD TV, complementary Wi-Fi, touch controls for the door signs and the much mentioned 'TV within a bathroom mirror' (which is just cool, no two ways about it!). A decent size, too. A clean, comfortable bed and a really nice shower unit sealed the deal.

The staff were very friendly and incredibly helpful. One day after an lengthy sight-seeing tour, we got back to find they had very kindly taken our luggage (lost at the airport for one day) up to our room so we had it waiting on our return. It's all in the little touches, and it was very much appreciated.

If you're looking to get out and see the sights, the Flatiron Hotel's location is really second to none. Close enough to the main sights and attractions of Manhattan, but far away enough to be a little haven at the end of a long days sight-seeing or shopping. Yes, you can hear taxi horns and sirens at night and the occasional rumbling of a subway train, but we certainly didn't find it unbearable by any means. Plus, you just have to remember this is NYC... 

Tip: As it's a relatively new hotel, a number of the taxi drivers and shuttle bus employees looked puzzled when you gave them the name. Best to make a note of the address if you go out and about.

I'll be recommending this hotel to friends and family, and given that it's still in the 'soft opening' stage (although the bar adjacent to the lobby is now open and looks great) it can only get even better. Well worth a look.

title: Friendly staff, very clean, great location
text: We stayed at the flatiron for our recent trip & we had a fantastic experience! We stayed in a Madison park double which was plenty of room for the 4 of us. (2 couples). After reading prior reviews we did request a top floor, you still hear some noise from outside, but that's NYC. The staff was very helpful in helping us get around the city. The hotel was very updated with still a different retro look in the bar area.  Our only complaint was that you cannot use the fridge in your room unless you want charged for the items in it, howeve they explain it all up front & you can request a 2nd fridge be placed in your room. Overall we loved it & would definitely stay there again!

title: Great stay but could use some improvement
text:
I think the first thing we were all surprised with was the location of the hotel.  We took the subway from JFK to get here and got off on 28th St.  It didn't look like much but once we got to the hotel and headed towards 23rd, you see the beautiful Madison Square Park and Flatiron Building!  The Flatiron is really a beautiful building and truly unique!  Around that area is also the popular Shake Shack right inside the park, as well as Mario Batali's Eataly!  There's no restaurant in the hotel itself so at least there are a couple of legit options around.

We had the Madison Double and it turned out to be one of the biggest hotel room I've ever stayed in for NYC.  NYC is known for the tiny rooms, even with doubles, but this room was fairly spacious with two full size beds rather than the "queen" size bed that it states.  Flat screen TV and a remote controls the curtains.  The temperature can be set easily also.  Beds were very comfy as we all got a good night's sleep.  The room also comes with one of those iHome iPod/iPhone controls.  The only thing about the room is the layout of the bathroom.  Our room's wash stand was right in front of the toilet with little room to spare.  Had to make sure we didn't touch the bowl when we were brushing our teeth :P

However, the showers were awesome.  Swiss rain fall coupled with a few shower heads that shoots right at your body.  The knob did fall off but I blame it on the Moen shower controls they use since I literally fumbled with everything until I found the right one.  Took me awhile to figure out where the control was and how to turn the shower on.  TV in the mirror is a nice touch!

Free wi-fi which should be great, but it is PAINFULLY slow.  It got to the point where we all gave up on using the wi-fi for our phones and switched back to 3G.

Staff was very helpful!

title: Commuication breakdown
text:
Flatiron Hotel itself is quite good - even trendy - clean and its location is very good indeed. No breakfast is available; however there are several establishments quite next door. There is a bar and some kind of "club" next to the lobby but luckily the sounds did not reach my room.
Some street sounds and other quests' noise did not bother very much, but if you are a light sleeper you must remember that New York never sleeps.

My biggest minus goes to the service. It seemed that I forgot something behind in the closet when I moved on. I contacted the front deskby phone 4 times during the following 10 days and left my phone number twice, all in vain. There seems to be major information breakdown between the front desk and housekeeping and also between the morning and and later shifts. All I needed to know if housekeeping had found one lost item in the room I stayed at - how much detective work does it take? They were just not able to tell me simply YES we found it or NO there was nothing left behind. ( I may have misplaced the item somewhere else, I just did not find it anymore during my trip.)
The most absurd thing was when I informed the front desk that they should contact me at 2 pm at the latest on the day of my return flight, I got a text message at 2.30 pm that they will give me an answer "by the end of the day".  So, no answer at all, thank you very much...

title: Flatiron
text:
Location is great.  The aquarium is beautiful.  Staff for the most part are very helpful.  We had the smallest room and that is very tiny, shower jet was wonderful.

They held or bags on our last day there, they provided us with plastic spoons and got some ice (as there is no ice machine on the floors.

The business center is completely free and when we were there not busy.  

All and all great experience.

title: Wonderful hotel in a great location!
text: This was our first trip to NYC and so glad we stayed at the Flatiron! The Toshi Corner Suites are so roomy and bathrooms are great. The hotel staff was so helpful, especially Steven and Alex. Steven suggested a great steakhouse for my daughter's 18th birthday dinner(Steak Frites) & helped us order tickets for 9/11 memorial. Great midtown location! Can't wait to visit NYC again and stay at the Flatiron. I have already recommended this hotel to friends who will traveling to NYC this summer.

title: Great hotel, great location, staff were very helpfully
text: Great hotel, great location, friendly staff, will definitely recommend it to others

title: A VERY THANKFUL TRAVELER!!!
text:
I've never really travelled alone before and New York was more than enough to confuse me.
Upon checking into the hotel (nice and clean rooms and facilities), i was still a good deal confused and i think it showed.
I was approached by one of the staff in the hotel (the general manager i think). All i remember was that his name was George. Good fellow was nice enough to take the initiative and offered to help me.

Not only did he answer all my questions, provided good service and made me feel very at home during my stay. He was nice enough to go out of his way to tell me how to get around NY and all the attractions worth seeing. I'm sure i took up a bit too much of his time. But thanks to him, my stay in New York was EXTREMELY enjoyable.

I'll be sure to go there again whenever i visit New York! 
A VERY BIG thank you to George!
(Look up George people! Good bloke with dark hair and glasses!)

title: Comfortable Stay
text: Had an enjoyable stay here not too long ago. The rooms were exceptionally clean and the staff were very helpful and friendly. Many thanks to George and the rest of the staff for making my visit to NYC a wonderful one!

title: Mismanged, Overbooks and lies ..Dont trust them !
text:
BEWARE THIS HOTEL OVERBOOKS ! ..We checked in and they said 20 minutes untill the room would be ready , then 20 minutes latter they said it would be 6~8 hours to come back at 4:00 pm, go figure.  OK ,So they checked our bags in and we came back at 4:00. THEN , they said there wasnt any rooms left because something had happened to an entire floor of the hotel.  The manager said there had been an "event" and it couldnt be helped. THIS WAS A FLAT OUT LIE. The hotel shuttle driver accidentally told us the truth , that they had just overbooked by like 12 rooms.
They offered to pay for us to stay at the Four points , I heard that they had done this for 12 rooms that day alone. The Hotel shuttle driver told us they had just overbooked by 12 rooms and he had been shuttling people all day.
The staff was sooo disorganized , the communication was pathetic , they simply didnt have anything together. The lobby looked nice , good luck if you book this room !

title: Great!
text: I stayed with my family for couple days, the hotel was very clean and nice. Everyone there was nice, especially George who made sure that we had everything we needed and gave us some great tips bout navigating the city for my parents who visited ny for the fist time.

title: Awesome Stay!
text: The Flatiron Hotel offered a perfect place for our recent visit to New York.  The central location was a perfect stop between uptown and Soho.  We were able to return to the hotel between our day excursions and our Broadway show and dinners out.  Stayed with my sister and her teenage daughters.  The bar area is quaint and very hip. Close to great restaurants and shopping.  Chelsea is beautiful. The parking associated with this hotel is inexpensive ($105 for 3 days) and very safe.  All around great stay.  Thanks Flatiron.

title: Disappointing
text: I am unable to review the room since I was never in it. I booked and prepaid for a room several months prior to our stay date (March 10th). My wife, who is 8 months pregnant and I were in the city for a surprise party. I researched the location in regard to the party location so she could easily return to the room when she got tired and it seemed to be a nice boutique hotel. Upon arrival, 4:30 on the 10th, we were informed, after we parked in the garage recommended by the hotel, that we no longer had a room due to a ceiling collapsing the night before (???) I am not sure why the didn’t call us in advance, but they booked us in another hotel. I was not pleased, but tried to be understanding and went to the next hotel (which shall remain nameless). Upon entering the room it was immediately determined it was unacceptable (not an even exchange by any standard) Then my wife began calling the Flatiron to request more suitable accommodations, she read a report of bugs in the hotel we were transferred too. It took approximately 1 hour and 4 calls for them to provide any suitable suggestions, now we are less than an hour from the party and are not dressed. We finally accepted a stay at another hotel which was very nice, but not particularly close to the location of our party. Overall it was a disappointing experience, because simple customer service in the form of a phone call should have been provided. We also questioned why it was our room that was damaged and unavailable, had every other guest booked prior to us? We had other friends from the party staying at the Flatiron without incident. Overall, I have nothing to say on the room, but the quality of our experience was poor.

title: Freaky Hotel on Broadway
text:
First off, make sure you know the address if your taking a taxi to the hotel, its not a known hotel for taxi drivers as I got the experience first hand.  The hotel is really nice and sheek and freaky. Huge Aquarian in the loby with tropical fish. Automatic curtains to close and open, digital do not disturb sign, TV in bathroom mirror. (not sure if all rooms are like this, We were on the 10th floor, so who knows) Surround sound TV, nice flat screen TV and a fridge but dont touch anything, what you pick up you pay. Just tell the front desk you didnt know just incase. 

Really nice hotel, got amazing deal on hotwire $95 a night. 
Free internet and printer if you need to print a boarding pass. Wireless internet in room.
Front desk staff, very nice, gave me free pouches of toothpaste.
Very comfortable bed and very clean hotel.

One advice, ask for the 10th floor room, the subway runs thru the hotel, you can hear it if your a light sleeper, not really a big deal to me, I heard it. 
Also, the noise with all the NY Taxi's honking, you can hear it pretty clear.

Location is perfect for MSG and shopping. About a 7 mins walk to Macy's and MSG.

title: Reservation #1540247 - Horrible Experience
text:
So the Flatiron had my first review deleted, claiming that I had not stayed at the property, so I’m sharing my res number. If they claim I didn’t stay there a second time, I assume they’ll give me a refund?

I booked a stay at the Flatiron on 2/17. The dates I booked were 2/22 to 2/24. After booking the hotel, I made flight plans and unfortunately had to book a redeye flight. I then contacted the Flatiron by phone and very clearly offered to add one night’s room on the beginning of my stay so that a room would be ready for me when I arrived at 7AM in the event that an early registration would not be possible. Jessica, who I spoke with, said that she “locked” that room and that an early check in would be possible. Again to be completely clear, I offered to book another night’s stay to ensure early check in, but was told by the Flatiron not to do so. 

Upon arrival early in the morning on the 22, I was informed that no room was available and that the room had been rented the night before…I would have to wait. I went to a Starbucks and waited about 2.5 hours until they had a room available. Not a huge inconvenience.

Unfortunately that was pretty much the highlight of my stay there. It became such a comedy of errors that I ultimately suspected that they were messing with me intentionally. 

-	I went to the front desk in the evening of my first day and extended my stay one day. The clerk made the change and told me I would receive an email confirmation. When it had not arrived by the next morning, I again stopped by the front desk to confirm. Either of those interactions would have been idea times for the front desk staff to offer to redo my key entry card – on three occasions the last two days of my stay, I couldn’t get into my room and had to go back down to the desk and reques that the key card be adjusted.
-	The WiFi service ONLY extended to the 8 to 10 inches closest to the room door. I called the front desk two nights in a row and both times and was told that the “web guy” wasn’t on duty, so please use the business center. 
-	The  Jacuzzi tub in my room did not work. I called the desk on the first night, no one ever came up.
-	When I got to my room on the third evening, it had not been cleaned. Had to ring the front desk two times requesting service. When they did service the room, they neglected to leave any bath towels. 

There’s more but that’s about all the space I have. I understand errors and I also believe that often times when one error occurs for whatever reason, seems like chances are something else will go wrong. So in all honestly I would have likely laughed all of this off if the Flatiron had not successfully gotten my earlier review removed. That speaks to their character and should serve as a warning sign to anyone considering staying there.

title: Very nice
text: Will definitely stay here again. Customer service was very nice, gave us a free upgrade to a king size room.

title: Great Customer Service
text: My family and I had a wonderful stay and really enjoyed the conversations and customer service provided especially by George, Jessica, Yomayra,Terrance and Allen with dash away limo...We will definately be coming back soon.

title: Weekend at Oprea
text: Room size small, Tiny closet,TV not mant channels, No Ice machine, Bar stools were hard on your back and butt. Staff was cluless were anything is (ie tic tock dinner and so on!). Very Loud outside. heater was very loud also.

title: Switched rooms 4 Times & Still found Hair in the beds
text:
The end of last month I was traveling to visit family and decided to treat myself to a night in the city using one of my free http://Hotel.com nights. I was debating between this hotel and an UWS one, but chose this one because it's proximity to the subway and my favorite coffee shop (perfect to grab breakfast/coffee on my way to the airport).

To sum up my 90 minutes in hell with the Flatiron staff: I ended up switching rooms 4 times because in each room there were either tiny black hairs in the bed or in one bed there were long black strands of hair & blood on the duvet. The front desk manager I dealt became more insensitive & cold each time I had to deal with him.

Also, it seems this hotel encourages it's staff to remain unprofessional. None of the housekeeping/maintenance employees were in any kind of uniform, the "General Manager" gave me his card in which his former title "Housekeeping Manager" was scribbled out and "G.M." was written above it. He also gave me his cell phone number (which he had to look up on his phone?) to call him next time I was in the city and he assured me "he'd take care of my visit".

Not once was I offered an upgrade for my inconvenience, any kind of refund, comped room, or anything that would have made my stay more pleasant beyond the vague "call me and we'll take care of you" thing.

I was made to feel like a nuisance & very unwelcome, and I think that would make any guest at any hotel upset.

title: Weekend Getaway
text: My wife and I recently stayed at Flatiron Hotel for her birthday weekend getaway.  I have to say the facility was top notch.  The staff were very accommodating when unfortunate circumstances changed our travel plans at the last minute.  The rooms are small (it's NYC though so that's expected) but well equipped with high end furnishings, bathroom fixtures and electronics.  We were also able to check our bags in at the front desk and leave them there after we checked out.  This allowed us to enjoy NYC for an extra day without hauling our bags around town.  Overall it was a very enjoyable experience.

title: Enjoyable Stay, located close to subway.
text:
I got a great deal reserving our stay through Hotwire at half the price.  I just got back from our trip (Feb 16 - 19) with my husband.  We were booked for 2 beds and I made a number of requests, which they happily provided. Since it was only the 2 of us, I requested to have the King size bed and from reading the reviews here about the noise, I also requested for rooms in higher floors. We end up getting a small cozy king bed room on the 8th floor in the hotel.  We still were able to hear the trains passing through, but the bed was so comfortable and my added exhaustion from traveling the city, we were totally out and sleeping like babies.  

The room was very modern and clean, we had fun with the remote curtains and the TV in the washroom mirror, but had a problem setting the alarm. Wish there were instructions on how to use the alarm clock in the room. As the alarm would set off the curtains to automatically open and the heat to turn on.  There wasn't enough towels, so we had to request for more.  We had a mini fridge full of items, but no place to put our own items.  So, we end up taking out some cans to cool our own items and placing them back when we left. We found out afterwards, the mini fridge keeps tabs of items you take out for more than 20 sec and charges it on the bill. When we checked out, we were charged for the cans, but the clerks removed the charge, as we told them we didn't consume the drinks and only use it for fridge space to put our own items. So, we will see later if they still charged us for the items on our credit cards. We had trouble controlling the temperature in the room. It was either too cold or too hot. There was also a delay with hot water for showering. It took about 5 mins to get the hot water running for our showers.  There were some misses but the stay was overall enjoyable, as we just need a place to sleep.

The hotel is conveniently located close to the subway. The reception will recommend you to take the subway on the 23rd, but we learned that there was a closer stop on the 28th and Broadway, which is about a 5-10 mins walk to the hotel.

I would definitely come back for another stay here as the location is great and the service satisfied our needs for the price we paid.

title: Excellent experience all around!
text: The staff was very friendly and helpful. They made me feel comfortable asking any little question. They even recommended a good sushi place nearby. The room is small... but it is NY and either way we spent 10% of our time there. Very clean and cute space. The location is also a plus close to everything.

title: 4 nights and NO proper housekeeping!
text:
We just got back from a 4 night stay at the Flatiron Hotel.
We booked the room through www.booking.com for a REALLY great price - 109$ a night for a double room in manhattan. Can´t be beat! 
This was a trip that we took to celebrate our 5th wedding anniversary, and when I booked the room I made a comment about this. When we checked in to the hotel there was a bottle of sparkling wine for us in the room. Very nice! But 4 nights later it wasn´t as nice anymore...

Pro´s:
Location; Close to subway, starbucks around the corner, side street to broadway and many good restaurants nearby (ilili, Le pain quotidian and others)

Free Wi-Fi (not as slow as expected) 

Room decoration and armenities (free coffee and water, minibar selection)

Electronic housekeeping and Do not disturb buttons

Automatic drapes

Not as loud as expected (Subway and street noise minimal, since we were on the 9th floor)

Possible to borrow adaptor (for EU plugs) and umbrellas free of charge

And last but not least, the best thing was an employee named Alex - Always in a good mood and always smiling - Asking how our days was. Hotel (GET MORE staff as service minded as he is!)

Con´s:

The hotel has a deal with a parking garage down the street (first 24 hours is paid by the hotel). Upon arrival we was not informed that there was two parking garages across from each other, and we parked at the wrong one (Icon) instead of Central Parking and had to pay 47$ out of our own pocket. Before picking up the car we informed the front desk staff about the situation and they told us, that they would talk to the manager, about reimbursing us. This was Wednesday. Thursday morning we asked the staff on the new shift if there were any news on the situation, they hadn´t heard or talked to anybody about it. We explained it to them and asked if they would talk to the manager. Friday Morning we went down, still no answer. The prior shift hadn´t told them about the situation. Obviously none of the staff knows how to pass on information when changing shifts. This is pretty annoying to have to deal with, when on vacation. We finally talked to the manager ourselves, and he told us he could´t do anything before he talked to the accounting department. We are now awaiting an e-mail. Seriously a manager that can´t make a decision like this, and take it off the final bill?. We feel that It was the hotels mistake not to guide os properly, and it became our headache.

Housekeeping a whole other story!:

Housekeeping was really late in our opinion between 2pm to 4pm (But maybe thats just us)

Not enough towels; the housekeeping took all of the dirty towels but somedays only replaced the big towels and not the ones for your face, hands etc. Also there is only one little hook to hang the towels on so if you want to shower both in the evening and in the morning, the towel will be wet in the morning.

When housekeeping had been in our room, they left empty shampoo bottles in the shower, and didn´t even replace them with new ones - We had to call the front desk for new ones.

They didn´t change the hand soap even though it had hair on it (I work at a hostel and we even do that there)

Hair was found in the shower, ours probably, but just a sign that they were not thorough.

They didn´t change the trashcans one day, and didn´t vacuum at all, even though there was visible need for it.

Housekeeping didn´t change our sheets AT ALL during a 4 night stay. When we were at the front desk friday morning, we asked if it was normal at this hotel not to change sheets. Their answer was: "we will check to see if thats the case". What????? Don´t change sheets, this is the 3rd night and the front desk don't know? Friday when we got back and the housekeeping had been there, they had only changed part of the bed linen. - not the pillow cases which was full of hair and make up and the upper sheet. 

We had had enough at this point and went down to the front desk, when I told them about it they checked their system and told me that housekeeping had been there. This really ticked me off, so I asked them to go with me to the room so I could show it too them myself, they wouldn't . At that point I asked for the manager, it took about 5 minutes and then he came and took me aside. His first question was if we came to the city often, my answer was that we didn´t have any set plans for it in the future yet, THEN A LONG PAUSE where the manager didn´t say anything.... Then half a sentence, and then he said: I can give you the last night for free because thats the only night that hasn´t gone through the system yet.

I told him that was fine, and then he sent somebody up to the room with some sparkling wine and pillowcases we could change our selves???

Looking back I find it kind of insulting the way it happened, but I´m questioning the managers ability or freedom to take decisions on his own.

Next morning we checked out with a weird feeling about the staff!!!

We had really hoped for us, to find a place, we could return to in the future. We have been in N.Y 5 times in the last 3 years, and love to go there, so we will definitely return to the city, but unless The Flatiron hotel get their act together, we won´t return to this hotel - Even though it´s at a good price!

For a 4 star hotel this is not good enough!!!

title: A hidden gem
text: Kind service, decent room, fun tech gadgets.  Location very convenient to sights, restaurants, activities:  walk to MSG, Times Square, etc.

title: I would recommend this hotel
text:
I stayed at the hotel from 2/15/12 through 2/19/12 with my husband.  we stayed in a king size room.  The previous comments made me nervous, so we requested a room on the upper floor, which they accommodated (7th floor). yes, you can hear the vibrations of the train below, but you couldn't hear street noise.  and the train vibration wasn't a big deal.  Very light sleepers probably have a problem with everything in NYC. 
Pros: for NYC the room is good sized.  people not familiar with NYC might be shocked by room sizes here, but it is new york.  I saw the queen size rooms, and they are much smaller than the king.  The bed was comfy, room was clean (we were nervous about bed bugs - no issue at all), the tech features were cool.  Ipod radio was nice, the black out shades worked really well.  bathroom was large/clean.  i wish our room had the cool showers i saw in the queen room (I peeked into a few other rooms during the mid day while housekeeping was cleaning).  but the bathroom with the tub was much bigger.  The hairdryer was a real hairdryer, not the typical hotel crappy thing (wish i knew ahead of time, i could have packed less).  the tv in the bathroom mirror was a novelty, but not really my thing.  the location is AMAZING!!  this is exactly where i want to be in NYC.  The cost was great, but i assume it will go up in price as it gets more well known.   we met the owner one night - he's really energetic and seems to care a lot about this project.  It's not like a big corporation is running this show - it's small and getting attention from the owner.  Thats nice to see.  Room safe is so well hidden, we had to call the front desk to find out where it was... but it's there.
Meh?: the lobby is interesting.... clean but a bit over the top for me.  Is this a con? probably not, but not anything special for me.  The decor overall is not exactly my taste, but at least more playful than most hotels. there weren't any places to really hang out in the lobby other than just some couches.  it wasn't the type of place i would like to just hang out.  Not bad for sitting and waiting for someone, but not a "place" yet.  Other hotels do this much better.  
Cons: wish there was a mini fridge in the room.  it has  cooler selling water/soda, but no space for our food.  The bar just opened while we were there.  The liquor selection is not great.  the bar tender gets an A for effort, but not execution.  I'm going to assume they just need some more time and experience.  and some nibbles.  Another Con - the hotel doesn't yet have any thing other than just rooms.  No cafe, no food, etc.  However, starbucks is right next door and the neighborhood has so much.  All in all, for the cost savings, i would prefer to spend the extra money on doing something outside of my hotel than just paying for hotel accoutrements.  
overall, i highly recommend this hotel.  we were very happy with it. our "cons" are minor, while the pros were great.

title: What a terrific hotel!:)
text: Booked this hotel through "Hotwire."  Terrific price and fantastic room (great location, too)... Book it!  Staff wass terrific!

title: Beautiful Hotel
text:
My friend and I ended up staying at the Flatiron Hotel in NYC for 3 nights.  We booked it through Hotwire and got a pretty amazing deal on the room!  The hotel lobby is very chic and trendy, very hip and modern.  The front desk staff were all welcoming and pretty cool.  The cylindrical aquariam is really something to see!  

The rooms were quite nice, size was typical of other NYC hotels.  Great things about the room were the electronic curtain/window shades, the TV in the bathroom mirror, the shower stall with all the spa jets was really nice after a long day in the city.  Probably the most amazing thing about the room were the comfort of the beds!! I have never slept on anything like that before and it was truly an amazing experience.

Somethings that could have been worked on...the heater is pretty loud and blasts hot air into the room.  It was hard to get a stable temperature in the room.  Also, the tile floor in the bathroom was freezing cold on barefeet.  It would have been nice to have heated tile floors or even provide guests with complimentary slippers.  Also, there were no towel racks at all in the bathroom! After showering we would just throw the towels on the floor or leave them on the counter. Sometimes I would hang them on top of the door.  i think this is something they perhaps missed???  It also would have been nice to have real glasses to use in the hotel room, rather than the flimsy plastic cups sealed in celophane that they give you.  That just makes the room look cheap.  They also need to upgrade the quality of coffee in the room.  While it was nice to have the coffeemaker and complimentary coffee, the quality was very poor.  We walked to Starbucks in the morning to get real coffee.  

I think that fixing up these little snags will make this an even better hotel than it already is.  I would definitely choose to stay here again!

title: Getting there - but they need better housekeeping staff
text:
Got a nice rate at BookIt.com to stay here during Toy Fair. I like trying out new hotels and Flatiron is still in a "soft opening" right now. 

The Good: 
Check in was great. Front desk staff was very helpful, and even gave me a card of their business manager to contact about show rates going forward. The room was nice. Had a Madison Park Double (#804) and room size is nice with the two beds. Turn down service (they close the electronic curtains) is given as well. It's 2 blocks from Eataly, which is great for food and close enough to Javits. Cabs were pretty easy to catch on 26th, too. Platform beds were super comfy. Lobby is gorgeous with that fish tank.

The Bad:
Housekeeping. Upon arrival we noticed a LOT of dust hanging from the bathroom vent. There was a housekeeper in the room next door, so we asked her to swiffer it as there was a damp/moldy odor. She refused. Told us to call the front desk. We did, they sent someone up to clean it. The TV only had standard channels and cable, the "on demand" button did nothing. It's possible they didn't hook it up yet and I wasn't at a loss watching TV and HBO anyway. But there was no TV check out, that I normally do. Two days before I left the housekeeper "cleaned"... took all the soap, shampoo, etc that was only half used, and didn't replace any. So I had no bar to even wash my hands with. But she forgot to dump the trash bins in the room as well. Not professional. Told the front desk staff, and they said they'd send stuff up while we were out to dinner (Valentine's Day). When we got back, shampoo/conditioner/lotion was there... but still no hand soap. Asked at front desk again. They said they'd send it... but none ever came. Checked out the next day. 

I'm not sure I'd stay again and it was a nice hotel. I know they're new, but asking for something as simple as SOAP shouldn't take 3 tries or more.

title: highly recommend!
text:
I found a great deal through Bookit.com, and it ended up being a good decision.  Its in a great location.  We were only a couple of blocks from our bus stops.  It's a bit of a walk to Times Square, but it's not that bad.  The lobby was small, but inviting.  Check-in was a breeze.  The guy (I wish I remembered his name!) at the front desk gave us great advice for navigating around NYC and great recommendations for late night food.  

The room was awesome.  It was small, which is normal for the city.  The bed was comfortable.  I loved the shower, the lights that dim above the bed, the keyless entry, and the button for "Housekeeping" and "Do Not Disturb," instead of the typical doorhanger.  And the BF loved the tv in the mirror.  

Koreatown is a couple of blocks over, with tons of places to eat.  It's a great place to stay if you plan on checking out other stuff besides Times Square.  The iconic Flatiron Building can be seen from the end of the street, and there's a great park nearby to have a picnic or to rest up.  

Dillon was so nice during checkout.  We left our bags at the hotel since we had a late bus.  When coming back for our bags, Dillon saw that we had some food and offered us the lounge area to eat and rest before traveling, which we took up on.  

I loved the fact that this was a boutique hotel and not a chain.  It was cozy, the staff was friendly, and it was quiet.  I've already recommended this hotel to someone that's visiting NYC in the spring.  I would definately stay here again!

title: clean, modern small hotel in chelsea
text: Got a good rate here down to the renovation works that are going on at the moment. Fine for me as the work is on the ground floor during the day (they are working on the bar). Staff very friendly and helpful, rooms are beautiful with lots of nice gadget touches (tv in bathroom mirror, electric curtains, iPod dock etc). effective heating/cooling and a decent room size. Just round the corner from the flatiron building, close to tea and coffee shops overlooking the square. Would definitely stay here again if the price was right.

title: Some good, some bad
text: I had high hopes for this boutique hotel but there are definitely some areas that need improvement.  Stayed for three nights.  Room was very small and cramped partially mitigated with high ceilings.  Great mattress and comfy bed but no extra blankets and a very noisy HVAC system.  No table, no lamp and no lighting controls on one side of the bed.  Where are you supposed to put your glasses or turn on a light in the middle of the night?  First day of housekeeping they brought no washcloths and all hand towels and did not replace the drinking glasses.  Second day of housekeeping, there was none - housekeeping was a no-show as of 4:30pm when we returned to our room after being gone from 8:30am.  When I complained about both housekeeping issues (I had left a note about the washcloths and glasses but no housekeeper showed up to read it) someone finally brought washcloths to the room an hour later.  Never did get any drinking glasses.  Seems like a minor detail until you try to take a pill.  Sign says they are in their soft opening but staff said they opened last August.  That is plenty of time to get the kinks worked out...  Staff was pleasant, location was OK thought the street where the hotel entrance is located is off the beaten path and a bit sketchy at night.  Some common areas were still under construction and the lack of any kind of dining was a bit inconvenient, especially for breakfast.  I would give them another try if the price was right...

title: Séjour parfait !!!
text: Superbe hôtel prêt de tout magasin, resto et bar.  Service impeccable et très propre.  Nous avons pu tout faire à pied Time square, la 5ieme avenue, Broadway et bien sur les resto et bar gay qui sont tout prêt.  En plus il y a un starbuck juste en face donc parfait pour le café du matin :-) Le resto et bar dans l'hôtel n'est pas ouvert mais vraiment pas grave car il y en plein tout prêt de très bon sur la 8ieme avenue.

title: Flatiron Hotel - Fantastic Stay!!!!
text:
This hotel is great, I highly recommend it.  The location is perfect, we were able to walk everyone, Times Square, Tribeca, SoHo, Central Park... (if you're lazy you may want to take a cab, these are not short walks).

I think for the price it's pretty much the best hotel in NYC.

The beds were super comfy and the linens were high quality, 4 star all the way!  The shower was awesome; with jets, rainwater showerhead etc.  The monogrammed towels were good quality, the hair blow dryer was a proper one, not the usual hotel nightmare.

Our room was large, 2 double beds with lots room to walk around.

The electronic curtaisn were cool, same with the tv in the bathroom. And our room had an ipod docking station, which is always a nice touch.

I was worried about noise because of the complainers on here, we didn't have any issues.  I think I heard a horn honking a couple of times... but that's to be expected in any city.  I didn't hear the supposed train noises at all.  (We were on the 3rd floor).

The lobby is really cool, hip furniture and a cool fishtank.

If you are the pickiest person ever, you might not like that the toilet roars when it flushes (it's powerful)... I didn't find it a problem, but you can hear it with the door closed.

title: Great location, helpful staff
text:
I stayed for a week here and one of the biggest strengths is the central location - on Broadway, near attractions like the Empire State, Madison Square Garden, and shopping. The room was clean and spacious, the bed was was big and comfortable, the bathroom even had a TV. I also liked the fishtank in reception - could be an attraction in its own right - and the fast lifts meant you never had to wait long.
Only two downsides, small points but enough for a 4 rather than 5 rating. The air-con was quite noisy - periodic bursts of hot air being a little too intrusive. And some confusion over the final bill took a little too long to resolve.
All in all, I would definitely stay here again.

title: Excellent small hotel
text:
My family and I stayed here this past weekend.  Great location and walking distance to great shops and restaurants.  How can it be bad being across from Shake Shack and a block from Eataly?  Entire building is spotless.  Front desk staff friendly and helpful.  Cant wait to return.
As an added bonus, we were able to park on the stree steps from the hotel.

title: Great location
text: We were pleasingly surprised of how nice the hotel and the location were. The staff is very friendly especially the hotel driver.

title: A GEM in the Flatiron District!
text: LOVED this Hotel!  Was thinking I should keep my opinion to myself because I'm afraid it will get too popular and I won't be able to get a room when I need it!  The location was perfect, the lobby cool, the front desk people were wonderful and my room was sublime!  Super comfy Bed and Bedding, small but perfect bath with a fabulous shower and a TV in the mirror!  They kindly kept my bag for me until I was ready to depart from the city.  The perfect location for me. Can't wait to go back!

title: Very nice experience!
text: I was pleasantly surprised: location was very good, hotel was clean and modern ( a little too modern for me - too many lighted screens - too much night lights). Bedding was clean and bed was very comfortable; bathroom was very petite but extremely comfortable. I had read the reviews of the hotel, and was concerned about subway noise- didn't hear a thing! The street noise was way too loud but it has nothing to do with the hotel- and everything to do with busy location in the middle of Broadway ( my room was on the 8th floor). I will stay there again if I will be able to get it at the same $98 rate !

title: Comfortable and Cozy
text: My fiancee and I stayed here for a weekend and we loved it. The hotel is very clean, staff is extremely nice, and the furniture in the rooms were up-to-date and very comfortable. Awesome shower with water coming out from every direction! I also loved that the beds were Temperpedic mattresses. It's also in a pretty good location in the in-between Uptown and Downtown (15 min walk from Time Square). I would highly recommend this place!

title: Great Hotel!!!
text: We stayed for 2 nights and will come back for sure.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.  Our room was in the 3rd floor with minimal street noise, did not bother us at all.  Room was very clean.  Location was great.  It was a very comfortable stay.

title: Fantastic stay at the Flatiron in Chelsea (NYC)
text: This was our first stay in NYC as a family (3 kids ages 6 to 12 years) and LOVED this hotel. The room was beautifully appointed with all sorts of electronic gadgets, including automatic curtain closers which the kids loved (along with the TV screen built into the bathroom mirror and the amazing fish tank in the lobby). The staff was extremely friendly and helpful and the room was spotless. However, Room 504 faced the street and was drafty and a bit noisy; the windows are original, single pane windows. Got a great deal thru Hotwire.

title: Wow, I mean, WOW!
text:
First of all, i hardly ever write reviews but i had to on this place. Looking online, there had been some mixed reviews about the Flatrion Hotel, but once we arrived, all of our doubts were immediately dismissed.
The front desk staff was really knowledgeable about the area and they mapped out routes for us to do what we had wanted to and recommended some great places to eat.
Housekeeping was perfect, not a spot or thing missed in the room through out our stay, they were all so warm and friendly we really felt like they appreciated us. Wish I could've brought that bed home with us. :))

 I will definitely be coming back on my  next trip and will be recommending it to friends and family.

title: Boutique Hotel Pros and Cons
text:
I have to say my favorite boutique hotel is The Dream in Midtown.  My stay there went ultra smooth, it was a great location and I felt safe.

My stay was from Friday - Sunday. The Flatiron is shiny and new but there are a few improvements needed:

Cons:
1. Sensitive to noise, I specifically requested in my reservation booked weeks ahead, NOT to have a room by the elevator, and they did the complete opposite.  My room literally faced the elevator.  Takes literally just one leap from the inside of the elevator into my room.  I called down to the front immediately realizing this and they said they'll check and call me back if anything.  So they called back literally 1 whole minute later and said there wasn't anything available.  Seriously, they could have waited 5 minutes to pretend they tried.  This showed me they are not accommodating and do not care to show they want to make an effort! I was ready to look for a new hotel at this point. 
2. Since there was nothing they can do about my room situation, and i was in a time crunch, I just sucked it up and stayed.  I got there on Friday afternoon and I needed to work a bit before the weekend.  For a few hours I was working in my room and all of a sudden someone opens the door into my room!  The voices of two adult men were behind my door about to walk in!  I quickly said "HELLO!"  They stopped opening the door halfway and did not see me but heard my voice.  I panicked!! I thought I was getting robbed or worst going to be assaulted!!! So I quickly grabbed my laptop ready to whack the people coming in.  Then they said "um, are you decent? we're here to check something!"  Are you kidding me?  I could have been in a very vulnerable situation!  Oh, and the room I was in did not have one of those long hook locks that keeps people out even if they have a key.  So this is a very unsafe situation for a single female traveling alone.  I put down my laptop and walked to the door to see what they wanted.  And they said they just wanted to check to see if something in the bathroom was fixed.  So one guy peeked into the bathroom and said it was.  I was just still in shock and disbelief in what was happening.  So the shorter guy saw this and asked "what's wrong."  I'm like "um. well, most people knock before they just walk into someone's room"  And they explained that they thought no one was checked in yet and the other guy said a matter of factually "you just checked in like 5 mins ago right? so ..." I'm like I've been here, working!  Jerk!  God the rudeness of this hotel at this point was almost too much to take.  If I didn't have to finish a report and meet someone soon I would have packed my stuff and moved to another hotel. 
3.  The noise level is outrageous!  I can sleep through fog horns and earthquakes but this room was beyond those things.  I heard the TV of the room next door all night long and loud too, the walls are thin.  The trains are also passing by every so often.  Because my room was so low in the building, I can hear every honk, siren, and crazies shouting!  Oh and people in and out of the elevators didn't help either!  Those noises went on all night long. 
4. One ice machine for the whole hotel, in Mezzanine level  and no vending machines for softdrinks or water.  (they are working on setting up minibars in the hotel rooms)  They did suggest we go across the street to the liquor store to get water/softdrinks, which we did and it was convenient enough. 

Pros:
Everything is new.
The curtains are electronically controlled, you open and close them with a remote!!! Really fun.
The curtains keep the light out very well.  So even if it's super bright out, the room can be dark.
The phone in room is cordless.
The TV was crisp (but it is digital so a lot of channels didn't have signal, since I don't watch much tv, I don't consider this too bad an issue)
The desk was good for working (though there were no power outlets where the desk is so my cords were connected to the walls on the other side, not too big a deal for me)
Two new bathrobes. 
The shower was awesome, it had a total of 8 spouts and 7 running at a time so you're getting sprayed from head to knees with multiple spouts, LOVE this feature.
There's a TV in the bathroom mirror (which can be a good or bad thing, I didn't like it because it got in my way of seeing myself since I'm short.  And it's not facing the toilet, so you can't watch it from there.  You can see it from the shower but can't hear it since shower is so loud) I think they tried with this but it ultimately does not make much since. 
Lighting in the rooms are well situated and can be adjusted for bright to dim to romantic.
Electronic control for Privacy  and Maid Service.
The lobby is very nice, with cool furnishing and a large cylinder aquarium. 
The doorman/luggage guys are very nice and quick to come to help me.  Girl who checked me in was also nice.
The location, right by beautiful Madison Square Park (depending on the type of person you are, it can be a shady spot at night, but I liked it because it was walking distance from all the places I ate at in LES and East Village.  Don't expect upper east side or midtown when staying here.  There are characters and you should be alert as you walk through the neighborhood)
Two short blocks from the Subway station.
Very easy to catch a cab.
They have car service if you need it ( i didn't use it but looks convenient)

All in all, my stay (after my first few hours of weirdness) went smooth.  I would stay here again, but I would definitely call ahead to make sure they won't put my room in front of the elevators and hopefully by then, they would have installed long hook locks so strangers can't just bust into your room if you're in the shower or doing something more private!

title: Comfortable and classy
text: This boutique hotel may not be as iconic as its namesake landmark building, but it's comfortable and classy with a hip, post-rococo atmosphere. (Love the multi-story fish tank in the lobby and the Venetian-style glass sconces throughout the building.) Our room on the eighth floor, though small, was quiet and spotlessly clean, with a well appointed bathroom including large plush towels, a multi-headed shower stall and—a first for me—a TV embedded in the mirror (yes, you can actually do your morning shave with Matt Lauer). The room also had a high-tech lighting system and mechanized drapes (no need to get out of bed to see that morning sun); and bathrobes and free Wi-fi were a plus. A few "soft opening" caveats: the bed that had been advertised as queen-size was definitely just a full (though made up with good quality linens and lots of pillows), with zero room on one side; the desk chair was way too big to maneuver around; and a minibar fridge was empty and locked. Get these kinks out, and I might just elevate my rating to "excellent."

title: Fantastic week at the Flatiron Hotel
text: I just finished a 5 night stay at the Flatiron Hotel while visiting NYC on business. I could not have asked for a more comfortable, enjoyable stay! The staff was extremely friendly and helpful and the room was great. The room I stayed in was very quiet, with minimal street noise, and I was on the 7th floor. It also had an amazing shower with all the necessities and the bed was always fresh and comfortable. The location was close to shops, restaurants, the drug store, and the subway. Very convenient and enjoyable! I look forward to staying at the Flatiron Hotel again soon.

title: Excellent Boutique Hotel
text:
Stayed here for the weekend of 12/17/2011.  Booked 2 full size rooms with two beds and requested high floors due to some earlier reviews on this site which mentioned subway noise.  Upon arrival, they said they only had side by side rooms on the lower floors.  When I pointed out that I had requested rooms on the higher floors, they gave us rooms on floor 9 and 10.  The 10th floor appears to be the highest.  They then upgraded us to corner rooms - very nice.

The rooms were very nice, spacious, and had lots of bells and whistles.  The jacuzzi tub was wonderful to use.  The electronic operated curtains were also a nice touch.  Check in was effortless and they were very accommodating when we asked to store our luggage for the afternoon after we checked out.

I wouldn't worry about the subway noise.  The subway does run underneath the hotel and you can hear it.  However, you can drown out the intermittent subway noise with white noise generated by the heating/ac unit.  Set the fan for continuous operation.  It is fairly loud and it effectively drowns out the subway noise.  Works like a charm.

This is a small boutique hotel and I think it has a great location and a great pricing.  The pricing was attractive because of the soft opening of the hotel.  I would definitely stay there again if I can obtain a similar rate.

title: Good spot - clean, new, and nicely appointed
text: I stay here regularly...what a great new addition to the Flatiron neighborhood!  The rooms aren't huge, but they are certainly ample enough (especially for New York). The beds are very comfortable, the bathrooms are new and very fresh, and the staff is very helpful (especially Terrance, who works in the evenings).  Plus, there's that truly awesome, two-story fish tank in the lobby!

title: Highly recommend
text:
Pros - price was right for a family of four making a last minute trip to NYC. $269 for 2 double beds. Location was great, room was outstanding (newly renovated) Staff was very helpful and friendly. 
Cons  - street noise. May have been the corner room and the wall of windows (which was a good thing for the view). If you are a light sleeper may want to request a room away from street. 
Bottom line - We will stay there again

title: Great new hotel!
text: We thoroughly enjoyed our one-night stay at the Flatiron Hotel.  First of all, the service was excellent!  Benjamin was kind enough to allow us to move our reservation over one night (due to illness), even though we had booked through Hotwire, which allowed no flexibility at all.  We were even able to upgrade to a corner suite for an additional $40.  Terrence was also great.  He was able to get us a last-minute dinner reservation at a popular Italian restaurant nearby.  The restaurant even raved about the Flatiron!  Our room was very clean (and I’m very picky!) and surprisingly large, especially for NYC.  Our daughter loved the high-tech details in the room - TV in the bathroom mirror, iPod docking station, remote controlled drapes, etc...  The location was also excellent, not far from anything but not in the middle of the chaos either.  Eataly was just a block or two away.  We were also able to walk to Times Square.  We loved the large fish tank in the lobby!  We would definitely stay here again.

title: Jim from NJ
text: My wife and I enjoyed our stay very much.  All the electronics were fun.  The shower was great.  We have seen nothing like it.  Management was very good and helpful.  The price was reasonable and the room was comfortable and clean.  The fish tank was amazing and the lobby was great for relaxing.

title: Very Nice Experience!
text: We got a great deal on the room through Travelocity and had a wonderful experience. The service was excellent from the moment we arrived. Terrance was accomodating and very helpful. The staff even stored our luggage for several hours after we checked out so that we could enjoy the rest of the day. We loved our room and all its finishing touches. We will definately return.

title: Perfect spot for whirlwind city stay
text: We got a great deal on the room- 140 incl. tax on bookit.com- and all of the little extras were wonderful! The aquarium was beautiful and the rooms, though very cozy, had fun touches with a remote for the curtains, iPod dock w surround sound, a tv in the bathroom and a great shower. The location is perfect especially if you don't like being trapped in midtown- you're a short walk away from everything. I could see a longer stay being uncomfortable with the room size and the tv was spotty- a lot of channels didn't come in. I don't know if its worth the $300/night they ask but if you find a deal, it's a great getaway!

title: This hotel is not 4 Star
text: It is a 3 Star Hotel with a 1 Star management. We had problems with bites for one bed, and rash in another. The hotel refused to refund our unused 4 nights. Expedia also refused to refund this, and we could not stay in the hotel. Additionally, there a no fridges in the room - they charge $10 extra a night for fridge. The management took 15 minutes to check us in. The elevator also was not working.

title: Great new boutique hotel
text:
Just returned from a 4 night stay at the Flatiron hotel and had an excellent experience. 
The check in/out process was extremely easy and they were able to upgrade my room from a one bed to a two bed for a discounted price. The staff was incredibly accomodating and friendly.
The location is GREAT if you want to get away from the hustle and bustle of the super touristy areas. It is within walking distance to a lot of food options as well as the N,Q,R subway line so it's very easy to get both uptown and downtown.

The room size was good and the bathroom was nice, though it was a little bit small. (There is a TV in the mirror -- pretty cool!) Beds and pillows were very comfortable. 

I will definitely be staying here again and would highly recommend it. I booked through travelocity, so for the price it was excellent.

title: Highly recommend this hotel
text: Our stay was wonderful. Room was very clean and bathroom was quite spacious. Shower was a bit noisy but it did not bother us. Everyone was helpful and friendly.  Our room was upgraded and we had a late check-out. We hope to stay there again and look forward to the bar being open.

title: A good new option
text: This hotel is brand new, so it's super clean and well decorated. The rooms are far nicer and bigger than what you'd normally get in NY at this price. I only had two gripes: 1. the parking garage they contract with down the street was full, and the attendant was completely disinterested in helping me; and 2. they do have an ice machine, but there are no minibars or even a soda machine on premises, which I found odd.

title: Gem
text: We booked our stay on a recommendation from a friend who has stayed at The Flatiron, but were a little nervous. We've had some terrible hotel experiences in New York City (especially downtown) but this place is a true gem! The extremely friendly front desk staff, the location, and the overall style of the place is unmatched. My boyfriend and I are already trying to nail down some dates to return in the spring. The front desk staff couldn't have been friendlier or more helpful. They offered us some great "off the beaten path" recommendations for places to eat and things to do that made our trip really special.  The rooms, though small (it's New York) were immaculate and all the special features (automatic curtains, lighting, tvs in the bathroom, etc) were SUPER cool. We ended up spending most of our time inside the room instead of exploring the city but oh well :) Really excited for the future of this place! Can't wait to go back.

title: Beautifully unique
text: A girlfriend and I stayed 3 days at this hotel. The location was great for getting around downtown NYC. The rooms were a reasonable size for the city, the shower was small but fantastic, and the lobby has an amazing massive aquarium as a centerpiece. Service was well intentioned, if inept. Eataly is one block away, and the best coffee at Stumptown is 3 blocks north.

title: Few start-up glitches but enjoyable stay
text:
All good in general, just a few things needing ironing out in this new hotel. Staff helpful and friendly, rooms are nicely done and clean - only couple of issues were a fuse blowing which put out main lights in the room - we coped with bathroom lights though and we were offered lots of lamps. Also they need to invest in double glazing as room heated up quickly but got cold quickly too so that would be nice to find a balance.
Enjoyed our stay though as it's in an ideal location to get all around Manhattan. Just round the corner from places to eat like Eataly or the Shake Shack and great bars like the rooftop at 230 5th.

title: New York Experience~
text:
When I visit New York (which is not often), I am always looking for a place that gives me that "New York" Experience. This was my first time staying at The Flatiron Hotel and everything was just as I had hoped. The Front Desk Staff was so friendly and educated on the surrounding area, with great suggestions on places to eat and local attractions. I really enjoyed the cozy feel and look of the room we stayed in. This hotel was much cleaner than other hotels I have stayed at in New York, so I was thoroughly impressed by that.
All around it was a great stay and I am very happy we chose this hotel to stay at! A WONDERFUL New York Experience thanks to The Flatiron Hotel! We will definitely be back~ Thanks again!!

title: Amazing Stay as usual
text:
This is the third time my fiance and I have stayed here. The hotel is in its soft opening, but regardless, this is the place for us. They have taken such good care of us everytime we come that its going to be tough to beat, I cant wait for the restaurant and bar to open.  

It seems like each time I stay, there have a change in staff, and it seems to be for the better in every situation. The gentleman with glasses was knowledgeable and welcomed us back. Every time he saw us he knew us by name. 

The rooms are always clean and the tech is cool, They have tvs in the bathroom, automatic curtains, and great lighting that you can set to any mood. I highly reccomend this place. It will only get better once they are running at full capacity. 

Thank You Sooo much for being great to me Flatiron!

title: Great hotel, great location....
text: I was not sure about this hotel because it was still in the soft opening stages, but I am so happy my husband and I stayed here. Staff was wonderful, hotel was cozy and quiet, our king size bed/room was clean an comfy, and after a long day of sight seeing in the cold it was nice to come back to a wall jet shower. The hotel has no room service/ restaurant but that was no big deal because restaurants/delis were walking distance. This is our new spot when we come back to NY.

title: Girls Trip
text: Clean, new, could be great.  Stayed during "soft opening", no restaurant, no hotel info binder.  Rooms were small, bathroom small, small vanity, but shower was excellent.  Front desk personnel very friendly and helpful. Definitely not a 4 star yet.

title: A total waste of money !
text: The rooms were the size of a closet. When we were upgraded-it was to a " bigger" closet !No lights,no help from the staff.We stayed for a week and they were not able to fix the light in a whole week ! No mirror, no closet to put your clothes in, no room for suitcases, a total disaster. Nobody new what they were doing ! We were sent from one person to another, without being helped in the end!.For $ 350 / night, we would have rather stayed in New Jersey !!!!

title: No Soap??
text: It was a rainy day but the hotel was well lit inside. Modern flair. Round fishtank that spans 2 floors. Very clean and new. A few minor detail items such as the elevator wrap on the doors and the stainless steel ceiling in the elevator still had the protective wrap in the corners. Rooms were High tech with automatic shades, recessed lighting and touch pad controllers. Closet could not fit a hanger straight. There was no bar soap in the hotel so they supplies extra shower gel..... Staff was friendly and location is nice. At $300.00 a nite, I expected a bit more but would go back if they ran a special.

title: Not ready for prime time!
text:
This good be a fine hotel, but, it is not yet operated very well. Not very polished, misses on all the little things and even a couple of the big ones! I stayed for 3 nights and never received a normal bar of soap I had requested, mind you nothing special just a regular bar of soap. I finally went out myself to the nearest Duane Reed and purchased one. Every little thing that one would expect in a 3 star, let alone 4 star hotel was absent. 

Someday they will get their act together and it will be a charming place to stay, just not yet!

title: Don't Stay Here
text: This is not a 4.5 start hotel and don't let anyone tell you otherwise. The check-in process took forever and no one really seemed to know what was going on.  They must have run out of standard rooms because I was "upgraded" to a larger room, which was a nice surprise, but when I tried to watch TV I discovered it was broken. I called the front desk and they sent someone up who couldn't figure out why it wasn't working either.  "No problem", I thought to myself, I'll just go for a workout in their fitness center.  Except the treadmill was broken too. I headed back to my room to write some emails before heading to bed, but found their internet was spotty and after 30 minutes of trying to get a connection just gave up and turned in for the night.  That didn't work either due to the fact that the subway was so close to the building that it practically shook my room every hour on the hour throughout the night.  The hallways were dirty and some of the construction in the room was falling apart. The elevator sounds like its run by a hamster in a hamster wheel. Don't stay here, you can find a better hotel in Chelsea.

title: Pricey postage stamp room
text: Our teeny tiny room rocked from the noises on the street including the rumble of the subway and street traffic. The bed was on a platform with drawers for storing our stuff... the only storage space in the room. Really claustrophobic experience that cost a bundle. Don't expect complimentary breakfast or coffee. That said, I do appreciate the early check in by the cordial folks at the front desk.

title: Great rooms, friendly staff, but rooms VERY noisy.
text:
This hotel would have been an absolute gem in my book if it weren't for the excessive street noise coming from single-pane windows mixing with the location on top of a subway line and busy street.  I will caveat this with the fact that I live in the suburbs and am not used to sleeping through commotion, was surprised I could still hear the rumbling trains and trucks with ear plugs on. Asked to change rooms to a quieter one, which the staff was very helpful facilitating, though that only helped marginally.

Rooms are very clean, new, and comfortable otherwise, with tempurpedic mattresses, all sorts of tech wizardy, including automatic curtains and tvs within the bathroom mirror, and the staff was very friendly.  

Good hotel at a good price if you are a heavy sleeper.  Unfortunately if you're not a heavy sleeper, I would strongly recommend looking elsewhere.

title: great service
text: we arrived later in the day but very helpful staff got us tickets to a broadway play (fantastic seats, row 6 centre) and generally made our stay perfect. The bed was excellent but room on the small side.

title: Chic hotel at the great location
text:
We stayed there for 4 nights in November.  The room was roomy as a New York standard. The comtemporary interier and clean. There was a TV in the bathroom millar.

Only one negative comment is the shower water.  It took a LONG time (the longest was almost 10 minutes) to get the hot water. 

Over all the stay was very pleasent. I would stay there again.

title: Will be excellent as soon as they come up to speed
text: My wife and I enjoyed our two night stay. The room and the entire hotel has a modern decor. Clean and comfortable. Many cool touches such as the TV in the bathroom mirror (which also had LED lights), the touch panel 'Do Not Disturb", the rainfall shower head. Some features were not yet working: the surround sound speakers, the mini-fridge was not installed, and near the end of our stay the cool room keycard failed  to the extent someone had to reprogram the room. The staff was helpful and appropriately apologetic about the minor glitches. The doorman was still a little unclear on the concept - we decided to hail a cab ourselves. I understand the hotel is recently opened - as soon as everything is installed and working properly it will be a great place.

title: Stayed for a night
text: Stayed there last night. Room was great. Lots of cool technology in them like a TV built into the mirror in the bathroom. Clean and cool ambiance, Staff very friendly. Lobby has a chiche look with huge fish tanks and cool lighting. I would stay there again.

title: Great Location
text:
Positive: Extremely kind staff. The cleaning people as well as the check in people were very pleasant and helpful. The room I had (802) was very large with lovely windows over looking Broadway and 26th. It was a corner room and not cramped at all. The location is perfect as well for me. 

There was free wifi and storing your bag was free as well. Both are appreciated. 

Negatives: I thought it was extremely ugly. The walls were a textured yellow and it wasn't to my taste, personally. I do not think this is a 4 star hotel, in terms of amenities and perks. I stayed at quite a discount, but think at full price, I would be disappointed. 

Note: There is quite a lot of street noise, so try to stay as high up as you can.

title: Nice hotel...not 4 star.
text: My sister and I spent 5 nights at The Flatiron Hotel last week. While it is a nice hotel and the staff is friendly and accommodating it is not a four star hotel. The rooms were clean and comfortable. They brought us up a mini fridge and coffee pot. The beds were comfy. What would make it a four star? Added touches like stationary, NY magazines, double paned windows, bell men, and room service. The location was fine for us...a bit out of the rat race, but for some, they may find it too far away from the hustle and bustle (we love to walk!) Would we stay here again? No, probably not. Would we recommend it to friends? Probably, with full disclosure.

title: Who (k)new?
text:
I was lucky enough to come across a deal from Bookit.com for <$300/night at this perfectly located (B'way and 26th) gem.
Friendliest front desk staff ever. Then check out the gorgeous two story aquarium in the center of the lobby, and the retro staircase going up to the low ceilinged mezzanine. 
The room was bigger than most boutique hotels. The towels were larger. The bathrobe and slippers were cozier. Two bottles of normal spring water instead of the usual fancy ripoff bottled water that gets added to your bill.
The shower was magnificent, plenty of jets and rip roaringly hot water right away.
Comfy bed. The best lighting I've ever had for reading in a hotel.
So clean that I think I might have been the first person to stay in the room! Filled with electronic gizmos to make your stay more interesting. Interesting in that I couldn't even figure out how to get into the room - the door doesn't have a slidey thing for your room card, instead you just touch it to the top of the latch (they should have told me!).
