Only drawbacks: no restaurant or bar, but they are coming. Also, the check in was late, 4 PM. 

Great experience at the Flatiron!

title: Awesome hotel
text: I came to this hotel in september for a vacation , i loved it so much i came back to it recently for another trip. Great hotel- very clean and updated. Its close to everything! Staff is super nice and helpful . Im always going and coming from new york and i wouldnt choose to stay anywhere else but here to stay.

title: Great location, new boutique hotel
text: The hotel has been newly refurnished, and the rooms are quite comfortable. Very central location in the heart of the city. The staff is friendly and available 24 hours a day. Showers have lots of nozzles that spray you from all angles at once. Definitely a great value for NYC and I would certainly come back again.

title: Pleasantly surprised, will stay again on our next trip
text: We come to NY once or twice a year to see shows. We usually try to stay a bit closer to the theater area when visiting, but saw the Flatiron prices and decided to give it a try.  Very pleasantly surprised at how convenient it was to everthing.  Only two blocks to the 28th St. subway which we could take to the theaters or downtown.  Although there is no restaurant in the hotel, it is located very close to a lot of good places.  There is a CVS and Duane Reader within a block, so we were able to buy snacks for the room.  The staff was very friendly, the fish tank is spectacular, and Mr. Toshi was there every evening greeting people.  We will definitely put this on our "repeat" lists of places to stay!

title: Friendly staff with fun technology equiped rooms
text: This is a newly opened hotel and when we visited the resturant was not yet open. This is not a problem really as there are plenty of places to eat nearby. The staff was very friendly and we alwas had a good feeling comming back to the hotell after a day out. The twin double bed rooms were large enough for us with two adults ald two kids to fit w/o any problems. A fun thing was the technology in the rooms including integrated TV in the bathroom mirror! Not very necessary, but fun :-)

title: Unpleasant Experience
text: We booked the Flatiron hotel in October for one night as we had a business meeting in the City.  We booked a corner suite and once we arrived in our room we saw some immediate issues.  The curtains did not close (they are controlled remotely), there was a loud subway noise every 10-15 minutes, and the room did not have a floor length mirror.  The front desk was accommodating and moved us to a lower floor, which did have working curtains, but still there was loud subway noise and no mirror (we were told they were on order and were to arrive that week).  We didn't spend much time in the room as we arrived back late and checked out early the next morning so we didn't think much of it..until we received our credit card statement the following month.  In addition to the room charge there was an additional charge of $200.00 from the hotel.  When I called the hotel to inquire about the charge, the person in reservations told me it was because both bed spreads were missing.  I was completely shocked!  I proceeded to tell the man on the phone that was an absurd allegation and that we absolutely did not steal anything.  The man said someone would call me back and that he could not address this personally.  After I did not receive a callback, I proceeded to call again and was able to speak to the person that was supposed to return my call.  I again told him that they were wrong and that we absolutely did not steal the bed spreads and demanded a refund of the $200.00 or we would dispute the charge with the credit card company.  He told me he would refund the money and apologized.  I asked him why we did not receive a call to ask about this before charging our card and he said it was an oversight and again apologized.  I would suggest anyone staying at this hotel be sure and check their credit card statements since this hotel happens to quietly add on charges without guests' knowledge.  Who knows if the bed spreads were even really  stolen.  This hotel obviously employs thieves either way.  Whether they are stealing items from the room and blaming it on guests....or just stealing money off of guests credit cards.

title: Pleasantly surprised
text:
A friend and I spent three nights at the Flatiron in mid-October and were pleasantly surprised, considering some of the less-than-flattering reviews. Our room was fantastic! Very high tech with a remote control for the TV embedded in the bathroom mirror, curtains, main TV, etc. It also had an iPod docking station. The linens were beautiful and the room was tastefully decorated. The hotel was in the soft opening stage, and while the furnture was very nice, it was sparce in the foyer.

The staff was very accommodating and friendly, particularly Dillon, GM Steve and the doorman. My only concern was a lack of security in the evening -- one evening there was no one at all in the foyer or reception area.

Amenities of a traditional hotel also were lacking, with no concierge or restaurant, but front desk staff was helpful in suggesting local eateries. It is a fair walk to Times Square, but we did enjoy the less touristy location - and it was only one block from Eataly!

We woudl definitely stay here on a future visit to NYC.

title: Recent Stay at the Flatiron Hotel: mixed bag
text: I stayed at the Flatiron hotel Oct 20-22, 2011.  It is a newly renovated hotel, and this was a soft grand opening, thus the room rate was less than $300 per night for the 1 week night and one Friday night I was there.  Lovely, clean lined foyer with a cylindrical two story tropical fish tank, and a glass circular stairway to the mezzanine.  No restaurant in the hotel at this time.  Location on Broadway was OK...just two blocks from the intersection of Broadway and Fifth Ave.  Closest subway station was at least a three block walk. Staff was friendly and helpful. My room was one of the larger rooms on the 10th floor. The rooms were recently remodeled and I found them clean and neat.   I do have two complaints on this hotel however.  They did not put in new windows when they remodeled, so there is street noise that infiltrates the room at night. (however, west 26th is quiet at night) Then there the rumble of the subway running under the street at this location.  The beautiful heavy, blackout drapes are automatic, you tug on them, and they open and close by themselves.  This was fine, until they decided to open and close on their own at 7:30, 8, and again at 8:30 AM.  My room was facing somewhat east, so the light was rather intense.  I let the staff know that I had a unseen visitor playing with my curtains, and they said they would look into it immediately.   When I returned, the issue seemed to be solved, curtains were closed, and didn't open until I tugged them when i got up the next morning. King size bed was Extremely comfy and made it difficult to get up in the AM.  Connectivity via their wireless network was weak.  I neglected to inquire about a hard cable connection in the room.  The flat screen TV was nice, but had to be located at the other end of the long room.  I am "blind" for long distances, so I needed my glasses to watch the TV from the bed.  Overall, the stay was enjoyable.

title: Great Stay at the Flatiron
text:
I had to book a last minute business trip to NYC and the Flatiron offered a rate that I could not resist.  I had done my research on the hotel so I knew somewhat to expect.
PROS:  Central location to Fashion District and Soho which were the main areas that I visited, Very nice Staff (went out of their way to greet me every day), Fitness room was complete when I visited (even though it is a little small)
CONS:  My room was a little on the small side, but I expected that since this is NYC, No mini-bar in room (but I believe they are working on this)
Overall, a great stay at the Flatiron.  There are many great places to eat within walking distance (ie Eately, ABC Kitchen).

title: Stunning little hotel . . .
text: This is hotel is new, and it shows in some respects, but it is gorgeous in it's details and a good value for NYC.  The GM, Steven, will do whatever it takes to please (he even immediately resolved an issue on my bill without question) . . . no NYC attitude here.  I enjoyed this hotel much more than the other larger hotels I've stayed in.  The rooms are small, and the TV screen in the bathroom mirror makes it difficult for anyone under 6' to see very well, but stays in New York are generally short, so it's not a major issue.  The location right on Broadway makes it super easy to get anywhere in the City.

title: Mixed
text:
The first night of a three night stay. Trying it out since I stay in NYC hotels 5-7 nights a month, Pluses-decent sized room and bath, lots of light, good tv.

Minus-only one bedside table so when my wife arrives tomorow one of us will have to put glasses etc ont he floor. Bedlside lamp unplugged. Fancy electronic drapes yet crappy plastic drinking glasses and very cheap furniture and bath amenities.

Pleasant enough desk staff but did not know wireless password

title: Perfect for a girls weekend!
text: I just got back today from staying three nights here. My friends and I traveled all the way from Canada and felt very welcomed! Steven who worked at the front desk made the best impression for us. Genuinely nice and would do anything for you! I can almost guarantee he was the one that walked 7 blocks to get a taxi for the lady in the other review. There was no room service, but why would you stay inside to eat/drink when you are in New York City?! It was a great location as well. The taxi fares were never too expensive. Stay here! =)

title: Do Not Stay Here - insulting customer "service"
text:
Do not stay at this hotel. I cancelled my reservation in advance of my stay, only to learn that my credit card was still charged for one night's stay plus tax because I didn't meet the "72 hour cancellation policy". I was never informed of this policy during the booking process, and no mention of the 72 hour policy was made in the confirmation email I received from the hotel after I reserved the room. The reservation agent I spoke with explained to me that he had no authority to reverse this charge. When I asked to speak with a manager, he explained to me (this was Saturday morning) that no manager would be available to handle the matter until Monday at the earliest and that, because it was the weekend, he really shouldn't even be working. How could there be no manager on duty at the hotel? This reservation agent then proceeded to lecture me on the customs of cancellation policies and how I should have known better. How insulting!
Three days after canceling my room and after repeated requests to have a manager call me, I have still not heard from a manager about reversing this charge and explaining the unprofessional behavior of the reservation agent. This hotel is poorly staffed with downright rude employees and absentee management. Be forewarned.

title: Beautiful Stay
text: Amazing home base for our NYC travels. the rooms were incredibility high tech and confortable. Definite Recommendation to anyone who's staying in NYC. Very Hip and cool feel.

title: Found a new hotel for family trips
text:
The few reviews I read prior to our stay were pretty bad and I don't understand why. The staff was really nice and even went out of there way to accommodate my wife and I. Our room was very clean and the cleaning staff was on point for our room(super tidy). Our room itself had some really hip features like an Ipod dock station with built in wall speakers, a cool bathroom mirror with a t.v. inside of it and a state of the art shower with like  8 shower heads. No fridge :( but I heard there in the works.  Location was very nice also!
   My wife and I were really impressed and will be staying there again in the near future. Keep up the good work Flatiron!!!
 P.s My son loved the fish tank in the lobby

title: New hotel but gym not open, no room service
text:
Stayed in September and still lots of new hotel issues:

No room service
No mini bar
Gym not yet open

Also, check in at 4pm and the jacuzzi baths in the rooms are half the size of a normal bath and so are pointless

title: Great Hotel
text: Ive stayed  at a lot of different hotels in New York City but I must say the Flatiron was my favorite, I stayed at the flatiron hotel in September and I loved it the hotel is beautiful and very clean and in New York its hard to find a up to date clean hotel without the price being crazy but the Flatiron is affordable and the rooms are very nice and comfortable. The staff was great as well very helpful and really tried to help us with any questions we had. Steven the manager is great and he was always there when we needed him. Im going back to NYC in November and I didn’t hesitate to book with the Flatiron again  it’s the only place I will stay when I go to NYC.. So if your looking for a nice clean affordable hotel in a great area, look no further the Flatiron is the place to be you wont regret it.

title: Wonderful Staff
text: The staff is excellent. A newly opened hotel, which still had some kinks to work out. Our room was very nice, but the bathroom had a couple issues. The staff was understanding and upgraded us to a beautiful suite. One thing that sticks in my head is the aroma...very fresh. :)

title: Loved it!
text: We are from Los Angeles and this was our first trip to New York.  The Flatiron Hotel was the perfect place to stay!  We absolutely loved it!  The hotel itself was located in a great location and close by to delicious dining and shopping.  It was very clean and well decorated.  The staff was amazing.  In particular, Terrance at the front desk went out of his way to make our stay a memorable one.  Another manager (whose name I didn't get) walked 7 blocks to get us a cab on our departure.  Toshi, the owner, also made us feel more than welcomed.  We have no complaints and we definitely recommend this hotel for anyone traveling to Manhattan.

title: Flatiron Hotel
text: This hotel was a great choice for my three BFF's and I for our first trip to NYC. A very clean and comfortable hotel, and beautifully decorated. The lobby was open and surrounded with windows, and had a huge circular aquarium in the center that went up to the second floor. Gorgeous! The rooms were very pretty and clean. Nice shower, and a built in TV in the bathroom mirror! Cool! The staff were very quick to accomodate any of our requests. and, they were more than willing to assist us in making our weekend a fun one, not one wasted on trying to figure out where to go and how to get there. Lots of great tips, advice and assistance from the desk staff, and especially the general manager Steven. You were all great! I'd come back and stay at Flatiron again for sure.

title: Nothing flat about the Flatiron Hotel!!
text:
I am one of the 3 peeps that stayed with Adelle and will 'ditto' her review since she took the words right out of my mouth lol!! It really was a fantastic hotel! and Steven, you are the best! 
First time in NYC with 3 of my gal peeps, and Flatiron made the experience even better. Hotel is ccc--Central, Clean, Crisp!!!! The aquarium is spectacular, and the corner lobby area make it for a wonderful people watch spot. A cross from classic (venetian plaster walls, italian marble etc.) to modern. Too cool, tv embedded in the bathroom mirror, a first for me to see. Staff was beyond helpful, and took time to understand what we wanted to do, and provide options accordingly. Our "foodie" G.M. was extremely knowledgeable, and made sure to get input and feedback from our stay. Your the best Steven!!! This hotel is a definite gem in the Big Apple!!!!!

title: Trip with the girls
text: Even though the hotel is just opening and working things out, I have to say it is a wonderful property. The views are spectacular I could see the empire states building. The rumble of the subway made me feel like hey I'm in the big city. Steve the manager was so kind and helpful I can't say enough good things about him. If you stay at this property you will hopefully get to meet him.

title: first time in the big apple
text:
Wonderful accomodating staff at front desk,
Spotless clean
great area

title: CENTRAL, CLEAN, CRISP
text: First time in NYC with 3 of my gal peeps, and Flatiron made the experience even better.  Hotel is ccc--Central, Clean, Crisp!!!! The aquarium is spectacular, and the corner lobby area make it for a wonderful people watch spot.  A cross from classic (venetian plaster walls, italian marble etc.) to modern.  Too cool, tv embedded in the bathroom mirror, a first for me to see.  Staff was beyond helpful, and took time to understand what we wanted to do, and provide options accordingly. title: Good place, not too touristy.
text: It's a very nice hotel. I enjoyed the tv on the mirror.

title: Fancy but impractical; beware the check-in time
text: This is a newly reopened hotel under new management that is clearly trying hard to make an impression as a hip property. There were certainly some impressive touches. Like the flat TV screen magically embedded into the bathroom mirror. Overall, though, I would have preferred it if the hotel had splurged less on electronics and other special effects, and more on practicalities that travellers actually need. For example, I would have traded the TV in the bathroom for a fridge, especially since there is no restaurant in the hotel. Worst of all, the hotel has a 4pm check-in time, probably because it doesn't have enough cleaners to turn around the rooms fast enough. I arrived at around 3pm and had to step out anyway to meet a friend, so it did not inconvenience me much. But if you are arriving in the city in the morning, this hotel would be the wrong choice. You don't want to pay these sorts of rates for the privilege of having the hotel store your luggage while you wait hours for your room.

title: Fantastic Stay !!!!
text:
I was in New York with my 2 daughters on Oct. 1 and 2nd and stayed at the Flatiron Hotel.  We were absolutely impressed with every aspect of this hotel.  Very clean and well appointed rooms.  Great size room (for New York).  The beds were amazing, the best sleep I have had in a long time. Great location.  I have a background in travel and have stayed in many hotels all over the world, the Flatiron by far exceeded our expectations in service, cleanliness, and decor.  As indicated in other reviews the hotel is still in its soft opening stage and may be lacking in some of the service areas however, this did not affect us in any way because if you required anything, the staff was "on it'  .

The Hotel Manager - Steven Meyer - definately made our stay unforgetable!  From the moment we arrived, Steven greeted us, spent time with us to provide us with information on sites, shopping, getting around, and even made dinner reservations for us.  

The hotel was very busy upon our arrival, check in was at 4 pm.  I needed to have the room available for 3 pm.  Steven took care of us immediately and ensured that we were comfortable, satisfied and had everything we needed.

I can't say enough about our experience in New York.  Having worked in the service industry for many years I can only say that good service is what keeps people coming back.  I have to go back to New York in a few months and will definately be back at the Flatiron.  Since my return 2 days ago, I have already recommended the Flatiron to a number of people travelling to New York in the next little while.

I recommend this hotel to anyone who appreciates good, beyond expectations service, a good night's sleep and a friendly environment.

Hope you enjoy your stay as much as we did.

Thank you Steven for taking such good care of me and my girls  -- coco and daughters :)

title: Serves it's purpose
text: The hotel is still not "ready". There are no amenities available at this time. My wife and I stayed here for our anniversary. Since we were in New York, we did not plan to spend much time in the hotel anyway, but it would've been nice to have a lounge. The hotel was clean and very up to date. The bathroom had a TV built in the mirror and the lighting and curtains were all controlled by a remote. The room was small, but very nice. The location was OK. It was one block away from Broadway but was 16 blocks from Times Square. Penn Station was 8 blocks so the Subway was within a good distance. Unfortunately I only have one photo because my wife's phone was lost on the trip.

title: Excellent!!!!!
text: We really enjoyed our stay at Flatiron over the weekend. First off its in a great location, it's in a quiet area but walking distance to so many hot spots around the city. The staff was exceptional and the hotel was beautiful! It was also very affordable and the rooms were extremely comfortable.  Highly recommended!!!!!

title: Almost great
text:
When some of the amenities (gym, lobby bar, mini-bars in room) are finished and the team is a little more polished, this will be a great spot.  The hotel is nicely designed and quality of furnishings is good.  The rooms are not huge, but comfortable.  Also, the neighborhood is interesting, not "touristy".

Staff should just be direct and honest about the missing amenities:  we were told by two different staff members that the gym wasn't finished, but they had an "arrangement with a local gym".  The arrangement was that anyone that was a resident of NYC got a free three-day trial.  Not sure why a NYC resident would be staying at the hotel!  The room rate was such that that the $30 fee for two-days at the gym was not a big deal.

title: New hotel with great potential
text: This newly-remodeled hotel was in its "soft opening" phase when I stayed there, so some of my observations may not apply as the hotel gears up for full service. For example, I arrived late at night, tired and thirsty, only to discover there was no room service, no restaurant or bar, no minibar in the room, and no vending machines. I assume this will not be the case forever, but if this matters to you, check before you book! The room itself was quite spacious, with glorious high ceilings and warm Venetian plaster walls. Wonderfully comfortable queen bed. Coffee maker on the compact desk but no electrical outlets on it, or nearby, for recharging phone, iPad and laptop. Push-button controlled draperies but no full-length mirror. There was enough space for an armchair, but there was no armchair. (These last two are the kind of things I expect they are still working on. I hope.) The bathroom was small but had good counter space and lighting. And a TV screen in the mirror. The shower was very small but had an amazing array of shower heads--an overhead rainfall head, a hand spray, and six body jets. Took a bit of experimenting to figure out the controls on the shower, however. Staff were friendly and helpful, although I think they are still figuring things out. Location is terrific, close to subways, Flatiron district, Chelsea galleries and restaurants, Greeley Park, etc. Penn Station is walkable if you don't have a ton of luggage and the weather is good. I would stay here again, especially after they are fully up and running.

title: Not that great
text:
We stayed here over labor day weekend.  We had the Toshi suite which is the corner room.  I believe this is the largest room on each floor.  The hote is small. There are only about 8 or 9 rooms on each floor.  From the floorplan map near the elevator, it appears the corner room is the largest.  The room overall was small.  The room had lots of windows which gave a good view.  From this room, you can get a side view of the Empire State buiding.  We stayed on the 9th floor.  The odd thing is, on the 9th floor, we can hear and feel the subway beneath.  I found this very strange.  You can basically tell when a subway was going thru.  
The hotel is new but somehow the rooms don't look or feel new.  The bathroom was small.  In general, everything felt claustraphobic.  The AC in our room was not working well.  It hums loudly all day but the temp in the room remained the same.  The engr came to look at it on the 2nd night but couldn't get it fixed.  We didn't sleep well during the entire stay.  The kids did enjoy the awesome fish tank in the lobby.  

We would not return to this hotel.  I found the hotel on Travelzoo and thought to give a try. Not a good choice.

title: Awesome Place!!
text: This was our first trip to NY. I took my 22 year old daughter and her two best friends and we planned to stay 4 days. After delays, cancellations, and a stay in another city, Delta finally got us to NY.  We arrived tired and discouraged. The staff at this hotel was absolutely wonderful. They made sure we had the best room in the hotel, and helped us map out our activities to guarantee us covering as much as possible in our shortened stay. Our every request was met and our stay was so comfortable. The beds are heavenly, the rooms were spotless, and everything was decorated so beautifully! One evening we were in the lobby, getting ready to get a cab and head to Times Square for the evening. The Owner, Mr. Toshi was in the lobby, introduced himself to us, offered us champagne, and had a staff member get us a taxi. We had champagne and took pictures with him, it was the start to a fun filled evening. We will stay at this hotel again!

title: Great hotel, great location
text: I found this hotel by chance on the net. I have to say that all is just great! The room is impecable, confortable, great huge tv, and the staff is very freindly. The manager Vince knows his work and is there for you. The best of the best.  We even had the chance to speak with the real owner of the hotel :-) rare  thing in this big city. Enjoy
